Mev Enthusiast.
Microsoft MVP
Magician.

title: Evm Architecture
description:
In this talk we will be talking about the architecture of EVM. We will learn the particular of this piece of the Ethereum blockchain.
We will understand how the EVM manages the storage, the memory and the basic instruction of smart contracts.
If you are a developer and you want to dig into the inside of Ethereum this talk is for you.

speakers.name: Germ√°n K√ºber
speakers.description:
Blockchain Developer. 
Mev Enthusiast.
Microsoft MVP
Magician.

title: MEV to mortals
description:
What is MEV? I do not have any idea. If this would be your answer. I have a solution for you. Come, come to our talk and live together the experience of digging in the harder topic of Ethereum.
I will go down this topic, and I will explain why the MEV is the topic that nobody wants to talk about.
I want to tell you something, you have to know about MEV, you have to understand why the MEV could destroy our fantastic world.

speakers.name: Germ√°n K√ºber
speakers.description:
Blockchain Developer. 
Mev Enthusiast.
Microsoft MVP
Magician.

title: Flashbot

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
Maybe you know what is MEV? maybe not.
Maybe you know what is Arbitrage? maybe not.
Maybe you know what is a Airdrop? maybe not.
If your answer is yes, this talk is for you, if your answer is no, this talk is for you too.
Come to this space, and walk with me in the better path of the tool's MEV democratization.

The time of the flashbot is now. Do not stay ou

speakers.name: Germ√°n K√ºber
speakers.description:
Blockchain Developer. 
Mev Enthusiast.
Microsoft MVP
Magician.

title: Dig deep in to a transaction with tenderly
description:
If you are a blockchain developer, I know that you tried to debug a transaction in some moment.
If you are a blockchain developer, I know that you tried to understand what happens in a transaction.

These features and a couple more, tenderly care for us.

In this space we will meet Tenderly, we will do a demo, where we will use all features of this fantastic tool for debugging and  monitoring.

I really would like your life as a developer to be easier. Please come and leave me to do it.

speakers.name: Germ√°n K√ºber
speakers.description:
Blockchain Developer. 
Mev Enthusiast.
Microsoft MVP
Magician.

title: Solidity Design Patterns
description:
Solidity is a very beautiful language, but has a lot of things that we would know, to take advantage of all of her features.
In this talk we will talk about pattern design, and why this kind of knowledge is super important if you want to become a good Solidity Developer.
Come with or without it, I promise that you will learn something anyway.

speakers.name: Shotaro Granzier-Nakajima
speakers.description: Smart Contract Developer at Kleros. Besides Ethereum conferences, catch me cycling, skating, and surfing through lovely Lisbon, Portugal.

title: All Rollups Lead Home: An Optimistic Roadmap
description: L2,22 is upon us, and Dapps are deploying across various roll-ups, but composability and interoperability across rollups remains challenging; especially with unavoidable Optimistic rollup 7 day delays. In this talk I will present a dapp agnostic bridging design for scalable and gas efficient fast message passing between rollups via merkle roots and an optimistic claim/challenge mechanism.

speakers.name: Mike Natanzon
speakers.description: Founder of Abundance Protocol. Builder. Economist. Researcher.

title: How web3 can scale public goods funding 1000X
description:
Web3 has the potential to not only decentralize finance, but to expand what is possible in the economy by creating a mechanism to capture the value of digital public goods (OSS, scientific research, digital content, etc.).
This talk will discuss the mechanism behind the Abundance Protocol, which allows exponential scaling of digital public goods funding both within web3 and on the wider web.

speakers.name: nir.eth
speakers.description: Co-Founder of [Yup](https://yup.io). Founding President of [Blockchain @ Columbia](blockchaincolumbia.org). Involved with several DAOs. Early investor in web3, written over 30 angel checks. Written for CoinTelegraph, Forefront, etc.

title: EVM Network Effects
description:
I'd like to give a talk on the network effects surrounding the Ethereum Virtual Machine and how devs can take advantage of it. 

Wrote a [piece on this](https://forefront.mirror.xyz/Sin6qtvFowBeZtz7-4I5gkGTB113ffanVOo4uGQWm90) for Forefront with a lot of positive feedback and further questions. Here's a [twitter thread](https://twitter.com/nir_III/status/15317206) on the topic too. I think this is an important topic for DevCon and would further discussion on L1/L2s, UX, and Dev Infrastructure.

speakers.name: Tal Derei
speakers.description: I‚Äôm currently a blockchain and zero knowledge researcher in my master‚Äôs researching zero knowledge acceleration and zkEVMs (general purpose EVM computations on L2). I‚Äôm part of the Scalable Systems and Software Research Group¬†at Lehigh University: https://wordpress.lehigh.edu/sss/.

title: Recursive Zero-Knowledge SNARK Proofs in zkEVMs
description: I‚Äôm interested in giving a talk about a primer into recursive ZK-proofs (enabling parallelizable proof generation) and zkEVMs (enabling L2 scalability). This would be a combination of two previous talks I‚Äôve given about the topic to my research group: https://github.com/TalDerei/Zero-Knowledge/blob/main/zkEVM.pdf, https://github.com/TalDerei/Zero-Knowledge/blob/main/Recursive_zkEVM.pdf

speakers.name: Andrew Chiw
speakers.description: After realizing web development was a dead end, Andrew got his start in blockchain development with Quantum Resistant Ledger, aeternity, Commons Stack, and the Ape Unit, where he worked on Cosmos IBC and cosmwasm smart contracts in Rust. Now he is at Aragon Labs.

title: Vochain - a Tendermint-Ethereum L1 blockchain for large scale zk-voting
description:
The vochain is a custom L1 using Tendermint for consensus/networking, Ethereum libraries for many things, allowing election results to translate into smart contract actions on Ethereum L1. It is meant for nation-state scale elections and we can already name a few noteworthy clients. The architecture enables traditional organizations as well as DAOs to take advantage of zk voting.

I will present the software architecture, demo an election, and present how zk cryptography changes the landscape.

speakers.name: David Sneider
speakers.description: David Sneider is the co-founder at Lit Protocol, a network for decentralized compute, encryption, and access control.

speakers.name: Chris Cassano
speakers.description: Chris got started in crypto in 2011 and created the first commercially available hardware wallet in 2013, Piper Wallet.  He co-founded Lit Protocol to democratize access to threshold cryptography and bring freedom through math.

title: Decentralized Programmable Key Pairs

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
Join this talk to get an introduction to Decentralized Programable Key Pairs (PKPs), by Lit Protocol.

PKPs are 'distributed custody cloud wallets' that act as a personal compute platform that can write to a variety of state machines (e.g Ethereum, IPFS) because they are 'smart contracts with a secret' that can make arbitrary HTTP requests and use that data in the computation.

speakers.name: Kevin Jones
speakers.description:
Developer Advocate @ Scaffold-ETH üèóÔ∏è 
BUIDLer @ BuidlGuidl üè∞Ô∏è
Photographer and Filmmaker | @kevinjonescreates üì∏

title: Intro to Scaffold-ETH
description:
Join Kevin Jones for a workshop on Scaffold-ETH, an off-the-shelf stack for rapid prototyping on Ethereum, giving developers access to state-of-the-art tools to quickly learn and ship an Ethereum-based dapp.

Scaffold-ETH is everything you need to get started building decentralized applications powered by smart contracts. Learn more at https://github.com/scaffold-eth/scaffold-eth

speakers.name: Vijay Krishnan
speakers.description: Leader and enterprise architect with 20+ years of wall street experience enabling banks & financial institutions to go digital. A subject matter expert on Blockchain & Crypto enabling customers to use Web3, DeFi, NFT and Metaverse. A mentor, speaker and an organic farmer.

title: 10 different architecture patterns for creating and launching an Ethereum project
description: DApps and NFT launches have taken the center stage this year with Ethereum and a few other chains. Unlike other use cases, most of DApps launches are short lived and put together with unknown patterns. Some of these patterns are very light and some are complex. I'll be talking about 10 different architecture patterns with examples (diagrams and some references ) and how these patterns help create repeatable products and faster time to market. Target audience are developers and architects.

speakers.name: Emma Rose Bienvenu
speakers.description: Too short to provide both our bios. Can provide them upon request, but Joey Krug is the co-CIO of Pantera Capital, co-founder of Eco, and founder of Augur. Emma Rose Bienvenu is the Chief of Staff at Pantera Capital.

speakers.name: Joseph Krug
speakers.description: CIO at Pantera Capital, Cofounder at Eco and Augur

title: How to Build a Compliant Decentralized Protocol
description: Emma Rose Bienvenu briefly outlines the key legal/regulatory frameworks in which decentralized protocols operate, identifying grey areas and walking through how teams can minimize the risk of ex post liability. Joey Krug then presents lessons learned from his experience building Augur, and how Ethereum-based projects can avoid running afoul of US authorities. Talk would cover best practices to roadmap product, communicate about it, and manage community in murky, hostile regulatory environments.

speakers.name: Emily Lin
speakers.description: Truffle developer advocate out here just trying to help devs build better. Former DevOps engineer now professional nerd sniper. Let's gush about what you're building! @_emjlin

title: Building better developer tooling through community
description: In this talk, I'll cover the various ways Truffle has been growing and measuring our developer community. I'll talk about how and why community has informed our product roadmap and surface the most effective strategies and recommendations. I'll specifically be covering social media, IRL vs. virtual events, and developer support and how that has created a feedback loop for building better tools.

speakers.name: Georgios Konstantopoulos
speakers.description: Georgios Konstantopoulos is the Chief Technology Officer and a Research Partner focused on Paradigm‚Äôs portfolio companies and research into open-source protocols. Previously, Georgios was an independent consultant and researcher focused on cryptography, information security and mechanism design. He earned his M.Eng. in Electrical & Computer Engineering from Aristotle University of Thessaloniki.

title: Foundry - A blazing fast, portable and modular toolkit for Ethereum application development.
description:
Foundry is a portable, fast and modular toolkit for Ethereum application development, written in Rust.

On top of testing & building, Foundry also allows launching local testnets, scripting & deploying smart contract calls, formatting and much more in the pipeline.

Relevant reading:
https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry
https://book.getfoundry.sh/
https://www.paradigm.xyz/2022/03/foundry-02
https://www.paradigm.xyz/2021/12/introducing-the-foundry-ethereum-development-toolbox

speakers.name: Brock Haugen
speakers.description: I'm an engineer by trade (previously at Coinbase, Tripgrid, imbrex, ...) who's passionate about crypto, web3, and bringing the next wave of builders and users to the space. My background is centered around facilitating the storage and retrieval of data in various industries; mostly in the form of an end user product.

title: Data 3.0 - Finding Balance Between Decentralization and Accessibility
description:
Building data intensive applications in Web 3.0 is hard: builders must understand the tradeoffs for data storage and retrieval across several vectors including L1s vs L2s, IPFS vs hosted storage, encryption, on chain events, etc. Choosing the "right" path for a given project is nearly impossible once business (costs) and product (speed) needs are factored.
This talk aims to give an overview of the options and tools available, their trade-offs, and guidance on when each may be most appropriate.

speakers.name: Christopher Robison
speakers.description: Founder of meTokens, a personal token protocol. Former Hoard, OMG Network, and Golem Foundation team member. Speaker/contributor at DevCon, NFT.NYC, ETHGlobal, Enterprise Ethereum Alliance, and Ethereum Community Fund events. Host and organizer of the Personal Token Summit. Published one of the first university academic papers on cryptocurrency in 2012-2013.

title: Using an Automated Discount Market Maker (ADMM) to Issue Personal Tokens

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: An **automated discount market maker (ADMM)** is a liquidity tool that can be used to issue trustless personal tokens. ADMMs are used to reflexively create discounts in markets when demand is low, and lock in prices at current rates when demand is high. Applied to personal tokens, ADMMs can be used to stimulate spending with a person when there is less demand for their labor or attention, or to ensure early supporters of a person are not priced out of their services when demand is high.

speakers.name: Noam Hurwitz
speakers.description: Noam is a lead engineer at Alchemy working on the core platform responsible for providing reliable node APIs at scale. He's been working on scaling Alchemy for the past 18 months, building out infrastructure that has withstood several orders of magnitude of growth. Prior to Alchemy, he worked at Quibi (perhaps the bust of the decade) and started his career out building distributed systems for Google Drive.

title: Web3 at Scale: Infrastructure to Bring Blockchain to One Billion People
description: I'm a lead engineer at Alchemy, a developer platform that operates web3 infrastructure at scale. This talk would cover the complexities of scaling web3 applications, scalable web3 application best practices, tradeoffs to consider in development, and how we're gearing up towards supporting developers moving forward.

speakers.name: Elena Sinelnikova
speakers.description: Elena Sinelnikova is a former Government of Canada solutions architect turned entrepreneur and co-founded several startups. Metis.io, scalability and low-code solution for DeFi, NFT, and dApps on Ethereum, and CryptoChicks.ca ‚Äì educational hub and accelerator for women in blockchain in 56 countries.

title: L2 Tech evolution: innovation or a blip?
description: L2 Tech evolution: innovation or a blip? Heated debates on stage between the traditional L2 and those who dare to innovate.

speakers.name: Sebastian Pape
speakers.description:
Sebastian started building technology products 20+ years ago.

Beside constantly building, he studied interaction design and computer science before eventually developing applications and systems serving millions of users. 

Sebastian lead technical teams at big IT companies and slipped into the Cryptosphere in 2018 having built an NFT browser/exchange for Gods Unchained as a side project.

Sebastian built DePay and became finalist at Ethereum's biggest online hackathon ETHOnline in 2020.

title: How we've built the first Web3 P2P Payment Gateway for Shopify
description:
DePay launched as the first Web3 P2P payment gateway on Shopify: https://apps.shopify.com/depay

I want to walk the audience through how we achieved that user experience:
- Seamless wallet connect experiences with auto-wallet-detection
- Scanning available assets
- Client-side payment routing with on-chain only data
- None IP-based local currency conversions
- Seamless Multichain experiences
- Anything-to-anything conversions via DEXes
- Transaction tracking and payment validations

speakers.name: yaoqi
speakers.description: Dr. Yaoqi Jia is the founder of Alt Research and AltLayer Network, an elastic and versatile scaling protocol for Web3. Before 2022, he was the director of Parity Asia, which provides blockchain infrastructure (say OpenEthereum) for the decentralised Web. He‚Äôs selected to the Forbes 30 Under 30 Asia list, 2019. Prior to that, he was the co-founder and CTO of Zilliqa, leading the efforts of design and delivery of the very first public sharding blockchain platform.

title: AltLayer: Runtime Execution and Elastic Scaling Layer for Ethereum
description:
(1) Multi-VM Support: AltLayer enables Ethereum with on-demand EVM/WASM execution layer.
(2) Elastic Scalability: To handle surge requests on Ethereum, AltLayer enables dApps to quickly spin off custom execution layer (flash layers) to serve users, with near-instant finality(<2s), low gas fees (<0.01USD) and high throughput(~2,000 tps). 
(3) Ubiquitous Verification: To embrace decentralization, AltLayer runs multiple block producers/verifiers including commodity machines, browsers for users.

speakers.name: Zhivko Todorov
speakers.description:
Co-founder of EnterDAO
Business Development & Partnerships at LimeChain
Contributer in Universe.xyz, FIAT DAO

title: Lessons from building products in a DAO-first way
description: Lessons of building products in a DAO-first way based on co-founding EnterDAO and contributing to Universe, BarnBridge and FIAT DAO through LimeChain.

speakers.name: Nicholas Fett
speakers.description: Nicholas Fett is an economist, developer, and founder at Tellor, a decentralized oracle. Former positions include an economist at the US CFTC and founder of Daxia, a derivatives protocol focusing on a truly decentralized architecture. He received an Ethereum foundation grant in 2018 to study defi on sidechains.

title: The Coming Rise of Oracle Extractable Value
description: Miner Extractable Value (MEV), or the ability of miners to front-run transactions, has been discussed at length in the space and is a known problem (or feature) in the dark forest of decentralized finance. A similar issue however comes in the form of oracle extractable value (OEV). As more applications use oracles or bridges to connect chains and real world data, the opportunity for OEV is already happening, set to explode, and must be thought about carefully by all projects.

speakers.name: yaoqi
speakers.description: Dr. Yaoqi Jia is the founder of Alt Research and AltLayer Network, an elastic and versatile scaling protocol for Web3. Before 2022, he was the director of Parity Asia, which provides blockchain infrastructure (say OpenEthereum) for the decentralised Web. He‚Äôs selected to the Forbes 30 Under 30 Asia list, 2019. Prior to that, he was the co-founder and CTO of Zilliqa, leading the efforts of design and delivery of the very first public sharding blockchain platform.

title: Sharding: The Old vs The New
description: Back in 2016, after Ethereum had operated for some time, Vitalik proposed Sharding for Ethereum. Over the past six years, we‚Äôve witnessed several rounds of discussions on the sharding design and numerous revisions of the implementation, from state sharding in 2017, to danksharding with rollup-centric scaling roadmap in 2022. In this panel, we elaborate the pros and cons of both the old and the new form of sharding technologies, from three aspects, i.e., throughput, security and interoperability.

speakers.name: yaoqi
speakers.description: Dr. Yaoqi Jia is the founder of Alt Research and AltLayer Network, an elastic and versatile scaling protocol for Web3. Before 2022, he was the director of Parity Asia, which provides blockchain infrastructure (say OpenEthereum) for the decentralised Web. He‚Äôs selected to the Forbes 30 Under 30 Asia list, 2019. Prior to that, he was the co-founder and CTO of Zilliqa, leading the efforts of design and delivery of the very first public sharding blockchain platform.

title: AltLayer: Runtime Execution and Elastic Scaling Layer for Ethereum
description:
(1) Multi-VM Support: AltLayer enables Ethereum with on-demand EVM/WASM execution layer.
(2) Elastic Scalability: To handle surge requests on Ethereum, AltLayer enables dApps to quickly spin off custom execution layer (flash layers) to serve users, with near-instant finality(<2s), low gas fees (<0.01USD) and high throughput(~2,000 tps). 
(3) Ubiquitous Verification: To embrace decentralization, AltLayer runs multiple block producers/verifiers including commodity machines, browsers for users.

speakers.name: simona pop
speakers.description: founder in the web3 space (Bounties Network), governance meta steward (Gitcoin, ENS, Element DAO), governance engagement strategy and tooling (Gitcoin DAO), community strategy (Status), advisory (part of many projects‚Äô in the ecosystem‚Äôs journey including 3Box, EPNS, DoinGud and more), mentorship (Kernel), Event creator and content curator (Schelling Point, Liscon, EthDenver)

title: DAOs and Biomimicry
description:
The talk would essentially be a distilled version of this piece I wrote around biomimicry and DAOs/coordination/governance https://pop.mirror.xyz/NbNlmtjw3hTzVHiCU9dBjcgFDxpD91UY8DOtl5Ht_x0

My general view I would like to impart with the audience is that what we collectively work towards should be rooted in balance, non extremist behaviour and mindfulness - with concrete examples of the work I have already done in practice across Gitcoin DAO, ENS and soon Element.

speakers.name: Bogdan-Radu Dumitru
speakers.description: creativity maxi

title: Model your first dynamic system with cadCAD
description:
CadCAD ‚Äì which sounds like something a Pok√©mon would say ‚Äì is slowly establishing itself as the lingua franca of the dynamic/complex system modeling world. It was, most notably, used by the EF to model the ETH2 PoS validator economy, but has also seen usage in protocol design.
This workshop acts as a hands-on introduction to cadCAD and its primitives. By the end, you'll have set up a cadCAD project with a basic simulation.

speakers.name: Jordi Baylina
speakers.description:
Jordi Baylina Technical Lead
Jordi is one of the strongest Ethereum developers in the world and a high impact contributor in the Ethereum community. He leads the technical development of the Polygon Hermez zkRollup and is currently working on the implementation of the zkEVM.
He is the co-founder of the White Hat Group, which played a major role in rescuing funds from TheDAO and Parity Multisig hacks. He‚Äôs the author of the MiniMe token contract, the elliptic curves Solidity library, as well as

title: Technical details of the opcode compatible zkEVM

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
I will explain some technical details on how we, at PolygonHermez, built the opcode compatible zkEVM. This will include some design details of specific pieces like the storage, the arithmetic state machine, the keccak circuit, among others.  I will also go thru some snippets of the zkASM code that emulates the Ethereum VM.  
I will include in the talk some performance measures and I will do a live demo of the testnet.

speakers.name: Alex Van de Sande
speakers.description: Alex joined the Ethereum foundation in 2014 and was lead of the Wallet and Browser project as well as many other contributions. During his term in the foundation he also founded ENS with Nick Johnson. He has also since worked on many projects, trying to help onboard users in a multisig account (Unilogin) and worked at the Defi project Balancer Labs. Alex is currently a delegate and public goods stewards for ENS.

title: How to talk to gÃµiÃµrÃµlÃµsÃµ users at pÃµaÃµrÃµtÃµiÃµeÃµsÃµ your app: how to do user research in a remote environment
description:
We often rely too much on our instincts about how our product work or prior knowledge on how it should be read. More often than not, we are wrong. Newcomers will always use your app in the "wrong" manner and talking to them will reveal many ways in which you can improve your product.

I've worked many years in many web3 projects, from the Ethereum Foundation Wallet, to ENS and specially a full year at the Defi protocol Balancer as a User Researcher. I would love to share what I've learned.

speakers.name: Chandler De Kock
speakers.description: Growth Strategy at UMA, Lead at Outcome, Co-founder at Across. Chandler focuses on building the future of web3 by solving the problems that matter to the humans that are the creators

speakers.name: Julia Rosenberg
speakers.description: Co-founder & CEO at Orca Protocol

title: The future of social coordination of DAO's

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Outcome protocol was launched with the intention of creating positive outcomes for DAO's. We build tools to make it easy for projects to align the incentives of all stakeholders (community, VC's, team members, users etc etc). The direction of the talk will be to talk through the lessons we learnt, how other DAO's and teams can take the success stories to their own projects and give an overview of the aspects of what we did that worked.

speakers.name: Gary Sheng
speakers.description: I cofounded Civics Unplugged, a 501(c)(3) that empowers Gen Z to become the civic innovators their communities need. In Jan 2022, CU launched the¬†Dream DAO (https://dreamdao.xyz), which provides high school leaders with training, funding, and community they need to leverage web3 to do good.

title: Gen Z: How To Join Them (Because You're Not Going to Beat Them)
description:
Generation Z is the most socially conscious and tech savvy generation ever. And they are already making waves in every industry, especially in crypto/web3.

But they won't be able to realize their full potential without the help of older generations.

Let's dive DEEP into practical things you can do to understand, help, and buidl with this group of extraordinary people.

We will dive deep into reflections on and lessons from 9 months of building a global Gen Z-powered DAO: Dream DAO.

speakers.name: Daniel Luca
speakers.description: Daniel is a self-taught developer with experience in multiple programming languages. Having a hacker mindset he always tests the limits of the software or hardware he interacts with. He likes to experiment with new technologies, always trying to develop his available toolchain.

title: Effective Smart Contract Mocking in Solidity
description:
Currently developed Smart Contract systems are very complex. To properly test your code, one has to deploy the whole system or mock specific parts. Mocking and Test Driven Development are as popular as they should be. Luckily, some tools help developers get started with setting up a solid testing framework and mocking specific parts of the system.

To help people get started, I will present how to solve some practical issues that I had to solve in my developer journey.

speakers.name: Sasha Tanase
speakers.description:
"My job is to translate extremely complex products into palatable bits and to be the users' voice when dApps are built"

In a constant search for improvement in design processes, products, and the blockchain space, Sasha Tanase has been working in Ethereum since 2018.

Past Head of Design at Alethio/ConsenSys, Head of Design Research at Keep Network, currently she is leading Design Research and Product Design at tBTC/Threshold Network and is one of the co-founders of Web3UX research panel.

title: The Future of Web3UX - a paradigm shift for a better collaboration between design and development.
description:
70% of UX design on Ethereum is defined within the Smart Contracts. So why are so few UX experts involved in Smart Contract design? It‚Äôs time for a shift towards better crypto UX.

The future of a better web3 UX will rely heavily on a paradigm shift. The necessity of change in the way we work and the way we look at how products are designed and planned is more and more needed. 

So are you ready to embrace the change?

speakers.name: Christine Moy
speakers.description: Christine is a Partner and Head of Digital Asset Strategy at Apollo Global Management, Inc. She leads digital asset strategy across the firm. Previously, she was a Managing Director at J.P. Morgan and defined its program through initiatives in digital assets, tokenized payments, internet-of-things, digital identity, digital collectibles, virtual worlds, and building applications on enterprise Ethereum that have transacted over $300 billion in value.

title: The DeFi CeFi Convergence
description: Learn how various areas of financial innovation and experimentation driven at exponential speed by Ethereum‚Äôs open source ecosystem (DeFi, stablecoins, identity, NFTs) continue to challenge Wall Street, and how centralized domains of capital markets, payments, and consumer banking are attempting to respond. Panelists are crypto native Ethereum ecosystem builders and investors that are embedded in traditional finance, and can share what they see as next gen DeFi and digital assets infrastructure.

speakers.name: Mahsa Moosavi
speakers.description: Mahsa is currently a part-time software engineer at Offchain Labs. She is also completing her doctoral studies at Concordia University, Canada. She mostly does research on blockchain technologies, decentralized finance, and Ethereum scaling solutions.

title: Fast and Furious Withdrawals from Optimistic Rollups
description: Bridges are very complex and have under-explored security issues. The issue we are focused on with withdrawing from L2, which requires L1 to be absolutely sure of what occurred on L2 (finality was reached) and current proposals like Offchain Lab‚Äôs Arbitrum require 1 week for finality. In this talk, we discuss the three designs for ‚Äúfast‚Äù withdraws that allow a user to move Layer 2 to Layer 1 instantly, while a counter-party takes the risk that the withdraw will not finalize.

speakers.name: Michael Straub
speakers.description: Learning how to create an interactive community and culture, establish strategic external partnerships, and automate marketing strategies.

title: Half Life Saga: First Manga series on the ETH blockchain
description:
Benefits to cosplayers and designers
What Half-Life saga represents for anime
Scheduled burn mechanisms for a better UX to receive physical copies.
AAA movie production
Community and customer oriented UX and design

speakers.name: Gabriela Chang
speakers.description: Co-founder of EthicHub & CMO

title: The unbanked, a real blue ocean opportunity for crypto
description:
1/4 of the global population is excluded from the current financial system. Financial exclusion stems from the belief that a population is too high risk to receive funding. Sadly, this factor preeminently causes these same people to never be able to break out of poverty.

Unbanked farmers fall in the same boat. Due to their lack of collateral and credit history, they can only access loans starting at 100% interest rate. Crypto and blockchain has an opportunity to change that for the better.

speakers.name: Jordan Lyall
speakers.description: Jordan is a veteran builder in web2 and web3. Previously, Jordan served as CPO and Co-Founder of Nifty's Inc, an NFT platform for community engagement. Widely considered a pioneer at the intersection of media and technology, Jordan founded the $MEME Project, an early experimental NFT protocol. Prior, Jordan led product teams for the DeFi division at ConsenSys and served as the CPO at Totle, a crypto liquidity network. In addition, he co-founded Make Believe Labs, acquired by JibJab.

title: MVC - Launching a Minimum Viable Community in web3
description:
Crypto moves fast, but we shouldn't rush formation and governance in new communities.

A "minimum viable community" is a group with just the right amount of structure and direction to attract early members and validate a community mission early on.

speakers.name: Eugene Leventhal
speakers.description: Eugene Leventhal is the Head of Operations and Outreach at the Smart Contract Research Forum (SCRF), which is a granted org focused on advancing web3 research. Prior to joining SCRF, Eugene worked at Carnegie Mellon University as a Project Manager, supporting a blockchain research initiative and a podcast amongst other projects.

title: Decentralized Research Centers
description: This talk explores the idea of Decentralized Research Center (DRC), the collection of networks needed to advance and apply research in a single domain area. The first DRC we're working on is the DAO Research Hub in collaboration with the DAO Research Collective and Metagov. This talk will walk through a model of bringing together governance researchers and placing new researchers at universities.

speakers.name: Guangmian Kung
speakers.description: One part engineer, one part jurist and one part business. Currently Integrations and Partnerships Lead @ Kleros.

title: Social Recovery with Kleros Court
description: For most users, the only feasible way to back up a wallet was to accept all the hassle of backing up its seed phrase and storing it in a secured offline environment. While wallet recovery solution like Argent and Loopring's 'Guardians' are a step in the right direction, they still fall short of being a fully trustless solution. In this talk, I'll introduce the next step in the evolution of these solutions: Kleros Court as the ultimate trustless social recovery solution.

speakers.name: Alexander M√ºller
speakers.description: TBD, currently HoP at ChainSafe.

title: The blurry line between public Goods and web3 products

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: ChainSafe is building public goods such as client implementation for Ethereum2, Filecoin, Mina and Polkadot. When we started our for-profit product efforts we realized how blurry the line between public goods and for-profit products actually is. In this talk I want to share our learnings in creating a setup where public goods and products can be developed without compromising on web3 values.

speakers.name: John Morrow
speakers.description:
Currently, I am COO and Head of Product at Gauntlet, where we are building a financial modeling platform for crypto. I also advise a handful of start ups and organizations - Cred Protocol, Integral.link, AllianceDAO, and the WEF. Previously I worked at a few other start-ups, as well as Microsoft and Goldman Sachs. 

I have been publishing research in crypto since 2019, where my research is focused on crypto-economics and risk. Here's one papers :https://scfab.github.io/2020/FAB2020_p5.pdf

title: Don't Start a DAO, Contribute to one
description: As DAOs proliferate, they will need to scale their operations to continue their various missions. Right now, very few DAOs have been successful at getting a decentralized group of contributors and this leaves founding teams to carry a heavy burden. By focusing on DAO partnerships and optimizing your DAO to allow for and incentivize other contributors to join, this will drive the next wave of progress in our decentralized future.

speakers.name: Afri Schoedon
speakers.description: Head of Protocol Engineering and Managing Director (Germany) at ChainSafe Systems. Initiator of the Goerli Testnet Initiative and organizer of ETHBerlin. Maintainer of the open-source Ethereum Ruby and Crystal libraries.

title: Post-Merge Testnets
description: The merge of the beacon-chain consensus layer with the EVM execution layer is a major milestone for Ethereum, if not the most significant. The changes introduced are also affecting testing infrastructure. It's an excellent opportunity to look at the public testnet infrastructure, compare the various networks, and present the Sepolia and Goerli testnets to teams and developers still relying on Kovan, Rinkeby, or Ropsten.

speakers.name: Maurotov
speakers.description: Co-Founder at Tropykus.com, CEO at TRU. Co-director of the InTIColombia research group at Universidad Nacional de Colombia. Leader of the Colombia node for the Iberoamerican Blockchain Alliance. Electronic Engineer from the Universidad Nacional de Colombia. Master's Degree in Creation of Innovative and Tech Based Companies from the Universidad de Barcelona

title: Why Latin America needs DeFi, learnings from Tropykus
description: In this talk I would like to share my learnings and evidence about some financial problems of Latin Americans, such as inflation, high rates for remittances, high interest rates for loans, the problems of migrants to access financial services and why Decentralized Finance is the answer to many of these problems. Also, how Tropykus users are finding solutions from real cases using DeFI

speakers.name: Thijs Maas
speakers.description: Thijs Maas is a lawyer turned crypto-entrepreneur, now co-founder and CEO of Onramper, a fiat on-ramp aggregator. After going down the crypto-rabbit hole and helping many startups figure out strategy, compliance, and go-to-market, he recognized the existing challenges in fiat-to-crypto on-ramps - and knew they were solvable.

title: The state of fiat on-ramps for layer 2s
description:
While layer 2s have seen widescale adoption, they are often less accessible for those users that don't have crypto yet. 

In this talk, Thijs Maas, the CEO of Onramper, shall share unique insights into the fiat on-ramp market for layer 2s, using unique insights we get as aggregator. We shall demonstrate the gaps in current layer 2 on-ramp coverage (and it's impact), and give insight into the actual performance of layer 2 on-ramps. Spoiler: things are less rosy than they might seem...

speakers.name: Thijs Maas
speakers.description: Thijs Maas is a lawyer turned crypto-entrepreneur, now co-founder and CEO of Onramper, a fiat on-ramp aggregator. After going down the crypto-rabbit hole and helping many startups figure out strategy, compliance, and go-to-market, he recognized the existing challenges in fiat-to-crypto on-ramps - and knew they were solvable.

title: The performance of fiat on-ramps in developing regions
description: In this talk, Thijs Maas, CEO of Onramper, shall share unique insights into the performance of the major fiat on-ramps in developing regions, using unique insights only obtainable as on-ramp aggregator. Even though the impact of Ethereum is greatest in those areas that deal with inflation, censorship, and a lack of access to the financial system, it is exactly those developing regions where we, as a space, do a bad job of providing people with easy access to crypto.

speakers.name: Thijs Maas
speakers.description: Thijs Maas is a lawyer turned crypto-entrepreneur, now co-founder and CEO of Onramper, a fiat on-ramp aggregator. After going down the crypto-rabbit hole and helping many startups figure out strategy, compliance, and go-to-market, he recognized the existing challenges in fiat-to-crypto on-ramps - and knew they were solvable.

title: Building direct fiat on-ramps for your ERC20 in 60 minutes.
description:
In this session organized by Onramper, developers can learn how to build fiat on-ramps to their own ERC20s in 60 minutes. This method for any ERC20 traded on 1inch or Uniswap. After the workshop, their users shall be able to directly buy their token with credit cards, debit cards and directly in over 180 countries.

Having fiat on-ramps is an important part of any web3 experience, as without them, web3 is only accessible for those that already have crypto.

speakers.name: Camila
speakers.description: Camila is an engineer and educator who is passionate about making it easier for developers to build in web3. Camila works as a Developer Relations Engineer at Edge & Node where she helps devs build performant, decentralized APIs. She is core team at Women Build Web3, an accelerator for developing top woman engineering talent and fund for projects led by women.

title: Machismo, Remittence, & Inflation: Scaling Ethereum for Widespread Adoption in LATAM
description: According to Gemini's 2022 Global State of Crypto Report, women in developing countries lead in the adoption of crypto among women. Particularly, women in Latina America lead in crypto ownership when compared to other regions, with 43% of crypto holders being women. We'll take a real world lens to the reality of LATAM and the need to scale Ethereum, the status of L2s, emerging modular blockchains, and how they all fit into the end goal of getting Ethereum transactions into fractions of cents.

speakers.name: abrilzucchi
speakers.description:
I'm a smart contract developer passionate about technology and the blockchain ecosystem. 

I started my career in technology at the age of 16, and every day I learn new things and try to improve myself and be updated with new technologies.

title: Blockchain Development, how I started in this ecosystem at the age of 18 and how women can get involved in this professional career
description: The talk is going to be about how I started my professional career in blockchain development when I was only 18 years old and starting to develop smart contracts in DeFi protocols. Incentives and tips for those who want to get involved and encouraging women to enter the tech world.

speakers.name: alerios.eth
speakers.description: I like to build stuff :)

title: Web3 Reputation for DAOs and the Future of Work
description: A walkthrough on how Verifiable Credentials and dIDs are making Web3 Talent identities more meritocratic, accurate and privacy-preserving, showcasing practical use cases of the Krebit.id protocol.

speakers.name: alerios.eth
speakers.description: I like to build stuff :)

speakers.name: Andr√©s Montoya
speakers.description: I do code.

title: Composable Reputation for your dApps with Krebit.id
description:
A workshop on how to easily add Decentralized Reputation to any Web3 dApp by composing Krebit's community-verified credentials protocol built on Ceramic and Ethereum:

Use Case 1: Decentralized KYC/AML
Use Case 2: Restrict access to Content and Communities
Use Case 3: Anti-Sybil prevention

speakers.name: Solange Rodr√≠guez Soifer
speakers.description: Startup Grind Director Chapter - Mentor - Edtech Specialist with more than 10 years developing Products and business on the IT industry

title: A new paradigm to accelerate Startups
description: In this session we will present a new way to accelerate Startups, with the world‚Äôs first community-owned accelerator, SG DAO.

speakers.name: Daniel Ospina
speakers.description: Daniel is an Organisation Designer and Decentralised Governance nerd. He's a co-founder of RnDAO - an Inter-DAO R&D center. Previously, he was Head of Governance at Aragon, consulted for the likes of Google, BCG, and the UN, and was a visiting lecturer in Oxford University.

title: Yearly summary of our research into DAOs
description: In 2021 we set out to build an inter-DAO R&D center to advance DAO governance and operations. Now, after nearly a year, we're ready to share a summary of the learnings across 5 different research projects carried with partners such as Aragon, Sobol, Near Foundation, and more, on the topics of Measuring DAO Community Health, Consent Vs Consensus for decisions in DAOs, Role definitions in DAOs, the surprising relationship between Onboarding & Meetings culture, and SubDAOs dos and don'ts.

speakers.name: Tino Breddin
speakers.description: Built real-time transactions systems and databases. Previously part of Aeternity Core team. Now part of HOPR Core team building a decentralised protocol for transport-level privacy.

title: The Story of D.E.R.P.
description: This talk presents the reasoning behind the creation of D.E.R.P. (https://derp.hoprnet.org/) as a tool to educate DeFi users about privacy aspects and threats they could are exposed to constantly. It will touch on topics like linkability, front-running and MEVs before giving a technical overview on how D.E.R.P. is built. Attendees will become more sensitive about privacy and tooling used during their daily DeFi adventures.

speakers.name: Simoneth Gomez Fernandez
speakers.description:
Especialista QA, apasionada por la educaci√≥n, entusiasta de la Web3 y mercados financieros.
+7 a√±os de experiencia garantizando la calidad de software en proyectos end to end realizando planes y ejecuci√≥n de pruebas, gestionando equipos y garantizando la calidad del desarrollo (web, mobile y metaverso) desde la etapa de dise√±o hasta la puesta en producci√≥n y QC. 
Experiencia en transformaci√≥n de negocios tradicionales a Web3.
Mentora QA en AcademiaQA.com
Web2 ‚Üí Web3 NFTforWorld.com

title: ¬øComo transicionar mis servicios de Web2 a Web3?
description: Si te apasiona la innovaci√≥n, tienes un negocio tradicional que ya ofrece servicios online, no te pierdas todos los casos de uso que tienes para implementar de Web 3 en tu web tradicional a bajo costo.

speakers.name: Joanes Espanol
speakers.description: Joanes Espanol is the CTO at Amberdata. He is a versatile technology leader and architect with 20+ years of experience building web-scale infrastructure and applications. He has extensive cloud experience building upon/integrating with AWS and Pivotal Cloud Foundry. Joanes has architected, built and managed distributed and highly available systems. He is experienced with continuous integration, delivery and deployment with focus on micro-services, automation, scalability and Agile development.

title: DeFi Insights and Data Analytics - Can we get beyond TVL please?
description: This workshop will showcase the DeFi insights and data analytics we are building ‚Äì helping the audience understand the key points and metrics they should be looking at ‚Äì well beyond Total Value Locked (TVL). We will talk about why DeFi is important, dive into some of the killer apps disrupting TradFi and will ensure that the audience knows what data to look for, how to find it, and what tools can be built on it.

speakers.name: Shawn Douglass
speakers.description:
Shawn Douglass is a business and technology executive with over 20 years of experience in the industry. Mr. Douglass is Co-founder and CEO of Amberdata, a leading provider of digital asset data 
infrastructure and market intelligence to financial institutions. He has held roles as Board Member, Operating Executive, Technologist, Advisor, Venture Investor, and derivatives trader. Mr. 
Douglass is a graduate of Harvard Business School.

title: Cryptoeconomics - This Is How We See it
description: Join Shawn Douglass, CEO and co-Founder of Amberdata as he takes you through macro trends in crypto. Shawn has a truly unique lense into the crypto landscape. He'll show you data driven trends, leveraging proprietary data, giving you insights well beyond the Twitterverse. Learn about today's risks and opportunities and see where the on-chain activity is. He will show you "how we see it" - helping you strategize where you should put your time, talent and money.

speakers.name: Eugene
speakers.description: Avid crypto enthusiast. Investment Banker. Angel Investor.

title: How can blockchain technology dis-intermediate global payment rails?
description: Blockchain technology is a disruptive force and here to stay. What are the largest financial institutions doing in this space and which are the start-ups that are trying to create an alternative payment rail that is unencumbered by traditional payments? In this talk, I plan to showcase latest institutional activity amongst the largest financial institutions and what some innovative companies are doing to offer alternatives to consumers in the realm of payments.

speakers.name: Ricardo Paix√£o
speakers.description:
Coordinator LIFT Learning, Brazilian Central Bank's policy to foster entrepreneurship among college students.
Professor of Engineering @ UnB (Universidade de Bras√≠lia)
MBA & PhD Business (Insead and USP).

title: Central Bank Digital Currencies in Latin America

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
The panel intends to discuss the current stage of development of central bank digital currencies in Latin America. 
Panelists will discuss ways CBDCs can be used to solve hard problems such as financial inclusion, specially cheaper cross border transactions, such as remittances. 
In 2019 remittances accounted for more than 20% of GDP in Honduras and El Salvador, 14% in Guatemala and 8% in the Dominican Republic. 
Tradfis, such as Western Union, charge up to 10% of the gross value transacted.

speakers.name: Jon Stephens
speakers.description: I am a current PhD student at UT Austin as well as the CTO and a co-founder of Veridise. My work focuses on developing automated techniques to verify and identify bugs in various locations in the blockchain stack.

title: Are Your Zero-Knowledge Proofs Correct?
description: Recent efforts have made it possible to write zero-knowledge proofs without having deep expertise in cryptography. Nevertheless, these proofs can be subtly wrong and result in situations where the application erroneously ‚Äúverifies‚Äù bogus information from an attacker. In this talk, we will give an overview of our research that can be used to reason about the correctness of zero-knowledge proofs and highlight some of the open-source tools that Veridise has developed to find bugs in ZK circuits.

speakers.name: Kuberan Marimuthu
speakers.description:
ex-Coinbase Engineering leader
Currently Founder of CypherD Wallet (backed by YCombinator & Samsung)

title: CypherD Wallet Notification SDK
description: Sending notifications to wallet addresses is a big pain-point today in web3. Your NFT gets a bid, there is no way to notify the user without collecting personal information. We are building this capability into the wallet and exposing it for dApp developers. Also the users would have full control over which dApps can send notifications to the wallet address. No dApp can send a notification to the wallet user without user's permission.

speakers.name: Enrico Bottazzi
speakers.description: Building self-sovereign and private identity systems @iden3, @PolygonId

speakers.name: Oleksandr Brezhniev
speakers.description: Technical Leader at Polygon ID

title: Hack ZK identity with Polygon ID
description:
- Intro on ZK and its benefits for privacy
- Intro about Polygon ID
- Workshop on how to use Polygon ID SDK to create an end-to-end privacy application

speakers.name: Daniel  Olarte
speakers.description: Daniel leads the Founder and Community Development team at the Celo Foundation. He is the co-founder of Purum, a web3 p√°ramo restoration platform in Colombia, and the co-founder of Lava a ceramic tiles studio. Previously, he led service design at Sutter Health. Daniel is an architect and industrial designer.

title: Lunarpunk, witchy regenerative futures
description: This talk will cover some of the regenerative mechanisms and design patterns in the web3 space. It will place particular importance on the role web3 can play for the Carbon market in Colombia (One of the few countries with a carbon tax and a carbon market (not voluntary). Following the more introverted, darker, mysterious aesthetic of the Lunarpunk movement, this talk will aim to discuss Regenerative Finance from a more grounded perspective, away from the overly optimistic Solarpunk perspective.

speakers.name: James Adams
speakers.description: James has 8 years with Fortune 200 US firm ITW, and experience of managing projects in China, USA, and throughout Europe. James completed his MBA at the University of East Anglia in 2018, leaving his role within ITW to set up the Akcela startup incubator in Norwich, UK, where he lives with his wife and son. Akcela has grown to be an incubator with a number of blockchain companies, including Tech Educators which works with individuals from diverse backgrounds learn to code over 14 weeks.

speakers.name: Dom
speakers.description: Dom Davis is a veteran of The City and a casualty of The Financial Crisis. Not content with bringing the world to its knees he then went off to help break the internet before winding up in Norfolk where he messes about doing development and devops. Dom has been writing code since his childhood sometime in the last millennium ‚Äì he hopes some day to become good at it.

title: Building a local community, the first 90 days.
description:
This workshop will walk through the first 90 days of building a blockchain community. Whether you have a core team already or need support to make one, we walk through the pre-launch stage of engaging the first members and supporters. 

Following the outline of what is required as a team, we work together to set out a 90-day plan to engage a "sleeping" community, organise meetups either in person or digitally and share pre written talks, engagement plans and materials.

speakers.name: Benjamin Mariano
speakers.description: I am a current PhD student at UT Austin studying formal methods, verification, and program synthesis with Dr. Isil Dillig, with a specialized interest in smart contract security. I am also currently Vice President of Engineering at Veridise, a security auditing company for blockchain applications which focuses on using automated program analysis and verification. I am particularly excited about the use of techniques like static analysis, abstract interpretation, and property-based testing.

title: Hardening Smart Contract Security with Formal Methods
description: Bugs in smart contracts can lead to disastrous consequences and weaken confidence in the blockchain ecosystem. In this talk, we will give an overview of Veridise‚Äôs open-source technology for improving smart contract security. In particular, we will show how and when to use our blockchain agnostic common vulnerability detector, protocol guided fuzzer and formal verifier. In addition, we will discuss the classes of bugs that can be found with each tool.

speakers.name: Jan Gorzny
speakers.description: I'm the Head of L2 Scaling at Quantstamp. I have been interested in scaling solutions since Lightning was discussed and the Plasma white paper was written. I'm particularly interested in making sure these systems are as secure as they are scalable, and I have looked over several such systems during my time at Quantstamp. I also have a PhD in Computer Science from the University of Waterloo, where I studied graph algorithms. Other research interests include formal methods and complexity theory.

title: An Overview and Wishlist for Rollup Escape Hatches
description: Escape hatches are meant to be a way to exit assets or state from a rollup in the hopefully unlikely event that sequencers are offline. In this talk, we review which projects have these hatches and what plans are publicly available for future rollups or versions of these rollups. We list some ideas that these, and other rollups, may implement or adopt in the future, for more robust and secure rollups. The suggestions will be rooted in our concern for security and the issues presented by bridges.

speakers.name: Bree Yek
speakers.description:
A growth professional with 8 years' experience in new business, cross-border and business process optimisation, driven by a passion for sustainability. 

Currently banking the unbanked climate-positive projects at Carb0n.fi.

My hobbies include canine rehabilitation, community-based sustainability initiatives and making TCM-inspired skincare.

title: How can Carbon Offset NFTS bring Sustainability and Blockchain closer together?
description: There has been a new wave of interest around sustainability found by many projects in Web3 over the past 2 years. Many facets of sustainability and ESG (Environment, Social & Governance) are permeating the blockchain industry and creating ripples of excitement. One of the first aspects of sustainability tackled by these projects is focused around Carbon Offsets. Listen to Bree Yek, CEO & Co-Founder of Carb0n.fi, present the history around carbon offsets and highlight future opportunities.

speakers.name: Georgi Spasov
speakers.description: Im a blockchain dev and architect, working in the space since 2017. I've contributed to public infrastructure initiatives - like Meta Transactions - and I've helped build multiple decentralised applications  and DAOs

title: Educating the next breed of Ethereum Developers

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: The goal is to have a discussion with fellow educators about what is needed in order for us to find, educate and integrate the next breed of developers. What are the next hot locations, ways of reaching new people, making blockchain development accessible, and tailoring content towards the new generation of developers? What are their specific needs and how can we meet them? What are the projects specific needs and how can we meet them?

speakers.name: Domantas
speakers.description: I am a guy with a lot of passion for building innovative products. My previous experiences include architecting and implementing DLT and blockchain-based solutions, decentralized applications, developing and auditing smart contracts and building software for major insurance companies in the region.

title: On-chain hack mitigation
description: With the growth of the DeFi ecosystem we also saw unprecedented growth of exploits and enormous amounts of money being stolen. This lead to the emergence of the new security related tooling and protocols. But just spotting and exploit does not necessarily mean it can be stopped. Without changing of the way the on chain behaviour of protocols and assets there‚Äôs a limit of what can be achieved. This is why Lossless protocol build first on chain hack mitigation protocol that allows stopping exploit

speakers.name: Romain
speakers.description: Romain is an entrepreneur driven by the hope of redefining stakeholder capitalism and offering more participants the opportunity to enter the game of governance. With his banking law background and following a philosophy of activism, he built Paladin, a governance lending protocol, with a vision to create a world where participation in economic structures is easier and more rewarding.

title: Decentralized governance or governance minimization: is there a right path?
description: When building decentralized protocols, you will be faced by one crucial choice: should your protocol be upgradeable, and if so, how can you implement a decentralized modification framework? In this talk, we will explore how the needs of governance in crypto have been misinterpreted, why minimization is a dangerous choice for most, and what we can learn from the previous centuries of governance to build eternal and immutable pillars for the future.

speakers.name: Collin Myers
speakers.description:
Hi I am Collin Myers, founder of Obol Labs and project lead of the Obol Network. I have been working on lower layer Ethereum technologies since 2017 historically working at ConsenSys. I have spent the better part of the last 4 years working on the enablement of Eth2 in various capacities. I built the Eth2 calculator, Eth2 launchpad, internet bonds, and a co-creator of DVT.

I have spoken at Devcon before and would to do it again! Thank You for putting this on!!!

speakers.name: Ois√≠n Kyne
speakers.description: Co-founder of Obol Labs and building Distributed Validator Technology for Ethereum.

title: Distributed Validators for Ethereum
description:
Obol Labs is a research and software development team focused on proof-of-stake infrastructure for Ethereum. Focus areas are Internet Bonds, Distributed Validator Technology, and Multi-Operator Validation.

The core team is building Charon, a distributed validator middleware client. We will discuss the use of Charon with the DV Launchpad and how validators of all sizes can use the software to add resiliency and safety to their validator nodes.

speakers.name: kamel
speakers.description: Kamel has been building apps in Defi for the past 5 years. He is currently the Co-founder and CEO of contango.exchange, a Defi derivative protocol built on top of fixed rate protocols.

title: Fixed rates in Defi
description:
Most of DeFi borrowing and lending protocols use variable rates (Aave, Compound, etc). However, fixed rate markets in TradFi account for 13 trillions USD and this sector is still in its infancy in DeFi. In the past years, we have witnessed the rise of several fixed rate protocols and the goal of this talk is to present different designs:
- Zero coupon bonds: notional, yield
- Yield stripping: Element, Sense
- Contract for difference: Strips, YielSwap.

speakers.name: Cayman Nava
speakers.description: Ethereum core developer working on Lodestar at ChainSafe

title: Lodestar: Metrics-Driven Development
description:
Lodestar is the newest production-ready consensus client, written entirely in TypeScript.

How did we do it? How did we go from buggy, slow, and scared to agile, confident chads?
Metrics, metrics, metrics!

We will introduce the concept of metrics-driven development in the context of blockchain node development and give fun examples where metrics saved our hide, time and time again.

speakers.name: Mya Shofany
speakers.description: My name is Mya Shofany, I'm leading the Regulatory efforts at NEAR Foundation, with an outward focus on some of the regulatory challenges that arise in a Web3 world.  I previously worked at Binance US as the Head of Institutional Onboarding, and prior to that I was at Gemini.

title: The Different Use Cases of NFTs and Regulatory Overview!
description: Hi as someone working in the regulatory realm seeing the amazing use cases that are evolving in the space, especially from an NFT perspective I would love to discuss them a bit more and provide a regulatory lens for developers and founders of such companies.

speakers.name: Matt
speakers.description: Matt has been building on Ethereum since 2017. At Kleros, he was the lead developer of the Token registry, Curate and was the lead maintainer of Proof-of-Humanity from it's launch until late 2022.

title: Pythia: Exposing misinformation factories
description:
The internet is full of news outlets and influencers deliberately confusing the public with misinformation. There is almost no reputation tax for this as most of the time technical individuals simply do not have equivalent timely public reach.
Pythia leverages Stake Curate and Kleros to create a market that rewards users for accurately flagging misinformation and defending wrong accusations.
Finally, this database of flags can be used to build an easy to access accuracy score dashboard.

speakers.name: Martin Gutierrez
speakers.description: Crypto passionate building the space and investing in it every day. I'm a graduted Business Administrator in love with the WEB3, have been investing in crypto since 2017 and now NFT's changed my life so I want to build to change many people's life too. I work as NFT Lead Strategist at Tita Media, ideating and launching NFT projects for real companies in Latam. In addition I teach about NFT investments at Abacus Exchange, the financial education leading platform of Latin America.

title: NFT's and how to apply them to your company. Launch your first NFT project.
description: In this workshop we will be covering everything from what's an NFT and how does it work, to their multiple applications for businesses focused on retail and fashion. The end goal is to learn how to apply an NFT project to your brand and teach the step-by-step that companies have to follow in order to launch a successful NFT project that adds real long term value to their buyers.

speakers.name: Thomas Herman
speakers.description: Tom has been building Utility NFTs since 2018 when he launched DeedLock, to lock and transfer real estate deeds using NFT smart contracts.  He has spent the last 3 years building blockchain solutions to address climate change including as the 3rd employee at AirCarbon Pte Ltd where he built an ERC20 based Carbon Trading Exchange.  Tom co-founded Meta Carbon and sold the first Carbon Offset Backed NFTs in April 2021 to support endangered animals and their habitats.

title: Tokenizing Social and Environmental Impact
description:
We're going to do a non-techncial review the different types of data about carbon and carbon markets that are used for creating carbon offset backed tokens for marketing.  Agenda will include a review of the following:
Project Types: Forestry, Methane Capture, Cookstoves, etc.
Permanence/Durability: how long will it stay sequestered?
Additionality: would it happen anyway?
Registries: Verra, Gold Standard, ACX, etc?
MRV: Measurement, Reporting, Verification
... and more.

speakers.name: Han
speakers.description: OtoCo is a decentralized spin-off from otonomos.com which was founded in the early days of Ethereum and which has since helped countless crypto projects with their entity setup around the world. OtoCo brings entity formation onchain and adds dApp plugins that let distributed teams get the best of both worlds: an unincorporated DAO controlling a legal entity as its agent in the "real world".

title: OTOCO: On-chain legal entities for DAOs and crypto projects.
description:
Legal concepts in web3 with a focus on our solution: OtoCo

OtoCo is an on-chain entity creator that instantly forms Delaware and Wyoming LLCs, in less than 2 minutes for less than $20, using blockchain technology. Legal tools for freelancers, web3 teams, and DAOs, including fundraising for a legally-binding DAO!

Turn business logic into smart contracts, tokenize companies and simplify business building. Real-world company formation and tooling dashboard, all using a crypto wallet!

speakers.name: Soy Fira
speakers.description: Im the first female artist in Colombia. I paint in one line trace because we're all connected by one trace, and if you are connected to your soul you can shine brighter. I am a civil engineer, convinced that the bridges that we need to build to make the world a better place are physical and between people. I exhibit my NFTs at Expo Dubai and coming soon at Times Square. I have been feature in Forbes, Bloomberg, Elle UK, Vogue magazine among other important press mediums.

title: Art reflects what happens in society
description:
I have always say and believe that art reflects what happens in society. 
From Renaissance to Cryptopunks, I am going to take you on a journey of the history of art, and why after the covid19 NFTs became popular, even though they were actually created in 2012 with the colored coins. Based on my own experience as the 1st female cryptoartist in Colombia, we will learn with what I like to call my"street" experience and discover the power of a female in a men dominated space.
tags: Female Empowerment and History of Art

speakers.name: ManuAlzuru
speakers.description: Manu is a Venezuelan engineer, serial entrepreneur, humanist, solarpunk, nomad and DAO/governance/NFT enthusiast. Worked as a field engineer for Schlumberger and disgusted by the oil industry, he got out as soon as he could. Moved to Europe and worked with Jumia (largest marketplace in africa) and Medlanes (backed by microsoft). Manu has been working within DAOs (MetaCartel, TheLAO, API3), has helped in multiple Ethereum events (Devcon, ETHBerlin, ETHBarcelona) and now founder of DoinGud.

title: Decentralized Social Impact - Impacto Social Decentralizado

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
Many in our industry any are talking about impact but we haven't yet as humanity come together to define what impact really means. Others are talking a lot about climate change but are disregarding other problems that humanity are facing (poverty, hunger, health issues, education, gender inequality and others).

We now have our disposal tools that could change the whole game. From ERC-20 tokens, to NFTs (ERC71, ERC1155s...) and different DAO patterns now is time to use them for good.

speakers.name: Caria Wei
speakers.description: Caria is a senior leader in multiple areas, including product management, program management, business analysis, enterprise release management, incident management, and change management. She is a PMP, AWS Solution Architect, and Professional Scrum Master. Caria also holds an MBA from Schulich School of Business, York University, specializing in Strategic Management and Entrepreneurship. Caria has been in the Blockchain industry since 2019 and is now the Head of Product and DevOps at Metis.

title: Future of Social Identity in Web 3.0

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: An exploration of how everyone can build the social Identify in Web 3.0. Deep dive into the non-transferable tokenized representation of the myriad traits, features, and achievements that make up a person or entity. How DAOs can incorporate social identity into the governance model to enable a fair and utterly decentralized decision-making process.

speakers.name: Eugene Leventhal
speakers.description: Eugene Leventhal is the Head of Operations and Outreach at the Smart Contract Research Forum (SCRF), which is a granted org focused on advancing web3 research. Prior to joining SCRF, Eugene worked at Carnegie Mellon University as a Project Manager, supporting a blockchain research initiative and a podcast amongst other projects.

speakers.name: Joshua Tan
speakers.description: Executive director of Metagov, mathematician and computer scientist at Oxford and Stanford. See joshuatan.com/research

speakers.name: Ellie Rennie
speakers.description: Ellie Rennie is a Professor and ARC Future Fellow at RMIT University. Her current research uses digital ethnography to study the social outcomes arising from automation technologies, including blockchain. Prior to commencing her Future Fellowship, Ellie's research was focused on the topic of digital inclusion. She has written five books.

title: Open Problems in DAO Science Workshop
description: This workshop will bring together practitioners and researchers to discuss and collaborate on open problems pertaining to DAO Science. This session will be run by the DAO Research Hub, organized by the DAO Research Collective, Metagov, and SCRF.

speakers.name: Eugene Leventhal
speakers.description: Eugene Leventhal is the Head of Operations and Outreach at the Smart Contract Research Forum (SCRF), which is a granted org focused on advancing web3 research. Prior to joining SCRF, Eugene worked at Carnegie Mellon University as a Project Manager, supporting a blockchain research initiative and a podcast amongst other projects.

title: State of Web3+Peer Review
description: This talk will provide an overview of the state of web3 and peer review. We'll also delve into the specifics of the SCRF peer review project, and we will provide a status update on the peer review experiments.

speakers.name: Lauren Turton
speakers.description: Lauren Turton is a Public Speaker, host of the podcast Freedom with NFTs (Gary Vaynerchuck has been a guest on the show), Director of Web 3 Content at MOKO, and is an advocate for women in Web 3. She is on a mission to onboard and educate the masses to Web 3 so more people can create new opportunities and revenue streams in their lives. She has a #1 Best Selling book on the business expansion process she created called Soul Career Clarity and was featured in Forbes in 2021.

title: How to Manage Your Time To Prevent Burnout
description: In order to leverage Web 3 technology to have global impact we must make sure we are properly taking care of ourselves so that we prevent burnout or even worse, sickness or death. In this powerful talk you will learn strategies and be provided with tools that will empower and support you in maintaining your health so you can continue to create powerful projects that change the world.

speakers.name: Gilbert Hill
speakers.description: Privacy technologist, entrepreneur and speaker. Former CEO at Tapmydata, VC-funded blockchain startup building tools for data control and portability.  As MD of a London digital agency Gilbert specialised in the relationship between data, digital marketing and regulation, founding a pioneering software product in the PrivTech sector, and Cookiepedia, knowledge base for consumer tracking on the Web (acquired by OneTrust). He is now the Chief Strategy Officer at Pool.

title: ‚ÄúThe End of the world as we know it‚Äù - new EU laws will destroy silicon valley, but are great news for our ecosystem
description: The business model of web dinosaurs is facing an extinction-level event. The comet here is 4 new European data laws which could change the world. From platforms to portability, algos to AdTech, these laws bust silos and free data. The goal is decentralisation and fairness, and ethereum offers infrastructure with marketplaces and NFT artefacts. We discuss this unique challenge to expand blockchain tech to a market of billions. After all, not all of us have crypto to invest, but we all have data.

speakers.name: Shiv Malik
speakers.description:
Shiv Malik - CEO Pool Foundation
Shiv Malik is the author of two books, the co-founder of the Intergenerational Foundation think tank, an award nominated broadcaster, and a former investigative ‚Äãjournalist for the Guardian. In 2021 he co-founded Pool and currently leads the foundation on its mission to bring Data Unions to the world and ensure people have control of their data and a genuine stake in the digital economy.

title: Passive aggressive no more: how Web3 and advertising reconcile themselves.
description: Web3 needs to decide how to handle advertising. Simply being anti-advertising isn‚Äôt going to work; advertising will find a way in. Web2 programmatic advertising has meant giving up on privacy. But that doesn‚Äôt have to be the choice for Web3. In this talk Shiv Malik, CEO of Pool Data will detail how data wallets allow users to store their digital money as well as their digital stories. Aligning payments and stories will revolutionise KYC and ad tech, and is the only real way to preserve privacy

speakers.name: Sina Mahmoodi
speakers.description: I work on the go-ethereum client, with a focus on tracing, the JSON-RPC as well as GraphQL APIs.

title: EVM Tracing in Geth
description: Geth comes with a variety of ways to analyze the execution of past and constructed transactions. In addition to the collection of built-in tracers, users can submit scripts in JavaScript or Go which hook to the EVM, receiving minute events such as "opcode executed" or "entered new call frame". In the workshop, the audience can follow along a summary of basic tracing, commonly faced problems, as well as an introduction to the more recently shipped features and how to write efficient tracers.

speakers.name: Hadrien Croubois
speakers.description: Distributed systems Ph. D. ‚ñ™Ô∏é Smart Contract Engineer @ OpenZeppelin ‚ñ™Ô∏é #Ethereum Magician ‚ñ™Ô∏é @graphprotocol advocate

title: Build your first contract with the wizard of OZ
description: Whether you are a new developer writing your first contract, or an advanced one starting a new project, the OpenZepplin wizard is here to help you bootstrap your smart contract contracts. Let's see how to use it, from the basic contract idea to its deployment, in under 5 minutes!

speakers.name: Hadrien Croubois
speakers.description: Distributed systems Ph. D. ‚ñ™Ô∏é Smart Contract Engineer @ OpenZeppelin ‚ñ™Ô∏é #Ethereum Magician ‚ñ™Ô∏é @graphprotocol advocate

title: OpenZeppelin Contacts Roadmap
description: An overview of OpenZeppelin latest (governance, crosschain operations, ...) and futur contract development

speakers.name: Hadrien Croubois
speakers.description: Distributed systems Ph. D. ‚ñ™Ô∏é Smart Contract Engineer @ OpenZeppelin ‚ñ™Ô∏é #Ethereum Magician ‚ñ™Ô∏é @graphprotocol advocate

title: 5 smart contract patterns I wish more devs would use
description: A few creative and undervalued smart contract design patterns that could help you build more effectivelly.

speakers.name: Justin Drake
speakers.description: Ethereum researcher

title: ultra sound money
description:
This talks paints a big picture for ETH the asset and its macro cashflows. We discuss unique dynamics arising from:

* **fee burn** (ETH for blockspace payments)
* **issuance** (ETH for validator incentivisation)
* **staking** (ETH for economic security)
* **defi collateral** (ETH for economic bandwidth)

speakers.name: cvh
speakers.description: I'm an experienced Web2 Cloud Security Leader thats been investing and researching blockchain and crypto since 2015 to only later fall through the EVM rabithole with Ethereum, where I currently spend my team through a anon persona helping DAO's from giving advise to being part of their Council. I've also been managing all type of ethereum/bitcoin miners & nodes for quite some time, and doing security audits on protocols and crypto related organisations

title: Stay Safe: the Metaverse edition
description: This is a personal guide into OpSec, Osint and just general Security Due Diligence when living in the Metaverse. I will be discussing some scams & hacks played on individuals that have led to huge losses, and guide you through a series of checklists and workflows around wallet & social networks management, a little around physical security (especially when travelling) and understanding your own attack attack vectors depending on your profile.
