speakers.description: I'm an experienced Web2 Cloud Security Leader thats been investing and researching blockchain and crypto since 2015 to only later fall through the EVM rabithole with Ethereum, where I currently spend my team through a anon persona helping DAO's from giving advise to being part of their Council. I've also been managing all type of ethereum/bitcoin miners & nodes for quite some time, and doing security audits on protocols and crypto related organisations

title: Stay Safe: the Metaverse edition
description: This is a personal guide into OpSec, Osint and just general Security Due Diligence when living in the Metaverse. I will be discussing some scams & hacks played on individuals that have led to huge losses, and guide you through a series of checklists and workflows around wallet & social networks management, a little around physical security (especially when travelling) and understanding your own attack attack vectors depending on your profile.

speakers.name: Fabrizio Romano Genovese
speakers.description:
I work at the intersection of category theory, a super abstract branch of maths, and crypto: I focus on applying very general mathematical techniques to problems such as protocol design and MEV. I am interested in compositional design, correct by construction code, open games, formal verification.
I did my PhD in categorical quantum mechanics at Oxford, where I learned compositional methods, and worked for years with Statebox, developing correct-by-construction graphical programming languages.

title: Compositionality: The 10x engineer secret sauce
description: Proponents of blockchains argue that compositionality is a key feature. What is compositionality though?  Maybe surprisingly, there is a rich mathematical framework in which the concept can be made precise as a theory of systems. In this workshop, we provide a primer of that theory and we showcase two practical applications based on it: compositionality in game theory (open games) and in formal verification (automata). The workshop is aimed at devs. There are no mathematical prerequisites.

speakers.name: Sunny Aggarwal
speakers.description: Sunny Aggarwal is a Co-Founder of Osmosis Labs, the team building the Osmosis Zone AMM on the Cosmos SDK. Osmosis is an advanced Automated Market-Making (AMM) protocol focused on privacy, AMM design, and the rapidly expanding interchain. Privacy is a fundamental right, and to protect against MEV, Osmosis is developing cutting-edge techniques to encrypt transactions in the mempool and assure fair execution without frontrunning. Sunny‚Äôs been developing blockchain technologies since 2017.

title: Why builders are flocking to interchain DeFi and how users can reap the benefits
description: A major trend that only seems to be accelerating is the push for interoperability between DeFi projects. Bridges are cropping up not just within ecosystems like Ethereum but also connecting Ethereum with blockchain ecosystems like Cosmos and Polkadot. This presentation covers the most important reasons for the boom in development that‚Äôs creating this interoperable future and the possibilities unlocked for end users when liquidity can flow across ecosystems and become availabl

speakers.name: Julien Genestoux
speakers.description: Julien is the Founder & CEO of Unlock, where he‚Äôs building the web's new business model by enabling new ways for creators to monetize their content through a decentralized, access control protocol. He created his first company, Jobetudiant, while still in school. After nearly 20 years, it‚Äôs still one of the largest job boards for students in France.

title: How NFTs can restore digital ownership for humanity
description: Everyone hears ‚ÄúNFT‚Äù and thinks jpegs, but we‚Äôre at the beginning of something spectacular. With NFTs, our ability to assess ownership transparently and privately means that web services can verify users (and their data) without having to rely on the surveillance economy business model. Instead of being the product, users are able to access the product via the economics programmed into their NFTs. Users get more control over how their data is used, monetized, shared and more.

speakers.name: Zaki Manian
speakers.description: Zaki Manian is a Co-Founder of Sommelier, the most powerful coprocessor yet for DeFi traders and Liquidity Providers. He‚Äôs also a Co-Founder of iqlusion, which provides infrastructure like a data center and a Cosmos validator for next-gen crypto technologies. Previously, Zaki helped build the Cosmos ecosystem. Zaki‚Äôs skill sets in software engineering, programming, and computer science are largely self-taught.

title: How DeFi Goes Mainstream: Bridging the Gap Between Degens and Regulators
description: DeFi is at a crossroads and regulation is coming. The Lummis Gillibrand Crypto Bill is a start! But there‚Äôs more we can do. Validators could, for instance, be the administrators that execute Know Your Customer functions on DeFi protocols. This sort of integration of regulations directly into the architecture of blockchains would enable DeFi to maintain the openness and transparency that‚Äôs so valuable while bridging the gap for regulators to have their needs met.

speakers.name: Shyamal Patel
speakers.description: Shyamal has masters in high performance computation from USC and then joined VMware as lead dev on the linux kernel device drivers. After doing product management at Berkeley he became one of the first PMs for NSX ( networking and security ) business of VMware. He joined Sommelier late last year and has been helping to bring the cellars ( strategies ) to market with solid tokenomics, fees, and great user experience for all users.

title: From Zero to DeFi Strategist with the Sommelier Stack
description: In this workshop we‚Äôll explore the entire Strategy development process on Sommelier. Sommelier allows for strategies leveraging secure, arbitrary off-chain computation (such as machine learning modeling). This includes building data pipelines from Ethereum using The Graph, financial modeling, yield optimization, and data science backtesting. We‚Äôll demonstrate the various components to strategy development using the example of Sommelier‚Äôs very first cellar - the Aave Stablecoin Cellar.

speakers.name: Parithosh Jayanthi
speakers.description:
I am an Ethereum enthusiast with a deep love for all things servers. I incorporated Ethereum into my Master‚Äôs thesis and loved the experience so much as to make it my full time job. I currently work in the DevOps team of the Ethereum Foundation and I mainly focus on the Ethereum Merge.

I‚Äôm also an avid photographer with a specific interest in Landscape and Travel photography. I‚Äôm a casual game

title: Quest for the best tests, a retrospective on #TestingTheMerge
description: A retrospective on #TestingTheMerge and all the various testing avenues we explored. I'd also give  a brief summary of what went right and wrong in our approach.

speakers.name: Milton Berman
speakers.description: I‚Äôm an informatics engineer and co-founder of WakeUp. I‚Äôve been leading software product teams for the past 15 years and started working in the cryptocurrency industry 5 years ago. I‚Äôm passionate about web3 and blockchain technology.

title: Why NFTs are valuable (hint: not because the twitter pfp)
description:
There's a clich√© that NFTs are just pfp (profile pictures), but the way I see it, that's the tip of the iceberg; in the upcoming era, only the 0.1% use cases will be pfp
I‚Äôd like to dive in on why NFTs have value and will become the technology that will define ownership in the upcoming era.
I will also highlight some ideas on how this technology works and how its infrastructure can be improved.

speakers.name: Gonzalo Silman
speakers.description:
I joined this community back in 2017 when I started to buy crypto. It was not until 2020 that I got fully involved in the crypto world. I started doing a lot of research about the ecosystem and this let me to build an NFT gaming community, Cryptohub, to share knowledge, experiences, achievements and help people get into this world. The biggest thing here, is that I started developing software around the NFT gaming technology.
Nowadays, I‚Äôm building along with some amazing people, WakeUp.

title: Latin America NFTs adoption: first steps & future of NFT technology.
description: Play to Earn games lowered the barriers to entry into the NFT world, encouraged some people to access banking services, and provided a new gateway to the crypto ecosystem. Through this talk, we will seek to review how Latin America came across it, especially Argentina, and finally, talk about its not-so-good but expected outcome. Finally, a thoughtful perspective will be given on what could have been learned from the maelstrom of 2021 and what the future immersed in NFT will look like.

speakers.name: Linda Lu
speakers.description: Linda Lu, Head of Ecosystem Oasis Protocol Foundation, is building the future of web3 with a focus on decentralized infrastructure, privacy, security & open-source environments.

title: Decentralized Data Science and Data DAO for Public Good
description: In this talk, we‚Äôll highlight our work on Decentralized Data Science and Data DAO for public good. Data DAO enables different entities and data producers to join together to form a DAO which governs how data under this DAO will be used and how the generated revenue and profit may be distributed and used. For example, a Data DAO of medical data from individuals may decide that the revenue generated from the data may be used to form an insurance which will be used to pay for medical expenses of pa

speakers.name: Linda Lu
speakers.description: Linda Lu, Head of Ecosystem Oasis Protocol Foundation, is building the future of web3 with a focus on decentralized infrastructure, privacy, security & open-source environments.

title: Confidential NFTs
description: Oasis‚Äô privacy preserving technology called Parcel, is being integrated with the Metamirror NFT marketplace. ‚ÄúArmy of Minions‚Äù, a confidential NFT series, grants owners access to the underlying mathematical functions that created their NFT. This exciting concept of connecting private NFT-based identity with ownership rights offers tantalizing possibilities for the future.

speakers.name: Linda Lu
speakers.description: Linda Lu, Head of Ecosystem Oasis Protocol Foundation, is building the future of web3 with a focus on decentralized infrastructure, privacy, security & open-source environments.

title: Cipher ParaTime: Confidential & EVM Compatible Smart Contracts
description: Traditional Finance is a black box. To unlock more market share DeFi needs to acknowledge that there ARE transactions that need to be kept private. Cipher brings a host of new features and capabilities to the Oasis Network, like confidential smart contracts, as well as EVM compatibility. With Cipher we aim to provide top-tier smart contract support while giving developers full access to confidential compute.

speakers.name: Paul Brody
speakers.description: Paul Brody is the global blockchain leader at EY (Ernst & Young).  For the last seven years, he has championed the use of public blockchains and open systems for enterprise users and the need for privacy.  EY is the only major professional services company focused on the Ethereum ecosystem and committed to public blockchains.

speakers.name: Swati Rawal
speakers.description: She received her B.Sc.(Hons) degree from the University of Delhi, Delhi, India in 2014 and her Master‚Äôs degree in Mathematics and Scientific Computing from NIT Allahabad, India in 2016. She did her Ph.D. from NIT Allahabad, India. Her area of research is Lattice-based Digital Signatures. She joined the blockchain team of Ernst & Young early this  year and working on the project Starlight

title: Scaling Privacy with Nightfall and Starlight
description: Five years ago, at DevCon in Prague, EY took the wraps off Nightfall, our open source public domain approach to privacy. Now it's live on Ethereum as a layer 2 privacy-enabled ZK-optimistic roll-up solution called Polygon Nightfall.  That's only half the story though - we also need private smart contracts.  This talk will cover our roadmap to that end, including our newest tool in development (also open source) called Starlight.

speakers.name: William George
speakers.description: William George has a PhD in mathematics from the University of Toronto. His thesis was on number theory problems related to elliptic curve cryptography. During postdoctoral fellowships at the University of Toronto and at √âcole Polytechnique (Palaiseau, France), he has done research on applications of blockchains, particularly in the use of blockchains in identity management systems. William is currently research lead for the blockchain-based dispute resolution platform Kleros.

title: Economic incentives and Souls in Schelling-point based oracles
description: Schelling-point based oracles, such as Kleros, can be used to attribute soulbound tokens (SBTs) to individuals based on subjective evaluations of their backgrounds and expertise. Moreover, mechanisms using SBTs can complement economic incentives in such oracles; for example, an SBT-conscious random selection process can determine the voters on a given question. We will focus on how the interplay of economic and social elements in such systems can be designed to maximize resistance to attacks.

speakers.name: Alex Shevchenko
speakers.description: Alex Shevchenko, Ph.D. in physics and math, entrepreneur, blockchain enthusiast since 2015, developer of Bitfury‚Äôs Exonum, and a strong believer in blockchain scalability solutions.

title: Building attractive ecosystems: Making life smooth for developers and users
description: How can we as an industry be successful and onboard billions of users to Web3? We as blockchain developers need to find an answer to this question and take the right steps towards mass adoption.

speakers.name: Luka Kropec
speakers.description: I work on the Translation Program at ethereum.org and ecosystem development at the Ethereum Foundation.

title: Growing the global Ethereum community through localization
description:
Over 6 billion people in the world do not speak English at all.
By localizing and providing Ethereum content (user interfaces, documentation, educational content, etc.) in different languages, we can dramatically increase our target audience and onboard more people to Ethereum, as well as make Ethereum education more accessible.

speakers.name: Elena Sinelnikova
speakers.description: Elena Sinelnikova is a former Government of Canada solutions architect turned entrepreneur and co-founded several startups. Metis.io, scalability and low-code solution for DeFi, NFT, and dApps on Ethereum, and CryptoChicks.ca ‚Äì educational hub and accelerator for women in blockchain in 56 countries.

title: Soulbound non-transferable NFT (Reputation Power): lessons learned from the implementation in our community
description: We have implemented and tested first release of the Reputation Power as Soulbound non-transferable non fungible tokens in Metis community in June 2022. This talk is the aftermath of this first implementation and its adoption by the community. I will talk about awesome results and improvements in the community governance that came out of it as well as lessons learned, so when others implemented their version if Soulbound tokens can learn from our experience.

speakers.name: Andreas Fauler
speakers.description:
linkedin.com/in/fauler
@XQTStrategy

title: Incorporating a DAO as a Societas Cooperativa Europaea (SCE)
description: Rocketstar SCE is the first DAO to incorporate as a Societas Cooperativa Europaea (SCE), a European Cooperative. The comparably new legal form very much aligns with DAO ideas and principles and allows for nearly complete digital operations, decentralized coordination, governance and ownership incl. a share register on a blockchain.

speakers.name: Igor Pugachevsky
speakers.description: Igor has more than a decade of experience in product launches. Before founding Hyperlens, he built products for a number of prominent DeFi and blockchain startups including Waves Labs & DeFiYield.

speakers.name: Milton Guarderas
speakers.description:
Founder of Bridging Networks
Chief Business Development Officer of Hyperlens

Milton has 5 years in-depth experience and international understanding of the Blockchain, NFT, Play2earn, Metaverse and Bitcoin OTC space. 

He has been building meaningful connections while learning from industry leaders around the globe by hosting VIP dinners and events connecting people and providing solutions the past 5 years for free.

title: Spatial Web3 dApps

speakers.name: Jose Fabrega
speakers.description: Former investment analyst, currently working at Research & Marketing for MetisDAO.

title: Decentralizing Society
description:
Decentralizing blockchains is a great step, but just the first step. It's hard to think of a decentralized future if corporations, identities, and communities remain highly centralized. This talk will focus on potential solutions to these issues, with an emphasis on Soulbound Tokens.

Users want privacy, but also want the benefits that come with transparency/reputation. So, how could users enjoy of both?

speakers.name: Ben Armstrong
speakers.description: Ben Armstrong of BitBoy Crypto is an investor, crypto influencer, and thought-leader whose involvement in the world of cryptocurrency began in 2012 when he first invested in bitcoin. Ben Armstrong founded the BitBoy Crypto YouTube Channel in January of 2018 when he decided to go "full-time crypto" and focus all of his time and energy on expanding the reach of the crypto community. Since then, BitBoy Crypto has become one of the most recognized news channels for the latest updates on Bitcoin and

title: Interest Rate Swaps: Unlocking DeFis true potential

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Interest Rate Swaps (IRS) are a core component of the world's financial systems, with a quadrillion dollars in notional trading volume exchanged each year in TradFi IRS markets. For DeFi to evolve into the future financial system of the world, interest rate swaps are a critical building block. Voltz Protocol brings interest rate swaps to DeFi in a manner that is up to 3,000 times more capital efficient than alternative models, unlocking a variety of use cases such as speculation, risk management

speakers.name: Rodrigo Benzaquen
speakers.description:
I've spent my career to date in various areas of tech - MercadoLibre as first employee, Kaszek Ventures and NubeliU. I developed a strong interest in crypto back in 2011 when I was living in Silicon Valley. 

After spending 14 years managing MercadoLibre Cloud Teams and three years living in Silicon Valley doing research & Development , I came back to Latin America and started NubeliU. 

Today, I'm spending my time working only on Crypto. We have a Family Office Crypto Fund, and SenseiNode.

title: Lessons learned running a validator in LATAM outside AWS

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
We found many small datacenters in different regions from LATAM that provided us with bare metal machines that would help the decentralization of the Ethereum POS Blockchain but we encountered the task to try to standardize how we can run multiple nodes in different countries using the same configuration and deployment automatization.

using open source tools and running as many nodes as we could deployed virtually, monitored from a unique dashboard and zabbix/grafana system.

speakers.name: Yuan Su
speakers.description: cofounder and tech lead of metis.io

title: Deep Dive: Metis Smart L2
description:
I will do a deep dive of the current and future state of Metis's smart L2 construct covering:
1. How rollups works
2. throughout implications
3. data availability assumptions
4. security assumptions
5. the role of governance in an infrastructure construct

The talk will be targeting at curious minds who want to dive into the details of core infrastructure designs and security trade offs.

speakers.name: lightclient
speakers.description: Member of the go-ethereum team. Maintains several specifications, including `ethereum/execution-apis`. Co-author of EIP-3074.

title: Lessons from the TxPool
description: October is a long ways away, but I'm planning to rewrite the geth tx pool soon and expect that there will be many interesting insights that come from that which I could speak on.

speakers.name: Caspar Schwarz-Schilling
speakers.description: Researcher @ Ethereum Foundation, Robust Incentives Group

title: tbd - several options, see description/notes
description:
There is a multitude of topics I am thinking of talking about: 
* reorgs but instead of focusing on specifics of ex ante reorgs (like liscon talk), I would want it to be more high level / ‚Äúphilosophical‚Äù. For example talk about how reorgs don‚Äôt really show up in traditional consensus literature (bc they don‚Äôt really concern safety/liveness which is the classical security notion), etc.

[CONTINUED IN NOTES ... ]

speakers.name: Ansgar Dietrichs
speakers.description: Researcher at the Ethereum Foundation

title: Multidimensional Resource Pricing OR L2EVM OR tbd
description:
Multidim. Resource Pricing: EIP-4844 will for the first time introduce a new resource type, priced independently from main execution. Can we split existing pricing into multiple dimensions as well, to make resource usage more efficient?

OR

L2EVM: Rollups are converging on EVM equivalence. Minimizing the difference to the base layer EVM brings many standardization benefits, but reduces speed of innovation. Can we have the best of both worlds by having a separate standard L2EVM?

OR

tbd

speakers.name: Enricripto
speakers.description:
Soy de M√©xico, tengo 29 a√±os, tengo mas de 6 a√±os en la industria cripto, me forme de manera profesional como psic√≥logo y licenciado en derecho por lo tanto mi enfoque ha sido dentro de cripto mas humano que t√©cnico, ademas de haber participado en m√∫ltiples seminarios acerca de psic√≥logia de las finanzas.

Actualmente tengo un club privado de personas con intereses en criptomonedas, mi comunidad tiene muchas personas activas que respaldan mi trabajo.

adicional a eso tambi√©n creo contenido.

title: Ethereum y finanzas de la vida cotidiana
description:
En realidad esta presentaci√≥n la he hecho en varios paneles acerca de cripto y web3 su verdadero nombre es ¬¥criptomonedas y finanzas de la vida cotidiana¬¥ en esta ocasi√≥n ser√≠a totalmente enfocado a Ethereum. 
Mi formaci√≥n como psic√≥logo y licenciado en derecho ademas de mis ya mas de 5 a√±os dedicado 100% al ecosistema cripto me permiten darle una visi√≥n humana al desarrollo de estas tecnolog√≠as que apuestan por la decentralizaci√≥n el progreso humano.

speakers.name: Joshua Tan
speakers.description: Executive director of Metagov, mathematician and computer scientist at Oxford and Stanford. See joshuatan.com/research

title: Building composable governance for DAOs
description:
How do we build interoperable systems for governing DAOs? This conversation will explore developments and insights from DAOstar One (https://daostar.one), a roundtable of 70+ DAOs and DAO service providers. Panelists include Dennison Bertram, CEO of Tally, Romain Figuero, CEO of Paladin, Kei Kreutler, co-founder of Gnosis Guild, and Joshua Tan, Executive Director of Metagov.

We will also be announcing a new DAOstar standard!

speakers.name: Rodrigo
speakers.description: Rodrigo Seira is Associate General Counsel at Paradigm. Prior to joining Paradigm, he was outside counsel to crypto investors and entrepreneurs at Cooley LLP. Prior to that, Rodrigo was a founding member of DLX Law, a blockchain and crypto focused boutique. Rodrigo earned a J.D. from Harvard Law School and a B.A. in Philosophy and Political Science from Middlebury College.

title: Legal Wrappers and DAOs
description:
Should DAOs form legal entities? What are the benefits and tradeoffs of "wrapping" a DAO with a legal entity?

What types of legal entities are available to DAOs and how do they compare to each other? 

I will present my research and tools like daos.paradigm.xyz

speakers.name: Pavel Sinelnikov
speakers.description: Pavel has been in the Ethereum ecosystem since 2017. Pavel currently works as the Integration Lead at Metis and has contributed in developing the core governance processes present in Metis.

title: Decentralizing Token Governance
description:
The baseline for many projects looking to decentralize their operations is through governance tokens. We will explore different governance token mechanisms including:

- Transferable models
- Proof of Usage models
- Reputation-based models

We will also explore some common attacks of governance (e.g. sybil) and some strategies to prevent those attacks.

speakers.name: Anne Connelly
speakers.description: Anne Connelly has been a leader in the blockchain and cryptocurrency sector since 2012. She is Faculty at Boston University, where she teaches blockchain for social impact. She is passionate about decentralized governance, and is a membe of the Gitcoin and MGD DAOs. She is the co-author of ‚ÄúBitcoin and the Future of Fundraising‚Äù, a book that guides charities to establish crypto donation programs, and the co-author of ‚ÄòTrust‚Äô, a graphic novel that teaches young Africans about blockchains.

speakers.name: CHIEF NYAMWEYA
speakers.description: Author, animator and creative director of Freehand Studios, Nairobi, Kenya.

title: Trust - the graphic novel that teaches young Africans about blockchain technology
description: 'Trust' is a graphic novel and motion comic that teaches young Africans about blockchain technology. In this session, we'll share art from the book and a clip from the motion comic. We'll also talk about the importance of storytelling as a means to onboard new people into the space - particularly those from diverse cultures.

speakers.name: Oaksprout the Tan
speakers.description: Oaksprout is a co-founder of Valory, the startup creating Autonolas, a platform and tech stack for building full-stack autonomous applications. He has extensive experience in web2 product development, as the founder of a self-sovereign data startup and as an early contributor to and investor in DeFi projects.

title: Putting the A back in DAO: a stack to build (off-chain) autonomous services
description: DAOs are incredibly important to the Ethereum ecosystem but many DAO tasks are still performed with very little actual autonomy. The current approaches are constrained, but don‚Äôt have to be.  Autonolas co-founder David Minarsch will demonstrate an open-source stack developers can use to build off-chain autonomous services that are robust (multiple nodes), transparent (code) and decentralized (multiple operators). The services are anchored on the Autonolas protocol on-chain, deployed on Ethereum.

speakers.name: Alon Muroch
speakers.description: Alon has been in the blockchain industry from 2013, started life as a developer working on bitcoin and ethereum clients, developing later on SSV.Network.

title: SSV/ DVT as the future of eth staking infra

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
Secret-Shared-Validator (SSV) is an implementation of Distributed-Validator-Tech(DVT) that enables the distribution of ethereum validator keys into independent operators which coordinate between one another using a consensus protocol and signing using threshold signatures.

SSV is built as a distributed staking infra for ethereum. The network is composed of permissionless operators (running ssv nodes) which are selected by services building on ssv as their operator pool to operate operators.

speakers.name: Christina Beltramini
speakers.description: Christina is Head of Growth at Aave Companies, focusing on partnerships across its suite of Web3 products. Christina began her career as an Investment Banker at J.P. Morgan, then worked for various hyper growth consumer tech companies in business development, operations and finance orientated roles. Prior to Aave, she was one of ByteDance/TikTok‚Äôs early US based employees working on music innovation partnerships and spearheaded the company‚Äôs first foray into NFTs.

title: Web3 Social - The Next Frontier
description:
Unpack the future web3 social world - why we need it and the protocols that will help shape it. 

Lens Protocol
Lit Protocol
Livepeer
ENS

speakers.name: Jon Kol
speakers.description: Building the Interchain future with Abacus. Previously at Galaxy Digital, and Passport Capital.

title: Build Interchain Apps with Abacus

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: In this workshop we will explain to the audience what the Abacus protocol is, and how they can use it and our tools to build bonafide interchain applications, applications that can come as close as possible to sharing state despite existing on difference blockchains. Abacus is focused on EVM chains, and can turn any EVM chain into another L2 for Ethereum.

speakers.name: David Gan
speakers.description:
David Gan is the Founder and General Partner of OP Crypto, the parent company of OP Venture Fund and OP Opportunity Fund. David is the only former tier-1 centralized exchange executive to launch a crypto venture capital fund, with native ties to both the western and Asia markets. 

In 2021, he founded OP Crypto to invest in projects that it believes will help shape the future of corporate governance and transfer power from centralized entities to content creators in the upcoming Web 3.0

title: Web3 investing in emerging markets
description: At OP, our mission is to invest in and support the best teams and projects that will bring blockchain adoption to the next hundreds of millions of people around the globe. Given our expertise and exposure, our core thesis is that there will be a new wave of users coming onboard in the emerging markets. Asia and LATAM is well-suited for rapid growth in crypto adoption due to its rapidly growing and young population.

speakers.name: Ross Neilson
speakers.description: PM & developer at DXdao working on building out novel governance platforms, built for DAOs by a DAO

title: Accessible Autonomy
description:
Often the most overlooked part of DAOs, autonomy and sovereignty is one of the core aspects of DAOs. In the current environment, this is treated as secondary and often we see DAOs that's core functionality isn't even interacting with on-chain contracts. 
This talk explores just how critical on-chain autonomy is and how only having a select few able to use that autonomy is a mistake. Technical background should not be needed to make a proposal and accessible autonomy is a key area to perfect.

speakers.name: Sunny Satva
speakers.description: Sunny is a social entrepreneur, engineer, and co-founder of the Cryptolingo DAO and Black Leaders DAO. Sunny is passionate about diversity, equity, and inclusion in web3 and sustainability.

title: Diversity and Inclusion in web3 through DAOs
description: The future of Web3 is dependent on making this space accessible to the masses. I'll be speaking about how DAO organizing is allowing more diverse individuals and communities to feel comfortable learning about, investing in, and building with blockchain technology. The Cryptolingo DAO is a multilingual organisation with a goal of breaking language barriers in web3. The Black Leaders DAO is advancing the next generation of black leaders in Web3. The Blu3 DAO is helping womxn find their dream jobs.

speakers.name: Cyrus Adkisson
speakers.description: Ethersale investor, early Dapp developer, creator of Ethereum's first cryptocollectibles (NFTs). Otherwise unremarkable.

title: The Story of Ethereum's First NFTs
description: I wrote and deployed Etheria, the first NFTs on Ethereum, the first NFT smart contracts in history and the first blockchain real estate (metaverse?). I spoke at Devcon 1. The story of how & why I built Etheria along with the story of how it was rediscovered and resurrected in 2021 is interesting as there were plenty of technical and social challenges to overcome.

speakers.name: Stanis Kulechov
speakers.description: Stani Kulechov, founder and CEO of the Aave Companies, was studying law at the University of Helsinki when he first began learning about smart contracts and thus, about the Ethereum blockchain network.¬† This lead to an exploration of how blockchain technology could impact the traditional financial system. In 2017, Stani released ETHLend, one of the first DeFi DApps which allowed for peer-to-peer digital asset transactions. Stani has made it his mission to create tools for an open, transparent, a

title: The web3 Social Layer -- Building Exciting, New Experiences
description:
Today, we give away valuable ownership of our data, content, and audience to big social network platforms, whose business models thrive on our acquiescence and their dominance. 

Web3 promises a new open graph where users own their data, content, and social networks and can move their digital footprint freely between platforms.

speakers.name: Arnau
speakers.description:
Arnau is a Software Engineer working in the crypto space since 2018. He has experience in decentralized identity projects (iden3), and has been working on Hermez since it's inception.
Currently leading the development of the node for the zkEVM rollup at Polygon Hermez.

title: Polygon Hermez zkEVM: Protocol and decentralization roadmap
description:
This talk it's going to be all about the zkEVM Polygon Hermez protocol:

- What actors participate on the network, and which is their role
- The different steps that we've gone through from the first testnet version until the current day
- Remaining work to be done before going mainnet
- How users can participate (aka run nodes)
- Future improvements to further decentralize the network

speakers.name: Arnau
speakers.description:
Arnau is a Software Engineer working in the crypto space since 2018. He has experience in decentralized identity projects (iden3), and has been working on Hermez since it's inception.
Currently leading the development of the node for the zkEVM rollup at Polygon Hermez.

title: WORKSHOP: Setting up your zkEVM Polygon Hermez node
description:
In this workshop, you will learn in practice how to set up your own zkEVM Polygon Hermez Node, you will:

- Understand what it is about
- Understand how to take advantage of the configurations
- Understand what each component does, why, and how
- Understand where the information is stored
- Understand which components are needed depending on the role you want to perform

speakers.name: Balazs Bodo
speakers.description:
Bal√°zs Bod√≥, is a socio-legal researcher at the Institute for Information Law, University of Amsterdam.
He was a Fulbright Visiting Researcher at Stanford University‚Äôs Center for Internet and Society in 2006/7 and a Fulbright Fellow at the Berkman Center for Internet and Society at Harvard University in 2012/13. In 2018 he received an ERC Starting Grant to study the legal, and political implications of blockchain based technologies, and started the Blockchain & Society Policy Research Lab.

title: When trust becomes a product - trust dynamics in the digital society
description:
Trust is a fundamental building block of our society. But trust, both interpersonal, and institutional, is constantly being disrupted ‚Äì willfully, or inadvertently ‚Äì by technological innovation. This innovation turns trust into a product, and the trustworthiness of a human being into a commodity to be bought and sold. 
How does the nature of interpersonal and societal trust change in response to the emergence of private technological trust infrastructures?

speakers.name: Thibaut Sahaghian
speakers.description: Thibaut is the CEO of Multis. He has been a blockchain enthusiast since 2014. He began his career as an investment banker at BNP Paribas but he discovered crypto‚Äôs potential while campaigning for a major French politician running for office when he investigated blockchain applications for online and decentralized voting. He believes that digital currency will birth an open financial system and support billions of entrepreneurs worldwide.

title: DAO dos and don'ts: learnings from the community on how to get your DAO thriving

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: It's easy to start a DAO but how can you ensure that it thrives, prospers, and hews to its mission? In this talk, Multis CEO Thibaut Sahaghian looks at learnings from top DAOs Multis works with and highlights community members in the space tackling thorny but necessary topics like compliance, coordination, reporting, and treasury management. Designed for people wanting to start a DAO or desperately needing to level up their DAOs toolkit.

speakers.name: Robby Greenfield
speakers.description: With 10+ years of experience in the blockchain ecosystem, Robby Greenfield has led over a dozen high-profile initiatives at the intersection of Web3 and social impact across 17 different countries. He has led blockchain projects with the UN, the U.S. State Dept., Care, the Red Cross, Oxfam, and WWF. More notably, he co-deployed the world's first crypto-based aid program, tamper-proof worker-voice survey, and DeFi USSD wallet. Greenfield co-founded ConsenSys Social Impact, BSIC, and Umoja Labs.

title: Decentralized Microfinance
description: Globally, there is $450 billion in financing demand by smallholder farmers - a group that feeds over 80% of the world. Without credit, these farmers cannot expand their farms nor increase their incomes. However, the blockchain ecosystem has amassed over $80 billion in total value locked across DeFi protocols that don't support pragmatic financing. "Decentralized Microfinance" proposes a structure on how to leverage DeFi to expand access to financial services to REAL underserved communities.

speakers.name: Chjango
speakers.description: Chjango is a longstanding cryptocurrency evangelist, community builder, and technologist with specialization in Layer 1 consensus protocols and cryptoeconomics. She works on seed stage projects, growing those ecosystems from 0 to $1B market cap, having been one of the founding team members of Cosmos Network. She now advises cornerstone Cosmos ecosystem projects like Osmosis. She was formerly Ecosystem Development VP at Tendermint Inc, the team behind Cosmos.

title: The perils of liquid staking in a pos L1
description: Lido voting power concentration

speakers.name: Lane Rettig
speakers.description: Lane Rettig is a writer, hacker, entrepreneur, and investor deeply fascinated by the intersection of technological and social systems, and committed to architecting and building human-centric software. He's been working full time on blockchain R&D since 2017. He was formerly an Ethereum core developer, and now focuses his efforts on Spacemesh, a  a next-generation smart contract platform based on a novel consensus mechanism.

title: Layer One Governance: 2022 Edition

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: This panel is an updated version of an extremely successful breakout session hosted in 2019 at DevCon V in Osaka (https://archive.devcon.org/archive/watch/5/state-of-blockchain-governance-breakout/). It will include speakers from major layer one ecosystems (Ethereum, Bitcoin, Near Protocol, Cosmos, Polkadot, Zcash, Tezos, BNB Chain, Polygon, Avalanche) and introduce how each ecosystem/chain is governed, what's going well, and challenges each faces.

speakers.name: Lane Rettig
speakers.description: Lane Rettig is a writer, hacker, entrepreneur, and investor deeply fascinated by the intersection of technological and social systems, and committed to architecting and building human-centric software. He's been working full time on blockchain R&D since 2017. He was formerly an Ethereum core developer, and now focuses his efforts on Spacemesh, a  a next-generation smart contract platform based on a novel consensus mechanism.

speakers.name: Ale Machado
speakers.description: Alejandro is a co-founder of the Open Money Initiative and a product strategist at Bitrefill, the world's most popular site to buy real-world goods and services with cryptocurrency, including being able to pay water and electricity bills in El Salvador. He will talk about his observations on the ground in El Salvador, where the average citizen doesn't have a bank account, but does have a mobile phone, and a better-than-average awareness of bitcoin and its benefits.

title: Bitcoin is for Dictators
description: Last year, El Salvador took a big step and became the first sovereign nation state to declare a cryptocurrency, Bitcoin, legal tender. Other countries, most recently Central African Republic, are following suit, and more are sure to follow. This talk presents the history and context of El Salvador's decision, including its complex political and economic situation. It's based on personal research and travel in El Salvador, and considers broader implications and lessons for the Ethereum community.

speakers.name: Lane Rettig
speakers.description: Lane Rettig is a writer, hacker, entrepreneur, and investor deeply fascinated by the intersection of technological and social systems, and committed to architecting and building human-centric software. He's been working full time on blockchain R&D since 2017. He was formerly an Ethereum core developer, and now focuses his efforts on Spacemesh, a  a next-generation smart contract platform based on a novel consensus mechanism.

title: EVM, Wasm, RISC, oh my! Blockchain VMs three years later
description: The blockchain VM (virtual machine) landscape has developed considerably since EVM was introduced seven years ago. This panel will feature stakeholders from various layer one and layer two ecosystems that are developing competing smart contract VM standards, including those that are EVM-, Wasm-, and RISC-V-based. It will cover the tradeoffs among each of these, using particular projects as case studies of successes and failures, with emphasis upon the importance of good developer tooling.

speakers.name: Matteo Alessio Tambussi
speakers.description:
Musician, web3 educator, co-founder @ SpaghettETH, linguist by training, martial arts lover.
listen to my music at https://linktr.ee/matlemad
read some stories at https:// matlemad.medium.com

title: DeFi the Police II
description: The centralized management of violence ( different than a "monopoly of violence") has bugs and gimmicks that we can iterate upon when proposing alternatives to the ultimate privilege of the traditional world: brute force its citizens.

speakers.name: Pranav Garg
Shubham
speakers.description: CTO at Routerprotocol

title: Securing cross-chain communication
description: The last year witnessed several cross-chain bridges being hacked and millions of dollars stolen by hackers. Despite the bridges having gone through several audits, we still see them getting exploited because hackers were able to get access to authorized private keys, signature replay attacks, etc. Let us see what a secure cross-chain bridge architecture should look like and what are the possible attack vectors and mitigation techniques.

speakers.name: Jonathan Alexander
speakers.description: Jonathan Alexander is CTO of OpenZeppelin and co-founder and council member of Forta. He leads the global development team at OpenZeppelin that works on OpenZeppelin Contracts, Wizard, Defender, and Forta. Formerly he was CTO at Tricentis and Vonage Business. When not working on software he likes spending time with his family, reading, tennis, and mountain hiking.

title: Decentralized Threat Detection Bots
description: Decentralized threat detection bots are a recent area of research and development for protecting the ecosystem. This talk will cover concepts and recent research on detection bots and implementation patterns including heuristic-based, time-series based, multi-block, and TX simulation. Examples involving prior exploits will be included, as well as tools, limitations, the potential for automated threat prevention, and areas for further research.

speakers.name: Marcio Diaz
speakers.description:
PhD dropout from Argentina, ex Polkadot core developer.
CEO/Founder of Pense Technologies and Seers social network.

title: Crypto Twitter
description: Seers shares its experience building a "Crypto Twitter", a clone of Twitter with built in crypto primitives like prediction markets, NFTs, DAOs. After presenting the framework behind the social network, we introduce questions and ideas for a next generation web3 social network.

speakers.name: Danno Ferrin
speakers.description:
Danno Ferrin is Principal Software Engineer at Hedera Hashgraph, where he spearheads the smart contract environment in the Hedera network. Previously he was Lead Protocol Engineer at ConsenSys Software Inc on their Ethereum Mainnet team, where he chose to go "full crypto" after leaving Google.

Danno is a maintainer for the Hyperledger Besu project, and sits on the Hyperledger Technical Steering Committee, where he is Vice Chair.

title: What alternative blockchains compatibility with Ethereum tooling can teach us about Ethereum's Future
description: In this talk the various techniques that some L1s and L2s use to provide EVM and RPC compatibility with end user and developer tooling will be examined. Special attention will be paid to features (address aliasing and expansion, RPC handing of system contracts, account abstraction) of other blockchains that Ethereum developers have discussed with an eye towards the compatibility issues they introduce.

speakers.name: Melisa M√≠a Vargas Echevarr√≠a
speakers.description:
Activist who believes in the power of communities, fascinated by the arts and sciences of persuasive and effective communication.

PR Specialist of NFT projects, Co-Founder of NFT Puerto Rico and hostess of Blockchain Puerto Rico in its CryptoJangueos.

Tandem nursing mother of two dragons under 4 years old and passionate about plant-based eating.

title: Building Communities Through Voice
description: The sales of the NFTs have presented the paradigm of the communities as an element of greater value in the projects. Their organic creation has propelled the adoption of Blockchain technology and the success of the projects. How do we promote the creation of these communities? With the most human and authentic element: the voice. This workshop promotes the creation of a brand strategy for your NFT project with the possibilities offered by the voice as the main element.

speakers.name: madeline li
speakers.description: Legendary member and Director of BD at Gelato Network

title: The future of Defi is automated
description: Will talk about how Ethereum is designed not to have loop and the necessity of having automation building on top of EVM.

speakers.name: Sonja Prstec
speakers.description: Crypto lawyer from Zug, in crypto since 2015, very passionate about decentralisation and cyber opportunities, love tech in general.

title: "Legal ghosts" - Decentralised protocols legal personality
description: The rise of the blockchain technology and the spectrum of digital interactions that it enables has a profound impact on our understanding of the law and the limits of existing regulations. Its borderless nature is undoubtedly disrupting well-established business models. Not only it creates novel legal problems; it also creates novel ways of finding out about them.

speakers.name: 0xJess
speakers.description: Social Communication Sciences University Degree (UBA) - Being part of the decentralized world since 2017 - Currently working on an NFTs infrastructure project called WakeUp - From Argentina

title: Global social paradigm shift.
description: I would like to join a panel discussion on how we are part of a global social paradigm shift. Where you can see those changes that are beginning to occur (culture, society, economy, politics) and how little by little they influence our lives. Different needs emerging from societies acting as the fuel for this revolution, which we can say started with blockchain, followed by bitcoin, and now it's accelerating with Ethereum and the many possibilities we have to build new things on eth.

speakers.name: Nevin Freeman
speakers.description: Nevin is the co-founder of Reserve, which has built a stablecoin wallet currently used in latin america and an Ethereum application for creating basket-backed stablecoins.

title: We need a privacy-preserving L2 - lessons from the use of stablecoins as money in Venezuela
description:
When you are transacting person to person, public keys can be linked to identities, and this is a non-starter.

We will share our experience with growing a network of 25,000 independent merchants, big and small, who now accept USD stablecoins for goods and services in Venezuela, and make the case for why we need a private L2 to scale usage of cryptocurrency as day-to-day money.

speakers.name: Jose Trajtenberg
speakers.description:
Crypto entrepreneur focused on democratizing finances in Latam under the deep conviction 
of evolving people's lives for good through Blockchain, DeFi & NFT‚Äôs.

title: Empowering crypto adoption as an engine for human well-being in Latam
description: We were main characters of UNICEF Innovation Fund thesis, by developing innovation and disruption in the traditional financial system so as to break intergenerational cycles of poverty. There's a huge responsability on all of us, since we know have the opportunity to change finances into an engine for human well-being. The adoption of crypto, not only brings a better and healthier financial system, but also brings mental health through the accomplishment of personal objectives.

speakers.name: Clara Lin
speakers.description: Crypto Lawyer of Kleros. Chinese lawyer. Founder of OIOLaw. Certified interpreter in Russian, Spanish, English, Cantonese. Speak Dutch and Deutsch. Holding 2 master degrees in law.

title: Crypto Philosophy --- Consensus
description:
This talk is about the crypto philosophy, which involves reflecting on and evolving the existing philosophy and concepts. It sheds light on the idea of consensus, the premise of blockchain, and its whole ecosystem. 

The talk will start with a game, where I will ask people to raise their fingers to indicate what would be the color that most people will choose. Then, the winners will get a little gift from me.

The talk concludes with (Nash) equilibrium where the concensus ends.

speakers.name: Robert Mao
speakers.description: Founder of ArcBlock, DID Labs. We empower developers for Web3 revolution. Check out our Decentralized Identity (DID), Blocklet and open blockchain protocols.

title: A general purpose fully decentralized frontend & backend infrastructure for Ethereum apps
description: A typical Ethereum application (e.g. CryptoKitties, Uniswap etc.) contains smart-contracts, server-side backend logic (web-server, database etc.) and front-end logic (as a web app or mobile app).  Ethereum only handle the smart-contracts, developers need to figure out the rest, usually they are deployed on centralized platforms. e.g. Amazon Web Service (AWS). We built a fully decentralized infrastructure to make developers and even end users deploy and run dApps like never before.

speakers.name: P√©ter Garamv√∂lgyi
speakers.description: I'm a web3 enthusiast, interested in both dapp development and low-level protocol engineering.

title: Challenges of Parallelizability under Ethereum's Execution Model
description:
We highlight two challenges of parallel execution on Ethereum: 1. Historical data shows that data dependencies force us to execute a large portion of transactions serially. 2. If we assign incentives to scheduling decisions, this might introduce non-determinism that the system cannot tolerate. In this lightning talk, we present these two problems and outline some proposed solutions.

Note that this work was accepted for and presented at ICSE'22 (https://bit.ly/3HzPKZT)

speakers.name: Souhail Mssassi
speakers.description: With more than 8 years of experience in cybersecurity as a Senior Security Researcher specialized in application security, cryptography and security of decentralized applications he assisted several organizations in improving their own cybersecurity strategy. And as an Instructor and a Speaker he presented Security lectures in universities and Conferences. Recently researching on Formal Verification in the cybersecurity Field. He is Also a Blockchain Developer in Solidity and Rust and also Worki

title: Blockchain Security : Introduction to Bridges Security
description: A blockchain bridge (also known as a cross-chain bridge) links two places, similar to a real bridge. It permits the transmission of data and digital assets across two blockchain networks, hence facilitating communication between them. Both chains may have different protocols, rules, and governance structures, but the bridge provides a secure way for them to interact. In this talk, we will understand how this bridges works and the security aspects of it.

speakers.name: Nicolas Pierre Debaene
speakers.description:
I'm an Artificial Intelligence researcher passionate about Data Science and Blockchain development. I had the opportunity to deepen my knowledge in Machine Learning, Deep Learning and Blockchain development during my working experiences in Blockchain and E-commerce. 

Besides that, I am addicted to NFTs and currently developing tools to analyze Ethereum smart contracts and NFT on-chain data.

title: Deep Learning Scam Detection for Ethereum Smart Contracts
description:
We present a Deep Learning based scam detection framework to automatically detect Ethereum fraudulent Smart Contracts, applicable on any contract (verified or not).

How? We use the automatically extractable bytecodes of smart contracts as input features of a Deep Neural Network, trained on data of observed fraudulent and non-fraudulent contract.
It aims to fasten and improve the difficult code analysis to analyze a Smart Contract and be more robust than simple pattern matching.

speakers.name: Maria Magenes
speakers.description: in DeFi since 2018, marketing Italian clown :)

speakers.name: Lenka Hudakova (Lenkla)
speakers.description:
Project lead for initiatives tackled by the Sustainable Ecosystem Scaling team at MakerDAO (X-Ray, Transparency Dashboard, etc.). 
Previously community lead & global events manager at the Maker Foundation. 
Actively onboarding more newbies into crypto (CryptoWomen, ETH/Web3 CPH meetup, event speaking). Supporting DAOs contributors' experience & exploring the field of decentralized HR practices together with People Ops Guild peers & Groundw3rk DAO operators.

title: Working in Web3 - tips & tales
description: I think it is always interesting at these events to have a fireside about how working in Web 3 is evolving, how to start and how to survive (esp in the bear market). Putting some "OGs" on the stage!

speakers.name: Alex Newman
speakers.description: Alex Newman is the Protocol Designer at the HUMAN Protocol Foundation, and comes from a distributed systems and database background. He has founded and sold several tech companies, most notably Ohmdata (sold to WANDisco) and is a seasoned technology leader who has built and led engineering teams for over two decades. He most recently helped launch hCaptcha.com at Intuition Machines. He is now focused on using that experience to help bring the next billion transactions onto the HUMAN Protocol.

title: How to build a Multi Chain protocol
description: HUMAN is a decentralised protocol that facilitates the exchange of HUMAN work, knowledge, and contribution.  At a high level, it consists of two layers, the Routing Layer and the Execution Layer.  The routing layer is responsible for routing jobs to the chains which offer the best execution terms.  The execution layer is responsible for distributing individual tasks within jobs to workers, verifying the results of those tasks, maintaining a reputation system and remunerating workers.

speakers.name: Federico Ast
speakers.description: Federico Ast graduated in economics and philosophy from the University of Buenos Aires and holds a PhD in management from IAE Business School. He is founder and CEO of Kleros, an Ethereum protocolusing game theory and blockchain technology in arbitration. He has lectured in universities such as Stanford and Oxford and was a speaker at Devcon and ETHCC. He is an alumni at Singularity University and hosts the first Coursera courses about blockchain and legaltech in Spanish.

speakers.name: Jay Buidl
speakers.description:
Jay Buidl is a contributor with Kleros, Proof of Humanity and Developer DAO. He acts primarily as the Tech Lead for the implementation of the next major version of the Kleros protocol.

In a previous life, Jay has been the CTO for a hedge fund, implemented quantitative trading strategies, managed on-prems and cloud infrastructure.¬†

With over 15 years in software and systems engineering, Jay has a long-time interest in web3, automation and opsec.

title: From Zero to Launch: How to Build and Scale a DAO
description:
The workshop helps founding teams go through the first steps of building a blockchain protocol. Participants will work in groups and they will:

- Develop a strategy and prepare user interviews.
- Reflect about the token economics of their protocol.
- Put in place the key processes for software development in web3.
- Craft a community building and marketing strategy.
- Define the governance of the DAO.
- Evaluate the legal risks of the project.
- Pitch the project to the audience.

speakers.name: Ivo Georgiev
speakers.description:
I've been coding since 10yo, in that time I've went through multiple things: I started with game dev, then switched to systems: I made my own Linux distribution at the age of 15, focused on improving the Linux UX: it peaked at p9 on distrowatch.

I cofounded a media center that grew to >25m users (Stremio)

More recently I've taken on a quest to combine all my skills, namely UX, security and smart contracts, to push the crypto UX forward in the form of a next-gen smart wallet, ambire.com

title: Why smart wallets are the future of Ethereum
description:
Let's explore how smart wallets and account abstractions can improve the day to day UX of Ethereum and EVM L2

Smart wallets bring huge benefits such as paying gas in stablecoins, transaction batching, hiding ERC20 approvals, even seedless&trustless email/pass auth

And most importantly - are smart wallets ready for mass adoption? With the adoption of EIP 1271 (signatures) and the ability to deploy them counterfactually with low overhead across networks, it appears that they are!

speakers.name: Shayan Eskandari
speakers.description: A developer and blockchain security geek. Shayan previously worked as a Senior Security Auditor for ConsenSys Diligence where he assisted with leading DeFi projects. He is also a former senior blockchain engineer at Bitaccess, responsible for building enterprise-level Bitcoin wallet infrastructure. Shayan is a doctoral candidate in Information Systems Engineering at Concordia University and has published several peer-reviewed papers on blockchain technology.

title: Identity Crisis: Staking ETH as a Public Company
description:
Staking on its own can be a challenging process and requires many checks and balances. But what if a public company wants to stake 20,000+ ETH and you have to convince multiple stakeholders along the way, while meeting the public market risk assessment requirements? It‚Äôs a whole other ballgame.

I want to share the challenges and opportunities I discovered while spearheading Ether Capital‚Äôs staking strategy, making it the first public company in the world to stake ETH and accrue yield.

speakers.name: Joshua
speakers.description: I am a self-taught software engineer working to improve decentralized technology at the lowest levels!

title: Demystifying Ethereum Assembly
description:
# Demystifying Ethereum Assembly

The EVM creates an economic incentive to minimize computation and data storage.
This leads to extreme gas optimizations in a few different assembly languages and patterns.

In this workshop, we will learn about EVM assembly through both a walkthrough of EVM basics and real-world, practical examples of assembly. This workshop assumes an intermediate level understanding of programming and at least a beginner understanding of Ethereum.

speakers.name: sxysun
speakers.description: Researcher at Flashbots

title: This is MEV
description: MEV has largely been a field where engineering drives science, it‚Äôs now time for science to drive engineering: we present an axiomatic formalization of MEV, the theory based on it, and the new applications that it enables.

speakers.name: Alexey Akhunov
speakers.description: Alexey is a software engineer with 25 years of professional experience of coding in Java, C++, Python and Go. His main areas of expertise are data structures, database systems, reverse engineering, and systems architecture. Follows Ethereum since the publication of the white paper, and works on Ethereum related projects since 2016.

title: Erigon 2 as a distributed database technology
description: Erigon 2 is a major upgrade to Erigon (one of the Execution Layer implementations). In this talk, it is being looked at as a hybrid database technology. Starting from the requirements of read performance, ease of  distribution, maintaining data integrity, and fit into Ethereum roadmap, it combines the strongest features from B-tree and LSM (Log Structured Merge) databases. Using some relatively novel but simple data encoding schemes, Erigon 2 gets even closer than Erigon to efficiency frontier.

speakers.name: Eric Arsenault
speakers.description: Eric is an entrepreneur, investor, and long-time DAOist, who is working on resurrecting a network inspired by The DAO. His interests lie around NFTs, tokenomics, and governance design and has helped a number of projects find early traction, including YGG, reNFT, and Opolis.

title: Increasing Accessibility to Venture Capital with Web3
description:
Venture investing is today mainly accessible to the well connected and wealthy. In this talk, I will explore a new building block for Web3 that will drastically increase accessibility to early stage investing to create a more inclusive and meritocratic world.

I will cover the history of venture capital + their perverse incentives, key learnings from Venture DAOs such as MetaCartel Ventures, and alternative web3 venture models like Seed Club and ‚Äúventure networks‚Äù like The DAO.

speakers.name: Clayton Roche
speakers.description: Clayton has been working in DeFi since 2019, well before that term made the cover of The Economist magazine. He was a country ambassador for MakerDAO, community manager for a DAI wallet called Mosendo, and started a DeFi community called DeFi Nation. In June of 2020 he joined the Universal Market Access (UMA) team. He leads UMA‚Äôs community and communications team.

title: Oracles: How I learned to stop worrying and love ambiguity
description: Oracles are sometimes called upon to answer questions that don‚Äôt have a right answer; maybe they only have a ‚Äúless wrong‚Äù answer. I will talk about some historical prediction markets that presented impossible questions to their oracles and what happened as a result. Then I will explore new research from Schelling point oracles. My thesis is that ambiguity can be our friend and will help Web3 have more relevance to the off-chain world, but only if we have oracles that can handle it.

speakers.name: pilippe shin
speakers.description: Pilippe is a recognized software test tools, blockchain core, and smart contract development expert. He is credited with bringing open source testing to Dreamspaceworld, Naran, Infac Elecs, and Robotever. Pilippe is the CTO at WeGo Co., Ltd a blockchain platform, and is in charge of functional testing, load and performance testing, and smart contract development for the WeGo platform. Pilippe has been a programming researcher for SK Hynix, LG Electronics.

title: Ethereum.phone for Light client
description:
At a time when decentralization has become more important as Eth2.0 becomes PoS , the project aims to lower the barriers of the general public's blockchain with mobile devices that are faithful to decentralization and added to blockchain functions by operating nodes on inexpensive devices.
We have set up and operated the Geth Embedded Light Node, and we have been designing and producing custom Embedded Light Node. In order to develop an Ethereum Phone that can operate Geth node.

speakers.name: Qi Zhou
speakers.description:
Qi Zhou, Founder and CEO of QuarkChain.
Qi got his doctorate degree from Georgia Institute of Technology, with nearly 10 papers published. When in graduate school, he developed one software and won a prize from Microsoft, awarded by Bill Gates in person. Qi previously worked as a senior engineer at Google and Facebook headquarters in the United States and has ten years of working experience in the field of distributed systems.

title: On the Future of Web3 ‚Äî Paving the Way to End-to-End Fully-Decentralized Web

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: One key feature of Web3 is decentralized compared to the current Web2, which is controlled by a few centralized companies such as Facebook, Google. However, when 99% of the users interact with the blockchain, one critical problem shows up: the dApp servers / NSPs are centralized! In this talk, we propose a solution for the future of Web3: an End-to-End Fully Trustless Decentralized Web, which means that any components in our Web2 from the user side and server side will be decentralized in Web3.

speakers.name: Tom
speakers.description: Tom supervised development of the world‚Äôs first 28nm Bitcoin mining chip. In 2014 he founded AlcheMiner and brought to market a 40nm Litecoin mining chip which garnered 20% of Litecoin mining power. Blockchain advisor to ITRI, one of the world‚Äôs leading technology research and development institutions. Administrator of the Bitcoin Chinese Community and the Taipei Ethereum Meetup group. Tom is a successful innovator with a deep commitment to improvements in the blockchain space.

title: Revolutionizing Options On-Chain with AMM
description: Zomma Protocol aims to be the underlying fuel for all on-chain financial products, specializing in DeFi options, upholding the mission of paving financial infrastructure in web 3 evolution. The team is focused at building an array of diversified products, that include yield mining, buy & sell European style options with minimal collateral to converge both TradFi and DeFi worlds with AMM, innovative staking pools as products and unique Zomma Liquidation Mechanism and Heston Model Pricing.

speakers.name: Georgios Spathoulas
speakers.description: Dr. Georgios Spathoulas is an active researcher (NTNU in Norway, UTH in Greece) in the blockchain domain. His background is mainly in computer systems security, baut he has gradually focused mainly on blockhain technology. He has participated in multiple research projects related to blockchain solutions for multiple domains. His research focus lies in the scalability of permissionles blockchain systems and mainly in the state channels domain.

title: Origami state channels
description: Origami is a novel state channels proposal that provides a robust alternative scalability solution. Origami is the first state channel design that allows unordered communication, enables flexible management of a state channel's participant set, enables the continuation of a channel after unresolved inactivity disputes and offers secure built-in functionality that allows members to delegate their signing duties to each-other to bypass the constant availability requirement.

speakers.name: Green
speakers.description: CS dropout meets crypto and gets obsessed with scalability and coordination tooling.

title: Collaborative List Curation + real-world pragmatic Use Cases
description:
Decentralized, collaborative and collaterized list building will act as the dependency that will enable a multitude of disruptive applications. Stake Curate, an implementation, will be described at a high level. After this, we will focus on such specific, real-world applications.
Non exhaustive list of examples:
- Social media, curating profiles
- Search engine, filtering websites
- Wiki, with skin in the game for articles

speakers.name: Ignasi Ramos
speakers.description: Blockchain Engineer at Polygon-Hermez

title: Scaling Ethereuem: Solving the blockchain trilemma with the zkEVM
description:
Scalability, decentralization, and security represent the core features of blockchain technology, or at least they should. However, retaining all aspects is extremely difficult with the concepts that we currently know of.
At Polygon-Hermez we relay in solving the trilemma with the zero knowledge technology.
This is a medium level tech talk where the blockchain trilemma will be explained focusing on how can be solved with a zk-rollup that will solve the lack of scalability in Ethereum.

speakers.name: Ignasi Ramos
speakers.description: Blockchain Engineer at Polygon-Hermez

title: zkEVM Vs EVM: Full compatibility?
description:
At Polygon-Hermez we have bet for the zero-knowledge EVM to solve Ethereum scalability. In this talk, will be explained if our zkEVM is 100% compatible with the current EVM and why.
Also the main challenges, tricks, tech decisions and differences we had to apply to achieve it will be explained

speakers.name: Hannes Graah
speakers.description: Founder of GRO and Former President of Growth at Revolut. Assembled a team in London with top executives from Revolut, Monzo, Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, BCG & McKinsey to build stablecoin yielding protocol GRO. Gro aims to empower individuals to easily create and share wealth by combining the best of decentralized and traditional finance. An investor/advisor in more than 10 companies as well as a growth strategist for 30+ brands and companies. Raised millions of dollars for UNICEF.

title: Forget DeFi Summer ‚Äì 2022 is the year consumers embrace decentralized finance
description: As our economy battles with inflation, DeFi products with higher yields than bank savings accounts are becoming increasingly attractive to consumers. At the same time, a raft of innovative applications that interact with people‚Äôs everyday lifestyles are pulling non-crypto native customers into the space. This talk will explore the impact DeFi can have on personal finance management, why this is a gamechanger for the wider blockchain industry, and what DeFi needs to do to seize this opportunity.

speakers.name: Sherlock
speakers.description: Co-Founder & CEO @ Meson Network

title: Meson Network: Build the Bandwidth Marketplace
description: Meson Network is building a bandwidth marketplace, using a protocol model to replace the traditional labor-based sales models, consolidating and monetizing idle bandwidth from long-tail users at a low cost. Here, users can exchange their unused bandwidth resources with Meson for tokens, and those who need bandwidth will come to Meson‚Äôs market to borrow bandwidth anywhere in the world. In Devcon, we will share our design and protocol, also release the product with the system running on ethereum.

speakers.name: Ignasi Ramos
speakers.description: Blockchain Engineer at Polygon-Hermez

speakers.name: Jesus Ligero
speakers.description:
I'm currently working on Polygon hermez in the protocol team.
Basically I develop smart contracts and use zero knowledge languages like Circom or zkasm.

title: zkEVM: Coding the EVM with zero-knowledge assembly

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
The zkEVM is how the Polygon-Hermez team has built the EVM with the zk assembly language. At this workshop, the different libraries zkasm (zero-knowledege assembly) and pil (polinomial language) will be explained and a workshop about how to code with zkasm will be shown.
This language has been developed by Jordi Baylina and used by the Hermez team to code the zkEVM.

speakers.name: Jim McDonald
speakers.description: Jim has worked on internet infrastructure for over 30 years, including running one of the first public access internet services. He has worked on hardware and software, in startups and multinationals, in technical, management and leadership roles. His current focus is on Ethereum staking, decentralized infrastructure, and advanced validator strategies.

title: Time-dependent yield with Ethereum staking
description: Staking in Ethereum is said to provide a stable return, however in reality the return varies significantly between validators and over time.  This talk explores returns for individual validators and the network as a whole: what impacts it, how it changes over time, and how the variation can be used to create fixed-term financial products underpinned by Ethereum validators.

speakers.name: Jim McDonald
speakers.description: Jim has worked on internet infrastructure for over 30 years, including running one of the first public access internet services. He has worked on hardware and software, in startups and multinationals, in technical, management and leadership roles. His current focus is on Ethereum staking, decentralized infrastructure, and advanced validator strategies.

title: Validator receipts: an alternative to liquid staking derivatives
description: Liquid staking derivatives are exciting and powerful, however come with centralization risk and the dangers of holding a derivative rather than its underlying asset.  Validator receipts present an alternative mechanism by which Ether locked in staking can be used as collateral without exposure to derivatives or loss of control of the validating funds.

speakers.name: Oaksprout the Tan
speakers.description: Oaksprout is a co-founder of Valory, the startup creating Autonolas, a platform and tech stack for building full-stack autonomous applications. He has extensive experience in web2 product development, as the founder of a self-sovereign data startup and as an early contributor to and investor in DeFi projects.

title: Actually Autonomous: What‚Äôs Holding Your DAO Back?
description:
How can we empower people to coordinate, manage common resources and make positive-sum decisions together?

In this talk we show how the lack of autonomy in DAOs is holding them and the entire Ethereum ecosystem back. We highlight the over-dependence on whole DAO votes and subDAOs, the lack of DAO composability and the inherent lack of scalability in DAO-run services. Open Autonomy, the open-source framework created by Autonolas, offers a viable solution to these challenges.

speakers.name: Jim McDonald
speakers.description: Jim has worked on internet infrastructure for over 30 years, including running one of the first public access internet services. He has worked on hardware and software, in startups and multinationals, in technical, management and leadership roles. His current focus is on Ethereum staking, decentralized infrastructure, and advanced validator strategies.

title: Challenges for the post-merge consensus network
description: The post-merge Ethereum network is pushing the boundaries of its design, resulting in lower validator rewards.  This talk provides some metrics by which to judge the overall health of the network, examines their past and current values, and provides suggestions for where the most critical upgrades are required.

speakers.name: Daniele
speakers.description: Daniele Pinna is the Head of Quantitative Research and Investment at 0VIX. He has a background in computational physics, demonstrating proof-of-concept for magnetic computing devices. Daniele obtained his PhD from NYU and has worked at universities and research institutes across the US and Europe. He develops quantitative metrics to assess protocol security, as well as offer user-facing solutions for managing their portfolios.

speakers.name: Amit
speakers.description: Amit is Head of DeFi Research at Polygon, leading research and development of next-generation DeFi protocols to grow and support the DeFi ecosystem. Amit works at the intersection of cryptocurrency, finance, econometrics, and statistics, with a background in quantitative roles in TradFi firms like JPMorgan Chase and ICICI bank. Drawing on his experience in DeFi, his Ph.D. in Economics from the University of Warwick, MA in economics from the Delhi School of Economics, Engineering from IIT

title: Market risk assessment: A multi-asset, agent-based approach applied to the 0VIX lending protocol
description:
We assess the market risk of the 0VIX lending protocol using a multi-asset agent-based model to simulate ensembles of users subject to price-driven liquidation risk.
Our multi-asset methodology shows that the protocol‚Äôs systemic risk is small under stress and that enough collateral is always present to underwrite active loans. Overall we quantify the risk of generating undercollateralized users as being less than 0.1% given our current liquidation incentives and loan-to-value ratios.

speakers.name: Jim McDonald
speakers.description: Jim has worked on internet infrastructure for over 30 years, including running one of the first public access internet services. He has worked on hardware and software, in startups and multinationals, in technical, management and leadership roles. His current focus is on Ethereum staking, decentralized infrastructure, and advanced validator strategies.

title: Ethereum issuance: past, present and future
description: A look at how Ethereum's issuance has changed over time, how major events such as EIP-1559 and the merge have affected it, and future projections for issuance and hence total supply.

speakers.name: Antonio
speakers.description: Freelance full-stack developer and developer advocate at Chainstack. Passionate about the web and the possibilities that blockchains can bring to it.

title: How blockchains fit in a web app infrastructure?
description: This is an introductory talk in which I'll explain the differences between typical web applications we use every day and how those can be built in a decentralized way with blockchain levering all the new technologies and protocols that have been released in the past months, like IPFS, theGraph, Arweave or Lens protocol.

speakers.name: Alex Bazhenov
speakers.description: Alex has been in crypto since 2017 and currently works as a senior software engineer Thesis where he is working on a decentralized and fully-open-source web3 wallet.  He has previously worked in high frequency trading in the TradFi world as well as a centralized cryptocurrency exchange.

title: EVM Assembly From First Principles
description: EVM assembly can be quite opaque and intimidating at first glance.  In this talk we'll take a look at exactly how EVM assembly works under the hood while dissecting (and implementing) some common functionality we see in smart contracts - as well as showing some optimization techniques you can use by jumping down to assembly in your solidity contracts.

speakers.name: Christine Kim
speakers.description:
