Christine Kim, Galaxy Digital, Research Associate 
Prior to Galaxy, I worked for three years at a crypto media company called CoinDesk as an analyst and tech reporter, mainly covering developments on Ethereum. I‚Äôm passionate about producing data-driven insights about the cryptocurrency and blockchain industry. My research focusses primarily on the protocol-level development and future roadmap of Ethereum.

title: A Breakdown of Ethereum Supply Distribution Since Genesis
description: As Ethereum looks ahead to its transition to a fully to a proof-of-stake consensus protocol, the topic of Ethereum‚Äôs supply distribution matters more than ever to network stakeholders. This is because under PoS, the amount of ETH users control directly determines how much influence they can have over the network‚Äôs consensus building process and the amount of rewards they can earn from staking. This talk dives into how distributed ETH supply on Ethereum has become over the last 7 years.

speakers.name: Steven Valeri
speakers.description: Smart Contract Dev @ Aave

title: GHO
description: An overview of The Aave Companies' Gho proposal and implementation. Gho, a native decentralized, collateral-backed stablecoin, GHO, pegged to USD, has been proposed to the Aave DAO.

speakers.name: Daniel Olshansky
speakers.description: V1 Protocol Lead at Pocket Network

title: The RPC Trilemma
description:
Reliable, Performant and Cheap RPC access is necessary for all dApp development. Light clients were mostly replaced by full node infrastructure providers exposing Performant and Cheap API access at the cost of Reliability: trustlessness and decentralization.

After Pocket v0 bootstrapped a network of 10s of thousands of nodes using Tendermint, application-specific R&D efforts into Pocket v1 enable competitive price & performance while innovating on L1 decentralization and reliability.

speakers.name: Lefteris Karapetsas
speakers.description:
ethereum developer since 2014! Contributed to solidity compiler and c++ ethereum.
Built the DAO, saw it get destroyed, then hacked it back to save whatever we could both in ETH and ETC.
Development lead for the Raiden network.
Founder of rotki.

I like birding :D

speakers.name: Y√°bir Garc√≠a Benchakhtir
speakers.description: I'm a backend developer working at rotki. I have studied mathematics and computer science and I'm currently living in spain

title: Understanding transactions in EVM-compatible blockchains powered by opensource
description:
Transactions are stored in the blockchain as hexadecimal data.That may be useful if you are a shadowy super coder but if you are like the rest of us you just need to have them explained in English.
If there are no tools that allow decoding of those transactions then the potential of web3 can not be realized. Is crucial that such tools are developed in the opens, as opensource code since decoding events for different chains and protocols scale faster than what any team of developers can maintain

speakers.name: Simon Emanuel Schmid
speakers.description: Simon is enthusiastic about simplifying the complexities of our interconnected world. He applies this passion as a Solutions Engineer at Edge & Node to enable the amazing projects in web3 building exceptional decentralised experiences leveraging The Graph. He joined the blockchain space professionally in 2017 as Head of Front-end/UX at Melonport which is now know as Enzyme Finance, one of the pioneering projects using The Graph.

title: Decentralize your stack! Publish a subgraph to the decentralized Graph Network
description: We look at the current common tech stack for dapps and look at the different layers and how to decentralize them. A special focus will be on the decentralized Graph Network which enables a decentralized indexing and query layer. We will discuss how this works, address common concerns and show best practices.

speakers.name: nikitastupin
speakers.description:
Nikita Security is a Security Researcher on the Research and Audits team at OpenZeppelin.
Prior to joining in January 2022, he helped secure large, medium, and small Information Technology companies from both offensive and defensive sides. Identified and disclosed 200+ vulnerabilities on bug bounty programs, presented research at 6 international conferences and taught 200+ students in total across universities and educational platforms.

speakers.name: Eric DeCourcy
speakers.description: Security researcher at OpenZeppelin

title: StarkNet contracts' security
description: StarkNet is a ZK-rollup on the Ethereum network that allows it to scale without compromising security. StarkNet contracts are written in a new programming language called Cairo, which contains its own idiosyncrasies. It is still in the early stages of adoption, but there are already StarkNet contracts developed by teams such as MakerDAO, Aave and others. In this talk we present how StarkNet contracts differ from Solidity contracts with a focus on security, vulnerability types and tools.

speakers.name: Sunny Jaycer
speakers.description: Developer Experience @ Superfluid

title: The Web3 Journey - Understanding Our Assumptions
description: A year ago, I would have never seen myself leaving my career in TradFi to enter the world of Ethereum and Web3. This talk will explore how I stumbled across the space while TA'ing at the University of Pennsylvania and quickly found myself becoming a highly active builder all the way up until I found myself working where I am now. From the intense optimism to hyperfinancialization, I'll explore what struck me about the Web3 space and how I navigated it as a fresh newcomer.

speakers.name: g. nick // gnidan
speakers.description: smart contract development tools

title: Robust smart contract interoperability with abi-to-sol

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
Want to write Solidity that interacts with on-chain contracts with minimal typing? abi-to-sol is a FOSS software tool that translates ABIs into ready-to-import Solidity interfaces.

Learn about how this tool can make your life easier as a smart contract developer! This talk will demonstrate the command-line tool and associated web UI, including some lesser-known features that maximize compatibility with your existing applications.

speakers.name: Sam Flamini
speakers.description: Sam is a self taught developer who works on Developer Experience at Superfluid.

title: Building a Thriving Developer Community
description:
I want to give a talk on the ins and outs of building a thriving web3 developer community. I help lead DevX at https://superfluid.finance and I've learned the hard way what it takes to get hundreds of projects built on your protocol. 

I'll give an overview of what both engineers and marketing/growth people get wrong about building a developer ecosystem, how we run hackathons, and how we've productized our docs and developer tooling.

speakers.name: Tas Dienes
speakers.description: Tas works on enterprise ecosystem development and ecosystem support at EF.  He is co-chair of the EEA Community Projects Project Governing Board.

speakers.name: Daniel Burnett
speakers.description: Dr. Burnett has over two decades of experience in the authoring, editing, and chairing of over a dozen web and Internet standards, including WebRTC, Verifiable Credentials, and Decentralized Identifiers.  In his current role as the Executive Director of the Enterprise Ethereum Alliance, Dan works to increase adoption of Ethereum by the broader non-technical business community for the betterment of all.

title: EEA Community Projects: a home for open standards development projects, managed by OASIS
description: The EEA Community Projects, formerly known as the Ethereum OASIS Open Project, is a hub for open source-based standards development in the Ethereum industry. We provide support for open source development of code, APIs, standards, and reference implementations.  Our goal is to improve the quality of standards in the Ethereum ecosystem and provide a path to formal standards developed within the framework of OASIS, an internationally recognized technical standards body.

speakers.name: Tas Dienes
speakers.description: Tas works on enterprise ecosystem development and ecosystem support at EF.  He is co-chair of the EEA Community Projects Project Governing Board.

speakers.name: Dan Shaw
speakers.description: Advisor at Ethereum Foundation for Enterprise Community. Dan is an engineer who likes to work with people. An open source veteran, Dan helped bring Node.js to the Enterprise and has worked with the Node.js Foundation, LF, CNCF, OSI, and now the EEA. Dan has founded 3 tech companies: Cor.dev,¬†NodeSource, and The Node Firm.

title: A Layer 2 Standards Working Group
description:
The L2 ecosystem needs standards!  We formed a L2 standards working group as an EEA Community Project, managed by OASIS.  We will provide a quick overview of L2 standards discussion topics thus far.  Others in the L2 ecosystem are invited to join and participate in existing discussions or raise new topics.

https://github.com/eea-oasis/L2

speakers.name: Juliette Chevalier
speakers.description: Currently leading Developer Advocacy at Aragon.org, Juliette is also the co-founder and engineering lead for Surge, an organization focused on onboarding women to Web3 through their NFT passport. Weekly, she also writes a newsletter called nerd_splash (newsletter.juliet.tech) studying the crypto intersection between technology and society. You'll probably meet her in cute coffee shops, yoga studios, tech conferences or online cohort-based courses.

title: The smart contracts behind DAOs
description: Smart contracts are the backbone of any DAO, yet few know about the technical architecture required to enable future-proof, modular, safe organizations. In this talk, I'll take you step by step through how we‚Äôre thinking of our smart contracts at Aragon: the what, the why, and the how.

speakers.name: Paul Kohlhaas
speakers.description: economist, biohacker, developer, building on Ethereum since 2016. on a mission to accelerate scientific progress and open medicine. previously at ConsenSys and identity solution uPort, founder of Eth dev studio Linumlabs.com & www.molecule.to

title: Beyond Patents: Building interoperable intellectual property vaults on Ethereum and Filecoin to make patents obsolete using ZKPs
description: Generating a verifiable proof that ‚Äúdrug X can cure disease Y through dataset W‚Äù without revealing the data would enable the trustless transaction of IP, making broken patent system and state enforcement obsolete. This talk explores the technical and legal designs for on-chain IP, as well as the first live use cases by VitaDAO.com. Next, we lay out technical components of an open IP protocol using ZK-SNARKs, the complexity of private vs public data storage, and governance.

speakers.name: Eduardo
speakers.description: Host and founder of Espacio Cripto.

title: The past, present and future of web 3 in LATAM
description:
Web 3 is here to change the world. NFTs, L2, and smart contracts are tools that people need in Latam to address economical disparity and to access a better financial ecosystem.

In my talk, I explain how latinos used crypto a few years ago, how they are using it, and how they'll use it to improve their lives through DAOs, NFTs, L2s and smartcontracts.

speakers.name: Paul Kohlhaas
speakers.description: economist, biohacker, developer, building on Ethereum since 2016. on a mission to accelerate scientific progress and open medicine. previously at ConsenSys and identity solution uPort, founder of Eth dev studio Linumlabs.com & www.molecule.to

title: Smart Contracts and Petri Dishes: Creating a Shared Technical Infrastructure Roadmap for Descentralised Science (DeSci) on Ethereum

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: DeSci is the combination of open science principles and decentralization. This workshop aims to unite founders and developers in the DeSci ecosystem to explore what infrastructure is needed: from reputation systems for scientific credentials, to file storage, public good funding and financialisation. Participants will actively determine pressing needs and a roadmap to functioning DeSci dapps, while also exploring the cultural complexity and UX of scientists as a user group.

speakers.name: Andreas Blazoudakis
speakers.description: Founder and investor of the unicorns Movile and iFood, plus other successful startups such as Playkids and Delivery Center. Serial entrepreneur with over 20 years of experience creating disruptive companies in the mobile and internet market

title: The Real Estate Digital Properties Era
description:
In this presentation we will share with the audience the pillars used to create the first real estate properties in Brazil,  using blockchain NFTs. 

The case to be presented are based in real customers that made online transactions in real time with real estate properties in different ways as fractional purchases and loans and mortgages using NFTs as a guarantee.

speakers.name: Ye Zhang
speakers.description: Ye Zhang is the co-founder and zk-researcher at Scroll. He used to work on hardware acceleration for ZKP algorithms and theoretical constructions behind ZKP protocols. Now his focus is on optimizing the zkEVM.

title: Scroll - zkEVM Testnet Launch Demo
description:
Why do we need secure scaling? How is Scroll different from existing zkRollups? What can Scroll bring to users and developers?
In this 20-minute session, we will introduce the design, principles, and the whole workflow of zkEVM, demonstrate our bytecode-level compatible zkEVM on testnet, and show you how easy it is for developers to deploy smart contracts on it.

speakers.name: Greg Chew
speakers.description:
Envisioned and founded QPQ, creator of the ‚Äòinternet of economics‚Äô and enabler of the programmable economy. 
Financial & legal professional, ‚Äòbig C‚Äô creative visionary, strategist, leader of leaders, futurist, conceptual architect and veteran entrepreneur. Two decades of experience in the deep tech end of ‚ÄòFinTech‚Äô with extensive commercial experience in capital markets, physical commodities and emerging markets.

title: Scaling Blockchain: how we open the digital economy to 5 billion users by 2030
description:
3 parts

Blockchain doesn‚Äôt scale
Level 2 amounts to re-centralisation
Layer 1 protocols are silos
DLT dream at risk

Layer 1 interoperability
Different from interconnectivity
Break through scaling, speed, services - a best of approach 
Must happen without recentralisation: true Layer Zero

Web3.0 becomes as efficient and convenient to develop and deploy in as Web2.0
Not just asset swaps, services, protocol features
Lego Master Builder
Hope renewed

speakers.name: Augusto Teixeira
speakers.description: A mathematician with a Ph.D. from ETH-Zurich and a post-doc from Ecole Normale Sup√©rieure of Paris. Augusto is an associate professor at the Institute of Pure and Applied Mathematics in Rio de Janeiro with a specialization in probability and graph theory. Throughout his career, Augusto has published 28 publications and academic papers. As an expert in crypto-economics and blockchain design, he leads scientific research at Cartesi.

title: Suggested titles for a panel: "Exploring non-EVM rollup implementations" OR "Content scalability: moving beyond EVM rollups" OR "L2 design space: exploring the newfound possibilities"
description: The Cartesi team is looking forward to participating in panels discussing layer 2, Optimistic Rollups, application-specific rollups, or non-EVM rollups implementations.

speakers.name: Augusto Teixeira
speakers.description: A mathematician with a Ph.D. from ETH-Zurich and a post-doc from Ecole Normale Sup√©rieure of Paris. Augusto is an associate professor at the Institute of Pure and Applied Mathematics in Rio de Janeiro with a specialization in probability and graph theory. Throughout his career, Augusto has published 28 publications and academic papers. As an expert in crypto-economics and blockchain design, he leads scientific research at Cartesi.

title: Layer 2s can do better than EVM compatibility
description: We will explore the currently under-explored design space that was unlocked by the arrival of L2 architectures. Focusing on optimistic rollups with interactive dispute resolution, we'll debate the subject of content scalability - which encompasses the ability of Ethereum smart contracts to inherit and utilize mainstream software stacks. In this talk, we want to open up the listener's minds and invite them to consider a wider array of architectural options that were unavailable before.

speakers.name: Ashley
speakers.description: Ashley Taylor Buck is a blockchain entrepreneur who joined the early Ethereum community in 2014 with a vision to further social mobility with this new economic paradigm. She co-founded ReSource to empower local communities and small businesses to grow cooperatively by offering credit to each other.  Previously she was the first employee of ConsenSys, a Community Microgrid Specialist for LO3 Energy/Brooklyn Microgrid, and a cyber expert for UN capacity building workshops.

title: Leaving the Casino Laboratory Behind: A Framework to Support the Emergence of ReFi
description: DeFi games are jeopardizing crypto's potential. As part of the Winterproof Alliance, we have developed a framework to understand if projects are building-long term solutions to support the emergence of an economy that regenerates our relationships to each other, public goods, and natural ecosystems. This talk will cover why this is needed, present the framework and examples of projects implementing these principles, and discuss strategies for how the space can support the emergence of ReFi.

speakers.name: Doo Wan Nam
speakers.description: Doo Wan Nam is Co-founder at Stable Node and Asia BD at MakerDAO Growth Core Unit. And Recognized Delegate at MakerDAO.  He has been Korea Lead from November 2018 to July 2019 and Business Development- APAC since July 2019 at the Maker Foundation. Doo previously worked as a blockchain analyst at Gifto and a senior analyst at Proof Suite. He studied economics and international relations at The George Washington University and holds an MA from Johns Hopkins University- SAIS.

title: Governance Theory & Practice
description: From MakerDAO to Optimism to InstadApp to Element Finance, we StableNode have engaged in various protocols as delegates and/or advisors. We especially focus on both Governance theory and governance practices, and believe I can join the panel to explore such and find ways to bridge such gaps.

speakers.name: Jake Brukhman
speakers.description: Founded CoinFund, a Web3-focused SEC registered investment adviser, in 2015, and has remained the CEO since. Also a writer, an artist, and a technologist with a background in mathematics and computer science. Previously worked at hedge funds, including Highbridge Capital Management, Amazon, as a technical product manager and engineer, and Triton Research as CTO. Recently, deeply involved in studying blockchain technologies, decentralization, digital crowdfunding, and crypto assets.

title: Unlocking the potential of NFTs
description: NFTs are the future and this talk will examine what is next for NFTs and the addressable market. Taking a moment to consider NFTs beyond collectibles and in-game assets. Specifically exploring NFT Financialization (defi primitives that are being built around NFTS) and NFT DeFi (new level of finance). For example, lateralized solutions and borrowing money against NFTs. The goal being to open people‚Äôs minds to the potentials of NFTs, as well as digital assets and decentralized systems

speakers.name: Yao
speakers.description: Project Manager in Blockchain and Web3 Tech @Superfluid Finance

title: The real use cases and why web3 matters
description:
From DeFi to NFT, to DAOs, Web3 attracts people's attention in different ways. With the rising capital investing in Web3, we all begin to question: why is Web3 special? Is it going to change the world or is it just a bubble driven by FOMO?
My talk will focus on the real use cases of Web3 in our daily life to showcase the unfair advantages of Web3 technology compared to Web2 or traditional services, and the current challenges that we are facing.

speakers.name: Cais Manai
speakers.description:
I developed software for banks for about 10 years before discovering Bitcoin back in 2012. I started building solutions that used Bitcoin that same year. 

Since then I've been involved in various startups and currently am co-founder and head of product for Obscuro, a Layer 2 protocol build on Ethereum.

title: A day in the life of a blockchain-enabled future
description:
I'd like to take the audience on a journey through a world set 10 years in the future. One where blockchain and privacy went hand-in-hand, and another without privacy.

I'll be exploring the amazing things blockchain will unlock, but how it can all go wrong if we don't also solve the problem of privacy. 

The talk will be based on my blog post here - https://medium.com/obscuro-labs/a-day-in-the-life-of-a-blockchain-enabled-future-2730bdacdb7d

speakers.name: Eduard Jubany Tur
speakers.description:
Founder at ZKX, Eduard, is passionate about working on DAOs, product development, token economics, go-to-market strategies, emerging markets, and complex challenges. He was previously at SOSV, one of the world's top VC firms, with over $1.2 billion AUM.

With 15+ years of sector-agnostic experience, Eduard has worked in leadership and growth roles in startups across Asia and Europe.

title: Governance Tokens are Dead. Long Live Governance.

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Governance tokens have proved not to be an effective tool of governance and representation of stakeholders for open-source protocols. What alternatives are there? Introducing Liquid Governance, a dynamic representation system for DAOs.

speakers.name: Ashish G
speakers.description: Ashish has worked at the intersection of customers and innovation. He has launched new brands, worked in Web 2 startup investing and incubation, helped set up an early-stage VC fund and been a part of a strategy team. He is passionate about the promise of Web3.0 and DAOs, and contributes to strengthening them.

title: Hey DAOs, here's what we want from you [Can me modified as per organizing team's suggestion]
description:
Presenting insights from the inaugural DAO contributors ecosystem study by Bankless DAO's research guild. The study gives a voice to DAO contributors. It captures their key needs, challenges and motivators of DAO contributors. 

If you are a DAO builder, listen in to understand how to attract more talent to your DAO.

If you are a DAO contributor, listen in to understand what your follow contributors are saying. And join the next study to amplify your voice.

speakers.name: Eric Bishard
speakers.description: Developer Relations Manager at MetaMask, conference speaker, organizer, host, web3 builder, and blogger focusing on JavaScript/Node, React, TypeScript, Solidity, and Ethereum blockchain.

title: Intro to The MetaMask API

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: We take a look at the MetaMask API surface as well as what is on our roadmap at MetaMask to make it easier to connect to MetaMask or other wallets from your Dapp or Mobile applications, understand common best practices when working in JavaScript and React.

speakers.name: Daniel Knobelsdorf
speakers.description: Founder of Transience Labs, Co-Summoner of Ethereum Venezuela, Normies DAO, and Gateway GM in web3, SingularityU Caracas and B Corps Venezuela in web2. Former lead for Trustlines in Venezuela and core team member of Commons Stack/Trusted Seed. Community & DAOs at IoTeX / MachineFi Labs.

title: Rise of the Normies (DAO)
description: Quick overview of Normies DAO activities during Devcon to showcase the power of bringing at least 10% normies/newbies into different crypto events to cross-pollinate between web3 kin and non-initiated folks, and discuss real life applications of our technologies in traditional industries and social causes.

speakers.name: Ann
speakers.description: Ann Brody is a doctoral student at McGill University who is studying how people conduct governance in digital settings in relationship to the protocol's design from a social science perspective. Her research is centred on examining how Ethereum technical affordances are being repurposed to support common good and non-profit initiatives via public goods DAOs and other projects.

title: The Dark Side of DAOs
description: This presentation will discuss some of my key research findings on the dysfunctional side of DAOs and protocol governance based on the knowledge gained both from academic research and industry practices.  The talk will discuss governance practices that lead to DAO vulnerabilities (i.e. technocracy, plutocracy, collusion, voting bribery, liquidation) and point toward best practices DAOs can adopt to avoid these common pitfalls.

speakers.name: Christian Murray
speakers.description: I am a research analyst at CoinFund, an early stage crypto venture fund that has been investing since 2015. I've spent 100% of my professional life in crypto and enjoy deep research on mechanism design.

title: Realtokenomik: the rise of governance minimization and value accrual tokenomics
description: Market downturns exposed flaws in the idealized governance mechanisms that were deployed during 2020-2021.  I will cover the shift towards governance minimization and how we can move towards automation of parameters and the elimination of subjective decision making earlier on, and what a governance minimized future looks like.

speakers.name: Michael Lewellen
speakers.description: Michael is the Head of Solutions Architecture at OpenZeppelin where he offers web3 security advice to leading financial institutions and blockchain protocols. Michael has 10 years of experience as a blockchain software architect and has consulted for prominent clients including Toyota, Verizon, and Thomson Reuters. Outside of OpenZeppelin, Michael educates on blockchain technology as a lecturer at UT Dallas and as a public policy advisor on the Board of the Texas Blockchain Council.

title: Securely Scaling Decentralized Governance
description: Learn about the pain points of providing security for a properly decentralized protocol and methodologies that can be used for addressing them. Striking a balance between appropriate security measures and checks on privileged accounts for things like upgrades is crucial for projects to become effectively decentralized while protecting users of the protocol from hacks.

speakers.name: Michael Lewellen
speakers.description: Michael is the Head of Solutions Architecture at OpenZeppelin where he offers web3 security advice to leading financial institutions and blockchain protocols. Michael has 10 years of experience as a blockchain software architect and has consulted for prominent clients including Toyota, Verizon, and Thomson Reuters. Outside of OpenZeppelin, Michael educates on blockchain technology as a lecturer at UT Dallas and as a public policy advisor on the Board of the Texas Blockchain Council.

title: Securely Scaling Decentralized Governance
description: Learn about the pain points of providing security for a properly decentralized protocol and methodologies that can be used for addressing them. Striking a balance between appropriate security measures and checks on privileged accounts for things like upgrades is crucial for projects to become effectively decentralized while protecting users of the protocol from hacks.

speakers.name: Ann
speakers.description: Ann Brody is a doctoral student at McGill University who is studying how people conduct governance in digital settings in relationship to the protocol's design from a social science perspective. Her research is centred on examining how Ethereum technical affordances are being repurposed to support common good and non-profit initiatives via public goods DAOs and other projects.

title: Introducing the Metagovernance Project
description: The Metagovernance Project is an interdisciplinary academic research collective that is committed to building standards and infrastructure for digital self-governance. This presentation will provide an overview of the various projects that Metagov research groups have been working on, and provide an autoethnographic account of what it was like for me personally to work in one of the working groups as a governance ethnographer.

speakers.name: Gabriela Chang
speakers.description: Co-founder of EthicHub & CMO

title: Catalyzing capital by tokenizing impact
description:
Impact investing grew to over 1Trillion market cap by leveraging blended finance. DeFi & NFT applications allow for much more transparent and efficient financing tools. Those, not only include blending together concessional and non-concessional investors but also include new forms of value (i.e. tokenised impact: carbon credits..). 

Institutions entities, have long tried to find solutions to those real world problems however were missing tools that enable exponential change to meet the SDGs.

speakers.name: Daniel Knobelsdorf
speakers.description: Founder of Transience Labs, Co-Summoner of Ethereum Venezuela, Normies DAO, and Gateway GM in web3, SingularityU Caracas and B Corps Venezuela in web2. Former lead for Trustlines in Venezuela and core team member of Commons Stack/Trusted Seed. Community & DAOs at IoTeX / MachineFi Labs.

title: Biosignal-Powered Tokenomics
description: How might we scale local government in LATAM? How might we fund the use and maintenance of urban public space? How might we build the necessary technical and social stack for the deployment of micro-community currencies and UBI? How might we meme this into existence? Join us for a quick presentation around the work/results of Transience Labs in Colombia with a focus on urban planning, public goods and festivals of human flourishing.

speakers.name: David Siska
speakers.description: I am currently a Head of Research at Vega protocol and Associate Professor of Mathematics at the University of Edinburgh. I've been interested in programming from an early age, oscillating between applied problems (coding) and theoretical (mathematics). At Vega I am mainly focused on whole system modelling, design validation and development of new protocol features. My maths research is on the theoretical aspects of reinforcement learning and optimal control algorithms.

title: Parameter optimization and emergent behavior in DeFi: agent based simulations and reinforcement learning
description:
As in any complex system there may be emergent behaviors in DeFi protocols. In this workshop we will show the basics of how agent based simulations combined with reinforcement learning can be used to explore these and also for optimization of various protocol parameter values. 

This will be based on https://github.com/vegaprotocol/vega-market-sim and https://github.com/msabvid/cpm_agent_based_sim . Participants should have Python / Pytorch if they want to hack along.

speakers.name: Carlos Melgar
speakers.description: Carlos has worked with numerous crypto companies as a business developer and advisor. He's continuously raising the bar for NFT utility and now using his experience in blockchain to create social and environmental impact on Utila, Honduras

title: The Mass Adoption Meme - How To Make It Happen
description:
The industry has been talking about mass adoption for years and using all sorts of examples as comparisons. The cell phone adoption curve, how remittances will onboard millions, banking the unbanked, tec...

The problem is that many of the people talking about it have no idea what it actually means to be unbanked, never sent or received remittances, or even understand the intricacies to be unbanked. The solution involves tapping into these communities and empowering leaders to create solutions

speakers.name: David Riascos
speakers.description: Cryptopsychologist working supporting the adoption of web3 in Colombia and Latam

title: Uncollateralized Loans an unexplored crypto opportunity for Latam
description: Around 700K USD per day is the market of shark-loans just in Colombia, there is not an efficient way to mesure how a person is credit wordy or not for this financial tool that have a big market in Latam. Crypto could have the solution, but it will need a new use cases to earn the trust for an abandoned market that scream for a new way for financial inclusion in terms of credit

speakers.name: Danny Holland
speakers.description: Obligate datavore, musician, and long-time Solidity developer, Danny is a nerd's nerd. Every topic is fascinating and Crypto doubly so. He's so irrationally long Ethereum, he made it his career.

title: ZK Rollups: Applied Privacy
description:
ZK Rollups are the future of scaling and privacy for Ethereum... but how? 

In this talk, veteran smart contract developer Danny Holland will give concrete examples of how to apply the Zero Knowledge part of ZK Rollups to protect user privacy and self-sovereignty using SNARKJS and Circom circuits.

Demographers hate this one trick...

speakers.name: Marto
speakers.description: Marto has been working at OpenZeppelin before it was cool. He currently leads the OpenZeppelin Contracts for Cairo project.

title: Account Abstraction on StarkNet
description: An overview of how native account abstraction looks on StarkNet.

speakers.name: Marto
speakers.description: Marto has been working at OpenZeppelin before it was cool. He currently leads the OpenZeppelin Contracts for Cairo project.

title: Cairo 101: From zero to hero writing secure contracts for StarkNet
description: This workshop is aimed to smart contract developers who want to learn the basics of Cairo development and its tooling. Go from zero to a deployed contract on StarkNet, a ZK or Validity Rollup.

speakers.name: Alejo Salles
speakers.description:
Sailing Master @Flashbots! ‚ö°ü§ñ
Former Research Lead at OpenZeppelin.

title: This is not MEV.
description: As a nascent field, cryptoeconomics is still lacking in terms of formal definitions upon which a cohesive theoretical edifice can be built. Maximal Extractable Value (MEV) is a particular example of a technical concept where there is no widely agreed upon formalization. Here, we discuss the difficulties in arriving to such a formulation, and survey some proposals. Critically, we emphasize what MEV is *not*, highlighting the critical aspects that need to be encompassed in its definition.

speakers.name: Kevin Owocki
speakers.description: Kevin Owocki is the founder of Gitcoin.co ‚Äî Where builders & funders come together to build the open web.  Gitcoin has delivered $60mm worth of value to OSS devs in the last several years. He has a BS in Computer Science, 15 years of engineering leadership experience in Open Source Software and Web Startups. Kevin is a community organizer in the Boulder Colorado Tech Scene.

title: Ethereum is Solarpunk ‚òÄÔ∏è
description:
Solarpunk is an art movement that envisions how the future might look if humanity succeeded in solving major contemporary challenges with an emphasis on sustainability problems such as climate change and pollution.

Solarpunk is our alternative to doomerism. ‚Ä¶ We just need a key that unlocks the building of new institutions -- Humanity Coordinating at Webscale.

Ethereum is Solarpunk - a key to coordinating humanity through it's coordination failures.

speakers.name: Kevin Owocki
speakers.description: Kevin Owocki is the founder of Gitcoin.co ‚Äî Where builders & funders come together to build the open web.  Gitcoin has delivered $60mm worth of value to OSS devs in the last several years. He has a BS in Computer Science, 15 years of engineering leadership experience in Open Source Software and Web Startups. Kevin is a community organizer in the Boulder Colorado Tech Scene.

title: Regen Investment Thesis: Creating Profitable Impact (‚ù§Ô∏èüå± = üí∞üìà)
description:
How might the web3 community engineer a capital rotation away from projects with the best ponzinomics + towards the projects with the best real-world impact? üå±

In this talk, Gitcoin founder Kevin Owocki will explore the movement towards financially rewarding Impact in the world + how it makes regenerative crypto-economics investable.   We will learn about network goods, a new anti-rivalrous type of network that is investible AND impactful.

speakers.name: Kevin Owocki
speakers.description: Kevin Owocki is the founder of Gitcoin.co ‚Äî Where builders & funders come together to build the open web.  Gitcoin has delivered $60mm worth of value to OSS devs in the last several years. He has a BS in Computer Science, 15 years of engineering leadership experience in Open Source Software and Web Startups. Kevin is a community organizer in the Boulder Colorado Tech Scene.

speakers.name: Griff Green
speakers.description:
Cofounder of Giveth, Commons Stack, & dappnode. Community manager for TheDAO, led the crisis response effort for TheDAO Hack and first Parity Multisig Hack from every angle, co-founder of the White Hat Group and led the creation of Token Engineering Commons. Advisor for PolygonID, PolygonHermez, brightID, Doingud, and steward for Gitcoin, ENS & Optimism.

I also lead 2 crypto focused burning man camps ;-)

speakers.name: Auryn
speakers.description: DAO obsessed co-founder of Gnosis Guild and clr.fund. Former professional basketball player.

speakers.name: trent
speakers.description:
- ethereum ecosystem work & All Core Devs call
- creating with @StatefulWorks
- one of many building the @ProtocolGuild

title: Practical Pluralism ‚ôªÔ∏èüå±
description:
Pluralism ‚Äî the understanding that diversity of people, beliefs, opinions, mechanisms, approaches, implementations, etc within a given context generally results in better outcomes than in the absence of such diversity. 

In this lightning talk, Regen Web3 Founders Trent Van Epps, Abbey Titcomb, Karl Flouresch, Kevin Owocki, and Auryn MacMillan will talk about how they're baking pluralism into their projects + building a more pluralistic world by doing so.

speakers.name: Shrey Jain
speakers.description: Shrey works on identity research with a focus on coordination and common knowledge. Shrey studied at the University of Toronto, and did machine learning research at the Vector Institute of Technology and MIT CSAIL. Shrey currently works at Microsoft under Glen Weyl.

title: The Most Important Property of Blockchains: Common Knowledge
description: Common knowledge is the one of the most important properties of a blockchain. Blockchains provide a way to guarantee a deterministic, sequential, shared knowledge that has yet to be realized by its users. The "non-financial applications" of a blockchain for identity, recovery, and coordination are not well discussed. Extending from a blog I wrote with Vitalik, l will focus on commenting on formalizing common knowledge and the other key non financial properties of the blockchain.

speakers.name: Alex Komarov
speakers.description:
Director of mobile at MyEtherWallet. 

Physicist by training, fell in love with UX and Product design in 2004, and never looked back. 
Worked in top US Interactive Agencies, created several businesses (product design agency, a food company), worked on product with many SV startups, co-founded (and failed) some as well.

In '17 got interested in crypto, saw that it has a huge UX improvement potential, and eventually landed in MEW. Lucky to be building great products with a great team.

speakers.name: Misha Nikanorov
speakers.description:
Building apps for iOS and macOS since 2010. Created apps that reached #top10. Worked on products at the intersection of hardware and mobile.
Main maintainer and contributor to MEW Mobile Web3 Toolkit.

title: Adding Web3 capabilities to your mobile products with MEW Mobile Web3 Toolkit.
description:
In this workshop you will learn how to add battle-tested, secure Web3 and Wallet capabilities to your mobile product. Tailored to mobile developers and product owners. Learn how you can leverage open source mobile-native web3 building blocks that MEW team built over the past 4 years: 
‚Äî MEWwalletKit (everything you need to interact with EVM chains in your product)
‚Äî Low-level Keychain/keystore interaction, secure key storage and encryption.
‚Äî Enabling DApp access with mewwallet-web3-provider

speakers.name: Ulysse Ramage
speakers.description: Passionate about video games and computer science since he was very young, Ulysse has graduated from the Swiss Institute of Technology and worked at Amazon before creating APWine in 2020 and moving full-time into DeFi. With a growing interest in art and design, he thrives to make yield derivatives accessible and easy to use as the UI/UX lead for the app.

title: Derivative Diversity: Using Community to build Trillion Dollar Bridges
description: DAOs are much more than just voting. A Decentralized 'Organization' cannot be the same five devs who launched the protocol simply because they have installed voting mechanisms and regulators have  made it clear that pseduo decentralization does not protect the founders or the protocol from prosecution. In order to realize an ecosystem beyond just stores of value, communities must be much more effectively utilized to build out the business organization of DAOs associated with protocols to ensure

speakers.name: Wuzhong zhu
speakers.description: Base in Singapore, love to travel. I am currently a developer advocate at Chainstack. Love hacking, building, and sharing. Passionate in helping developers adapt to Web3

title: Planning your EVM node for performance
description: There are many important aspects of a node‚Äîother than just transaction spotting. As a web3 infrastructure provider, we notice that people spend a lot of time and money to find the right tool, but not everybody understands right away that it is equally important finding the right node. This talk is focused on some of the metrics of a node we believe are important but often overlooked.

speakers.name: Jacob Czepluch
speakers.description: Contributing to Ethereum since 2015. Mainly worked on the Raiden Network. Passionate about how Ethereum can help the greater good!

title: Beamer Bridge - enabling a rollup centric future for Ethereum
description: We will be talking about how Beamer Bridge will help realise a rollup centric future for Ethereum by keeping the true values of Ethereum in mind. We will talk about how Beamer is the only bridge that guarantees the same security as Ethereum L1 and what other pros we can achieve by only focusing on rollup to rollup bridging.

speakers.name: Yaroslav
speakers.description:
Yaroslav Shakula is the CEO of YARD Hub, a venture studio focused on Web3/NFT/P&E projects. He has been involved in award-winning Web3 projects as an investor and advisor. Yaroslav is passionate about DAOs, community-backed projects, and gaming industry disruption through blockchain
 
Yaroslav's professional background includes affiliate marketing, AI, project management, and business development as a product owner and managing partner. Early in his career, he participated in global campaigns

title: Venture Studio model in Web3 space
description:
There are lots of ambitious Web3 startups/projects/ideas who realize that they want to focus on developing their projects, while day-to-day operations they‚Äôd rather get handled by someone else. Venture studios intend to help with that through experienced operators: marketers, designers, finance experts, recruiters, and more.
Yaroslav will elaborate on the nature of venture studios in the Web3 space and on how to manage such studios amid crypto winter.

speakers.name: Nico Vergauwen
speakers.description: Nico is the founder and CEO of Tenderize. Before founding Tenderize late 2021, Nico spent nearly 3 years as a protocol engineer at Livepeer, which was one of the first work token staking protocols. The experiences obtained from working at Livepeer and being a node operator were invaluable in the creation of Tenderize.

title: Make Staking Great Again
description: We present a design for a liquid staking protocol that fixes some of the recent issues like centralisation, cartelisation and unpegging. Our mission is to unlock the full utility potential of staked assets for all participants in web3 protocols while minimizing any obstructions to their current workflows and interfaces. This increased capital efficiency and improved user experience for staked assets is key to empower the growth of people and businesses participating and foster decentralisation.

speakers.name: AD
speakers.description: The proposed speaker is Vasiliy Shapovalov, Technical C-Ffounder of Lido DAO with a background in infosec, blockchain development, and staking. If Visa or travel restrictions make this impossible, Lido DAO will find the next best replacement to deliver the talk.

title: The Future of Liquid Staking
description: Liquid staking is now a major factor is the staking economy and staking protocol design. I'm going to lay out how I think it's going to interact with future DeFi, protocol development, MEV, interchain communication, L2s and modular blockchains. How liquid staking protocols will have to change with the blockchain world, and how to make them to shape themselves better.

speakers.name: Eli Ben-Sasson
speakers.description:
Eli is a co-founder and president of StarkWare, and Chairman of its Board of Directors.

He has been researching cryptographic and zero knowledge proofs of computational integrity ever since he received his Phd in Theoretical Computer Science in 2001.

title: StarkNet - next steps for scaling and expanding the ecosystem
description: How to reach new peaks of scaling on L2 (and L3) and how to achieve this together with the ecosystem

speakers.name: Randall Johnson
speakers.description: Randall is one of the original blockchain regulatory compliance experts, having advised incubators and projects worldwide since 2017.  He helped write the World's first cryto-offering laws for the country of Anguilla, and has advised dozens of important projects on structure, compliance programs and tokenomics.  Randall is a founder in Gaia Labs, Ltd., an important reg-tech focused incubator, and is co-founder of several projects including LiquidEarth, Hover and Landslide.

title: Creating a Proper Real Estate NFT Ecosystem
description: Bringing the World's Real Estate Value Into Crypto Properly.  Real estate is by far the World's largest assets class, at $325 Trillion, but the legacy multi-jurisdiction systems of deeds, mortgages, securities, taxes etc. are real impediments to creating this bridge properly, to allow the value of real estate to be effectively used in the digital space.  Learn from an expert how the creation and use of "LiquidEarth NFT's" is the first safe, compliant and proper solution for real estate.

speakers.name: Carlos Matallana
speakers.description:
- Blockchain developer since 2018
- Ethereum enthusiastic :)
- Worked on self-sovereign identity at Iden3
- Main contributor to zkRollup PoC developed at Iden3
- Protocol designer at hermez zkRollup
- Protocol designer at polygon-hermez developing the zkEVM

title: Polygon-Hermez zkEVM state-tree architecture
description:
- Insides about the state tree used in polygon-hermez zkEVM rollup
- Explain its architecture, functionalities and features
- Design decisions
- Similarities/Differences among Patricia Merkle-Tree used in Ethereum
- How it does affects to match zkEVM - EVM compatibility

speakers.name: Carlos Matallana
speakers.description:
- Blockchain developer since 2018
- Ethereum enthusiastic :)
- Worked on self-sovereign identity at Iden3
- Main contributor to zkRollup PoC developed at Iden3
- Protocol designer at hermez zkRollup
- Protocol designer at polygon-hermez developing the zkEVM

title: zkEVM: zkAssembly language
description:
- `zkasm` is the language created thinking on coding the zkEVM
- It is a based assembly language where any program can be written
- Its registers and instructions are being thought to be used to write a zkEVM, an assembly code that interprets EVM bytecode

speakers.name: N E Davis
speakers.description: Neal Davis works with the Urbit Foundation on developer experience.  He has taught computer science at the University of Illinois since 2015.

title: A Haber‚ÄìStornetta‚ÄìBayer Blockchain on Urbit
description:
The blockchain was invented from 1989‚Äì92 by Haber, Stornetta, & Bayer at Bell Labs. Their concept for a blockchain required Merkle trees of document certificates to be collected into a timestamped block & posted publicly.

We will use Urbit as a platform for an HSB-style blockchain: collating documents, hashing in a Merkle tree, & posting a timestamped chain for observers. We will also discuss how an observer can verify document authenticity (modulo trust in immutability of the public ledger).

speakers.name: crypto@antonela.me
speakers.description:
Antonela is a product design lead practicing ethical user research and open, human-centered, participatory design. She is interested in critical internet infrastructure, security, privacy, open-source communities, and feminism as an intersectional practice.  Currently, she is bringing usable security to the decentralized identity manager, MetaMask. Before, she led the User Experience team at The Tor Project. 
Between 2012‚Äî20, she has been wandering all over the world, living a nomad life.

title: Usable security in web3
description: Self-custodial wallets are the most powerful expression of autonomy we can aspire to in web3, but can people actually keep their EOA accounts safe? Balancing security and usability is critical for onboarding the next billion to web3. During this talk, we will explore how both can converge to give users a usable, secure experience.

speakers.name: diego beltran avila
speakers.description: Abogado Magister en derecho con profundizaci√≥n en Tecnolog√≠as TIC¬¥s, Socio Director de la firma legal GroupLegalTic. Participe acad√©mico e investigador en entornos legales de las nuevas tecnolog√≠as 4.0. especialmente Blockchain e I.A.

title: Aspectos m√≠nimos legales para proyectos en Blockchain.
description: Mi inter√©s en realizar este aporte a la comunidad, es brindar ciertos conocimientos jur√≠dicos necesarios, que de forma din√°mica y concreta, le permitan a todo emprendedor, desarrollador e interesado, conocer cu√°les son esos m√≠nimos legales a tener en cuenta en un proyecto general de blockchain  y qu√© elementos b√°sicos se deben considerar al momento de desarrollar Smart contract, NFT y criptoactivos.

speakers.name: Andrej Berlin
speakers.description: Andrej Berlin is the co-founder and creator of Deep Work. He has been involved in the design of over 100 different products, services, and organizations. Ranging from open source teams, start-ups, enterprises and fortune 500 companies.

title: First principles for DAO design
description: DAOs represent a new form of human organization. Through my research and experiences building the web3 design studio called Deep Work, I will share my mental model for organizations in web3 and show how to think about designing yours. With specific examples, I will explain how to start the pursuit of an exciting goal with the right norms, design processes for emergent behaviors, and avoid the stress of hiring and micromanaging by decentralizing certain aspects of work.

speakers.name: Kyle Weiss
speakers.description:
Kyle is currently a DAO contributor, a steward to multiple communities and the Executive Director of the Gitcoin Foundation. Before co-founding the Gitcoin Foundation, Kyle has been the COO of Gitcoin Holdings, a Product Lead at Twitter and the co-founder of Colorado Product. 

Kyle is an even keel, inner-directed leader who is authentic in interactions while remaining modest and charitable.

title: DAO economics - the constellation of sustainability
description: DAO financial sustainability often requires a constellation of approaches and considerations. In this talk I will walk you through how Gitcoin thinks about and solves for our DAO's financial longevity.

speakers.name: Luis Naranjo
speakers.description:
Software Developer at Microsoft

Mexico / United States

Likes to write about code, the internet, and everything in between

Thinks blockchains are cool sometimes

title: Progressive decentralization of node infrastructure

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: There is a meaningful segment of the Ethereum ecosystem that relies on centralized node providers for RPC access. There is a chunk of that segment that could be convinced to become their own node provider if we provide them with the tools, learning resources, and rationale for why this is aligned with their interests. This talk will aim to help us better understand this segment. We will also talk strategy to help us win over this group to promote decentralization + client diversity.

speakers.name: Stefan Beyer
speakers.description:
Dr. Stefan Beyer has been involved with distributed systems since 2004 and with Ethereum Security since 2017. He has audited hundreds of smart contracts, including Hermez, Aztec, PolyMath, Nexus Mutual and many more. 
He is the managing partner of Solidified, one of the oldest and most respected Ethereum security companies.

title: The State of Smart Contract Security - Observations based of 5 Years of Auditing
description:
Smart contract security became an issue shortly after the first protocols went live on Ethereum. Since then, a lot has changed in smart contract development, protocol design and the community's approach to security.
The talk explores old and new challenges, what we have learnt about smart contract security and what we may have missed, and summarizes modern challenges and potential solutions, from the perspective of 5 years of smart contract security auditing.

speakers.name: Madhavan Malolan
speakers.description:
Founder CEO of Questbook - a multisig designed for grant & bounty programs. Completely decentralized product.

Hacking in web3 since 2016. Early contributor to Plasma Network working group.

Run a blog at https://mirror.xyz/madhavanmalolan.eth

title: SACI - a software framework for decentralized applications
description:
Most applications are not completely decentralized - they have a point of Centralized failure

SACI is a decentralized replacement to MVC. A short talk on how to think about the software stack while building dapps

S - Storage using arweave/ipfs/Filecoin
A - Application compiled and hosted on decentralized storage (single page apps)
C - Contracts where all the logic resides
I - indexer to make data accessible to UI

https://mirror.xyz/madhavanmalolan.eth/0h9QKmgfPFqlaU1nwr-llRuIwKxhTXPt

speakers.name: Jiajia Cui
speakers.description:
- Quantitative Analyst in VEGA Protocol (current position) 
- 7 years ESG (Economic Scenario Generator) modelling experience in Moody‚Äôs Analytics
- 2 years teaching experience in The University of Liverpool in Econometrics and Mathematics in undergraduate and postgraduate level.
- Leading professional training in Statistics for UK government department HSE
- 2 years experience in Gaming industry in AshGaming (designing profitable games)
- PhD in Mathematics from The University of Edinburgh

title: Optimal Automated Market Making in Future Market: An Agent Based Simulation
description:
Constant product markets (CPMs) as a type of automated market making have shown to be a useful combination of a price discovery mechanism with liquidity provision allowing existence of liquid markets without the need of ‚Äúmarket makers‚Äù. Most CPMs are designed for spot trading, margin trading in future market add extra complications from the constrains on capital and risk from inventory. 

In this talk, we explore how to find optimal strategy in margined CPMs using reinforcement learning.

speakers.name: Camila Wolff
speakers.description: Camila is the project manager of Metaskins design studio. She¬¥s a Magister on Human Resources Management and has been working since 2015. She¬¥s passionate about leading teams into the creation of new experiences for the web3 space.

title: Creating metaverse content

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
Metaskins Studios Company Story
Metaskins is a fully customizable one stop shop for any and all metaverse or NFT needs. We specialize in personalized digital wearables, custom infrastructure built on metaverse parcels and brand tailored metaverse events. In the past, we have created some of the highest quality metaverse-ready 3D avatars out there and we are ready to do the same for any of your projects! Based in Colombia, our talented team of in-house modelers.

speakers.name: Christian Seifert
speakers.description: Research @ Forta. Prior to joining Forta, Christian spent 14 years at Microsoft leading security research and applied research teams supporting Microsoft Defender security offerings. Christian also led The Honeynet Project, a global non-profit security research organization bringing passionate security researchers together working on open-source honeypot tool development and threat intelligence.

title: Hunting and monitoring for on-chain attacks
description:
Web3 security requires a comprehensive security approach from reuse of secure, audited libraries, audits, threat modeling and security assessments to bug bounties, monitoring, and incident response.
In this workshop, we will dissect a real world on-chain attack, categorize each step the attacker took into four distinct stages (funding, preparation, exploitation, and money laundering) and walk through the development of a heuristic/ ML approach to identify these attacks using the Forta Network.

speakers.name: Alexandre Bourget
speakers.description: Alexandre, a trained classical pianist, now father of 8, started programming at age 12. He discovered Bitcoin in 2013 and launched the first Canadian Bitcoin payments processor. He continued to become a prolific data scientist and open-source advocate, only to come back to blockchain to build high-performance data solutions in the space.

title: Introducing Substreams

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
Substreams is a powerful blockchain indexing technology, developed for The Graph Network, to supercharge Subgraphs.
It enables you to write Rust modules and to compose and reuse community data streams. It provides extremely high performance indexing by virtue of parallelization, in a streaming-first fashion.
In this session we'll uncover how you can benefit from them.

speakers.name: Fatemeh Fannizadeh
speakers.description: Fatemeh Fannizadeh is a Swiss qualified lawyer and independent practitioner. She advises blockchain projects of public interest throughout their development and leads teams of international external counsels to address specific regulatory and dispute resolution needs of the clients. Her advise covers all areas of legal needs, while mainly focusing on holistic crypto legal risks mitigation. Her previous experience is in white collar crime, economic sanctions and international arbitration.

title: Crypto lawyers on the loose - the specter of economic sanctions
description: Individuals involved in the space and crypto projects, especially the stronger their defi component, are faced with the question of their eventual subjection to economic sanctions against targeted nation states, groups or individuals, and resulting compliance obligations. Because of a lack of knowledge and fear of enforcement, FUD is very present with regards to this topic resulting in unfortunate under- or over-compliance against targeted groups. This talk is a primer on economic sanctions.

speakers.name: Ben Armstrong
speakers.description: Ben Armstrong of BitBoy Crypto is an investor, crypto influencer, and thought-leader whose involvement in the world of cryptocurrency began in 2012 when he first invested in bitcoin. Ben Armstrong founded the BitBoy Crypto YouTube Channel in January of 2018 when he decided to go "full-time crypto" and focus all of his time and energy on expanding the reach of the crypto community. Since then, BitBoy Crypto has become one of the most recognized news channels for the latest updates on Bitcoin and

title: How ethereum is the catalyst for disrupting industries, including music, gaming, & sports."
description: How ethereum is the catalyst for disrupting industries, including music, gaming, & sports. This talk draws on examples that have already taken place thanks to ethereum, and where we‚Äôre likely to go.

speakers.name: Emily Lin
speakers.description: Truffle developer advocate out here just trying to help devs build better. Former DevOps engineer now professional nerd sniper. Let's gush about what you're building! @_emjlin

title: Build a Gaming DApp on StarkNet
description: Truffle as worked with StarkNet to create a StarkNet Truffle box, boilerplate code to help you build your DApps as fast as possible. Join us in this workshop as we teach you how to quickly build a gaming DApp on StarkNet, leveraging L2s to get the fast and cheap transactions necessary to make web3 gaming successful!

speakers.name: Josh Crites
speakers.description: I am a self taught blockchain developer who loves nurturing the infinite garden. I am energized by learning about cutting edge technology and sharing my knowledge to get others excited as well. In previous lives I was a ski patroller, a barista, a skateboard manufacturer, a farmer, a carnivorous plant researcher, among other things. :)

title: Developing Privacy Preserving Applications on Ethereum with Aztec
description: We will go over conceptual and technical components that will be helpful for developers that are interested in building privacy preserving applications on Ethereum. We'll build a basic web application that allows a user to create accounts, deposit assets to Aztec and bridge those funds to Ethereum L1 defi to earn yield while contributing to the Aztec privacy set. We will dig into specifics like the Aztec account model and creating custom bridge contracts for arbitrary Ethereum L1 interactions.

speakers.name: Emily Lin
speakers.description: Truffle developer advocate out here just trying to help devs build better. Former DevOps engineer now professional nerd sniper. Let's gush about what you're building! @_emjlin

title: Build a DApp on Optimism: How to Conquer L2 Bridging
description: L1 to L2, L2 to L2, L2 to L1...bridging is complicated, messy, and difficult! In this workshop, we'll teach you how to easily build a DApp that leverages Truffle's L2 Bridge Box, which helps you quickly set up a DApp configured to handle all the complexities that come with L2 bridging.

speakers.name: Chris Anatalio
speakers.description: Platform Advocate @ ConsenSys supporting Infura. LinkedIn Learning technical author with 5+ published courses and active technical writer. Software engineer with 12+ years of experience in distributed systems as well as DevOps and Web front-ends. Experienced Web3 conference speaker and active member of the Web3 DevRel community. Recovering DeFi degen, long-term HODL'er, bear market BUIDL'er, chain-agnostic web3 evangelist and generally enthusiastic blockchain fanboy.

title: Gamification Mechanics for Web3 Developer Education
description:
Demonstration of building mechanics, built on on Ethereum, to inspire developers of various skill levels to begin their web3 developer journey and to continue building and evolving their skillset.

This workshop will demonstrate how to leverage your existing educational content to create a more holistic platform with gamification to help learners navigate the topology of content, to verify their knowledge and to display verifiable credentials representing that knowledge!

speakers.name: Andres Gomez
speakers.description: Andres Gomez is a Colombian computer scientist with experience in the research areas of information security, machine learning, computing infrastructure setup, and monitoring. He has finished his Ph.D. at the G√∂ethe University of Frankfurt and CERN. Currently he is a blockchain security researcher at Edenia (Costa Rica).

title: Tikuna: an Ethereum blockchain network security monitoring system
description:
We will describe Tikuna, a proof-of-concept P2P network security monitoring system for the Ethereum blockchain. By leveraging Machine Learning techniques, it will extract security and performance insights for early detection of relevant incidents. Tikuna will bring improved visibility to the security state of the Ethereum P2P network. 
This is an ongoing project that has just been granted with an Academic Grant from the Ethereum Foundation.

speakers.name: Markos Lemma
speakers.description: Markos Lemma is coFounder & CEO of iceaddis, Ethiopian first innovation hub and tech startup incubator. Founder of SelamCompany an edutech venture working on primary education and literacy. Also co-founded high potential ventures 3BL Enterprises and DBR Technologies. Markos works with high potential and socially responsible startups in East Africa. Speaker on TEDx 2014. His work has been mentioned in different media such as The Economist, BBC, VOA, CCTV, Al Jazeera, TechCrunch,&Capital Magazine.

title: Dev Community Development to Serve the Next Billion
description: Though many don't talk about it, there are new products and services pushed to the market by African developers. What is it driving this? And how blockchain use cases are most impactful? In a region where there is less jobs and less economic power; Blockchain can be the answer. How can we focus on empowering these communities and increase adoptions.

speakers.name: Yevheniia Broshevan
Yevheniia Broshevan
speakers.description: Yevheniia Broshevan is the co-founder and CBDO at Hacken, a leading Web 3.0 cybersecurity company. Yevheniia is responsible for establishing partnership relationships with industry players and coordinating the work with clients. She is a Certified Ethical Hacker with >10 years of expertise in cybersecurity and a recognized female tech leader.

title: Cybersecurity in Today's Space
description:
Yevheniia Broshevan: co-founder of Hacken and –°BDO. Yevheniia is a cybersecurity professional who is responsible for managing a big community of white hat hackers (6,000 hackers) working on detecting vulnerabilities in clients‚Äô systems. Yevheniia has organized a number of industry conferences and communities for security specialists and enthusiasts.  
The list of clients cooperating with the HackenProof team led by Yevheniia includes such famous brands as CoinGecko, Gate.io, FTX, Huobi, Avalanc

speakers.name: Luis Fernando
speakers.description:
With a great passion for politics, economics, and technology, I see the best future that can await our society in the union of these.

Co-founded Politiks in 2017, a political analysis and consulting platform and graduated with the Diploma in Public Affairs at IESA in Caracas, Venezuela. And currently works as a Software Engineer in a social startup that incubates global entrepreneurs called Bridge for Billions.

title: Blockchain, a way to optimize governments.
description:
Open government policies are one of the main foundations for healthy democratic systems. Web 2.0 technology has already made it easier to establish mechanisms to make this possible, but web3 allows us to go further.

Blockchain opens the doors not only to develop more efficient open government policies but also allows us to create solutions that substantially reduce the operating costs of states and facilitate bureaucratic processes for citizens, all while reducing corruption.

speakers.name: Harry Papacharissiou
speakers.description:
Harry is a Developer Advocate for Chainlink Labs, the leading provider of secure and reliable open-source blockchain oracle solutions. He also sits on the board of directors for Blockchain Australia, the peak industry body for Australian businesses implementing or evaluating blockchain technology.

Harry truly believes in the immense possibilities that blockchain and web3 technologies offer, and how they have the potential to usher in a new age of economic fairness, transparency and efficiency

title: Cross-Chain Bridge Security: Securing the Connectivity between Ethereum and Other Blockchains
description:
The past year has seen a meteoric rise in the use and exploitation of cross-chain bridges, with over half a billion dollar in users funds  having been stolen by exploiters.

In this session we'll discuss:
- What is a cross-chain bridge
- What are some of the recent bridge exploits, how and why they occurred
- What we as developers can do to minimize cross-chain exploits, and ensure the safety and security of users funds when bridging between Ethereum and other chains

speakers.name: Adrian Sutton
speakers.description: Adrian is an escapee from the world of centralised finance but is now making amends by contributing to the Ethereum core protocol as a Lead Blockchain Protocol Engineer at ConsenSys.  He is a core dev on both the consensus and execution layers, leading development of ConsenSys Teku and contributing to Hyperledger Besu. When he's not coding he can be found discussing Ethereum and answering questions on pretty much all the Discord servers, and Telegram chat rooms and‚Ä¶

title: Hard Truths for Stakers
description:
Staking ETH on the beacon chain? Do you know what you've actually signed up for? There's plenty of places that will tell you how easy staking is and how awesome, intelligent and good looking stakers are, this talk is not one of them.

Instead, here are the hard truths you need to know about staking. What are the risks? What responsibilities are you signing up for? And where exactly do you fit in the Ethereum ecosystem?

speakers.name: Auryn
speakers.description: DAO obsessed co-founder of Gnosis Guild and clr.fund. Former professional basketball player.

title: EIP-5005 -- Zodiac: A composable design philosophy for programmable accounts
description: Most programmable accounts (like DAO tools and frameworks) are built as somewhat monolithic systems, wherein account and control logic are coupled, either in the same contract or in a tightly bound system of contracts. This needlessly inhibits the future flexibility of individuals and organizations using these tools and encourages platform lock-in via extraordinarily high switching costs. The Zodiac standard encourages a composable pattern for designing and implementing on-chain organizations.

speakers.name: Daniel A. Nagy
speakers.description: Swarm architect since 2015, initially with Ethereum Foundation, since 2019 with Swarm Foundation. Has been active in financial cryptography since 2006. PhD in applied mathematics from Queen's University of Kingston, Ontario, Canada. Former lecturer on Cryptography at ELTE Budapest University of Science in Budapest, Hungary.

title: Storing Humanity's Knowledge in Decentralized Merkleized Data Structures
description: Projects like OpenStreetMap, GitHub or Wikipedia are currently running from a centralized server infrastructure, leaving them vulnerable to blocking and even destruction in a "Library of Alexandria fire" type event. However, moving them to a Web3 infrastructure with content-addressed storage and ENS has advantages beyond resilience. The collaborative process of building and maintaining such data sets can also immensely benefit from decentralization, improving their quality and usefulness.

speakers.name: Max Hampshire
speakers.description: Max is Developer Relations for Nym. He was previously a smart contract developer, writer, and artist.

speakers.name: Shane Qiu
speakers.description: Growth @Nym Technologies; prev Researcher @Binance Labs; crypto since 2017

title: Nym: Using the Mixnet to privately broadcast Ethereum transactions
description:
The Nym Mixnet is a generic layer-0 privacy layer for network communications. 

This workshop will introduce participants to: 
* The architecture of the Nym Mixnet infrastructure and services 
* How Nym Service Providers can be used to obfuscate sender location / IP and timing when broadcasting Ethereum transactions 

Participants will learn how to: 
* Set up a local Nym client and connect to the Mixnet 
* Use this client to privately broadcast Ethereum transactions to the mempool.

speakers.name: Cy Li
speakers.description: My Name is Cy Li, and I am an International Entrepreneur and Venture Capitalist currently Based in ShenZhen, China. I have been involved with blockchain projects since 2016 and have always wanted to find my own place in the community where I can maximize my skill sets. As the current Director of De University of Ethereum, I hope to aid the future development of the Ethereum and contribute to the success of the network and it's impact on society.

title: Standardized Self-Learning: The Road to Mass Adoption
description: Being based in China, we see challenges facing new users when trying to learn the inner workings of the Ethereum network. Newer technologies, such as sharding and zk proofs, solve important problems for Ethereum, but also present entry barriers for newcomers. To ensure the future of the Ethereum network, there must be a mass adoption event or campaign for the technology. To achieve that, developers need to be onboarded, and consumers need to be familiarized with the tech outside of crypto.

speakers.name: Alex Vinyas
speakers.description: Master of the CoWmunity

title: The fight for MEV
description: The Fight for MEV is a talk that focuses on the two most "famous" MEV solutions designs, CowSwap and Flashbots. It will go over the differences in how each model is designed, and why each solution has made those choices (users, objectives). We will end on how we see the future at CowSwap in relation to the merge, MEV, and the overall Ethereum DeFi ecosystem.

speakers.name: Georgia Rakusen
speakers.description: Georgia is a seasoned user researcher, and has specialised in the web3 and crypto space for the last 5 years. She works for tooling, wallets, DeFi, NFTs, DAOs and gaming clients to help them understand their users and build better products, and established The User Research DAO; a collective of UX research experts dedicated to elevating the quality and quantity of user research being conducted in the web3 space.

title: Going on safari: researching users in the metaverse
description: A research study was conducted to understand the experiences of users in the metaverse. The deep conversations with participants in that study inspired the researchers to explore how web3 interactive platforms could act as a tool for qualitative ethnographic research in their own right, using 'netnography' to uncover behaviors and cultural learnings. In this talk, Georgia will share what can be gained by 'going on safari' and observing users in this new social ecosystem.

speakers.name: Sandi Bitenc - CEO 3air
speakers.description: Sandi is a serial entrepreneur and a computer geek. His professional computer career started already in his teens when he was part of a hosting and domain registrar startup company that went to become the biggest in the Adriatic area and branched to software development and a fully-fledged marketing agency. He has leading experience in the gaming industry and the health industry. He is part of many blockchain communities and devotes most of his time to the industry. As a WR holder in 24-hour apn

title: Connecting millions of people in Africa‚Äôs cities to the World.
description:
With our proprietary technology we bring affordable, high-speed, and stable broadband internet, digital TV, and IP telephony to the under-connected people and businesses in developing countries.
‚ÄúK3 last mile‚Äù technology provides up to 1 Gbps dedicated internet connectivity, over 150 digital TV stations and IP telephony simply through air. Each base station serves users in up to a 50 km radius.

speakers.name: Sandi Bitenc - CEO 3air
speakers.description: Sandi is a serial entrepreneur and a computer geek. His professional computer career started already in his teens when he was part of a hosting and domain registrar startup company that went to become the biggest in the Adriatic area and branched to software development and a fully-fledged marketing agency. He has leading experience in the gaming industry and the health industry. He is part of many blockchain communities and devotes most of his time to the industry. As a WR holder in 24-hour apn

title: Connecting millions of people in Africa‚Äôs cities to the World.

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Connecting millions of people in Africa‚Äôs cities to the World.

speakers.name: Julian Zawistowski
speakers.description: Decentralised systems visionary and entrepreneur running Golem Foundation and Wildland. Founder and ‚Äì until June 2019 ‚Äì CEO of Golem Factory. Economist by trade, fascinated with blockchain technology, as well as sociology and economics of decentralised systems. In the past consultant and researcher of public policies, co-founder of Institute for Structural Research.

title: Proof of Usage governance: beyond coin voting
description: The Proof-of-Usage (PoU) and User-Defined Organisation (UDO) governance, currently being developed by Wildland with RxC, address the limitations of coin-voting governance models. The non-transferable PoU tokens are derived from the users' usage of a platform and grant them governance rights. This is combined with assuring users' uniqueness and platform-specific SBTs that enable plurality governance with correlation control. This framework can be applied in any project with measurable usage.

speakers.name: Olivier B√©gassat
speakers.description: I work in R&D at ConsenSys. My research focus in on delivering the zk-evm.

speakers.name: Franklin Delehelle
speakers.description: Applied cryptography researcher at ConsenSys

title: Proving evm bytecode execution in the zk-evm
description: Rollups are the go-to solution to scaling Ethereum and at the heart of the Ethereum roadmap. Programmable rollups and zk-evms have gathered a lot of attention and research interest. Provers in particular, which produce cryptographic proofs of evm execution, pose challenging problems both theoretically and practically. In this talk we will present our arithmetization and proving scheme, and demo the zk-evm under development at ConsenSys, providing an EVM bytecode compatible end to end solution.

speakers.name: Abel A Bodo
speakers.description: I am a research and development contributor of ethereum swarm, with a generalist background in mathematics, computing, biology and complex systems.

title: Bandwidth incentives for decentralised storage
description:
Decentralised storage requires incentivisation for making data available to others by serving requests, in order to compensate for the associated bandwidth expenses. 
To solve for this, we can create an economy of p2p requests, keeping tabs on requests from specific peers, using prices based on DHT proximity to content, introduce efficient aggregation of microtransactions and debt forgiveness as different means of settling these tabs.
