speakers.name: Julio Santos
speakers.description:
I am a technical leader, software engineer, entrepreneur and investor.

Currently I lead product and engineering at Fractal as a co-founder. We work on privacy-preserving web3 identity verification for sybil-resistance and KYC/AML compliance.

Previously, I co-founded Life on Mars (a boutique software consultancy), Gruvi (a movie marketing agency), and a number of other companies which went nowhere but taught me a lot.

I am driven, supportive, resilient, and loyal.

title: How Identity Maximalism Is Holding Web3 Back, And What To Do About It
description:
Whatever happened to self-sovereign identity? Why are we still feeding our data to walled gardens? Why haven't identity protocols taken off?

Identity is complementary, not anathema, to anonymity. It brings us legitimacy and the next billion users. Identity is the missing piece to enable democratic governance, UBI, fair airdrops, authentic NFTs, and regulatory compliance. So why are we dropping the ball here?

I'll show you how we got here, why we're stuck, and how we get out ‚Äî or we're ngmi

speakers.name: Chris Hayes
speakers.description: Chris Hayes leads global government relations at the Celo Foundation, which is a grant giving organization that supports the ecosystem and builders on the Celo blockchain.  The Celo blockchain is a decentralized, open-source, mobile-first, carbon negative, layer-1 blockchain permitting developers to build applications for real world use cases.   Chris also currently serves as an Advisor to Aumni, a growing company building tailored data analytics solutions for the private funds industry.

title: Global Crypto Regulation: Stories from the trenches from the crypto lobbyists fighting to preserve the promise of Web3
description: I would like to organize a panel among other Government Relations professionals that are actively lobbying to preserve the promise of Web3, while also achieving regulatory clarity to ensure the industry can continue to thrive. The panel would include a Layer-1 representative (myself from Celo Foundation), the Head of Policy at Ledger (to speak on policy issues impacting custodians, Wallets and NFTs, and a leader on policy at an exchange or VC working directly on policy issues globally.

speakers.name: Stepan Sonsky
speakers.description:
Security Engineer | Ethical Hacker @ Ackee Blockchain
Crypto-anarchist, free-market economy maximalist, tech enthusiast, ex-Android developer for 10 years.

speakers.name: Jan Kalivoda
speakers.description: I like to do and approach things differently than usual in our society, which is why I became a hacker. I'm currently working as a security engineer on Ethereum with my friends at Ackee Blockchain.

title: Reentrancy is not dead
description: Do you think that reentrancy bugs are already past problems? Are you sure your NFT contracts based on the OpenZeppelin library are safe? We will show you a brief theory behind the reentrancy and possible attack vectors for your ERC-721 and ERC-1155 contracts.

speakers.name: Suzana Maranh√£o Moreno
speakers.description: Suzana is the blockchain technical consultant in WFP Innovation Accelerator, guiding humanitarian projects to implementation. Suzana worked hands-on in Brazilian Development Bank blockchain projects, including tokenization development and deployment of a blockchain national infrastructure. She was also the vice-chair of ITU-T FG DLT and of the Blockchain Action Group at the Brazilian Anti-corruption and Money Laundering Strategy in 2020. She is a PhD student at the University of Geneva.

title: What World Food Program/UN is doing and wants to do with blockchain to generate impact?
description: WFP/UN is the world‚Äôs largest humanitarian organization. WFP is exploring blockchain and crypto in different initiatives, including Building Blocks, world‚Äôs largest implementation of the blockchain for humanitarian assistance currently assisting 1 million people, and Empact, which connects food-insecure youth to the global digital economy. We want to discuss with you what can we do next to generate impact to the people we serve. We source, support and scale solutions to end hunger worldwide.

speakers.name: Carl Beekhuizen
speakers.description:
researcher with the ethereum foundation.

focus on consensus & cryptography r&d when not farming protocol calls for "goodbyes"

title: The KZG Ceremony - or how I learnt to stop worring and love trusted setups
description:
Danksharding, ProtoDanksharding, & EIP4844 make use of KZG commitments which require a trusted setup.

As usual, Ethereum does this differently by having an order of magnitude more participants than previous trusted setups. I will be running through why the trusted setup is needed, how it works, and why you should trust it.

speakers.name: Stepan Sonsky
speakers.description:
Security Engineer | Ethical Hacker @ Ackee Blockchain
Crypto-anarchist, free-market economy maximalist, tech enthusiast, ex-Android developer for 10 years.

title: Brain hacking for productivity
description: Developers and auditors need a sharp focus and deep concentration. I‚Äôll show you the most popular, natural, and legal nootropics to improve your brain performance with no side effects.

speakers.name: Dr. Slobodan Sudaric
speakers.description:
Dr. Slobodan Sudaric is a partner at cLabs, where he heads the regenerative economics team, and a co-coordinator of the climatecollective.org initiative. His work focuses on incentive design and asset tokenization at the intersection of web3, economics and climate tech.

Before entering the web3 space, Slobodan held various positions in consulting, research and financial institutions. He holds a PhD in applied game theory (HU Berlin) and a MSc in financial economics (LSE London).

title: Tokenized Natural Capital and Regenerative Finance
description: How can we use web3 technology and liquidity for the protection and preservation of natural resources? Step one: bring natural capital on-chain. The aim of this talk is to provide an overview of the challenges around tokenizing natural capital assets and to illustrate the potential of such assets for regenerative finance using the example of the Mento stability protocol on the Celo blockchain.

speakers.name: Eskender Abebe
speakers.description:
Eskender joined ConsenSys as a Product Manager on the Customer Success Strategy team. In his role, he‚Äôs focused on strategic initiatives within the department, currently with an emphasis on the development of VillageDAO. In his previous roles, he‚Äôs worked as a consultant, for the NBA's Brooklyn Nets, and as a platform product lead at an Edtech firm. Outside of work, Eskender is an avid NBA fan and world traveler. 

His favorite food is lasagna.

speakers.name: DROR AVIELI
speakers.description:
ConsenSys Web3 Customer Success (MetaMask, Infura, and much more).  Looking for creative ways to ensure amazing Total Customer Experience
Founder of the VillageDAO

title: It Takes a VillageDAO
description:
Introducing VillageDAO, a customer success platform modernized for the Web3 era by mobilizing communities into tokenized customer success teams.

VillageDAO helps DAOs and Web3 companies ‚Äã‚Äãidentify, authenticate, and empower experts from their communities to serve their communities in exchange for token rewards. By elevating and incentivizing the most helpful contributors, Web3 companies can effectively entrust customer care and troubleshooting not to third parties, but to their own users.

speakers.name: Rob Solomon
speakers.description: CFO, DIMO

title: Real World Web3
description: Yev will walk through a real world application of blockchain and NFTs. Vehicle NFTS and trip NFTS - something that every developer and everyone with a vehicle will benefit from. How are vehicle NFTs and trip NFTs different? How are developers accessing vehicle data like never before? How will this improve applications, businesses, and vehicle ownership?

speakers.name: Alan Chiu
speakers.description:
Alan Chiu is the co-founder and CEO at both Enya.ai and Boba Network. 

With more than 20 years of experience in building and investing in enterprise and fintech startups, he leads the efforts at achieving Boba Network‚Äôs goal of bringing Ethereum to the next billion users worldwide.

title: Hybrid Compute: It‚Äôs time to make Ethereum Smarter
description: My talk will cover Boba's Hybrid Compute Protocol as the next step in Ethereum Layer 2 scaling. Current scaling solutions focus solely on making transactions cheaper and faster but the compute power available on-chain is limited. I will go into detail how Hybrid Compute allows developers to call on off-chain APIs in a single transaction thereby augmenting Ethereum to make it smarter though expanded compute ability. It will introduce developers to this broader range of possibilities and scaling.

speakers.name: Fernando Martinelli
speakers.description: Co-founder & CEO at Balancer Labs

title: Boosting tokenomics with ve80/20
description:
Learn how Balancer and other protocols use a combination of the ve (vote-escrow) system and Balancer 80/20 pools to achieve some of the most desired properties in tokenomics design:
* Long-term alignment
* Deep liquidity 
* Swap-fee accrual with low Impermanent Loss
* Price correlated to ETH (for ETH bullish projects like Balancer)

speakers.name: Justyna Broniszewska
speakers.description: Justyna Broniszewska is a Lead Blockchain Engineer at TrueFi Engineering, the core team building TrueFi lending protocol and working on a set of public goods applications including UseDapp, Waffle & Mars. Justyna was a mentor and speaker at ETHDenver, ETHAmsterdam, Devconnect. An active member of ETHWarsaw Web3 community.

speakers.name: Micha≈Ç Sieczkowski
speakers.description: I'm an engineer passionate about blockchains and decentralised systems. I've been building in the web3 space since 2018. Hit me up if you'd like to talk about Rollups, L2s or Ethereum scaling in general.

title: How to build a multilayer DApp in less than 30 minutes?
description: Learn how to rapidly develop front-ends for your smart contracts with useDApp. Make the user experience snappy, while reducing your Infura/Alchemy bill. Create auto-refreshing UIs, which update on each new block, on wallet, and network change. Track transactions progress, replaced transactions, history, and show notifications.

speakers.name: Alex Herrmann
speakers.description: coder, mathematician and philosopher

title: Coincidence of Chains
description: Given the recent increase in L2 viability, we will present a way to connect L1s with L2s without needing to actually move funds. Coincidence of Wants shows us that if one user wants to bridge from L1 ETH-USD to an L2, and another user wants to do the opposite, we can match these users completely without going through a bridge or liquidity pool. Not only are there benefits in price but also in security as no MEV can be extracted.

speakers.name: Justyna Broniszewska
speakers.description: Justyna Broniszewska is a Lead Blockchain Engineer at TrueFi Engineering, the core team building TrueFi lending protocol and working on a set of public goods applications including UseDapp, Waffle & Mars. Justyna was a mentor and speaker at ETHDenver, ETHAmsterdam, Devconnect. An active member of ETHWarsaw Web3 community.

speakers.name: Micha≈Ç Sieczkowski
speakers.description: I'm an engineer passionate about blockchains and decentralised systems. I've been building in the web3 space since 2018. Hit me up if you'd like to talk about Rollups, L2s or Ethereum scaling in general.

title: Workshop: How to build a multilayer DApp in less than 30 minutes?
description: Learn how to rapidly develop front-ends for your smart contracts with useDApp. Make the user experience snappy, while reducing your Infura/Alchemy bill. Create auto-refreshing UIs, which update on each new block, on wallet, and network change. Track transactions progress, replaced transactions, history, and show notifications.

speakers.name: Ben Smith
speakers.description:
Studied Pure Mathematics at uWaterloo and McGill (Specialization: Gauge Theory & Linear Algebraic Groups). Currently active in blockchain (Ethereum) R&D.

Analytics Master and Dune Wizard

title: Proof of Optimization: How to build a decentralized matching engine
description: In this workshop we demonstrate how to set up and deploy a solver. A solver is a matching engine responsible for optimally settling the orders in a batch auction with uniform clearing prices. A decentralized network of solvers compete to win batches according to an objective criterion geared toward the maximization of user benefits ‚Äì such as trading peer-to-peer, protecting users from MEV, reducing execution costs and improving overall retail trader experience.

speakers.name: Makoto Inoue
speakers.description: Makoto Inoue is one of the core developers at Ethereum Name Service which provides NFT compliant naming service to various blockchain addresses and decentralised file systems. He is also co-founder of Ethereum based event service called Kickback and hosts events such as London Ethereum Codeup where a group of developers examine the latest smart contracts

title: ENS cross chain integration strategy
description: In general, most cross chain use cases are ‚Äúasset transfer‚Äù for bridges to cross tokens from one chain to another then each application deploys the exact copy from L1 to other chains. However, ENS (Ethereum Name Service) has a set of unique challenges because ENS functions as a ‚Äúglobal address book‚Äù to resolve addresses on any chains from any wallets. We have received lots of requests from chains and dapp developers about how to integrate ENS into their chain of choice and I am going to explain

speakers.name: Sergey Nazarov
speakers.description: Sergey Nazarov is co-founder of Chainlink, the leading decentralized oracle network used by global enterprises and leading Web3 projects at the forefront of the blockchain industry. Chainlink is unlocking a world powered by cryptographic truth by enabling smart contracts on any blockchain to reliably connect to real-world data and off-chain computation and currently secures tens of billions of dollars in value for smart contracts across decentralized finance (DeFi), insurance, gaming, and other

title: Improving Oracle Infrastructure on Ethereum
description: Oracles continue to fuel the growth of the Ethereum and layer-2 ecosystem. To build dApps that serve real-world use cases, from DeFi and DAOs to NFTs and beyond, Ethereum developers need access to secure oracle networks. In this session, Sergey Nazarov will dive into the latest oracle innovations and showcase new capabilities that enable Ethereum developers to build the scalable, secure, and feature-rich applications that can achieve widespread adoption.

speakers.name: Bartek Rutkowski
speakers.description: Bartek Rutkowski is a Lead Blockchain Engineer and Protocol Architect at TrueFi Engineering, the core team building TrueFi lending protocol and working on a set of public goods applications including UseDapp, Waffle & Mars. Bartek was a mentor and speaker at ETHOnline, ETHAmsterdam, ETHPrague, Devconnect and many more. An active member of ETHWarsaw Web3 community.

title: Is testing smart contracts with TypeScript still sexy in 2022?
description:
Solidity-only testing frameworks are taking the community by storm. Is there still space for TypeScript-based testing frameworks? Yes! 
Let's talk about the advantages of testing smart contracts with TypeScript suites and explore the newest features of the OG smart contract testing library Waffle.

speakers.name: Josef Gattermayer
speakers.description: Co-founder of Ackee and CEO of Ackee Blockchain, a blockchain auditing company. Josef is also an assistant professor at CTU in Prague, where he received a doctorate in distributed systems. His life goal is to make blockchain secure so he could retire. Proud speaker at Devcon IV.

speakers.name: Tomas Bayer
speakers.description: Project Manager in Ackee Blockchain

title: Security audits - scam or legit?
description: Security audits of smart contracts do not offer a binary answer whether the code is secure or not. Yet why are audits important for projects and their users? What should a good audit report contain? What is a good auditing practice? How to identify a weak report? And howto read the audit report to make the binary decision whether the project cares enough about security? Josef will demonstrate on examples and guide audience through the auditing jungle.

speakers.name: David Siska
speakers.description: I am currently a Head of Research at Vega protocol and Associate Professor of Mathematics at the University of Edinburgh. I've been interested in programming from an early age, oscillating between applied problems (coding) and theoretical (mathematics). At Vega I am mainly focused on whole system modelling, design validation and development of new protocol features. My maths research is on the theoretical aspects of reinforcement learning and optimal control algorithms.

speakers.name: Witold
speakers.description: Research quant at Vega protocol.

title: AMM design for margined products
description: Despite certain known limitations AMMs have proven to be an important element of the DeFi ecosystem. Their main strength lies in the ease of liquidity provision which is beneficial both to traders and holders of otherwise idle capital. As most current designs focus on spot markets,in this talk we‚Äôre going to explore an AMM model suitable for trading margined products. We believe that making these types of markets more liquid and accessible is not without significance for DeFi‚Äôs long-term success

speakers.name: Anna George
speakers.description: CEO/Product Lead at CowSwap and Master of the CoWs

title: One Block, One Batch: Examining the potential of frequent batch auctions in Ethereum
description: This talk will focus on the future of (de)centralized trading, and examine how frequent batch auctions can revolutionize existing market economics by bringing fairness and protection to Ethereum‚Äôs various stakeholders. We will review why Ethereum would benefit from a global batch settlement layer, touching on MEV and unfair pricing of CFMMs.

speakers.name: Bartek Rutkowski
speakers.description: Bartek Rutkowski is a Lead Blockchain Engineer and Protocol Architect at TrueFi Engineering, the core team building TrueFi lending protocol and working on a set of public goods applications including UseDapp, Waffle & Mars. Bartek was a mentor and speaker at ETHOnline, ETHAmsterdam, ETHPrague, Devconnect and many more. An active member of ETHWarsaw Web3 community.

title: Workshop: Smart-contract testing using Waffle framework
description: Let‚Äôs learn how to effectively and easily write TypeScript smart contracts tests suites. We‚Äôre going to explore how to create a testing environment, execute transactions, assert balances, state and event emissions. This is going to be the place where developer experience and smart contract security truly meet.

speakers.name: Edi Sinovcic
speakers.description:
Short tagline: Blockchain architect and consultant building the decentralised future one step at a time. CEO of ShardLabs.io

Short bio/story: Edi has been actively involved in blockchain development since 2017. Worked as an engineer in Solidity team of Ethereum Foundation and soon after founded Shard Labs. Shard Labs has become one of the core builders and developers in multiple protocols such as Lido, Polygon, Starkware, etc.

title: Sharding the ShardLabs - from the core Ethereum dev to CEO of the company
description: From Ethereum core dev to now scalling a blockchain startup. How to reach optimum between decentralization and efficiency in the organization. ShardLabs (https://shardlabs.io/) has started as a couple of individuals working on a project called Sourcify inside Solidity team of Ethereum Foundation. Now group of 30 individuals working on different primitives in the space. How do we move to the fully DAO organization? What are the current issues? How can we solve them.

speakers.name: Suzana Maranhao Moreno
speakers.description: Suzana is the blockchain technical consultant in WFP Innovation Accelerator, guiding humanitarian projects to implementation. Suzana worked hands-on in Brazilian Development Bank blockchain projects, including tokenization development and deployment of a blockchain national infrastructure. She was also the vice-chair of ITU-T FG DLT and of the Blockchain Action Group at the Brazilian Anti-corruption and Money Laundering Strategy in 2020. She is a PhD student at the University of Geneva.

title: Grassroot solution to proof one‚Äôs address using decentralized social trust
description: Despite how critical it is to be able to prove your own address, many people do not have formal documents to do so. We created an alternative way to prove this using a decentralized social trust solution and tested it in a Brazilian favela. A similar approach may be used to proof other facts, like gender, sex and income. These proofs may be used e.g. in social programs and in purpose-driven lending. We also developed a model to enable a certifier to earn more by telling the truth than cheating.

speakers.name: Felix Leupold
speakers.description: Technical Lead @MEVProtection. Multi-dimensional Batch Auctions with Uniform Clearing Prices on Ethereum. Prev. @gnosisPM, @facebook, @google. @HPI_DE Alumnus.

title: Towards Fairer DEXs on Ethereum

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: MEV is inherent to Ethereum and cannot be banned at the core protocol layer. Dapps should therefore carefully assess and reduce the amount of MEV they create. Multi-dimensional batch auctions with just in time competition for order flow offer a fundamentally fairer way of trading on Ethereum. P2P matching reduces the amount of extractable AMM interactions, while best price execution is guaranteed through a network of competing ‚Äúsolvers‚Äù.

speakers.name: Michal P≈ôevr√°til
speakers.description: Michal is the lead developer of Ethereum tooling at Ackee Blockchain. He has 14 years of experience in development ranging from embedded systems to mobile technologies. Holds a degree in Computer Security from Czech Technical University in Prague. Currently works on providing the best tools for Solidity development and security analysis.

speakers.name: Luk√°≈° B√∂hm
speakers.description: Cyber security student and smart contract hacker

title: Woke: Property-based fuzzing and transaction debugging
description: Fuzzing is a useful technique for finding vulnerabilities that would be difficult to detect using unit tests. The disadvantage is that the analyst often has no direct control over the values or order of the functions being tested. Woke fuzzer combines fuzzing and property-based testing techniques. Vulnerabilities found can be debugged transaction by transaction at the Solidity statement level. In this workshop, the use of the Woke fuzzer is explained in detail using simple examples.

speakers.name: Oleksandr Brezhniev
speakers.description: Technical Leader at Polygon ID

title: ZK Identity and Privacy On-chain
description:
Solving privacy and scalability of on-chain identities with iden3 protocol and Polygon ID solution. 
Introduction of ZK Query language: universal circuits and request language to generate zero-knowledge proofs for authentication and privacy-preserving identity verification. Real-world web2 and web3 applications.

speakers.name: Vitaly Yakovlev
speakers.description:
Vitaly is the CTO at ZKX, where he leads all aspects of the technology and innovation of a suite of Web3 products. He is a strategic, business-driven leader with 20+ years of experience and specializes in developing operational strategies to assure business growth through emerging technologies and product-market-fit.

Vitaly is a former senior partner at Springer Digital Ventures, where he focused on early-stage start-ups and scale-ups in Web3, DeFi, and SaaS companies.

title: Killing AWS: How to Decentralize Parallel Computation

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Due to constraints in parallel computation and data processing of blockchains and rollups, the Web3 ecosystem is currently limited. A new application layer is essential in unraveling a new wave of use cases for dApps and Web3. We are building a new consensus-driven node network that provides discreet and decentralized computational power to mobile apps and applications within Web3. This talk will cover how we're building this network and the current challenges we're grappling with.

speakers.name: Alfredo B. Roisenzvit
speakers.description:
Economist - Harvard University
Professor - Grad Level: Big data, Risk Management, Blockchain&Crypto, Behavioral Economics
Co Founder: MoonQuant.capital  A specialized startup developing algorithmic trading bots for Crypto and  DeFi
Former Bank Regulator and Financial Risk Management consultant

title: Making Smart Contracts Smarter: The use of embedded Auto-regulation tools for risk management in Decentralized Platforms
description: We have seen many well intended protocols fail due to poor risk management in design.  Smart Contract based Decentralized protocols need to auto-regulate.   This makes a great difference in terms of planning and execution, when compared to traditional markets, where global regulation and "testing in production" are more available.   The use of known and proved risk management tools (i.e. concentration risks, structural limits, etc) will help reduce unnecessary stress and even avoid failures.

speakers.name: Jan Kalivoda
speakers.description: I like to do and approach things differently than usual in our society, which is why I became a hacker. I'm currently working as a security engineer on Ethereum with my friends at Ackee Blockchain.

title: Can‚Äôt hack a protocol? Hack yourself first!
description: Hacking is usually quite an exhaustive activity. You will probably be less effective with a hangover or when your body is missing something. This lightning talk will briefly introduce biohacking and how to maximize your effectiveness during security audits or other comprehensive work. And yes, you will learn how to eliminate hangovers without self-destructing.

speakers.name: Jeremy Musighi
speakers.description: Jeremy Musighi is Head of Growth at Balancer Labs, supporting the community-driven growth and sustainability of the Balancer protocol. He has also been a crypto investor, speaker, and consultant since 2013, as founder of Immutable Capital. Previously, Jeremy founded, grew, and sold two consumer Web2 companies.

title: Cross-Entity Coordination: Balancer's DAO Service Provider Model
description: A uniquely innovative model for decentralized coordination has emerged in the Balancer DAO, where contributors ranging from corporate teams to anon individuals are acting as service providers fulfilling key functions and being funded and held accountable by the DAO.

speakers.name: Daniel Duan
speakers.description: Daniel has been working in frontend for many years focusing on performance and developer experience. He is currently at Legitimate building an ecosystem around physical NFTs and was previously at GOAT.com, WeWork, and Squarespace.

title: Performance in the Web3 World
description:
Performance is important for web apps, and that means dApps too!

Learn about techniques including image optimizations, content delivery for IPFS, javascript bundle size management, cache for on-chain data, server-side rendering, and more.

speakers.name: Stepan Sonsky
speakers.description:
Security Engineer | Ethical Hacker @ Ackee Blockchain
Crypto-anarchist, free-market economy maximalist, tech enthusiast, ex-Android developer for 10 years.

speakers.name: Jan Kalivoda
speakers.description: I like to do and approach things differently than usual in our society, which is why I became a hacker. I'm currently working as a security engineer on Ethereum with my friends at Ackee Blockchain.

title: NFTs don‚Äôt need audits
description: I met a guy at a conference who claimed that he doesn‚Äôt need an audit of his NFT project because of what can go wrong with minting. We will show you that everything that has user input needs to be audited. This workshop introduces auditing techniques on selected vulnerabilities, explaining their discovery and exploitation process.

speakers.name: Luker
speakers.description: Jen Luker has been involved in the Ethereum space since 2016. First at ETHNews, then as a project manager for MyCrypto, and now is helping lead the Security Team at MetaMask. She is excited to see the continued evolution of Ethereum and stresses the importance of continued education on best security practices.

title: Current Anti-Phishing Measures to Combat Scammers
description: This talk will go over some of the more common attack types, with a heavy focus on phishing, and highlight best practices as users and, more importantly, as Ethereum builders who have a responsibility to protect their users. As example, I will discuss some of the things MetaMask is already doing and has in the works to take arms against a sea of scammers.

speakers.name: Jan Kalivoda
speakers.description: I like to do and approach things differently than usual in our society, which is why I became a hacker. I'm currently working as a security engineer on Ethereum with my friends at Ackee Blockchain.

title: Pitfalls of EIP-2771 aka meta transactions
description: There are several projects that are preparing for meta transactions. However, many of them are not aware of their critical impact on security. Are you wondering why people use Context from Openzeppelin, or do you just want to use GSN for your project because it's super cool? This talk is for you.

speakers.name: Stepan Sonsky
speakers.description:
Security Engineer | Ethical Hacker @ Ackee Blockchain
Crypto-anarchist, free-market economy maximalist, tech enthusiast, ex-Android developer for 10 years.

speakers.name: Jan Kalivoda
speakers.description: I like to do and approach things differently than usual in our society, which is why I became a hacker. I'm currently working as a security engineer on Ethereum with my friends at Ackee Blockchain.

title: Differences between upgradeability and upgradebility
description: People have figured out a way to make smart contracts mutable, and that introduces a new complexity. However, it's not really complex if you know a bit, for example, adding one line of code or executing one transaction will earn you a $10 million bounty. Let's take a deeper look at this topic so you can secure your project or buy a yacht.

speakers.name: Oliver JL Renwick
speakers.description: Oliver is a terminologist, SBC enthusiast, and translator. He currently lives near Cleveland, Ohio, USA, with his wife and two kids. He works at ConsenSys, where he helps maintain the MetaMask Knowledge Base and, in general, tries to explain the madness of web3 to those who want to know more. He speaks Spanish and English fluently, and can get himself into trouble in Italian, Arabic, Catalan and French.

title: Positive framing and communication for web3
description:
The Ethereum ecosystem was, in some ways, born out of rejection of legacy systems. This is often reflected in the way we name and describe our projects and tech, names that are at best edgy and irreverent, but more often are obtuse and unhelpful.

In this session we'll look at a number of examples, from the simplest of technical concepts to the most far-fetched DAO and token naming schemes, and see how by casting them in the positive rather than the negative, we go from hindering to enabling.

speakers.name: Jackson Blazensky
speakers.description: I studied mathematics and computer science at the University of California Santa Barbara. From then until now I have worked on applied cryptography in the blockchain context. I lead applied cryptography at Edge & Node and the SnarkForce, where we apply bleeding edge cryptography including SNARKs to The Graph Network.

title: Roadrunner Polynomial Commitments: Record Transparent Proof Size with Applications to EIP4444 and SNARKs

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
We present Roadrunner Polynomial Commitments, Transparent Polynomial Commitments with record proof size. We illuminate some technical innovations which make our construction possible.

We then explore applications of Roadrunner to solving EIP4444 (historical state expiry and offloading of historical queries for Full Nodes), and synthesizing new SNARKs.

We announce our open source Rust implementation, benchmarks, and also our paper detailing our construction and its proofs of security.

speakers.name: Guillaume Ballet
speakers.description: Geth team, interfacing between research and engineering. Interested in evolutions to the Ethereum protocol.

title: Stateless Ethereum: how verkle trees make Ethereum lean and mean
description: This talk goes over the changes brought by verkle trees. It will give a high-level overview of the technical changes, an update on the implementation of verkle trees, and paint a picture of a stateless Ethereum.

speakers.name: Santiago Palladino
speakers.description: Santiago, aka Palla, currently leads the Defender development team at OpenZeppelin. He joined the Ethereum space in 2017, has contributed to multiple open source projects, wrote the book "Ethereum for Web Developers", and is also a council member for TheGraph. Before getting into web3, he worked for over 10 years on software development, focusing on disease surveillance and disaster response. He was also a TA at University of Buenos Aires, where he got his Masters in Computer Science.

title: Building the infrastructure for secure web3 operations
description: Operations of smart contract systems have unique challenges, ranging from key management and deployments to transaction monitoring and automation. In this talk, we will go through the many of the common problems we have identified over the past years of building OpenZeppelin Defender, along with best practices for solving them, with a strong focus on operational security.

speakers.name: Agustina Aldasoro
speakers.description: I'm a **Computer Scientist** from University of Buenos Aires, where I'm also a former teaching assistant of Algorithms and Data Structures II. I've been working as a Software Engineer since 2015 in different companies, such as Wolox, Flimper and Medallia, with a large experience in Backend and Infrastructure. Currently, I'm **Tech Lead** in the Platform team in **Decentraland**, where we build the decentralized Services network to support the Metaverse backend functionalities.

title: Using IPFS to create a Metaverse
description:
Leverage the decentralized IPFS network to scale content storage management for a Metaverse implementation.
- Manage all assets storage and remove S3 dependency  
- Navigate through the Metaverse Assets changelog history 
- Ownership validation based on Ethereum blockchain
- Strength the network and decentralization by fostering the community to contribute with nodes 
- Remove the complexity to manually implement content synchronization on the network

speakers.name: Santiago Palladino
speakers.description: Santiago, aka Palla, currently leads the Defender development team at OpenZeppelin. He joined the Ethereum space in 2017, has contributed to multiple open source projects, wrote the book "Ethereum for Web Developers", and is also a council member for TheGraph. Before getting into web3, he worked for over 10 years on software development, focusing on disease surveillance and disaster response. He was also a TA at University of Buenos Aires, where he got his Masters in Computer Science.

title: Automating smart contract workflows with OpenZeppelin
description: The goal of this workshop will be to demonstrate how to automate actions that respond to on-chain events using OpenZeppelin Defender. As a use case, we'll deploy an NFT contract and set up an automated workflows that mints a new collectible to every user that performs a trade of a specific ERC20 on Uniswap. We'll use the OpenZeppelin Wizard for creating the contract, Remix for compilation and deployment, and Defender for setting up the monitoring and minting.

speakers.name: Sasha Shilina
speakers.description: PhD, managing partner and CRO at Paradigm, researcher at Humanode. An artist and a researcher by vocation interested in all practices rooted in modern science, technology, art, and synergistic relationships between them.

title: Impact of NFTs on creative industries: state of the arts
description: This presentation is an attempt to conceptualize the main NFTs use cases for creative industries, analyze the current NFTs landscape, give a concrete and systematic overview of the benefits and flaws of the blockchain and NFTs technology, and propose solutions.

speakers.name: Sandeep Nailwal
speakers.description: Sandeep Nailwal is a co-founder of Polygon, a leading Ethereum scaling and infrastructure platform. Sandeep started his career as a software engineer and, in 2015, launched ScopeWeaver, India's largest marketplace for professional services, where he designed blockchain-based decentralized application architecture. Prior to that, Sandeep led the technology department at Welspun, the largest textile company in Asia, and worked as a consultant at Deloitte.

title: A Holistic Approach to Ethereum Scaling (Scaling as a Spectrum)
description: The race to scale Ethereum is on, and layer-2s have emerged as veritable frontrunners. However, scaling offers numerous barriers and requires a holistic approach. From addressing the data availability problem through modular chain designs, increasing throughput and efficiency through various flavors of EVM-compatible rollups, to deploying fully sovereign sidechains, Ethereum's scaling roadmap must explore all possibilities and be open to all futures.

speakers.name: JESSE SCHULMAN
speakers.description:
TELOS
Head Of EngineeringHead Of Engineering
Telos ¬∑ Full-timeTelos ¬∑ Full-time
Mar 2022 - Present
Web3
Dreamtsoft
6 yrs 10 mos6 yrs 10 mos
Advisor
Nov 2020 - Present ¬∑ 1 yr 8 mos
Software & Platform ArchitectSoftware & Platform Architect
Full-timeFull-time

title: EVM 2.0
description:
Telos EVM is already miles ahead of current competing Solidity solutions, but development isn‚Äôt slowing down. The Telos EVM 2.0 will guarantee that Telos continues to offer unmatched power for Ethereum-based applications decades down the line. Development of RPC 2.0, one core component of EVM 2.0, is already in progress. The TCD has teamed up with leading experts to drive this initiative.
RPC Optimization and Docker Implementation

speakers.name: Anurag Arjun
speakers.description:
As a co-founder of Polygon, Anurag takes care of Polygon products, acting as the bridge between Research, Economics, and Engineering functions. 

He has 11+ years of experience in building technology products, with deep experience in working with structured and unstructured financial data."

title: A Modular Approach to the Data Availability Problem

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Monolithic blockchains fail to scale because they‚Äôre asked to perform too many tasks (execution, settlement, and data availability). By taking a modular approach (decoupling transaction execution from data availability), entire ecosystems could scale to meet global demand. This will foster a new breed of application-specific blockchains that can update, fork, and change how it handles execution. This is critical for DeFi devs to patch bugs, experiment with execution, and reduce their dependenc

speakers.name: Felipe Montes
speakers.description: Co-founder & CEO of kravata, a crypto-as-aservice company that enables LATAM businesses to offer crypto solutions in their own platforms. PhD in complex systems, associate professor of Engineering and ex-director of Analytics MSc at Uniandes. Ex-director of quality assurance and vice-minister (ad-interim) at the Ministry of Education, and international consultant in complexity, network science, and data analytics with more than 30 peer-reviewed papers in journals such as Nature (SciReports).

title: Compliant ramps: an infrastructure for LATAM crypto adoption
description: Latam users rely to a large extent on P2P for crypto/fiat transactions. Traditional and crypto-native businesses lack of compliant infrastructures to directly offer crypto use cases to their users. Also, global exchanges have been playing an on/off ramp intermediary role that is centralizing web3. In this talk we will discuss the main challenges on building direct ramps for web2/web3 businesses in LATAM across the layers of regulations, compliance, technology, and education of businesses & users

speakers.name: Marcos Maceo
speakers.description: Tech Lead of Juno at Nethermind

title: Juno, the StarkNet Client
description:
StarkNet is a Permissionless STARK-Powered L2 ZK-Rollup, which is the next step in the **evolution of Starkware**. It brings it closer to a universal L2 platform that will use Ethereum as its L1. To make it succeed is mandatory to decentralize each of the StarkNet functionalities, and this will only be possible if we have a network of nodes that decentralize this information and make that information public

Juno objective is to bring the StarkNet decentralization, made by Nethermind

speakers.name: Dan Shaw
speakers.description: Advisor at Ethereum Foundation for Enterprise Community. Dan is an engineer who likes to work with people. An open source veteran, Dan helped bring Node.js to the Enterprise and has worked with the Node.js Foundation, LF, CNCF, OSI, and now the EEA. Dan has founded 3 tech companies: Cor.dev,¬†NodeSource, and The Node Firm.

speakers.name: Daniel Burnett
speakers.description: Dr. Burnett has over two decades of experience in the authoring, editing, and chairing of over a dozen web and Internet standards, including WebRTC, Verifiable Credentials, and Decentralized Identifiers.  In his current role as the Executive Director of the Enterprise Ethereum Alliance, Dan works to increase adoption of Ethereum by the broader non-technical business community for the betterment of all.

title: Ethereum Business Readiness in 2022
description: Ethereum has had amongst its stated objectives to support enterprise adoption from its inception. Over the years, there have been a number of challenges to this becoming a reality. Now the necessary components are all there to fully support a number of compelling use cases, most of which use Ethereum Mainnet as the final settlement layer. Drawing from research across 120 companies, learn how companies are succeeding today and what infrastructure they are using to get to production.

speakers.name: Nick Frontera
speakers.description: Nick Frontera is the founder and CEO of Apollo Entertainment, a metaverse consulting and production studio based in Miami, Florida, USA and Bogota, Colombia. Prior to becoming involved in the NFT space in 2017, Nick worked as an entertainment and intellectual property attorney at a prominent Los Angeles based law firm. Since leaving the legal field, Nick has worked as a consultant to top creators in the space and is the project lead for the Satoshi's Legions play and earn game.

title: The Evolution Of Play & Earn Economies in Web 3 Gaming
description: From Runescape, to Diablo to World of Warcraft play and earn games have existed for decades but have remained highly centralized. This talk will review historical examples of play and earn economies in the traditional gaming space and explore how Web 3 can be used to evolve player economies through decentralization.

speakers.name: Kosala Hemachandra
speakers.description:
Kosala Hemachandra is the founder and CEO of MEW (MyEtherWallet),
the leading Ethereum wallet interface, which is free, open-source and
secure. Kosala is driven by the idea that blockchain technology will
help define a new era of global finance. He has over 9 years of
experience as a computer engineer and has grown MEW into a global
LA-based blockchain company.

title: Building a Multi-chain Experience
description:
Join MyEtherWallet founder Kosala Hemachandra in a hands-on workshop for MEW‚Äôs newest Chrome extension wallet.

Participants will explore features of this new open-source extension, how it can improve user experience and encourage mainstream adoption, and  be adapted to the unique needs of different blockchain communities.

Takeaways:
-Adding support for a unique blockchain.
-Adding custom assets, functionality and DApps.
-Leveraging the unique features to optimize for user experience

speakers.name: Lori Blonn
speakers.description: Head of Operations @ Certora

title: Using Mutations To Strengthen Formal Specification
description: Formal verification is an effective technique for ensuring DeFi security. It assists humans in finding bugs before the code is deployed and can formally prove many program invariants. However, formal verification is only as good as the specification. This talk presents a new mutation-based technique for strengthening the quality of formal specifications. This helps users gain trust in the result of formal verification and improve their specification to support subtle properties and edge cases.

speakers.name: Brian Norton
speakers.description:
Brian Norton, Chief Operations Officer of MEW (MyEtherWallet), has
built years of startup operational management experience in
industries across the tech space, including edtech, industrial
automation, and now blockchain. Brian‚Äôs work at MEW is driven by
the idea that blockchain technology, designed for everyday life, will
change the way we live for the better in way we can not yet imagine.

title: Crossing the Political Chasm: Understanding the perceived ideologies of Web3 and Crypto and their impact on adoption.
description: From Bitcoin‚Äôs debut more than a decade ago, to our current multichain ecosystem, crypto and blockchain have long associated with the libertarian ideologies from which they spawned. But now with global awareness growing, it becomes necessary to ask: are those ideological associations contributing the expansion of the space, or could they be holding us back? In this talk we cover how the political underpinnings have influenced its development, its perception, and where we can go from here.

speakers.name: Chris Remus
speakers.description: Chris Remus is a decentralization activist, entrepreneur, and writer. In 2017, he founded Chainflow, a crypto infrastructure company, to help build the foundations for a more inclusive, equitable, and fair economy in Web3. Without any outside investments, Chris has grown Chainflow into one of the most active and effective teams across more than a dozen of the leading blockchains. When he's not working, you can find him cycling, meditating, or spending time with his family.

title: Decentralizing Power on Eth2
description:
A small number of entities already control the majority of Eth2 stake and, with it, power over the network. It‚Äôs urgent that we understand how this power can be more equitably distributed, so that Eth2 can become more decentralized and censorship-resistant, in the spirit of the Ethereum community‚Äôs core values.

On this panel, we‚Äôll invite experts from across the Proof-of-Stake stack to discuss what the community can do to build the foundations for a sustainable, decentralized future.

speakers.name: Nazar Hussain
speakers.description: I am around the industry for quite a long time having experience spanning. Along the journey learned a lot in different industries including Sales, Health, Accounting & Finance, Marketing, Vehicle Tracking, and many more. With such diversified business domain exposure, I possess strong knowledge and skills in all aspects  overseeing, management, and the development of software products. Open Source remains a strong uphold for me and I had been and will be contributing to Open Source projects.

title: Settlement Systems and Cryptocurrencies
description:
- Types of Settlement Systems 
- Settlement Systems  & Currency Zones 
- Bitcoin as a settlement layer 
- Ethereum as a settlement layer 
- Future of financial systems  & cryptocurrencies

speakers.name: Vince Major
speakers.description: Vince Major is an actor, marketer and storyteller. Currently working as the head of marketing at MyEtherWallet, Vince has been working in the arts for over a decade.

title: My Mother Hates Your Project (And Mine)! Why We Need More Soft Skills In Crypto
description:
GM, fren, anon, ape in, DeFi, DApps, protocol, WAGMI. 

Words have immense power, and yet we are doing ourselves a disservice when it comes to everything crypto by not embracing soft skillers. The way in which we continue to name, explain and communicate our creations will have profound impact on adoption. And right now, we suck at it. Hard.

speakers.name: Jeff Jablon
speakers.description: Public Relations Associate at Wachsman

title: Anish Mohammed's Session on ZKPs
description:
Panel Abstract: The regulation of the digital assets industry is inevitable. As KYC/AML rules reign, it‚Äôs easy to wonder if the erosion of privacy, one of crypto‚Äôs key value props, is unavoidable. Fortunately, privacy and compliance in crypto can coexist, thanks to zk technology.
Talking Points: What increasing regulations means for the future of DeFi and Web3. Why privacy and compliance aren't mutually exclusive in the crypto industry. The interplay between zk tech & security in DeFi. And more

speakers.name: Angela Vitzthum
speakers.description: Angela is a Product Manager with almost a decade of experience. Having found her way into Web3 she works on Fairdrive to bring data sovereignty to the masses. A true believer in the power of decentralization she hopes to create a positive impact by empowering people through data ownership. She loves dapps, protocols & dogs. In no particular order.

title: Drawing from customer journey: ethical product design practices in Web3
description: When building in Web3 we‚Äôre typically building for trust. Web2 has trained Product Managers to capture & track as much data as possible to better understand the user journey, pain points in the experience and most importantly where/what to optimize for. This talk reviews how we understand if a project is successful in Web3 without compromising the User‚Äôs privacy & trust.

speakers.name: matt shams
speakers.description:
Ethereum Proof of stake Fanboy 

https://blog.blockswap.network/eth2stakinganddaovalidators-ce7e72bbe63f

title: under 2 min - Become an Etheruem staker and set up node
description:
We need more mainstream users to partake in Etheruem PoS activity, 

A brief talk showcasing stake tooling for Etheruem deposit contract that allows a normal user to safely stake 32 ETH and have his/her Ethereum Validator from 0, this includes generating credentials and processing deposit, another 60 seconds will allow them to have a node up and running using DVT techstack.

speakers.name: Adrian Sutton
speakers.description: Adrian is an escapee from the world of centralised finance but is now making amends by contributing to the Ethereum core protocol as a Lead Blockchain Protocol Engineer at ConsenSys.  He is a core dev on both the consensus and execution layers, leading development of ConsenSys Teku and contributing to Hyperledger Besu. When he's not coding he can be found discussing Ethereum and answering questions on pretty much all the Discord servers, and Telegram chat rooms and‚Ä¶

title: Post-Merge Ethereum Client Architecture
description:
Take a look at the key components of a post-merge Ethereum "node" and how they fit together, encompassing both the consensus and execution clients. How do the two clients work together? What impact does the different designs of clients have on that? And what opportunities are there for execution and consensus clients to work together better in the future?

Let's break down the knowledge silos between consensus and execution layers to get the most out of merged future of Ethereum.

speakers.name: Andrei Anisimov
speakers.description: DeFi founder, early contributor Flashbots, ex-Coinbase

title: Quantifying Risk and Rewards in DeFi Options Vaults
description: DeFi Options Vaults (DOVs) are at the forefront of innovation for decentralized products. LPs put over a billion dollars of assets into DOVs last year to earn yield without any formal analysis of the risks and payoffs of DOVs. Our research performs a long-term backtest of historical DOV performance data and projects returns under various conditions using Monte Carlo simulations. We evaluate the risk/reward profile of DOVs and create a framework for improving current and designing new strategies.

speakers.name: Carlos Mario Alba Rodriguez
speakers.description:
Cybersecurity consultant | Creator of "Crypto para personas y empresas".

Master's degree in cybersecurity - Universidad Internacional de la Rioja (In progress 2023)
Certified Ethical Hacker - EC Council
Cybersecurity Analyst Professional - IBM
Bachelor of Engineering | Ingenier√≠a de sistemas - Universidad de los Andes

title: The top 3 Crypto Scams and how to avoid them
description:
When you and I started in the crypto ecosystem, one of our main concerns was to lose our money. 

Currently, scammers use several techniques, but the most popular scams do not require technical procedures, but social engineering skills to trick us.

Among these scams you can find: 
1. Rug pulls
2. Pumps and dumps
3. Crypto Ponzi schemes (especially growing in the LatAm region)

By the end of this talk you will have learned: what are these scams, how they are done, and how to avoid them.

speakers.name: haoyun
speakers.description: Based in Shanghai ChinaÔΩúETHPlanet TEAM ÔΩú EDCON TEAM ÔΩú Member of togETHer

speakers.name: yanyan ho
speakers.description: Dapp-Learning Founder.  Faithful of Austrian economics, Interested in DEFI, ZK, DAO

title: The community support team in china

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: We hope to share our community growth experience in China with more people

speakers.name: Jonathan Alexander
speakers.description: Jonathan Alexander is CTO of OpenZeppelin and co-founder and council member of Forta. He leads the global development team at OpenZeppelin that works on OpenZeppelin Contracts, Wizard, Defender, and Forta. Formerly he was CTO at Tricentis and Vonage Business. When not working on software he likes spending time with his family, reading, tennis, and mountain hiking.

speakers.name: Rajeev
speakers.description: Founder @TheSecureum (https://twitter.com/0xRajeev)

speakers.name: Gon√ßalo S√°
speakers.description:
Gon√ßalo, currently co-founder of the ConsenSys Diligence team, has 20+ years of experience in offensive security.
Notable achievements range from cracking DRM algorithms to breaching a major international consumer electronics retailer.

While studying Aerospace engineering, Gon√ßalo also built 3 startups (AdTech, BioTech, Mobile). Passionate about turning MVPs into production-ready products, he has also mentored a fair share of entrepreneurs in the past 5+ years.

speakers.name: Mehdi Zerouali
speakers.description: Mehdi Zerouali is a co-founder and Director of Sigma Prime, a leading Sydney-based blockchain security company. Mehdi has been in the information security industry for 10 years and has performed hundreds of security assessments targeting critical infrastructure. With Sigma Prime, Mehdi applies his skills to the Blockchain space, helping prominent projects secure their decentralised protocols.

title: Future of Smart Contract Security Audits: REKT or WAGMI?
description: Smart contract security audits have become a de facto requirement for Ethereum applications. However, there continue to be multi-million dollar hacks every week highlighting significant challenges with audits such as questionable quality, arguable effectiveness, unreasonable expectations, high cost, low availability and dearth of talent. This panel proposes to debate on these contentious aspects with some leaders in this space and peek into their crystal ball to see if we are REKT or WAGMI.

speakers.name: Costanza Gallo
speakers.description: Costanza is Ecosystem Manager at the Swarm Association, previously she was Community Manager at Golem. She has an MSc in Law, Anthropology and Society from the London School of Economics and she's passionate about freedom of information.

title: Censorship-resistant Wikipedia: why Web3 infrastructure is not enough
description:
What do people in China, France, and Venezuela have in common? They all, at some point, couldn't access Wikipedia or parts of it. 
In this speech, in order to provide an anthropological analysis of censorship, I will analyze the context in which censorship takes place and I will look at two types of attempts of blocking access to Wikipedia - technical efforts and human threats - and I will argue that a web3 censorship-resistant architecture is a necessary but not sufficient solution.

speakers.name: Rik Krieger
speakers.description: Rik Krieger is co-founder of HOPR. He has already successfully led the FinTech SONECT to the TOP 50. After his bachelor's degree in St. Gallen he started a career in business development at Gate Group International, where he worked for various airlines worldwide. In the following years, he gained extensive strategic experience at various companies. After his Executive Master's degree at the University of Zurich, he is now responsible for all commercial matters at the HOPR Association.

title: How to build an outstanding Dev-Team in tough market conditions
description: Finding Developers has become increasingly tough. IT Engineers are on high demand, especially experienced ones. In addition the amount of fraudsters has increased significantly. The right selection process, on skill set, character & "cultural match", in order to find the best matching resources, is key to success. I will present a selection process for start-ups, which I am working on since 7 years in order to find & also build exceptional teams with an outstanding performance.

speakers.name: Pablo Villalba
speakers.description: Entrepreneur. Product / crypto / art / code / finance. Previously founder at @8fit (acquired by @Withings), @RedboothHQ, $40m+ revenues

title: DiVa ‚Äì Distributed Validators for Trustless Eth2 Staking
description:
As of today, Lido controls 33% of all staked ETH (with only 28 node operators), and the top 4 staking entities control >50%. This has huge implications for decentralization and security. The future of Ethereum is at Stake!

DiVa is a protocol with a separation of concerns between Signer and Aggregator using DKG. This allows anyone to join the network as a validator, and offers stakers the full advantages of Liquid Staking Derivatives.

speakers.name: Nick Johnson
speakers.description: Nick Johnson is the founder and lead developer of the Ethereum Name Service. Prior to launching ENS, he worked at the Ethereum Foundation, where he acted as core developer on go-ethereum.

title: State of the ENS

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: An overview of ENS's innovations and progress in the last couple of years. Learn about how the ENS DAO is developing new approaches to decentralised governance, and how the development of ENS's offchain infrastructure makes trustless access to data held outside L1 easier for everyone - enabling both ENS's expansion to L2s and much broader applications.

speakers.name: Mary Pan
speakers.description:
Researcher; Blockchain/DAO/governance enthusiast; Electronic music composer (quefear; https://audius.co/quefear)
Affiliation: Paradigm Research ( https://medium.com/paradigm-fund; @Paradigm_fund); Skolkovo Institute of Science and Technology (Skoltech) (https://www.skoltech.ru/en ; @Skoltech)

title: Smart Contracts in the Renewable Energy Sector: Challenges & Solutions
description: Renewable energy has become an important part of the energy sector and is projected to reach $1,977.6 billion by 2030. The trend of decentralization and digitalization is driving the search for innovative solutions that provide reliable and tamper-proof data and energy exchange to support the deployment of more distributed control solutions. Smart contracts could be an essential component for the market's continued growth, as well as may offer a solution to the emerging industry challenges.

speakers.name: Randall Johnson
speakers.description: Randall is one of the original blockchain regulatory compliance experts, having advised incubators and projects worldwide since 2017.  He helped write the World's first cryto-offering laws for the country of Anguilla, and has advised dozens of important projects on structure, compliance programs and tokenomics.  Randall is a founder in Gaia Labs, Ltd., an important reg-tech focused incubator, and is co-founder of several projects including LiquidEarth, Hover and Landslide.

title: Creating Jurisdictional Mobility:  The Use of Hover Trusts
description: Everyone agrees that the more than 187 country's often vague, conflicting laws is one of the greatest challenges in our industry.  After years of expert research into the problem, I will show you how the use of "Hover Trusts", a new, uniquely scalable international trust platform, allows consumers and project developers the ability, to legally choose the best country and laws to actually govern their crypto assets. Come see why "Jurisdictional Mobility" is so important, and is finally here.

speakers.name: Georgios
speakers.description: Product Manager at ChainSafe with focus on dApp interoperability and bridges.

title: How bridges can improve L2 interoperability
description:
Two of the biggest arguments against L2s are that they are breaking composability and interoperability. DApps are deployed as stand-alone apps in each L2 with limited ability to communicate with each other. This leads to silos and several issues in terms of capital efficiency, governance, security, user experience and maintenance.
We will explore how bridges should become the interoperability layer that will connect all the protocol ‚Äúsilos‚Äù across L2s, by using secure message passing.

speakers.name: Tyler Kell
speakers.description: Tyler Kell is a research engineer at the Initiative for Cryptocurrencies and Contracts (IC3) and Cornell Tech, where he writes academic papers on crypto-related topics, including Miner Extractable Value (MEV), Frontrunning, Digital+Decentralized Identity (DID), Internet Scams, NFTs, and more. Prior to working in cryptocurrency, he worked as a penetration tester/ethical hacker, so securing software is a career passion. In his spare time, he enjoys collecting and trading NFTs.

title: Sybil Resistance in Airdrops & NFT Drops: Architecture Design for Fairness
description:
Airdrops + NFT Drops have sybil resistance problems. Creators want to target audiences that care about their work, but an ecosystem of malicious participants has arisen that targets sybil attacking airdrops for more tokens, and using frontrunning bots to extract rent from normal users minting popular NFTs for resale, like ticket scalpers at music festivals.

In this talk we explore "fairness" in drops, and different architecture designs that solidity developers can use to have fair drops.

speakers.name: Kaan
speakers.description:
Main Developer of the project sourcify.dev 
Ethereum Foundation

title: Human-Friendly Contract Interactions
description:
Web3 users often sign transactions without knowing what they are doing. How can we let them take more informed decisions? Contracts verified on Sourcify (https://sourcify.dev) can be presented with human-friendly information via the ABI and the NatSpec documentation

The talk will explain how it's made possible with "Solidity contract metadata" and how Sourcify's "full verification" works. We'll also touch upon alternative approaches to how to display human-readable tx information to the users

speakers.name: Juan Pablo Salazar H
speakers.description: Abogado, Master en Relaciones Internacionales, certificado en derecho de las ciberoperaciones otorgado por CCDCOE ‚Äì OT√ÅN Taillinn. Lleva m√°s de 12 a√±os de experiencia en Derecho TIC y Regulaci√≥n de tecnolog√≠as emergentes, actualmente es Head Legal & Regulaci√≥n en Ripio, ha trabajado para el Ministerio TIC de Colombia, fue Jefe de Regulaci√≥n de la ANTV, ha sido representante de Colombia con OECD, UNESCO - IRCAI International Research Center of Artificial Intelligence, y en Convenio Budapest.

title: Regulaci√≥n internacional del mundo cripto, realidades y retos. International Regulation on Crypto World, reality and challenges.
description:
¬øRegular o no la cripto?, esa es la cuesti√≥n. En diversos pa√≠ses del mundo se han presentado iniciativas para regular el mundo cripto, de las cu√°les algunas se han convertido en norma vinculante. Sin embargo, el gran reto es regular correctamente sin basarse en el temor o desconocimiento. En el talk se abordar√°n las siguientes tem√°ticas:

- Pa√≠ses que han regulado el mundo cripto o en los que se tramitan iniciativas.
- Principales temas de inter√©s en la regulaci√≥n cripto.

speakers.name: Michalis Kargakis
speakers.description: Pragmatist, Unix philosophist. Interested in decentralized finance and cryptographic protocols.

title: ReFi bites

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: A random set of ideas that can be leveraged to scale climate financing and drive funds towards climate action. None of these ideas have been implemented today in the web3 space and do not exist in any form in the traditional carbon markets as far as is known to the speaker.

speakers.name: Leona Hioki
speakers.description:
The founder of Intmax.
Having been researching the scalability of Ethereum since 2017.
I developed the NFT project (2018) and the financial engineering source code on DeFi (2019) to study the cost of Ethereum from many aspects. In 2021, I posted the idea of Intmax and am working on its development.

title: Intmax ~New trade-offs in L2 achieving both extreme scalability and privacy~
description: Starting in 2021, Intmax discovered a previously unknown tradeoff for the basic configuration of zkRollup, enabling both unprecedented scalability and privacy. The zkRollup protocol, including more sophisticated communication and storage configurations, allows the security of user assets to be separated from the liveliness of the application. This provides smart contract developers with performance similar to cloud services.

speakers.name: Angela Ocando
speakers.description:
√Ångela Ocando is Blockchain School Director at Platzi. 

She is one of the web3 leading women in Latin America, builder of one of the largest blockchain and cryptocurrency learning communities in Spanish.

title: The impact of education in Blockchain Adoption
description:
Blockchain adoption  is more than finance and especulation and the power of education for building new solutions and new technologies builders than can be allow us to use those tools without notice and take advantage to blockchain properties. 

Also, talent and Human Resources that we have in Latinamerica to be builders and protagonist of the region.
tags: All of target audience options. Adoption

speakers.name: Rahul Kothari
speakers.description: Rahul is an engineer at Reddit's crypto team. He previously worked briefly for the Ethereum Foundation and was also a core contributor to Bluesky, the decentralised social media research org by Jack Dorsey. Rahul has worked for multiple blockchain ecosystems and therefore enjoys fiddling with unique blockchain architectures (like those by some L2s). Rahul's current interests are L2s and social tokens. Outside of crypto, Rahul enjoys table tennis, climbing and doing improv!

speakers.name: Nick Dodson
speakers.description:
Building the fastest modular execution layer 
@FuelLabs_

Builder of the only* optimistic rollup on Eth. 

The autonomous future is here.

Prev. #16 @ ConsenSys

speakers.name: Joe Andrews
speakers.description: Cofounder @ aztec

title: New paradigms by non EVM compatible L2s!
description:
As L2s become bigger, several like StarkWare, Aztec and Fuel have built a VM that doesn't resemble the EVM for multiple reasons. 

EVM is great. We love the EVM. But non-EVM based L2s bring about new paradigms, and innovations and expose us to new possibilities that are just not possible on the EVM. These L2s truly are expanding the scope of Ethereum and we should explore these more!

speakers.name: Amitay Bohadana
speakers.description: Im Amitay Bohadana i'm 30 years old. born and raised in Eilat, Israel. served in the army for 3 years as a combat soldier with experience with explosives. also participated in the Israeli Air force Pilot course. I have BSc Software engineering degree. studied in Afeka, Tel-Aviv. was working as a full-stack developer for Mizrahi-tfahot - a large Israeli Bank. while working on the Bank I crossed the lines and started learning solidity. currently working as a Blockchain Developer at Dcentralab.

title: Sarknet L2 solution. how to send message between layers L1 <-> L2
description:
In the workshop generally I will show how to communicate with the L2 Starknet network. I will go step by step on the proccess of creating a ERC20 contract and bridging it to L2.
 I will show then how to withdraw it back to L1. will be also explaining how L2 Validity rollups (also known as ZK rollups) is keeping the security of L1 while make it much more scalable.

speakers.name: Christoph Jentzsch
speakers.description: Christoph is a theoretical physicist, former core-dev of Ethereum (2014/15), co-founder of slock.it, author of TheDAO, business angel and today co-founder and CEO of corpus.ventures. His wealth of experience, vision, and understanding of Ethereum is dedicated to build the next generation of web3 products.

title: The long-tail of Ethereum block space: Strategies to pay less for gas!
description:
EIP1559 optimizes for fast and predictable TX inclusion. But it is less optimal for non-time-critical TX's, such as ETH transfers, staking, and contract deployments.
Based on frequency analysis and controller modeling we show that many users are still systematically overpaying.
Beyond block space demand, the base fee follows well-defined rules (e.g. the 1559 ‚Äúrubber band‚Äù) and statistical patterns. By strategically timing TX users can save costs and contribute to load-balancing Ethereum.

speakers.name: Lenka Hudakova (Lenkla)
speakers.description:
Project lead for initiatives tackled by the Sustainable Ecosystem Scaling team at MakerDAO (X-Ray, Transparency Dashboard, etc.). 
Previously community lead & global events manager at the Maker Foundation. 
Actively onboarding more newbies into crypto (CryptoWomen, ETH/Web3 CPH meetup, event speaking). Supporting DAOs contributors' experience & exploring the field of decentralized HR practices together with People Ops Guild peers & Groundw3rk DAO operators.

speakers.name: Wouter Kampmann
speakers.description: Wouter Kampmann is currently working as team lead of the Sustainable Ecosystem Scaling Core Unit (SES) at MakerDAO. The SES team performs research, analysis, and bootstrapping work on the challenges and solutions for scaling up MakerDAO. Its mission is to remove the barriers between decentralized workforce, capital and work. Previously, Wouter worked as the Head of Engineering at the Maker Foundation.

title: Making two friends with one gift: How our Transparency Dashboard informed better governance and aligned contributor incentives

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: DAOs with long-term ambitions strive toward effectiveness while preserving decentralization & resilience. That requires coordination & transparency. The Transparency Dashboard is conceived out of these needs. Built as OSS by the SES team @MakerDAO, we provide stakeholders with a single interface with information about Maker‚Äôs workforce, capital & work: teams can effectively share information like their progress & budget; governance participants get unified data insights that aid decision-making.

speakers.name: Potuz
speakers.description: I am a professional mathematicial that temporarily happen to be a core developer at prysmaticlabs. I enjoy the types of puzzles that arise when trying to hack the protocol.

title: The right way to hash a Merkle tree
description:
We shill an assembly SHA256 library that is optimized to compute the hash tree root of a Merkle tree. It consists of reusing two publicly available methods:
1. Hardcoding padding block. This method is used in Bitcoin's core client hashing algo. 
2. Use CPU-vectorization to hash different branches in parallell. This is Intel's "multi-buffer" method. 

Initial benchmarks show up to 1200% improvement on hashing of large lists on AVX512. 

A GoAssembly version is used by prysm.

speakers.name: Andrea Novakova
speakers.description: Community Manager at Ackee Blockchain, wannabe surfer & almost professional thief of emojis from other discord servers (jk!)

title: How I accidentally became a Community Manager and now I take care of hundreds of developers
description: Have you ever applied for a job and ended up doing something completely different? I have ..and you know what? It's pretty dope! Every day I'm in direct contact with crypto people and I see how important it is to build a community from within. You probably know what it's like to be part of one, but do you wanna know what it takes to nurture one? Let a woman in STEM share that with you, haha!

speakers.name: Tian-Yuan Zhao
speakers.description:
I'm a mission-driven passionate digital product designer who's highly audacious, tenacious, and vivacious. I care massively about working on products that are, design-driven, exponential-in-nature, and systemically-impactful and thus have been designing various Web2/3 products ever since 2015.

I'm someone who cares deeply, widely, and profoundly about designing a better world by working in foundational layer of human civilization - technology because tech can only solve the problems of tech.

title: Stop "Gas"lighting your Community
description:
In 2019 I had published this article and subsequently claimed 2nd place for Noonies in 2020:
Hackernoon article detailing my thoughts on product-market fit for Web3: bit.ly/2V
Hackernoon article highlighting my Noonie Nomination (and subsequent win): bit.ly/3QRvrLt

Today, I can confidently say I predicted what is & should happen if one intends to build Web3 products for the masses: the criticality of mobile, the renewal of self-sovereign identity, and importance of collectivism.

speakers.name: Sarah Allen
speakers.description: Sarah Allen is the IC3 Research Program Manager, supporting interactions among faculty, students, industry partners, and broader blockchain community. She works to promote collaborative, multidisciplinary blockchain research.

title: IC3 and the Future of Blockchain Academic Research
description: The Initiative for CryptoCurrencies and Contracts (IC3) is an academic blockchain research initiative based at Cornell Tech with academic experts across disciplines and a history of collaboration with Ethereum. In this talk, I will discuss successes of academic Ethereum research, the need for academic expertise in building the Web3 future, open challenges for the community, and the need for new structures for funding and publication that can bridge the gap between academic experts and builders.

speakers.name: Troy
speakers.description: Troy is a security engineer at Trail of Bits that performs code review on smart contracts and blockchains. He also contributes to open source security tooling like Slither.

title: Getting More Out of Static Analysis with Slither's Python API
description: In smart contract audit engagements, it is common practice to run static analysis tools like Slither, but it is more valuable to customize rules for each protocol individually. We will cover how to get the most out of static analysis by using Slither‚Äôs Python API to analyze program properties such as variable dependencies and state inconsistencies. Attendees will walk away knowing how to tailor static analysis to their needs and write high assurance smart contracts.

speakers.name: Santiago Palladino
speakers.description: Santiago, aka Palla, currently leads the Defender development team at OpenZeppelin. He joined the Ethereum space in 2017, has contributed to multiple open source projects, wrote the book "Ethereum for Web Developers", and is also a council member for TheGraph. Before getting into web3, he worked for over 10 years on software development, focusing on disease surveillance and disaster response. He was also a TA at University of Buenos Aires, where he got his Masters in Computer Science.

title: Being a responsible multisig signer (verify, don't trust!)
description:
So you have been trusted with safeguarding a project along with other members of your community, congratulations! But, alas, the first transaction from a developer on the team comes in. How do you proceed? Can you blindly trust the developer? Should you? It's tempting to just see what other multisig members do and roll along, right?

In this talk we'll go over what you can do to verify what a transaction will actually do, and what tools you have at your disposal for this. No coding required!

speakers.name: Harsh Rajat
speakers.description: Harsh Rajat is the Founder and Project Lead at Ethereum Push Notification Service (EPNS). He has over 11 years entrepreneurial experience in various spectrum of tech; including architecting, development and design in different tech fields (Mobile, Web Services, SaaS, Blockchain). Besides this, he is a master of trading using the classic strategy of buying high, selling low.

title: Why Web3 Communication Matters!
description: EPNS is world's first decentralized communication protocol for Web3! Using which any dApps, smart contracts, backends can send communication (starting with on chain / off chain / gasless notifs) tied to user wallet addresses in an open, multichain and platform agnostic fashion. Open communication layer allows any crypto wallet / frontend to tap into the network and get the communication across.

speakers.name: Mario Alves
speakers.description: üëÄ Building the developer economy üöÄ Co-founder & CEO @taikainetwork üíô CEO @bepronet (acquired by TAIKAI)

title: DeSoc: The future of work through a meta protocol
description:
The current platforms are based on centralized reputation systems, which take years to build for both organizations and workers and just apply for that specific platform and not transversely through all existing platforms.
DeSoc and soulbound tokens are the key to unlock this, by allowing the possibility to create a transversal way for reputation systems to be used cross-platforms, leveraging on smart contracts that manage the interactions between organization A and worker B.

speakers.name: norswap
speakers.description: Norswap works for Optimism where he does research & development. He used to work on and teach about compilers. On his spare time he likes to lift weights, watch anime, and research DeFi protocols.
