title: Rollups, Shards & Fractals: The Dream of Atomically Composable Horizontal Scaling
description: Rollups allow blockchain to scale vertically, while preserving their trust properties. But what do we do when we reach the limits of vertical scalability? It might also be desirable to accomodate multiple rollups with different operating rules, virtual machines, or security trade-offs. Horizontal scaling solves these issues, but doesn't allow atomic composability. In this talk, we review approaches to horizontal scalability & ways to get as close to atomic composability as possible.

speakers.name: Justin Holmes
speakers.description: International touring musician; blockchain bluegrass and video game traditionals.

title: Is blockchain tech only for buying drugs?  ...and what's wrong with buying drugs?
description:
Brilliant organizations have positioned themselves on the best side of history for decades in efforts to end drug prohibition and mollify the negative impact it visits upon society, with a non-trivial focus on Colombia.

Blockchain tech seems to be more successful than any of these efforts at the task of providing access to plants and compounds which are unavailable in licit markets.  First, a shallow dive into prohibition and its impact, then: what does this mean for blockchain economics?

speakers.name: Omar Espejel
speakers.description: Machine Learning engineer turned StarkNet Developer Advocate. Leader of the [Spanish](https://twitter.com/StarkNetEs) and Portuguese StarkNet communities. Winner of the Miami Activate X Wormhole Hackathon 2022 thanks to the creation of [functions to provide numerical operations to Cairo](https://twitter.com/galronx/status/1528472289054175232).

speakers.name: Henri
speakers.description: I explain to people what StarkNet is and how they can build cool stuff on top of it

title: StarkNet 101 Workshop - Getting started with unlimited scalability
description: A 2-hour workshop introducing the StarkNet Layer 2 network, how it works, and why it provides scalability to the Ethereum ecosystem. For this, participants will learn how to harness the power of the Cairo programming language and write their first semi-complex smart contract.

speakers.name: Christopher Robison
speakers.description: Founder of meTokens, a personal token protocol. Former Hoard, OMG Network, and Golem Foundation team member. Speaker/contributor at DevCon, NFT.NYC, ETHGlobal, Enterprise Ethereum Alliance, and Ethereum Community Fund events. Host and organizer of the Personal Token Summit. Published one of the first university academic papers on cryptocurrency in 2012-2013.

title: Personal Tokens for Public Goods: Invest in Builders, Not Buildings
description: This presentation strategically explains how personal tokens unlock the continuous and sustained development of public goods. Builders can use them to acquire funding, while investors can use them to achieve an ROI - all without compromising the integrity of what is being built. Additionally, it includes a community call to action: tokenize yourself, and invest in the people who are building public goods.

speakers.name: To√±o Romero
speakers.description:
ETHLima Community Leader
Blockchain enthusiast
Financial Executive with more than 20 years of experience in telcos
Systems Engineering and Finance studies

title: How to build bigger and stronger ETH communities in Latam
description:
We propose to present a panel with representatives of at least five Ethereum communities in Latam in order to review what has been achieved so far, the main challenges they face and the vision they have regarding the future.
From this discussion, the audience will be able to draw conclusions regarding the degree of progress of the different communities, understand the particular difficulties of each country and identify if there is a common vision for Latam.

speakers.name: Rajeev
speakers.description: Founder @TheSecureum (https://twitter.com/0xRajeev)

speakers.name: Mudit Gupta
speakers.description: Mudit is the Chief Information Security Officer at Polygon. He's a security researcher by the day and an ethereum developer by the night.

title: Web3 vs Web2 Security: Same or Different?
description: Web3 security is typically associated with smart contract security. The biggest Web3 hacks have however involved traditional Web2 vulnerabilities and attack vectors. This panel proposes to debate on the similarities and differences between Web3 vs Web2 security with some leaders in this space towards the goal of highlighting the current status, historical lessons from Web2 security and future challenges for a safer Ethereum ecosystem.

speakers.name: qizhou@quarkchain.org
speakers.description: Qi Zhou is the Founder of Web3Q and QuarkChain for future blockchain infra. Before being a full-time Web3 builder, Qi Zhou was a senior software engineer at Facebook, Google, and EMC/Dell, with extensive experience in scalability. Qi Zhou received his Ph.D. degree from the School of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Georgia Tech.

title: Achieving Data Availability via Dynamic Data Sharding with Applications for Large Decentralized KV Store
description: In this talk, we present a dynamic data sharding on Ethereum L2 to address the data availability problem that stores a large amount of data far exceeding the per-node capacity. We apply the dynamic data sharding to a decentralized KV store on top of an Ethereum sidechain, and our early analysis suggests that the cost of storing large values can be reduced to ~1/100x compared to the fully-replicated EVM storage via SSTORE while ensuring tens or hundreds of replicas of the values in the network.

speakers.name: Chris Swenor
speakers.description: Reach CEO Chris Swenor managed technical teams across the globe for over 15 years before leading the blockchain development platform to a $48 million valuation in May of 2021. With multiple exits under his belt, Swenor serves as mentor at Harvard Business School, TechStars, and MassChallenge. Reach has amassed over 6,000 developers as of March, 2022, with many exciting new developments underway.

title: Ethics in DApp development
description: ‚Äã‚ÄãThis presentation will be an excellent overview of the current pitfalls of web3 development and an introduction to a new programming paradigm that is inclusive and accessible. Reach is being used by companies to build decentralized applications and more developers are needed in order to fully realize what decentralized technologies have to offer. This presentation aims to dispel uncertainty and fog around web3 development with down to earth explanations and an easy to understand roadmap

speakers.name: JP Miller
speakers.description: JP is the Director of Learning at Reach, a global web3 company that's making it safe, easy, and secure to build DApps on multiple blockchains. Reach is empowering full stack developers to cross the chasm from web2 centralized, to web3 decentralized development and JP is building the curriculum that's bridging that gap. JP lives in the intersection of technology and education and has a special passion and excitement for the potential of the decentralized internet.

title: Jumping into Blockchain Development with JavaScript
description: You've probably heard of Bitcoin and even Ethereum, you may have heard of hacks worth millions of dollars involving these technologies, as well. What you probably haven't heard of is the high-level programming language that intends to make massive scale web3 hacks of this nature a thing of the past. Reach looks and feels like JavaScript so it's not a great challenge for web2 developers to get up and running and building their own decentralized apps.

speakers.name: Subhash Karri
speakers.description: Co-founder of Questbook

title: Scaling grants operations with the power of community
description: Discuss various operations challenges that are impeding the efficacy of grants and critical analyse these issues. Provide research insights into these issues can be overcome by decentralizing the process using the 'delegated domain allocator' framework.

speakers.name: qizhou@quarkchain.org
speakers.description: Qi Zhou is the Founder of Web3Q and QuarkChain for future blockchain infra. Before being a full-time Web3 builder, Qi Zhou was a senior software engineer at Facebook, Google, and EMC/Dell, with extensive experience in scalability. Qi Zhou received his Ph.D. degree from the School of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Georgia Tech.

title: Introduction to ERC-4804: Web3 URL Standard
description: One key missing part of the current Ethereum stack is the decentralized accessibility layer that allows users to interact with web3 applications directly. In this talk, we present ERC-4804: Web3 URL Standard, which defines HTTP-style web3:// links to locate any on-chain web resources generated by smart contracts. We will give a demo of on-chain NFT generation and further illustrate more complicated applications such as dynamic dweb including dumping and browsing all Vitalik's blogs on-chain.

speakers.name: Ainsley Sutherland
speakers.description: Ainsley is the product lead at DEX Labs, leading R&D contributors to DerivaDEX.

speakers.name: Alex Towle
speakers.description: Alex is the Tech Lead for the Core Infra team at DEX Labs, leading engineering on both smart contracts and the Rust-based L2 system for DerivaDEX. Previously, Alex has worked at 0x protocol and 0x-mesh as a protocol engineer and as a Solidity auditor at Authio. He studied Math and Computer Science at UC Berkeley.

title: Application specific L2s: A scalable design for decentralized derivatives

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: DerivaDEX‚Äôs app-specific L2 uses a network of trusted hardware-enabled operators for computational integrity and throughput. This accessible but technical talk details the system architecture, and how L2 challenges such as checkpointing, data availability, and MEV have been addressed. This novel approach to app-specific L2s offers a compelling alternative to both ‚Äúapp chains‚Äù and existing general-purpose L2s, and benefits enormously from Ethereum‚Äôs security for settlement and governance.

speakers.name: Michal P≈ôevr√°til
speakers.description: Michal is the lead developer of Ethereum tooling at Ackee Blockchain. He has 14 years of experience in development ranging from embedded systems to mobile technologies. Holds a degree in Computer Security from Czech Technical University in Prague. Currently works on providing the best tools for Solidity development and security analysis.

speakers.name: Luk√°≈° B√∂hm
speakers.description: Cyber security student and smart contract hacker

title: Woke: Language server and static analysis for Solidity
description: There are not many good, regularly updated open source tools for Solidity development. The Woke tool implements a language server that allows efficient development and analysis of Solidity code in your IDE. The tool also provides an API that makes it easy to create custom detectors for vulnerabilities and other problems in the code. This workshop will illustrate how to use Woke for static code analysis and will teach  custom detectors through examples.

speakers.name: elgirafo
speakers.description: giraffes are cool

title: A comprehensive protocol for open-source and decentralized service marketplaces
description: The services sector is the largest worldwide by share of global GDP, yet, there is no open protocol for service providers to sell their services on the internet. They mostly depend on intermediaries that take a hefty commission. I believe that now, the components to create a protocol that is decentralized and open-source are here; storage (IPFS), messaging (waku), and execution (Ethereum POS + Gnosis Chain). I will discuss the components, the testing we have done, and the challenges ahead.

speakers.name: Junghyun Colin Kim
speakers.description: Junghyun seeks to build a fast and service-oriented blockchain platform that can improve developer experiences for blockchain developers. He previously worked at Samsung Electronics after receiving a Ph.D in computer science and engineering from Seoul National University where he researched high performance computing with GPGPUs. He is interested in system software, programming models, and virtual machines.

title: A blockchain architecture for Polymorphous EVM-compatible Chains
description: In the future, we can think that there can be many blockchains remained and some of them will support EVM. Even though they support EVM, some features can differ from Ethereum to meet their own needs. Some examples are Klaytn, Avalanche, and Fantom. I anticipate they share Ethereum‚Äôs ecosystem, but they need to have their own ecosystem tools for their own features. In this talk, I want to discuss how we can build such a blockchain architecture to support both ecosystems together.

speakers.name: Adrian Brink
speakers.description: I'm a researcher and engineer working to build decentralized counter-party discovery, solver and state settlement layers. I've done a few things from working on core consensus research and implementation around Tendermint BFT to building and upgrading PoS systems worth way too much. With a couple of friends we built one of the very first PoS companies situated in the Swiss Alps in the world and now I'm working at Heliax for a decentralized future.

title: Intent-centric (intent-solver pattern) architectures for fully decentralized dApps
description: Ethereum provides decentralized, permissionless and censorship-resistant state settlement and dApps make extensive use of that. However most dApps also need counter-party discovery and solving capabilities in order to provide users with interactivity to discover others with whom to trade/settle transactions. This talk proposes an intent-solver pattern and explains how dApps from OpenSea to CowSwap and L2s such as Optimism or Starknet can use it to become truly decentralized.

speakers.name: Stefan Kobrc
speakers.description: Developer with over a decade experience in the blockchain industry specifically. Worked in various industries during his career (government, banking, public transport, real estate, education, etc.) ETH supporter since the days of the ICO and ETH staker since the beacon chains inception.

title: Like a Kindergeburtstag - Ethereum Node in under 3 minutes with Stereum
description: Stereum is a tool to manage the process of setting up & maintaining an Ethereum node for the user with a heavy focus on self sovereignty, privacy and flexibility. With Stereum you are capable of setting a node up in under 3 minutes. Around Bogota we hope to have finished our full release version (currently in beta - https://github.com/stereum-dev/ethereum-node/milestones?state=closed) and would like to talk about the development, the challenges and why a node is valuable infrastrucutre

speakers.name: Stereum Team
speakers.description:
Stereum is a tool to manage the process of setting up & maintaining an Ethereum node for you with a heavy focus on self sovereignty, privacy and flexibility. Stereum is actively developed by the RockLogic GmbH, who first started to develop on its predecessor in 2019.

Stereum aims to be the most flexible way to leverage your Ethereum node for staking, data science, development or your own personal use case. We hope to explore every hermit‚Äôs dream with you!

title: Stereum Workshop - No more headaches for a full functioning Ethereum node
description: Stereum is a tool to manage the process of setting up & maintaining an Ethereum node for you with a heavy focus on self sovereignty, privacy and flexibility. In this workshop we will to surprise you how easy it is to go from nothing to a full functioning (staking) node. Additionally we would like to discuss how to use your node with Stereum for dApps & what other protocols (like SSV) you could use.

speakers.name: Awa Sun Yin
speakers.description: I used to work for surveillance capitalism, now I work on goods for the public.

title: An architecture for user-defined markets
description: Anoma is an intent-centric, privacy-preserving protocol for counterparty discovery. Its design enables programmable intents (as expressive as needed) & decentralized counterpart discovery, which can help decentralize modern dapps on Ethereum, from marketplaces to PGF mechanisms like QV/QF. Unlike most dapps, where there needs to be a pre-existing protocol or set of smart contracts, on Anoma users can directly create a market for whatever assets, logic, and conditions by programming intents.

speakers.name: Thomas Barker
speakers.description:
Entering Fintech middle age. Freelance, and doing lots at @mattereum this year. Most of my career has been spent building mid-tier software for early growth start-ups. Very interested in using web3 for real-world useful things, talk to me about carbon credits and W3C Verifiable Credentials. Never got into the speculation, so having fun staying poor :)

Devcon attendee since No. 1 in London!

title: Carbon in Chains: Putting Carbon Credit Markets in a Web3 Context
description:
I‚Äôd like to give an overview of the carbon markets and their emerging presence in web3.

In outline:
* Types of credits
* Buyer & seller motivations
* Market actors: Registries, brokers, etc.
* How web3 comes in
* Wider structural issues in the carbon markets, and how ReFi can help.

speakers.name: Thomas Barker
speakers.description:
Entering Fintech middle age. Freelance, and doing lots at @mattereum this year. Most of my career has been spent building mid-tier software for early growth start-ups. Very interested in using web3 for real-world useful things, talk to me about carbon credits and W3C Verifiable Credentials. Never got into the speculation, so having fun staying poor :)

Devcon attendee since No. 1 in London!

title: Five Devcons in Five Minutes
description: A humorous, yet informative, whistle-stop tour of our conference, with focus on the changing demographics and social themes of our favourite week of the year!

speakers.name: Satyam Agrawal
speakers.description: Satyam has been working as a professional software developer since 2016, working extensively in the web3 world since then, highly focused on building financial products from the ground up and smart contract security. He collaborated with many web3 projects namely Element Finance, Polymath Network, Maple Finance, Ethereum Foundation etc.

title: The Magic of weiroll and its curses
description:
As Ethereum reaches the masses, we need more smart contracts (SC) to facilitate the interaction with Defi products. Development of SC comes with a lot of operational overheads like auditing, finding the right engineer etc. So to minimize it I present a solution called Weiroll, which is a simple and efficient operation-chaining/scripting language for the EVM.

- Introduction to weiroll ecosystem.
- Discuss its magic i.e godspeed SC development. 
- Safety measures one should take.

speakers.name: Thomas Barker
speakers.description:
Entering Fintech middle age. Freelance, and doing lots at @mattereum this year. Most of my career has been spent building mid-tier software for early growth start-ups. Very interested in using web3 for real-world useful things, talk to me about carbon credits and W3C Verifiable Credentials. Never got into the speculation, so having fun staying poor :)

Devcon attendee since No. 1 in London!

title: Digital Signatures and the Real World
description: Learn about how the law manages digital signatures on this whistle-stop tour. The difference between Electronic and Digital signatures. EU vs US recognition. The joy of PKI, and what is a UNCITRAL model law anyway?

speakers.name: Satyam Agrawal
speakers.description: Satyam has been working as a professional software developer since 2016, working extensively in the web3 world since then, highly focused on building financial products from the ground up and smart contract security. He collaborated with many web3 projects namely Element Finance, Polymath Network, Maple Finance, Ethereum Foundation etc.

title: Do and Don't of launching a NFT project
description: NFT proliferation is inevitable, There adoption is increasing day by day so a lot of questions in collectors' and creators' minds related to which NFTs are safe, How to launch an NFT project etc. This talk will address what are tools and tips a creator can use to readily launch an NFT project on the other hand what are the ways the collectors differentiate between a real genuine valued NFT project & a hyped fishy project.

speakers.name: Eli Ben-Sasson
speakers.description:
Eli is a co-founder and president of StarkWare, and Chairman of its Board of Directors.

He has been researching cryptographic and zero knowledge proofs of computational integrity ever since he received his Phd in Theoretical Computer Science in 2001.

title: Recursion - increasing throughput, speed and efficiency
description:
Recursion is the next step in taking rollups to new levels of throughput, speed and efficiency.
How? With STARKs we can generate a proof that attests to the correctness of large computations. With recursion, we can prove several proofs, each one attesting to the correctness of a large computation.

speakers.name: Heiko Burkhardt
speakers.description: Heiko is an information engineering and management graduate working as a blockchain developer for 5 years.

title: ENS Mail - Decentralized, secure and open messaging protocol
description:
ENS Mail is a protocol enabling decentralized, open, and secure messaging based on established web3 services like ENS and IPFS. It doesn't rely on any central service. The user has complete control over where their messaging data is stored. By using ENS names and ENS text records as the registry for public keys, the user owns the identity linked to their messages.
ENS Mail comes with a reference implementation for a standalone web application, a widget, and a delivery service.

speakers.name: Emily C Williams
speakers.description:
Having studied economics, I became obsessed with the idea of resilient , localized, "bottom-up" systems which are few and far between. I was instantly drawn to bitcoin as a peer-to-peer currency, and even more excited when I learned about Ethereum which could address many generalized use-cases.

I've been smart contract developer for about 4 years and currently work at Uniswap helping with core protocol. I'm excited to continue striving to uphold core principles.

title: A Technical Talk on Keeping NFT's Decentralized
description:
The explosion of art NFTs has been amazing for the blockchain space but it has also fostered an environment that sacrifices many values that blockchains promised, since art and metadata are often centrally stored off-chain.

NFTs can be decentralized by putting metadata directly on-chain or using other protocols such as IPFS or Arweave. We'll cover in technical detail the how and why regarding the importance of truly decentralized NFTs.

speakers.name: Tim Boeckmann
speakers.description: Tim Boeckmann is the CEO and cofounder of Mailchain.com, a decentralised, private communications protocol, offering self-sovereign data and identity ownership.

title: Humanity deserves better communication tools
description:
Society needs better communication tools. It needs to move away from predatory privacy violations and censorship.

Web3 identities, decentralised storage, and a new set of tools offer ways to reinvent online communication for a more equitable humanity.

We'll discuss on-chain and off-chain communications, and how data privacy, censorship resistance, and public goods can be achieved with a sustainable economic model using ethereum (L1s and L2s), ENS, and IPFS.

speakers.name: Ivo Georgiev
speakers.description:
I've been coding since 10yo, in that time I've went through multiple things: I started with game dev, then switched to systems: I made my own Linux distribution at the age of 15, focused on improving the Linux UX: it peaked at p9 on distrowatch.

I cofounded a media center that grew to >25m users (Stremio)

More recently I've taken on a quest to combine all my skills, namely UX, security and smart contracts, to push the crypto UX forward in the form of a next-gen smart wallet, ambire.com

title: How to sell your wallet as an NFT
description:
Up until now, you couldn‚Äôt just sell a wallet. Why wouldn‚Äôt the buyer trust you that you deleted the private key? 

But what if you could? Thanks to smart wallets, you can convert a wallet address to a NFT and list it on Opensea

Why would you do it? Transferring anything untransferrable, for example soulbound tokens - is one reason‚Ä¶ but there are other too

speakers.name: nugaon
speakers.description: Fighting for free speech and free information flow.

title: The unstoppable dApp layer of the World Computer

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
DApps should be fully serverless, uncensorable, cheap to maintain, trustable and users should possess the data produced by dApps that are interoperable between other dApps.
The required components for these rely on many technical aspects such as metadata structure and its validation, web browser security and its API or common registry of dApps. Some of the technical solutions will be presented but the goal is to invite the community into a common discussion and collaboration.

speakers.name: Sam MacPherson
speakers.description: Sam joined crypto during the 2017 bull run as a hobby. While looking for interesting projects he came across MakerDAO and was instantly hooked. After being part of the community for 2 years, he joined on as the first DAO smart contracts dev and later joined the Protocol Engineering team full time. Today Sam coordinates with the other DAO mandated actors across technical, business and strategy to grow the Maker ecosystem.

title: Multi-Chain Maker: Lessons Learned from Building dss-bridge
description: Supporting cross-chain communication in the application layer is not trivial. There are many trade offs between complexity, security and trust. This talk is about the lessons learned taking this journey for the Maker protocol.

speakers.name: Armando Kuroda
speakers.description:
Financial Artist, entrepreneur, and investor. Armando has been building Fintech for the last 15 years. From an arcade ATM to a decentralized network of debt collectors. Pioneer the use of alternate data to help create credit profiles in thin file underserved credit markets. Now invests seed along other crypto entrepreneurs.
Passionate about using programable ultra sound money to build the next generation of Financial tools and protocols that can result in a more creative, kind, and free world

title: Creativity is the ultimate colateral.
description: With the advent of DeFi and NFTs in the context of the creators economy- we are now en route to a world where artists and creators can benefit financially from their artistic output. Historically banks take into colateral land and capital. But what happens to those who arent owners of land or have created capital? With the right tools and protocols, the EVM, can help individuals create their own assets (NFTs) and use them as colateral. Since creativity is unlimited- we can always create value.

speakers.name: qizhou@quarkchain.org
speakers.description: Qi Zhou is the Founder of Web3Q and QuarkChain for future blockchain infra. Before being a full-time Web3 builder, Qi Zhou was a senior software engineer at Facebook, Google, and EMC/Dell, with extensive experience in scalability. Qi Zhou received his Ph.D. degree from the School of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Georgia Tech.

title: Mitigating Bridge Attacks via On-Chain Rate-Limiting Smart Contracts
description: Recent huge losses from bridge attacks call for better bridge security in the case of key loss/leakage or API failures. In this talk, we present on-chain rate-limiting algorithms to mitigate the attack losses from the TVL of the bridge to the pre-set rate limits over a time window (e.g., $20M over a day).  We explore several implementations including Consensys simple rate limiting, token bucket rate limiting, and sliding-window-based rate limiting, and discuss the pros and cons of them.

speakers.name: qizhou@quarkchain.org
speakers.description: Qi Zhou is the Founder of Web3Q and QuarkChain for future blockchain infra. Before being a full-time Web3 builder, Qi Zhou was a senior software engineer at Facebook, Google, and EMC/Dell, with extensive experience in scalability. Qi Zhou received his Ph.D. degree from the School of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Georgia Tech.

title: Concentrated Liquidity for Multiple Pooled Assets
description: Uniswap V3 improves liquidity efficiency by concentrating liquidity.  However, it only works for paired-token pools. In this talk, we present concentrating liquidity for multiple tokens in a pool, especially for same-backed assets. We derive the invariant curve and prove that the liquidity can be concentrated in a price range [p, 1/p], p < 1 for any swap in the pool with n, n >= 2 tokens.  Numerical results are conducted to corroborate our findings, and some extensions will be discussed.

speakers.name: Chris
speakers.description: Chris Powers is a contributor to DXdao, where he focuses on governance. He fell into crypto through a previous career in China finance and fell hard for the Ethereum community and DeFi in the 2019 bear market. In addition to his work at DXdao, he also writes the Dose of DeFi newsletter, a weekly roundup for DeFi news since 2019.

title: Soulbound: DXdao's three year history of non-transferrable governance
description:
DXdao launched in June 2019 with reputational-based governance, which means that governance power is associated with a particular Ethereum address and cannot be transferred. Now, we call this "soulbound".

DXdao has a rich on-chain history of non-transferrable governance. Unlike token-dominated DAOs, DXdao's ~25 core contributors have the biggest say in governance, which aligns long-term interests.
This talk will focus on the successes, challenges and pitfalls of non-transferrable governance

speakers.name: Sam Seo
speakers.description: Sam is the Director of Klaytn Foundation, a non-profit organization established to accelerate global adoption and maturity on the Klaytn blockchain, and also Chief Klaytn Officer (CKO) at Krust Universe where he is leading the development and operation of the Klaytn blockchain. He received his B.S. and Ph.D. degrees in computer science from Seoul National University, and has authored numerous papers on parallel programming and high-performance computing.

title: 3-Year Experience on Integrating and Publicly Running PBFT with EVM
description: Practical Byzantine Fault Tolerance (PBFT) consensus algorithm is not generally preferable for public blockchains because of its technical challenges such as limited scalability or liveness issues. However, if these challenges can be overcome, faster blockchains with PBFT can enable more dApps to be realized. In this talk, we will present 3-year experience of developing and running Klaytn, focusing on how we addressed the technical challenges when integrating PBFT to the EVM tech stack.

speakers.name: Rachel Hofstetter
speakers.description: Rachel is the CMO of Hightop, a consumer banking experience powered by DeFi. Previously, she was the Chief Marketing Officer at Chatbooks, where she built the brand and demand strategies that led the company‚Äôs hyper-growth, including double and triple growth years, and brought on millions of customers. Rachel was a magazine editor at titles like O, the Oprah Magazine, and went on to write Cooking Up a Business, a business best-seller from Penguin-Random House.

speakers.name: Mick Hagen
speakers.description: Mick is a developer and entrepreneur. He is currently the CEO and Founder of Hightop, a consumer banking experience powered by DeFi. In 2018, Forbes named Mick one of 3 ‚ÄúTitans bringing crypto to the mainstream‚Äù (along with CZ of Binance and Vitalik himself). Mick is a major contributor to various DAOs in DeFi, including his current role on the multi-sig at SushiSwap. Mick previously founded Mainframe, a decentralized messaging protocol that presented at Devcon 3 in Cancun.

title: Consumer DeFi, NOT CeFi: 3 Principles to Bring DeFi Mainstream
description: How do we bring the next billion people to DeFi and the financial opportunities it unlocks? CeFi was the first attempt at making DeFi available to the masses, but we all saw what happened when the effort, information, and risk was abstracted. We‚Äôre proposing a new model of consumer-friendly DeFi: DeFi Access. This abstracts the effort of DeFi, while still sharing information and risk. We‚Äôll share 3 principles for appealing to mainstream consumers while remaining decentralized.

speakers.name: Kyle Waters
speakers.description: Kyle is a crypto data scientist and researcher at Coin Metrics, a firm specializing in blockchain analytics. He co-authors weekly research notes in Coin Metrics'  State of the Network publication, as well as longer-form content. His research interests include fee market mechanics, on-chain attribution, and thinking up new ways to visualize blockchain networks and their data. He also has written extensively about Ethereum crypto art marketplaces and the intersection of art and tech.

title: Beyond 4 Bytes: Classifying Ethereum Smart Contracts from Compiled Bytecode
description:
Over 50 million smart contracts have been deployed to Ethereum since genesis.
But not much work has been done to classify all contracts ever created using on-chain data.
In this talk, we look at Ethereum smart contracts from the bottom up, starting with the compiled bytecodes. What are the most common contracts and functions? Can we track compiler version usage from on-chain data? How have protocol changes such as EIP-1559 impacted contracts? Can emerging trends be detected using bytecodes?

speakers.name: alphaK3Y
speakers.description:
I am an infrastructure developer at heart building systems for humans.

I want to build things that make humans happy.

I want to write smart contracts that connect worlds.

Plenty of love!

- alphaK3Y

title: Orderbooks And the Future of Decentralized Exchanges
description: AMMs have recently become an extremely popularized model of decentralized exchange due to their low barrier to entry for liquidity providers and the simplicity of the user experience. Despite the improvement on the UX side, we haven't seen continued growth and transition towards DeFi specifically as it relates to token exchange. How can we build an economic model that encourages market makers to transition over to web3 and what tradeoffs will we ultimately make?

speakers.name: Manank Patni
speakers.description:
Manank has been a Blockchain Developer for 4 years and is currently a blockchain developer at Spheron Network. Previously he has worked with Demodyfi, Hacera, Algorand, EPNS, and Hyperledger where he worked on several blockchain products.
He has a good speaker background with several sessions presented at the Hyperledger Global Forum USA 2020 and Open Source Summit Japan 2020 where he shared the work he did with the Hyperledger Cello project.

title: Building Frictionless Dapp Experience for End Users and Devs
description: Navigating through the web3 ecosystem is quite tedious and nuances of multiple moving elements add to the problems of devs and end-users. This talk will take devs through a small journey of picking the right components for their dapp to keep the user experience as simple as possible. It will include how they can provide Web2-like smoothness via better onboarding, Universal identity solutions, gas relayers, improved UI for better utility, and smart contract changes for minimal interaction.

speakers.name: Vinko Kojundzic
speakers.description: Graduated computer science and did MBA at London Business School. Started Cuspis during my MBA and developed it into a software market player in SEE with 4 companies in 4 countries. Separated ownership and management in Jan 2022. With professional management in place, I got my time back so I can totally focus on what I like: new technologies and its use-cases. Never stopped learning. Think that my brain works better now than in my 30s. Experimenting with a blockchain technology since 2018.

title: We still don‚Äô know what we are eating! Solving the food quality problem using Food quality Web3 concept and Web3 site hopping
description:
We are still not sure what is the quality of food that we are buying. How we know when we go to market/Farmer‚Äôs market how this food is grown/transported/stored? We can only read labels, believe in brands or quality assurance standards. We want to be able to see history of specific piece of food. 
Presenting Food Quality Web3 concept: digital identity, smart contracts, API interfaces and Web3 site hopping enabling true decentralisation.

speakers.name: Ross Neilson
speakers.description: PM & developer at DXdao working on building out novel governance platforms, built for DAOs by a DAO

speakers.name: Augusto
speakers.description: Digital nomad form Argentina, working as full stack developer since 2013 and involved in crypto since 2015.

title: How to add governance to an ER20 token with ERC20-Guilds
description:
The workshop will explain how to add a basic, on-chain, L1 or L2, 100% decentralized governance layer over an ERC-20 token using a base ERC20Guilds, after this we will explore different ERC20Guilds implementations with extra features like off-chain signatures, anonymous voting, conviction voting, safeguard mechanisms, multi signatures, etc.
At the end of the presentation we will discuss and brainstorm more features and how they can be implemented, witting code live with the attendees.

speakers.name: qizhou@quarkchain.org
speakers.description: Qi Zhou is the Founder of Web3Q and QuarkChain for future blockchain infra. Before being a full-time Web3 builder, Qi Zhou was a senior software engineer at Facebook, Google, and EMC/Dell, with extensive experience in scalability. Qi Zhou received his Ph.D. degree from the School of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Georgia Tech.

title: Creating Dynamic Decentralized Websites with Smart Contracts
description: Current decentralized websites (dWebs) mainly use IPFS/AR to store static content with limited capabilities. In this workshop, we will give a tutorial on creating dynamic dWebs with smart contracts including creating a dHomepage in a few minutes with ERC-5018 Filesystem-like smart contracts. We will further dump Vitalik's blog on smart contracts and access them in a decentralized way using web3:// links defined by ERC-4804.  Advanced applications such as dBlog with comments will be discussed.

speakers.name: dan
speakers.description: Dan started his career in investment banking where he realized how the traditional finance system was broken. He moved to the startup space building a company in the education and SaaS space and when Ethereum and DeFi started to get traction he started to contribute to DeFi projects in the derivative space. He recently founded rysk finance, a DeFi derivative protocol with a focus on uncorrelated returns. He makes wine in his spare time.

title: DeFi Derivatives: The Good, The Bad And The Ugly
description: Derivatives are a critical instrument for a mature financial system but are also very controversial. The current DeFi derivative space is composed of a ‚Äútrio‚Äù of participants: The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly. Like in the Sergio Leone movie, the trio is a critical part of the system and the goal of the talk is to analyze those actors and their needs in order to build and innovate the DeFi derivative space achieving the good, learning from the bad, and focusing on the ugly.

speakers.name: Augusto
speakers.description: Digital nomad form Argentina, working as full stack developer since 2013 and involved in crypto since 2015.

speakers.name: John Kelleher
speakers.description: Coordinating technical efforts at DXdao.  Working full time building product teams and developing products on Ethereum since 2017.

title: A DAO that should have failed, but it didnt
description:
On 2019 a new DAO was launched by gnosis with the goal to govern DutchX platform, the problem was that DutchX never succeeded and never gained adoption so this DAO ended with a small amount of funds that were used to do a token fundraising, in May 2020 it raised 25,000 ETH just before ETH prices skyrocketed.

What does a small dao with 25K ETH in beginning of a bull market does? The same DAO that a year ago was dead?

speakers.name: Matthias Geihs
speakers.description: Matthias currently leads the development of the Perun State Channels project. Before, he worked as an IT Security Specialist in the financial services industry. He holds a PhD in cryptography and computer security from TU Darmstadt for his work on the theoretical foundations and the system design of long-term secure digital archiving systems.

title: Building State Channels for Ethereum, Cosmos, Polkadot, the Internet Computer, and Cardano
description: The Perun state channel project is one of the oldest state channel projects out there. When we started building our library, we designed it with an abstraction layer that would make it work for different kinds of blockchains. 2 years later, we are realizing the potential of this blockchain-agnostic design and have built and are building backends for Ethereum, Cosmos, Polkadot, the Internet Computer, and Cardano. In this talk we want to share the experience of working with the different networks.

speakers.name: Eseoghene Mentie
speakers.description: Eseoghene's passion for identity can be traced back to my consulting days, where she spent significant time traveling as a Nigerian and having to deal with all the issues surrounding travelling for work. This led to her work in web3, specifically on identity mobile app uport.me and serto.id. As the head of engineering at Disco, she specialises in SSI, privacy, reputation, and implementing engineering best practices and processes.

title: How To leverage rich user data in your dApp ‚Äì representing humans as themselves.
description: With non-financial data not as easily available and public in the metaverse, how can dApps create interactions and experiences based on these types of data, while preserving their user‚Äôs privacy? Use Disco's tooling to display and allow users share information about themselves. The challenge? It's hard to integrate unfamiliar tooling. Good news is it's easy for any dApp dev to to leverage rich user data by using Disco's tooling so you can perform dependant actions and reward engagement.

speakers.name: Klaus Kursawe
speakers.description: Klaus has first started working on Byzantine Consensus during his PhD in 1998, where he build a fully asynchronous consensus layer. He then explored and published in other areas of digital security including secure hardware, privacy preserving technologies, and security for critical infrastructures, before returning to further work on Byzantine fault tolerance. He currently works for Vega protocol.

title: Beyond Stake: Implementing diversity policies on PoS
description: We look at the challenges of implementing various diversity-improving policies on a PoS network. Economic (dis)incentivization is a popular approach, but can be undermined by non-standard miner economics such as (cross-domain) MEV or derivatives on incentivization. As an alternative, we outline an approach to include diversity support into the consensus level without requiring changing the basic functionality of the protocol by adapting the concept of general adversary structures.

speakers.name: Jolene Dunne
speakers.description: Researcher @ Flashbots

title: Improving PBS: Lessons learned from mev-boost and Builder API
description: PBS is a major change to the core Ethereum protocol. It attempts to minimise negative effects of MEV by delegating block building to a market of block builders, via the builder API. This talk would cover what we have learned from the rollout of mev-boost, focusing on what the real-world builder dynamics look like, and what this means for in-protocol PBS. What are the main improvements that we can make to the PBS design in response to how mev-boost is performing?

speakers.name: Robert Zaremba
speakers.description: Robert Zaremba is an agile Software Engineer, Solution Architect and Entrepreneur. He is working for international companies, funding startups and is developing Internet of Blockchain. Robert is a genuine strategist, leader and executive advisor. Since 2016 Robert has been building blockchain projects full time. https://zaremba.ch/

title: Regenerative Finance

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
We will go through various ReFi protocols and define common structures as well as try to explore new initiatives making our world finances more sustainable.
We will analyze the household social-ecological pyramid: framework proposed by Easdale and L√≥pez (2016) to analyze the Social-Ecological Systems. 
Our goal is to research how we can improve existing DeFi protocols to make them ESG reach.

speakers.name: Sasha Pitkevich
speakers.description: Sasha is the Blockchain Professionals community (https://wearecommunity.io/communities/blockchain) lead, evangelist and business and solution architect. Fascinated by the power of the decentralized approach Sasha had quickly become an ambassador of the technology focusing on the adoption topics. Sasha have spent 7 years leading blockchain capabilities first at Accenture then seeking for more public solutions build possibilities she had moved to EPAM where she leads the Blockchain business.

title: User-driven frontend decentralization. Why we need crypto-browsers.
description:
The usual understanding of Web3 neither targets the UI/UX layer in its decentralization efforts nor considers the end user as an actor behind the decentralization. 
We will talk about frontend decentralization enforced by users (instead of an owner based one) as the necessary requirement for the success of Web3. 
We point out the minimal requirements for a community based crypto-browser, and call for cooperation to implement it.

speakers.name: Sky
speakers.description: Sky Minert is a full-time DAOist, highly focused on DAO2DAO relations and seeking out and supporting projects that are building what proper DAOs need to function in a truly decentralized manner. His focus is often on bizdev, partnerships, operations and governance.  You can find him around the MetaCartel, DXdao, DAOhaus, DiamondDAO, Logos DAO communities and more.

title: How DAOs Can Use Results-Based Community Incentive Tools to Achieve Goals
description: I would like to share with interested audience members some of the new tools and methods that are available to DAOs and communities using built in crypto-economic incentives to achieve community goals.  There is also a tie in to using these tools to create better alignment in the public goods space.

speakers.name: qizhou@quarkchain.org
speakers.description: Qi Zhou is the Founder of Web3Q and QuarkChain for future blockchain infra. Before being a full-time Web3 builder, Qi Zhou was a senior software engineer at Facebook, Google, and EMC/Dell, with extensive experience in scalability. Qi Zhou received his Ph.D. degree from the School of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Georgia Tech.

title: Cross-L2 Bridge - Hashed Timelock Contract vs Delayed-Proved Timelock Contract

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Transferring the assets from one OR to another generally involves a 7-day challenge time, which is long.  In this talk, we will discuss several solutions to address the issues without introducing the trust of 3rd parties. The hashed timelock contract (HTLC) can offer almost instant transfer, however, requires two user transactions per transfer. To reduce user interactions, we will illustrate the delayed-proved timelock contract (DPTLC) recently by proposed Vitalik and discuss the pros and cons.

speakers.name: crypto@antonela.me
speakers.description:
Antonela is a product design lead practicing ethical user research and open, human-centered, participatory design. She is interested in critical internet infrastructure, security, privacy, open-source communities, and feminism as an intersectional practice.  Currently, she is bringing usable security to the decentralized identity manager, MetaMask. Before, she led the User Experience team at The Tor Project. 
Between 2012‚Äî20, she has been wandering all over the world, living a nomad life.

speakers.name: Omna Toshniwal
speakers.description: Designer turned Product Manager. Lead of MetaMask mobile. Here to build towards a more equitable society.

title: Wallet UX: the dance of usability & security
description:
How do you design for a wallet that'll onboard the next billion users to web3? 

This talk gives an insider view to the UX philosophy and practices at MetaMask, and how it has evolved over the last years. Design decisions define the experience of 10s of millions of users. With examples, we'll share the trade-offs we make, and systems we are developing to build a wallet that is accessible to the next wave of users incoming to web3.

speakers.name: Jorge Arce-Garro
speakers.description: I am a blockchain and cryptography researcher from Costa Rica, currently working at Nethermind. I look into all kinds of tools related to Ethereum scalability questions, such as layer 2s, liquid staking, and zero-knowledge proofs. Besides Ethereum, I am working on a PhD in mathematical physics at the University of Michigan.  In my free time I enjoy memes and dancing.

title: Shamir Secret Sharing with no ID numbers!
description:
Recall that, when splitting a seedphrase via Shamir Secret Sharing into n shares, each share is numbered (from 1 to n). These ID numbers are necessary for reconstruction‚Äîif they are lost, reconstruction may be impossible or require brute force.

We will quickly review Shamir Secret Sharing and show a trick that can be used to encode the ID numbers into each share for BIP-39 compliant seeds, so that users only need to store the share mnemonic.

speakers.name: Butian Li
speakers.description: Co-founder of Blockless; Former COO at Wabi, worked at NGC Ventures, Lightspeed; B.S. Engineering, UC Berkeley, Wharton MBA

title: Decouple blockchain and decentralization

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Ever since the birth of Ethereum, a rich tapestry of alternative blockchains has expanded throughout the Web3 ecosystem. That said, the technical infrastructure of many blockchains, while publicly verifiable and open-source, are designed as closed ecosystems. As such, blockchain as technology alone cannot support multi-layered services that require resources outside of the blockchain ledger. Decentralization-as-a-service will empower next-gen dApps that cannot be built solely on a blockchain.

speakers.name: Omna Toshniwal
speakers.description: Designer turned Product Manager. Lead of MetaMask mobile. Here to build towards a more equitable society.

title: Build to drive diversity & profit equally
description: What investigating organic MetaMask adoption in the emerging markets taught us. In this talk we'll share lessons from our UX research studies, and steps we are taking in product development to increase equal access to the opportunities brought by web3.

speakers.name: Karen Scarbrough
speakers.description: I lead an enterprise blockchain group that focuses on building applications for future. I also co-host the Houston Ethereum meetup.

title: Speaking of Legitimacy: Coordinating with the World Outside of Ethereum
description: In March 2021, Vitalik published "The Most Important Scarce Resource is Legitimacy" detailing the ways legitimacy may obtained in society. Though much of last few years was driven by hype, the growth in legitimacy of the ecosystem is more compelling. Communicating this legitimacy is an underrated tool in growing Ethereum with external parties. In this talk, I'll go through different narratives backed with data, without overpromising that can help in communicating legitimacy to the skeptical.

speakers.name: Kevin Jeong
speakers.description:
2020~2021
- Development of a virtual machine based on a universal zero-knowledge proof circuit
- Zero-knowledge proof blockchain core development, smart contract development
2019~2020
- Blockchain PoC Construction / Smart Contract Development / Enterprise Blockchain Development
2017
- Seoul Ethereum Meetup, Co-organizer
- Onther, Chief Executive Officer (~present)
2016
- University of Southern California
- Research Area: Software Project Management and Big Data

speakers.name: Suah Kim
speakers.description: Suah Kim is a senior researcher @ Onther.inc. Prior to that, he was a research professor @ Department of Information Security,  School of Cybersecurity, Korea University.

title: TONStarter: a new scalable liquidity provider incentive model for launchpads
description:
We present a new scalable liquidity provider incentive model called user owned liquidity (UOL) where the incentive is in the form of a discount for bonding (a mechanism proposed by Olympus DAO).

Under the proposed model, the liquidity provider has to invest in the launchpad to utilize the earned incentive, which deters mercenary liquidity while creating a positive synergy to encourage users to use the launchpad platform.

speakers.name: Thomas Vieira
speakers.description: Thomas Vieira has been designing, building, and testing human-centered software for most of his life. He has a passion for onboarding people to new technology that solves their needs in ways just now becoming possible. In addition to developing software and leading product efforts, Thomas composes classical music in his early mornings and late evenings.

title: Cheatcodes I Have Known And Loved
description:
# Cheatcodes I Have Known And Loved
better smart contract testing with Foundry

## Who's it for
Solidity devs

## What's it for
Inspire and better equip the audience to write excellent test suites

## Program
1. Why test
2. Inefficiencies w/ standard test practices
3. Techniques
    1. Forge Basics
    2. Assertions (eg, expectEmit, expectRevert, custom)
    3. Manipulating EVM state (eg, warp, prank, hoax, etch, forking)
    4. Gas Golf
    5. Fuzz/Invar/Symb
3. Where to + Q&A

speakers.name: Billy Luedtke
speakers.description:
Senior Token Mechanism Engineer @ ConsenSys; Founder @ Intuition; 
Previously: Enterprise Lead @ uPort; Co-Chair @ EEA Digital Identity Working Group; Founder @ RAPID; Developer Relations Lead @ ConsenSys; Steward @ One Million Developers; Senior Technology Advisor @ EY Blockchain

title: Intuition | Improving our intuition through cryptoeconomic technologies
description: As our global society ushers us into interacting with an exponentially increasing number of things, our intuition in each of our interactions becomes increasingly dissipated. Because we are no longer intimately familiar with the things we are interacting with, we supplement with social-enabled technologies to better understand the world around us and gain intuition in our interactions. Intuition (the protocol) seeks to enhance the world's intuition through a system of cryptoeconomic mechanics.

speakers.name: Sasha Pitkevich
speakers.description: Sasha is the Blockchain Professionals community (https://wearecommunity.io/communities/blockchain) lead, evangelist and business and solution architect. Fascinated by the power of the decentralized approach Sasha had quickly become an ambassador of the technology focusing on the adoption topics. Sasha have spent 7 years leading blockchain capabilities first at Accenture then seeking for more public solutions build possibilities she had moved to EPAM where she leads the Blockchain business.

speakers.name: Ethernian
speakers.description:
before Ethereum: more than 20 years in IT as a developer / architect.
after Ethereum: Developer and Founder of Dapplets Project - The Home of Augmented Web.
https://dapplets.org

title: Augmented web3: Tokenization of existing legacy ecosystems (Github, NPM etc)
description:
Augmented Web enables and installs cryptoeconomics on top of existing legacy communities and ecosystems without having to ask its stakeholders for permission.
In this workshop we will debelop an example of such an economy installed above the GitHub. 
We go into details about how the enabled cryptoeconomy boosts existing GitHub workflows and how it revitalizes stagnated ones.
Further we go on to discuss how to apply this pattern to other legacy ecosystems.

speakers.name: Nicolas Riquelme
speakers.description: Historian, programmer wanabe, building stuff on web3

title: Chainbridge SDK for fun and profit
description: Communication between networks is vital for the multichain future. However, until now, building Dapps that can communicate between networks requires a non-trivial infrastructure, as well as enough code to be able to transfer assets or messages from one point to another. In this workshop we want to show how by using chainbridge-sdk and chainbridge-hub, developers can build Dapps that are cross-chain without having to think too much about the infrastructure that's behind it

speakers.name: Ryan
speakers.description: Hi all, I'm Ryan. I'm a builder, tinkerer, thinker (ideally in reverse order!) Co-founder of NauFinance, ex-Chainlink Engineer, and alumni of Cornell Tech. I love all things DeFi, NFTs, and promoting financial opportunity.

title: Crowdfunding: The Future of Non-Fungible Economics
description: NFT collateralized lending need a paradigm shift. Much of fungible DeFi today is accessible regardless of one's wealth. Want to yield farm with $100 USDC? Be my guest. Existing NFT-backed lending protocols, however, unfairly favor the wealthy. Such protocols provide no mechanism for smaller lenders to combine forces and compete together, leaving lending power more centralized. The future of NFT lending will be open to savings accounts of all sizes by coordinating crowdfunded loans.

speakers.name: Long Long
speakers.description: tbc later

title: Crypto marketing or marketing in the crypto world
description:
1. Tactics used by crypto marketing 
2. Product sells itself? 
3. Crypto world and its marketing

speakers.name: Mikhail Dobrokhvalov
speakers.description: Blockchain developer with 10+ years of experience in software development. Before discovering Ethereum in early 2017, launched a food delivery service and scaled a large e-commerce website. Currently focused on the adoption of NFTs in real life as a technical co-founder of Linkdrop.

title: Bringing NFTs to physical items
description:
In this talk I would like to describe and compare different approaches to bridging NFTs and physical items. 

Talk outline:
1. What does it really mean "bring NFTs to physical items"? 
2. Why would we want to do that?
3. Current approaches (IYK/Poap/Kong Cash/ Linkdrop): QR codes vs  NFC tags
4. Our experience and key learnings 
5. Closing thoughts

speakers.name: Hart Lambur
speakers.description:
Hart is the Co-Founder of Risk Labs, the foundation supporting the UMA and Across protocols. UMA is an optimistic oracle (OO) that can provide and verify arbitrary data on-chain. Across is a cross-chain bridge that is secured by UMA's optimistic oracle.

Hart studied computer science before working as an interest rate trader at Goldman Sachs through the financial crisis. In 2013. He now leads a team of researchers at Risk Labs.

title: Multisigs are bad! Replacing the risks of multisigs with permissionless ‚Äúoptimistic execution‚Äù
description: Multisigs are a major point of centralization for many crypto systems. This talk highlights the risks multisigs pose to web3 and presents an alternative: ‚Äúoptimistic execution‚Äù. Optimistic execution allows _anyone_ to optimistically propose a transaction; the transaction is executed if no one disputes it. Provided there is a single honest watcher, this mechanism offers a trustless and decentralized alternative to X-of-N multisigs.

speakers.name: Hart Lambur
speakers.description:
Hart is the Co-Founder of Risk Labs, the foundation supporting the UMA and Across protocols. UMA is an optimistic oracle (OO) that can provide and verify arbitrary data on-chain. Across is a cross-chain bridge that is secured by UMA's optimistic oracle.

Hart studied computer science before working as an interest rate trader at Goldman Sachs through the financial crisis. In 2013. He now leads a team of researchers at Risk Labs.

title: Battle of the bridges: Untangling the tradeoffs of various bridge designs
description: This panel invites 4 of the leading bridge protocols to debate the various tradeoffs that have emerged between different cross chain bridge designs, including pros and cons, and security considerations. Panelists include the founders of Across (Hart Lambur), Hop (Chris Whinfrey), Nomad (Arjun Bhuptani), and Stargate (Bryan Pellegrino).

speakers.name: Kristen Cabrera
speakers.description: I'm a web developer based in New York City. I have experience at startups in Buenos Aires, Copenhagen, and NYC. I'm currently engineering @ Foundation. Before that, I was at The Wall Street Journal. I'm trilingual in English, Spanish, & Portuguese. In my free time, I like to code websites that reflect my interests in design & pop culture.

title: Accessibility in Web3
description: Web3 is the promise of decentralized power and a better internet. For people with disabilities, technology makes things possible, yet the barrier to participation is high. For Ethereum decentralized applications, it‚Äôs up to designers, builders, and contributors to practice accessibility in their work. These applications are a product of our creation and, much like algorithms, they can be biased. It‚Äôs up to us to push web3 forward by leading through inclusivity.

speakers.name: Shogo Ochiai
speakers.description: Solidity, Rollups, DAO for Nation

title: How to make your nation DAO in a permissionless way.
description:
Human coordination is the beloved usage of public blockchain and why not we use it for it!

# Summary
- DAO with 1-person-1-ballot democracy is so underrated.
- Mobocracy is solvable via VRF randao... the deliberative democracy!
- On-chain legislation is effective in many ways... even DeFi-native public bond and treasury yielding!
- How to adopt it, mass-resignation of politicians? - No, super convenient PTA/HOA app and the micro-public mesh network tells how the nation must be.

speakers.name: Junghee Lee
speakers.description: Dr. Junghee Lee received his B.S. and M.S. degrees in Computer Engineering from Seoul National University in 2000 and 2003, respectively, and his Ph.D degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering from Georgia Institute of Technology in 2013. He is currently with the School of Cybersecurity of Korea University as an assistant/associate professor since 2019. He is also with GnomeLab as a CTO since 2022. His expertise includes blockchain, system security, and computer architecture.

title: GnomePad: Secure Crypto Finance Pad
description: The hardware wallet is known to be the most secure way to keep the crypto asset. However, it needs to be connected to a software wallet to make transactions. Especially, to use DeFi, NFT, and Web3 services, they need to be connected more frequently. GnomePad is a dedicated tablet device where only pre-installed apps can be executed. With other advanced security features, GnomePad offers comparable security to hardware wallets while making transactions.

speakers.description:
2020~2021

title: layer2 aggregation for dapps' need.
description: Tokamak Network supports Dapp to use Layer2 comfortably. It's not only to support layer2 solution, but also to support ecosystem for dapp in layer2. dapp project can be launched on Tokamak Network's launchpad platform(TONStarter), and we're planning to support dapp by providing layer2 specialized for dapp and providing verifier pools for optimistic rollup.

speakers.name: Lawrence Gosset
speakers.description: I am a full-stack software engineer currently working in the web3 space building tools for creators. I like to wear as many hats as possible, slipping into whatever role is required to build great products.

title: Decentralizing your design system
description:
Since launching, Foundation‚Äôs approach to design has allowed us to onboard millions of creators and collectors into the NFT space. Now, developers everywhere will be able to leverage the thoughtfulness of our design via FoundationKit ‚Äî a crystallization of our design thinking in the form of a plug-and-play library of UI components.

In this talk, I‚Äôll walk you through the journey of architecting the Foundation design system, and how we‚Äôre making it open and accessible to developers everywhere.

speakers.name: Collin Myers
speakers.description: Collin is the co-founder & CEO of Obol Labs, a R&D-focused team developing a protocol for trust-minimized staking. Before Obol, Collin led global product strategy at ConsenSys and was the global head of BD at Token Foundry.

speakers.name: Ois√≠n Kyne
speakers.description: Co-founder of Obol Labs and building Distributed Validator Technology for Ethereum.

title: How to create a Distributed Validator Cluster for Ethereum
description:
Create a Distributed Validator Cluster with other workshop attendees! Learn about Distributed Validator Technology(DVT) by creating a validator with a group of peers to mitigate the problem of single-point of failure in Ethereum Staking.

This workshop will walk you through a [Distributed Validator Key Generation Ceremony](https://docs.obol.tech/docs/dvk/distributed-validator-keys) & setting up of your [Distributed Validator nodes](https://docs.obol.tech/docs/dv/introducing-charon).

speakers.name: Thy-Diep Ta (‚ÄúYip‚Äù)
speakers.description: Yip is cofounder at Unit Network, a leading full-fledged DAO builder for the token economy. She has founded Unit Masters, the signature free blockchain literacy program that has trained several thousand pioneers across the globe in Web3 Fundamentals. She is a governor at H.E.R. Dao and co-founder at DLT Talents, both providing scholarships to hundreds of women to enter the blockchain economy.   Yip has received several recognitions for her work in closing the gender equitability gap

title: The Power of Mindfulness - How to keep the calm when it burns?
description:
How do you keep the calm mind in an extremely challenging world of fast pace innovation coupled with daily volatility? 

Attend this workshop to learn the basics to  keep focus, distinguish signal from noise and most importantly - identify how to lighten up the inner flame when it needs to shine.

speakers.name: Kevin Jeong
speakers.description:
2020~2021
- Development of a virtual machine based on a universal zero-knowledge proof circuit
- Zero-knowledge proof blockchain core development, smart contract development
2019~2020
- Blockchain PoC Construction / Smart Contract Development / Enterprise Blockchain Development
2017

title: layer2 aggregation for dapps' need.
description: Tokamak Network supports Dapp to use Layer2 comfortably. It's not only to support layer2 solution, but also to support ecosystem for dapp in layer2. dapp project can be launched on Tokamak Network's launchpad platform(TONStarter), and we're planning to support dapp by providing layer2 specialized for dapp and providing verifier pools for optimistic rollup.

speakers.name: Jeff Wentworth
speakers.description: Jeff Wentworth is a Co-founder of [Curvegrid](https://www.curvegrid.com/), a blockchain software company founded in Tokyo, Japan in 2017. Curvegrid's MultiBaas blockchain middleware makes it easy and cost effective to build on blockchain. In the Ethereum ecosystem, Jeff is a regular mentor at [ETHGlobal](https://ethglobal.com/) hackathons and occasional contributor to go-ethereum. Previously, Jeff worked in financial services and enterprise data storage.

title: Node Provider Reliability and Monitoring
description: For many DApp developers it‚Äôs convenient and economical to use a blockchain node provider. But not all node providers are created equal: cost vs. performance vs. uptime, client compatibility, securing connections, scalability, failover, data reliability, and websockets vs. HTTPS are themes we‚Äôll provide practical advice on to help attendees build better DApps. This talk is based on five years of experience running production workloads at scale across all major node providers.

speakers.name: June Sim
speakers.description:
2021 ~ Onther Inc. CEO
2020 Korea University Ph.D., Cybersecurity Engineering
2019 KPMG Samjong Accounting Corp., Blockchain Consulting & Digital Strategy
2016 Korea University School of Cybersecurity, Master of BigData Engineering
2015 Deloitte Anjin LLC, Startup Consultant, Corporation Risk Consultant
2012 Samil PwC, Internal Audit

title: GnomePad : Secure Crypto Finance Pad
description: The hardware wallet is known to be the most secure way to keep the crypto asset. However, it needs to be connected to a software wallet to make transactions. Especially, to use DeFi, NFT, and Web3 services, they need to be connected more frequently. GnomePad is a dedicated tablet device where only pre-installed apps can be executed. With other advanced security features, GnomePad offers comparable security to hardware wallets while making transactions.

speakers.name: Ken Smith
speakers.description: Ken Smith is the founder of NextBlock Solutions, a blockchain consulting company that provides training and educational services to web3 organizations. Ken is an Ethereum node operator using the RocketPool protocol and a member of the Node Operators Association (@NodeOperators) and has been active in the Ethereum and other blockchain communities since 2014.

title: A Bayesian Analysis of MEV Proposer Payment Value (PPV) to Model the Total ETH Staking APR Post-Merge.
description: This talk presents a statistical model and python code that can be used to predict total ETH staking rewards both from beacon rewards and from block proposer payments. We assume that the current ethereum protocol parameter setting for rewards and penalties continues to be constant during the time modeled. We next performed a monte carlo prediction using historical Ethereum proof-of-work mining block rewards to calculate future Ethereum staking (beacon chain) proposer payment value (PPV) rewards.

speakers.name: Natalie
speakers.description: I was born in Ukraine and spent 8 years of my life in Shanghai where I completed my journey from being a devoted Julian Barns reader to being a devoted blockchain whitepaper reader.

title: Web2 to Web3: a combination of UX simplicity and functional complexity
description: A Web3 user, "I don't want an easy wallet, I want a complex one. If it is so easy and simple, how can it be safe?"  After building and designing a wallet (FoxWallet) with an incredibly user-friendly interface while providing mining-related technical services, our team indeed has a lot to share on hows, whats and whys of its functional user-centered design. Instead of differentiating between Web2 and Web3 users, why not create a products that would create a worthy journey for both?

speakers.name: Billy Rennekamp
speakers.description: Billy Rennekamp is the Cosmos Hub Team Lead at Interchain GmbH. He's the co-founder of Folia‚Äîa space for exhibiting and collecting NFTs‚Äî and Clovers Network‚Äîa game that rewards the creation of scarce art. Projects that he has contributed to include Ethereum, Gnosis, Aragon & Relevant. He is a member of Are.na, Guild.is, NewModels.io and Trust.support.

title: Multichain, Interchain, Interop
description: The reality of many blockchains grows more present every day. This panel invites bridge builders and protocol specialists to complain about the problem and celebrate the solutions. Experts on the following topics will be present: the Inter-Blockchain Communication (IBC) protocol from Cosmos, Polkadot‚Äôs cross-chain message-passing protocol (XCMP) and Ethereum's best bridge architects and cross-shard communication researchers.

speakers.name: Vladimir
speakers.description: Your Web 3.0 travel fren

title: From local communities to sustainable travel
description: Global travel solutions should be rediscovered. This idea is shouting at us from infinite lines in the airports. Centralised companies did a great job in early 2000, but they forgot about people. With Ethereum we can design public goods for local communities to operate, govern and own the data, making businesses and the industry sustainable. In 1950 there were only 25 million tourists worldwide. In 2018 there are 1,4 billion of people who travel. Lots of work ahead!

speakers.name: Xinyu Huang
speakers.description: Xinyu Huang graduates from UIUC with a master's degree in Data Science in 2020. He joined ChainInfo team during his master's degree and has been working there till now. He has contributed to several projects held by ChainInfo, helped build a database that collects and tags more than 200 million addresses, and participated in the development of tools like Biteye and Dragnet that provide users with high-quality data service.

title: The Decentralization of Ethereum 2.0 -- From the Perspective of Data Analysis
description:
Although there are more than 400,000 validators staking on the beacon chain, most are controlled by a few staking pools rather than worldwide home stakers. This talk will analyze the on-chain data to figure out the actual decentralization level of Ethereum 2.0 from three aspects, including:
1. validator ownership
2. node geo-distribution
3. block builder.

The talk will also give an overview of present optimizations like Light Client, State Expiry, and put forward some of our understandings

speakers.name: Shiv Malik
speakers.description:
Shiv Malik - CEO Pool Foundation
Shiv Malik is the author of two books, the co-founder of the Intergenerational Foundation think tank, an award nominated broadcaster, and a former investigative ‚Äãjournalist for the Guardian. In 2021 he co-founded Pool and currently leads the foundation on its mission to bring Data Unions to the world and ensure people have control of their data and a genuine stake in the digital economy.

speakers.name: Justina Petraityte
speakers.description: Justina is Developer Success Lead at 3Box Labs where she focuses on improving the developer experience when building applications on the Ceramic network. Prior to joining 3Box Labs team, she has been working in the Developer Relations space, focused on data science and machine learning, for over 4 years helping open source projects to build successful developer products and vibrant communities around them.

title: Sign in with Ethereum: the most powerful protocol in #Web3?
description:
Sign in with Ethereum is an almost accidental byproduct of #Web3, but is already turning into an incredibly powerful tool for user engagement and convenience. Wallet holders sign into DeFi protocols to manage their money or sales of NFTs but can it be much more than it already is. Linking seams of rich data to an ethereum address is the future of identity, ease and monetisation on the web.  
Join Jonathan Padilla, from Snickerdoodle, Lauren Feld From 3Box (Ceramic) and Shiv Malik from Pool Data

speakers.name: Jayden Kim
speakers.description:
Jayden Kim,
Currently COO at RadiusXYZ

speakers.name: JONBGBEEN HAN
speakers.description:
Ph.d student (Seoul National University).
I'm intersted in Blockchain and MEV-solution.

title: Developing MEV-resistant protocol with PVDE (Practical Verifiable Delay Encryption)
description: MEV occurs as transactions are openly observed and controlled by Operators(miners/sequencers). This means that Operators can exploit transactions and extract profits through sandwich attacks via reordering transactions in a block. Hidden slippage! To protect users from MEV, we have a design for an MEV-resistant DEX based on a scheme called PVDE. This cryptographic scheme uses time-lock puzzles and ZKP to reduce the computational resources for proving the validity of the time-lock puzzles in ZKP.

speakers.name: Uri Kirstein
speakers.description: Uri is a Developer Advocate and Software Developer at Certora. Uri fell in love with blockchain in 2018 after doing a research project as an undergraduate student at the Technion. He joined Certora right after graduation.

title: Specification-Based Testing
description: In addition to unit tests and manual audits, specification-based testing is increasingly becoming a necessity. Specifications describe the systems‚Äô properties, which, if they don‚Äôt hold, can cause serious bugs. This workshop will demonstrate the power of specification-based testing. Workshop participants will learn how to identify key correctness properties of their protocols and formally verify them using the Certora Prover. Participants will get a key to use the Certora Prover for 3 months.

speakers.name: Anuj
speakers.description: Rabbit in Holes

title: G-d & Crypto: get ready or get rekt
description: Any sufficiently advanced tech is indistinguishable from magic. Transmuting Data into Digital Gold amounts to digital alchemy. Started with Szabo's God's Protocol (1997) that Chainlink promises to implement! Even the evangelical drive to spread the message of crypto or the notion of Trust that lacks a Center, akin to a G-d that's everywhere and nowhere so lies beyond our need to trust in Her! Time to transcend the secular notion of rationalism in crypto gov/politics - a multidisciplinary workshp

speakers.name: Abhilash Inumella
speakers.description: Product at QuestBook.

title: Kill the shill
description:
Proposing a new Defi lego to kill the shill. Anyone can propose the next move of any wallet by placing a conditional buy order: "if vitalik.eth buys eth, I'll also buy 10$ eth". Each order lasts only twenty hours by default. 

As a wallet owner, you can get suggestions on the tokens and NFTs to buy without the shill. #killTheShill CryptoInfluencers will say "I'll match the top suggestion -- let's go üöÄ"

In this lightning talk, we'll also demo the mobile UI innovations we did.

speakers.name: Chang-Wu Chen
speakers.description: Dr. Chang-Wu Chen is the head of imToken labs, leading wallet, contract development and crypto research. Prior to joining imToken, he worked for AMIS as a chief scientist from 2018 to 2020, and Ethereum Foundation as a researcher from 2017 to 2018. He served as an adjunct assistant professor, teaching Ethereum DApp development, at the National Chengchi University from 2018 to 2021. He is currently also a Taipei Ethereum Meetup co-organizer.

title: Post-Merge Wallet
description: Crypto wallet is an entry point to onboard users to Web3, but the complexity of key management prevents the real decentralization to be realized and widely adopted. After the Merge, Ethereum is pivoting to a rollup-centric roadmap. What does the future wallet look like? In this talk, I would like to talk about what is the missing part for current wallet design centered around L2, DeFi applications, abstract account and social recovery from our past experience.

speakers.name: Youssef El Housni
