speakers.description: I am an applied cryptographer at ConsenSys working on cryptography and SNARK libraries in Go (see gnark and gnark-crypto). I am also a final year PhD student in cryptography at Ecole Polytechnique in Paris.

title: What signature scheme for your zk-rollup?
description: A zk-rollup bundles a hundred of transactions into a single validity proof that attests to the correctness of these transactions. The zk-rollup operator manages the accounts and transactions by verifying a user signature. Hence, this verification needs to be proved in the final validity proof. In this talk we will compare signature schemes and elliptic curves that are suitable for zk-rollups. In particular, we propose a novel construction that leads to the fastest proof generation.

speakers.name: Felipe Faraggi
speakers.description:
python and ethereum builder.
Have been in the crypto space since 2012 and building on ETH since 2016.
TheDAO sufferer, genesis staker, owner of several cryptokitties and 414 degen score.

ETHglobal Hackathon winner (Project: hashink), EthCC volunteer, Devcon 3-4-5 participant, devcon/ethberlin/trufflecon speaker.

I've spent Œû2.18212 on gas.

speakers.name: Vicente
speakers.description: I'm a web3 dev mostly focused on frontend. Started working in the ecosystem in 2017 through a dApp project called Legacy, a decentralised death man switch built on Ethereum. Later on I worked as the lead dev for a mobile crypto wallet for Cardano. Currently I lead the frontend development of Alphaday, a multi-platform data aggregator for the web3.

title: ‚ÄúETHSQL‚Äù: What I learnt trying to tag/classify/relate all the information in Ethereum ecosystem to help the community keep up with everything

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
Applying tags and classifying data in order to create relations between all the information in the Ethereum ecosystem is hard. One thing is getting on-chain data and another is trying to tie this with off-chain data.
Quantitative & Qualitative data alike have different properties and the harder part is actually the off-chain stuff. So much chaos and lack of order- unlike structured on-chain data since genesis.
Anyway, come to the talk if you want to see how chaos & order combine in UML format.

speakers.name: Jacek Czarnecki
speakers.description: Jacek Czarnecki is a crypto lawyer with vast experience in the DeFi space. As a former Global Legal Counsel of the Maker Foundation, he contributed to the first and largest DeFi protocol and DAO. Jacek was also involved in several global and European initiatives to create policy frameworks for web3. He works with a few crypto projects on their regulatory and decentralization strategy. He graduated from Warsaw, Oxford, and Harvard universities.

title: Decentralizing Centralized Things
description: Decentralized governance is great, but its real applications are narrow. Intellectual property rights, various assets, corporate entities, legal rights, control powers, reliance on legacy institutions‚Äîall of them are complicated to decentralize. The workshop will explore if and what kind of things can be decentralized and the methods of decentralizing centralized stuff. The workshop will be fueled by my direct experience from probably the largest decentralization project in the space: MakerDAO,

speakers.name: Oskar Thoren
speakers.description:
Oskar Thoren is the protocol research lead at Vac, an R&D org creating modular p2p protocols for private, secure, censorship resistant communication. Before that he was Head of Engineering at Status, a mobile Ethereum client. He also organizes the Papers We Love meetup in Taipei.

Website: oskarth.com
Twitter: https://twitter.com/oskarth
Vac website: https://vac.dev

title: Private and incentivized p2p messaging with Waku using ZKPs
description:
In this talk we'll look at Waku, the communication layer for Web3, and how it uses ZK for its service network. We cover topics such as:

- Using RLN to provide private, economic spam protection
- Incentivizing costly services, such as storing messages, while protecting users' privacy with ZKPs
- How these can be deployed in a p2p network
- How we we get the best of both worlds with Rust and Circom using ark-circom and Zerokit
- Briefly on how we plan to use Halo 2 in the future

speakers.name: Felipe Faraggi
speakers.description:
python and ethereum builder.
Have been in the crypto space since 2012 and building on ETH since 2016.
TheDAO sufferer, genesis staker, owner of several cryptokitties and 414 degen score.

ETHglobal Hackathon winner (Project: hashink), EthCC volunteer, Devcon 3-4-5 participant, devcon/ethberlin/trufflecon speaker.

I've spent Œû2.18212 on gas.

title: Frengli√±ol: Spanglish and Franglish Ethereum
description:
Math and CS lost in translation? Yes it can happen.
Lets go over the common mistakes or bad translations in language when speaking about blockchain and ethereum.

And let's try to define a definite glossary.

speakers.name: Richard Muirhead
speakers.description:
Richard is Co-Founder and Managing Partner at Fabric Ventures. Fabric backs the founders of the Open Economy. investing in builders, businesses and digital assets from inception to scaling since 2012. Fabric invested in the likes of Polkadot, Ocean Protocol, Orchid, Sorare, 1inch, The Graph, and NEAR.  

Richard combines a pedigree in open source, developer-oriented tools, and early stage venture investing with blockchain focus since 2012, and has invested in Pantera Venture Fund I, Bitstamp,

title: The art of the DAO
description: The world will soon look like an intermeshed network of DAOs, where several DAOs combining together, would constitute the underlying infrastructure of the subset of the economy exposed to an end-user. However, since DAOs are a very nascent concept, there are still problems from governance to treasury management. We would explore the evolution of decentralisation, and how the world is moving towards this vision.

speakers.name: Fred
speakers.description: Fred is fascinated by complex systems, distributed ledger technology and the oxford comma.

title: Crosschain patterns
description:
L2 technologies allow for Ethereum to scale, but also opens the door for many new interesting dApp designs.
Rollups can compose with L1 Ethereum smart contracts in a trust-minimised fashion by leveraging the protocol's crosschain communication affordances.
A developer can leverage crosschain communication in many different an interesting ways, in this talk we'll explore a couple different ones.

speakers.name: Richard Muirhead
speakers.description:
Richard is Co-Founder and Managing Partner at Fabric Ventures. Fabric backs the founders of the Open Economy. investing in builders, businesses and digital assets from inception to scaling since 2012. Fabric invested in the likes of Polkadot, Ocean Protocol, Orchid, Sorare, 1inch, The Graph, and NEAR.  

Richard combines a pedigree in open source, developer-oriented tools, and early stage venture investing with blockchain focus since 2012, and has invested in Pantera Venture Fund I, Bitstamp,

title: Public Goods on the Ethereum Blockchain:
description: Open Source Client Code, Protocol Research, Documentation, and Community Building, all, fall under the public goods umbrella. This talk would explore how they are more public goods than private goods, and how interesting, flexible funding mechanisms are needed for these public goods.

speakers.name: Alice Henshaw
speakers.description: Alice is a smart contract engineer at Uniswap. Previously she was a smart contract auditor and researcher at OpenZeppelin.

title: Price Oracles: Uniswap V2 vs V3

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
Uniswap V2 & V3 provide the ability to create manipulation-resistant price oracles. These oracles can be used by other protocols to fetch a secure and reliable price for an asset. If used incorrectly price oracles can be disastrous.
-A comparison of oracles on V2 & V3.
---Manipulation resistance
---Geometric vs Arithmetic mean
---Liquidity requirements
---Concentrated vs full-range liquidity
---Invertibility
-Common mistakes in price oracles
-Existing integrations with protocols

speakers.name: Peter Davies
speakers.description: I am an independent Ethereum researcher (currently funded by the Ethereum Foundation). Most of my work is on the next generation [Execution Layer Specifications](https://github.com/ethereum/execution-specs).

title: EELS: The future of execution layer specifications
description: Peter Davies gives an overview of the work of the EELS (Ethereum Execution Layer Specifications) team on the [new executable specifications](https://github.com/ethereum/execution-specs) for the Ethereum execution layer. He discusses why new specifications are needed and how they will impact future governance processes.

speakers.name: Ivo Georgiev
speakers.description:
I've been coding since 10yo, in that time I've went through multiple things: I started with game dev, then switched to systems: I made my own Linux distribution at the age of 15, focused on improving the Linux UX: it peaked at p9 on distrowatch.

I cofounded a media center that grew to >25m users (Stremio)

More recently I've taken on a quest to combine all my skills, namely UX, security and smart contracts, to push the crypto UX forward in the form of a next-gen smart wallet, ambire.com

title: The future of wallets: MPC vs smart wallets
description:
There's undoubtedly more we can do to improve Ethereum wallet UX, and there's two technologies competing for this: MPC (multi-party computation) and smart wallets.

Let's explore the relative strenghts and weaknesses of each, as well as the protocol upgrades that will help (eg account abstractions, EIP3074 and EIP4337) and how those affect the comparsion.

speakers.name: Friederike Ernst
speakers.description: Friederike is the COO of Gnosis and cohost of OG blockchain podcast Epicenter. She has been in web 3 full-time since early 2017 and enjoys tricky engineering challenges and attempting to change the world for the better. In a previous life, i.e. before 2017, she was a research physicist: After a PhD in complex quantum systems in Berlin she worked as a postdoc at Columbia and Stanford/ SLAC.

title: Gnosis Chain: Make Ethereum Weird Again
description: Home to over 1500 DAOs and several UBI projects, GC has an ambitious roadmap for implementing single slot finality and account abstraction. Gnosis Chain's security model hinges crucially on decentralization: By partnering with projects like dappnode in striving to make validating easier, GC has managed to attract over 100k validators while keeping tx fees low (<USD 0.01 for 100k gas). I will talk about the technological challenges of straddling the blockchain trilemma and architectural choices.

speakers.name: Fezyla Mokrani-Zemour
speakers.description: COO @KYVE

title: Building community and a robust product with an effective incentivized testnet
description: My workshop will be a testnet session on KYVE‚Äôs incentivized testnet. The aim is to show developers what a decentralized data lake looks like, how it works and what kind of stress tests we are putting the protocol under to ensure it is ready for mainnet. It also provides an opportunity to showcase how incentivized testnets can be the location for relationship building with validators, community members  and the project team as an asset before the mainnet launch.

speakers.name: Trent McConaghy
speakers.description: Trent McConaghy co-founded Ocean Protocol, building decentralized tools to level the playing field for AI and data. He has worked on AI since the mid 90s, Python since the early 2000s, and blockchain since 2013. He helped to kick off Token Engineering, and is a member of MetaCartel Ventures. He loves to code:)

title: Analog verification via EVM Agent-Based Simulation
description: How do we verify smart contracts in light of rug pulls, flash loans, or other MEV games? How do we test and tune incentives? Existing practice applying digital verification to the software logic is useful, but doesn't help here because the problems are analog in nature. Inspired by best practices from the semiconductor industry, this talk describes novel flows & tools for analog verification, including new EVM agent-based simulation tooling, and potential advanced verification tools.

speakers.name: Francesco Andreoli
speakers.description: DevRel ü•ë  + Community @Consensys @metamask & Early Stage Investor at @ouicapital, Ex developer communities @digitalassetcom @damldriven @angelHack, African #Art #NFT #kitesurf

title: Tools & infrastructure in Web3
description:
I would like to speak on Tools & infrastructure and current tech stack trends for developers in Web3. I recently had a panel with Simon Emanuel Schmid (Edge, The Graph) and Austin Griffith (Ethereum Foundation) and loved it at DevConnect in Amsterdam. I could also ask them to join me on the panel as I know they will be there. 

Questions that I want to answer are discussing challenges, breakthroughs in tooling, merge and infrastructure providers, and unsolved problems.

speakers.name: Alfredo B. Roisenzvit
speakers.description:
Economist - Harvard University
Professor - Grad Level: Big data, Risk Management, Blockchain&Crypto, Behavioral Economics
Co Founder: MoonQuant.capital  A specialized startup developing algorithmic trading bots for Crypto and  DeFi
Former Bank Regulator and Financial Risk Management consultant

title: eth IS money!  And why Ethereum is the platform for future global economic growth
description: If we study the history of Money we will see it is a symbol, that represents indirect exchanges.  At first, there were real assets (like gold), and then they became financial assets (like bank money).  Via the analysis of the history of money and monetary instruments, I intend to demonstrate that Ethereum is the most advanced creation of a platform for financial assets, which explain all the previous expansions of wealth in humanity.

speakers.name: Gustav Arentoft
speakers.description: Founder and CEO of StableNode.xyz, core contributor at 1inch, former MakerDAO.

title: Building an index for DAO transparency
description: At StableNode we are building an Index for transparency and decentralization scoring for DAO's. In this talk I will go through our process for building out what we believe will help achieve greater visibility in the inner workings of DAO's. We have been applying scientific methodologies to achieve objective scoring metrics, which we believe can help create standards for how DAO's operate.

speakers.name: Luis Bezzenberger
speakers.description: Luis has a background in finance and works in the Ethereum space since 2015, mainly as a product manager on protocol-level infrastructure and payment systems. Since 2021 he's the product manager at Shutter Network which is an open source project that uses threshold encryption to combat MEV and malicious front-running, as well as voter misbehavior in governance systems.

title: Shielded Voting Using Threshold Encryption
description:
Shutter Governance is a tool for governance platforms to introduce shielded voting for their users. It uses threshold encryption and is designed to fix issues with misbehavior, voter apathy, and voting incentive.

Simply put, with Shutter Governance, votes are encrypted during the voting period. The votes are decrypted and thereby only revealed after the poll closes.

The talk will include a live demo of Shielded Voting as developed in partnership with Snapshot.

speakers.name: Torgin Mackinga
speakers.description:
Torgin is a smart contract auditor at ChainSecurity.
He published a paper titled "TWAP Oracle attacks: Easier done than said?" analyzing TWAP oracles and introducing the "multi-block MEV attack", which makes manipulation much cheaper by hiding information from arbitrageurs.

title: Future- and multi-block MEV in PoS Ethereum
description:
In PoS Ethereum, block proposers are known ahead of time. This allows for new types of MEV, which leverage the ownership of future block space.
Using this, some attacks that were expensive due to arbitrage competition, such as oracle manipulations, become very cheap. There could also be opportunities for incentivizing high-MEV transactions in a future block that you know you will control.

speakers.name: Torgin Mackinga
speakers.description:
Torgin is a smart contract auditor at ChainSecurity.
He published a paper titled "TWAP Oracle attacks: Easier done than said?" analyzing TWAP oracles and introducing the "multi-block MEV attack", which makes manipulation much cheaper by hiding information from arbitrageurs.

title: Future- and multi-block MEV in PoS Ethereum
description:
In PoS Ethereum, block proposers are known ahead of time. This allows for new types of MEV, which leverage the ownership of future block space.
Using this, some attacks that were expensive due to arbitrage competition, such as oracle manipulations, become very cheap. There could also be opportunities for incentivizing high-MEV transactions in a future block that you know you will control.

speakers.name: Eugene Bochkov
speakers.description: Founder at marscolony.io

speakers.name: Dmitry
speakers.description: CTO MarsColony; Software Engineer with experience in web3, fintech and high loaded systems

title: Society-building framework for web 3
description: I'm Eugene, one of the creators of marscolony.io, where we are building web3 framework for future society. Currently we are running multiple experiments on each of the worlds we are launching. Each world has it's own governance, economy and mechanism of token distribution. The purpose of the workshop is to share our funding and to collect feedback from users.

speakers.name: Pol
speakers.description:
Pol Lanski is the COO of DAppNode and builder at dOrg.
After mining dogecoin in 2014, fell in love with the political possibilities of blockchains - starting with the dependency of political sovereignty from economic sovereignty. 
He spends most of the time thinking about economics, incentives, ecosystems and outcomes.

title: 5 Strategies to beat the centralizing forces
description:
Our estimation of tail risks/black swan events is bad and we suck at preparing for catastrophic outcomes. Even though we can see centralizing forces acting despite the best design intentions (MEV, liquid staking concentration), we are not currently counteracting them efficiently.
In this talk we will run through 5 strategies that we can take to build a future where we don't need to rely on doom talk and nag people into decentralization, but we can foster it and nurture it to emerge naturally.

speakers.name: Christopher Goes
speakers.description: Christopher is a co-founder of the Anoma project and Heliax company. He previously led architectural design and specification of the IBC protocol for the Cosmos project and wrote the Wyvern decentralised exchange protocol for Ethereum.

title: Anoma: an intent-centric, privacy-preserving protocol for counter-party discovery, distributed solving and atomic multi-chain settlement
description: Traditional blockchain platforms are imperative, designed around transactions which are ordered and executed. By contrast, the Anoma architecture is declarative, designed around intents: ephemeral preference functions over possible states which describe which states of the system actors prefer. In this talk, I will outline the Anoma architecture, provide an intuition for the design rationale, and describe how to use Anoma as a rollup to settle on Ethereum.

speakers.name: Hanno
speakers.description: I am passionate about human rights and the role that decentralization technologies can play in empowering communities and individuals. I am currently working on Waku, a suite of p2p messaging protocols, within the Vac decentralized research organization.

title: How to contribute to Web3's communication layer
description: This workshop takes attendees through configuring their own nodes to participate in a Waku p2p messaging network. Waku is the communication layer for Web3. Node operators will learn how they can tweak their contribution to the network by choosing which Waku protocols they support. We will focus on the Nim client for Waku, _nwaku_, as it is especially suitable for user-run nodes.

speakers.name: Oskar Thoren
speakers.description:
Oskar Thoren is the protocol research lead at Vac, an R&D org creating modular p2p protocols for private, secure, censorship resistant communication. Before that he was Head of Engineering at Status, a mobile Ethereum client. He also organizes the Papers We Love meetup in Taipei.

Website: oskarth.com
Twitter: https://twitter.com/oskarth
Vac website: https://vac.dev

speakers.name: Hanno
speakers.description: I am passionate about human rights and the role that decentralization technologies can play in empowering communities and individuals. I am currently working on Waku, a suite of p2p messaging protocols, within the Vac decentralized research organization.

speakers.name: Franck Royer
speakers.description: Franck is leading the Waku Product effort.

title: Centralization Is Web3's Biggest Problem
description:
While we are thriving to build a scalable smart contract platform, we are lagging behind on other key infrastructures needed to build a decentralized internet which is truly open to everyone.

Such infrastructure element is a messaging network, that enables parties to communicate and interact, free from censorship, metadata aggregation and other third party meddling.

During this talk, we'll learn how we need to build together an agnostic, neutral, censorship-resistant communication network.

speakers.name: Rebecca Rettig
speakers.description: Rebecca Rettig is General Counsel of the Aave Companies, a group of software development companies that build blockchain-based software for the web3 world.  ebecca works with policymakers across the globe on regulatory matters relating to decentralized finance (‚ÄúDeFi‚Äù), among other things.  Rebecca currently serves on the Board of Directors of Silvergate Bank, a public company, and the Board of the DeFi Education Fund, a 501(c)(4) promoting education.

title: Regulation and DeFi: Where do we go from here?
description: DeFi has become a focus point for regulators and policy makers across the globe. Many jurisdictions are conducting studies about DeFi and many global regulators have put out position papers on DeFi. As a community we need to be coordinated on what we can do going forward to ensure that regulation of DeFi allows for continued innovation in this space. This talk will give a brief background on regulatory interest in DeFi and also provide action items we can take going forward.

speakers.name: Jesus Ligero
speakers.description:
I'm currently working on Polygon hermez in the protocol team.
Basically I develop smart contracts and use zero knowledge languages like Circom or zkasm.

speakers.name: Carlos Matallana
speakers.description:
- Blockchain developer since 2018
- Ethereum enthusiastic :)
- Worked on self-sovereign identity at Iden3
- Main contributor to zkRollup PoC developed at Iden3
- Protocol designer at hermez zkRollup
- Protocol designer at polygon-hermez developing the zkEVM

speakers.name: Carlos Matallana
speakers.description:
I'm blockchain enthusiastic and I have been working on blockchain since 2018.
I have been enrolled in iden3 (identity project) and afterwards be part of the zk-rollup development.
Rollup-PoC and later on hermez-network has been the two main projects related to zk-rollups. Currently working on the zkEVM as a team lead in the protocol team.

title: Introduction to Circom2.0
description:
The workshop aims to explain the basics of Circom2.0, the new features respect Circom1.0, the tool stack and explain a simple project about the following topics: 
- Zk-Rollup + Mixer: Put a mixer in the withdraw of Hermez1.0.
- Polygon ID: Explain some of the Circom circuits of polygonID and how can be used.
- NFT project: A project that aims to airdrop an NFT to some address that accomplish certain conditions without reveal the address.

speakers.name: Alvin
speakers.description: Alvin Lee is an member of DeGate DAO and a former policymaker in Singapore. A graduate of Yale College, he was the speechwriter on economic relations for the Prime Ministry and First Deputy Prime Minister of Singapore.

title: The Sovereign Individual and the Rise of the Crypto Native
description: What does it mean to be a crypto native? The Ethereum community has always been about ideals and making an impact. In this talk, we dive into the origins of the crypto native, what defines the crypto nation as a whole, and how Ethereum has the most critical role to play in the creation of a trustless, permissionless global system.

speakers.name: Pol
speakers.description:
Pol Lanski is the COO of DAppNode and builder at dOrg.
After mining dogecoin in 2014, fell in love with the political possibilities of blockchains - starting with the dependency of political sovereignty from economic sovereignty. 
He spends most of the time thinking about economics, incentives, ecosystems and outcomes.

title: Everything a Solo Staker should know for the next phase of Ethereum
description: Solo stakers have a lot on their plate. Keeping up with every single change, how it will affect them and what steps they need to take to ensure their operation runs smoothly is a full time job! In this talk we are going to detail very clearly everything that they should be doing, everything that's coming, what tools and projects are coming to the rescue and what they are expected to do.

speakers.name: Jakub Wojciechowski
speakers.description: Founder of RedStone flash Oracles, software engineer with 10 years experience in FinTech, including 4 years in blockchain. Previously CTO of Alice, blockchain impact investment platform, smart contracts auditor at Open Zeppelin and leading Etheroscope project - Ethereum analytics platform funded by the UK Government. Winner of ethLondon, NYC blockchain week, ethOnline hackathons.

speakers.name: Jakub Wojciechowski
speakers.description: Software engineer with 10 years experience in FinTech, including 6 years in blockchain; Former CTO of Alice, blockchain impact investment platform. Leading Etheroscope project - Ethereum analytics platform funded by UK Gov. Winner of ethLondon, NYBW, ethOnline hackathons. Used to be a smart contract auditor at Zeppelin Solutions and a freelance blockchain architect. Currently, he's a founder of RedStone.

title: Flash Oracles - a novel way of delivering data to EVM without touching the storage.
description:
New DeFi & Web3 projects require diversified data delivered at a higher frequency to get an edge over competitors. However, the biggest bottleneck for Oracles is the high storage costs of EVM which hinder scalability.

To solve that problem, RedStone provides data based on meta transactions and layer-2 Arweave storage, supporting thousands of data feeds delivered at a few seconds refresh interval. We will discuss the benefits and limitations of such a design and showcase live integrations.

speakers.name: John Kelleher
speakers.description: Coordinating technical efforts at DXdao.  Working full time building product teams and developing products on Ethereum since 2017.

title: What Vitalik Got Wrong with Soulbound Tokens
description: Soulbound is an evocative name but it is off the mark.  We explore how reputation, certificates, and ratings tied to Ethereum addresses are being used today, and what potential they hold for tomorrow.  From DAO governance, to education, to identity, we go back several years in our research and imagine how non-transferable attributes will disrupt the Ethereum ecosystem and eventually the world as we do some soul searching on the systems we are building.

speakers.name: Pol
speakers.description:
Pol Lanski is the COO of DAppNode and builder at dOrg.
After mining dogecoin in 2014, fell in love with the political possibilities of blockchains - starting with the dependency of political sovereignty from economic sovereignty. 
He spends most of the time thinking about economics, incentives, ecosystems and outcomes.

title: Everything Stakers should know for the next phase of Ethereum

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Stakers have a lot on their plate. Keeping up with every single change, how it will affect them and what steps they need to take to ensure their operation runs smoothly is a full time job! In this talk we are going to detail very clearly everything that they should be doing, everything that's coming, what tools and projects are coming to the rescue and what they are expected to do.

speakers.name: Alfredo B. Roisenzvit
speakers.description:
Economist - Harvard University
Professor - Grad Level: Big data, Risk Management, Blockchain&Crypto, Behavioral Economics
Co Founder: MoonQuant.capital  A specialized startup developing algorithmic trading bots for Crypto and  DeFi
Former Bank Regulator and Financial Risk Management consultant

title: The Case for $UBI as a Universal-Aide independent token
description: $UBI is a decentralized token that drips to proven registered humans.  it ultimately represents people¬¥s time, as it drips at a rate of 1/hr.  I argue that $UBI can be the symbol (token) used to deploy direct economic aide to specific individuals in determined groups.   As programmable, it can be defined in subsets where price sustains can be defined, and be a vehicle for direct assistance diminishing the costs of actual bureaucracy, where more than 50% of funds are misused.

speakers.name: Jakub Wojciechowski
speakers.description: Founder of RedStone flash Oracles, software engineer with 10 years experience in FinTech, including 4 years in blockchain. Previously CTO of Alice, blockchain impact investment platform, smart contracts auditor at Open Zeppelin and leading Etheroscope project - Ethereum analytics platform funded by the UK Government. Winner of ethLondon, NYC blockchain week, ethOnline hackathons.

title: How to deploy your own custom Oracle in 5 min and connect it to your contract with just a few lines of code.
description:
Stateless oracles are an interesting alternative in the DeFi money lego offering better scalability and lower refresh intervals. At this workshop, we will present the underlying architecture, security aspects, opportunities and flaws of this novel approach.

You‚Äôll build your own simple Oracle using the web creator, implement a DeFi protocol following a step-by-step tutorial and understand the challenges of mainnet launch following the use case of decentralised prime brokerage service.

speakers.name: Alexis Masseron
speakers.description: Alexis Masseron is the Co-Founder and CEO of Atlendis Labs, the organization that contributes to Atlendis, a capital-efficient DeFi lending protocol that enables uncollateralized crypto loans. Alexis has an engineering background and started his career in the field of IoT. After discovering Ethereum, he joined ConsenSys as a software engineer and worked on multiple enterprise blockchain products. Alexis is passionate about blockchain technology and its application to DeFi and identity.

title: Launching a new DeFi protocol - an overview of security best practices in action
description: This session will cover the steps the Atlendis Labs‚Äô team took in launching the Atlendis protocol. Attendees will get an understanding of the security best practices that are used (internal testing using Foundry and Brownie; testnet launch, audit reports, bug bounty program, community AMAs and feedback sessions), and have the opportunity to ask questions.

speakers.name: Daniel Perez
speakers.description:
Software engineer with 10+ years of experience and open-source advocate with over 3,000 GitHub stars. Currently Daniel is finishing up his PhD at Imperial College London, where his research is on the security of blockchain systems and applications.  
Daniel is also a co-founder at [Backd](https://backd.fund) and [Gyroscope](https://gyro.finance).

speakers.name: Lewis Gudgeon
speakers.description: Lewis is a Computer Science PhD candidate at Imperial College London, publishing mainly on DeFi risks. Prior to this he worked as an economics consultant. He holds an MPhil in Economics Research from the University of Cambridge and a BA in Philosophy, Politics and Economics from Warwick University.

title: How to encrypt your seed phrase with one piece of paper and a pencil
description:
In this talk we present an offline encryption algorithm that makes it impossible for an attacker to retrieve the original seed phrase even with access to the full plain text seed phrase backup.
We give details about the algorithm and then evaluate it from both a cryptographic security perspective and a usability perspective.
We show that the encryption is secure enough to be unbreakable while being simple enough for a non-technical person to perform the decryption by hand.

speakers.name: S√∏ren Terp Jessen (Balloonist)
speakers.description:
Soren is currently supporting MakerDAO in creating legal resiliency.
Before that, he was a regulator with the Danish Financial Supervisory Authority.
He has been drafting international legislating and guidance targeting issuers of cryptocurrency, exchanges, and DeFi-products.
Back in 2018, Soren was part of the team creating a CFD-trading platform on Ethereum and after that, he was a co-founder of the team creating Dafnir.com where you can send Dai and the recipient will get local currency.

title: The necessity of decentralization for DAOs and DeFi products
description:
Most DeFi products rely on centralization in one or more areas, and there are products that have a hidden centralized authority and are decentralized in name only.
Collaboration in a DAO might as well be considered a general partnership with shared liability

I will give my take on
1) When a DeFi product/DAO is so decentralized that it can not be considered a legal subject.
2) How a DeFi product/DAO needs to be organized, so its participants have no or little risk of being considered liable

speakers.name: Jorge Arce-Garro
speakers.description: I am a blockchain and cryptography researcher from Costa Rica, currently working at Nethermind. I look into all kinds of tools related to Ethereum scalability questions, such as layer 2s, liquid staking, and zero-knowledge proofs. Besides Ethereum, I am working on a PhD in mathematical physics at the University of Michigan.  In my free time I enjoy memes and dancing.

speakers.name: Michal Zajac
speakers.description: Head of Cryptography Research at Nethermind. Enthusiast and researcher of zero-knowledge proof systems focused on their security and efficiency.

title: Quality nodes and how to get them permissionlessly
description: Numerous blockchain applications, like liquid staking protocols, distributed validator technologies, data oracles, or zk-rollups‚Äô distributed sequencers and provers require that the set of nodes tasked to perform a specific task is competent to run the task, has proven past performance, or is of ‚Äúhigh quality‚Äù relative to a considered metric. In this talk, we would like to propose a solution to the problem of the automated and permissionless build of a high-quality set of nodes.

speakers.name: Jakub Wojciechowski
speakers.description: Founder of RedStone flash Oracles, software engineer with 10 years experience in FinTech, including 4 years in blockchain. Previously CTO of Alice, blockchain impact investment platform, smart contracts auditor at Open Zeppelin and leading Etheroscope project - Ethereum analytics platform funded by the UK Government. Winner of ethLondon, NYC blockchain week, ethOnline hackathons.

title: Modular smart contracts - separating transaction ordering from evaluation and state updates on Arweave.
description:
EVM blockchains use a monolithic architecture where recording transactions are tightly coupled with the execution layer. We‚Äôll present an alternative approach where transaction ordering is separated from evaluation and state updates. 

We'll present how to implement a modular smart contract design, discuss its challenges and demonstrate how to organise caching layers to allow efficient lazy evaluation, whilst maintaining consistency among different execution networks in a trustless way.

speakers.name: Jakub Wojciechowski
speakers.description: Founder of RedStone flash Oracles, software engineer with 10 years experience in FinTech, including 4 years in blockchain. Previously CTO of Alice, blockchain impact investment platform, smart contracts auditor at Open Zeppelin and leading Etheroscope project - Ethereum analytics platform funded by the UK Government. Winner of ethLondon, NYC blockchain week, ethOnline hackathons.

title: Build your data optimised & modular smart contract on Arweave with WASM
description:
During the workshop, we will demonstrate how to implement smart contracts on top of the Arweave storage chain, allowing for heavy data processing and deferred lazy evaluation based on https://warp.cc/

We will explain the challenges and benefits of using a modular smart-contract platform when the storage is decoupled from the computation layer and show how to deploy your own decentralised execution network to perform trustless computation tailored to the needs of your app.

speakers.name: Dominic Bruetsch
speakers.description:
Smart Contract Security
Senior Engineer at Chainsecurity (Founding Partner)

title: Thinking like an auditor to develop safer smart contracts
description:
Since 2017, ChainSecurity has audited countless smart contracts. Based on this experience, our experts will present a methodology for secure smart contract development.

During the workshop, we will coach attendees to think about their project like an auditor would, to help them develop safer smart contracts using foundry and forked mainnet tests.

speakers.name: June Sim
speakers.description:
2021 ~ Onther Inc. CEO
2020 Korea University Ph.D., Cybersecurity Engineering
2019 KPMG Samjong Accounting Corp., Blockchain Consulting & Digital Strategy
2016 Korea University School of Cybersecurity, Master of BigData Engineering
2015 Deloitte Anjin LLC, Startup Consultant, Corporation Risk Consultant
2012 Samil PwC, Internal Audit

title: An Idea for Expanding the Ethereum Ecosystem : Launch for Launching Your Project and Creating Tokenomics
description: TONStarter is the first-ever decentralized launchpad platform for Layer 2 projects and recently launched a new function called ‚ÄúLaunch,‚Äù which allows anyone to create their project and tokenomics. By simplifying the process of project creation and tokenomics, we believe this will expand the Ethereum ecosystem. In addition, project teams can benefit from using TONStarter‚Äôs ‚ÄúStarter‚Äù function to onboard the Tokamak Network ecosystem and get funding for the project.

speakers.name: June Sim
speakers.description:
2021 ~ Onther Inc. CEO
2020 Korea University Ph.D., Cybersecurity Engineering
2019 KPMG Samjong Accounting Corp., Blockchain Consulting & Digital Strategy
2016 Korea University School of Cybersecurity, Master of BigData Engineering
2015 Deloitte Anjin LLC, Startup Consultant, Corporation Risk Consultant
2012 Samil PwC, Internal Audit

title: Platform Governance: Forming a Sound Ecosystem of Economic and Non-Economic Contributors
description:
LYDA is a social token platform that allows economic and non-economic contributors to contribute to the growth of the platform. This governance structure was influenced by Vitalik Buterin‚Äôs ‚ÄúSoul Bound‚Äù concept.
$LYDA is the platform‚Äôs tradeable native token, and $LNT is a non-transferable token which entices non-economic contributions from the users. $LNT can be used to reward social token issuers and holders as well as a means to onboard new ecosystems into the platform.

speakers.name: John Smith
speakers.description: Founder of JustCause Crowdfunding platform. Former NLP researcher with a focus on medical data. Found and fell in love with Ethereum in May of 2017 and never looked back.

title: Lossless Donations a Different Approach to Fundraising
description:
We use an innovative funding mechanism to allow users to give to public goods, charities, personal cause...
Users/team create pools representing a cause. Users deposit tokens into pools which deposit them into Aave. The interest earned is donated to the cause associated with the pool. Contributors can withdraw deposits in full.
We have a grant from the Aave grants DAO, and want to talk about lossless donations. 
https://www.justcause.finance/#/ working on getting audited launch on Polygon+L2s

speakers.name: Valeria
speakers.description:
A sweet cheerful girl who 10 years ago laughed at people who are paid with cryptocurrency, and now I think that this is our present and future. 
Worked with the development team, then with all the teams in the company, and this month became HR.

title: DAO Formation: Corporate vs Nation-State Structure Approaches
description: Architecting a DAO is a challenge and most look at it from the business perspective. This talk discusses benefits of looking at it from the perspective of a nation-state formation, what mechanisms could boost decentralized organizations' decision-making and ops, looking through the lens of history lessons and present solutions in governments and corporations. The presentation will share the experience after a year of operating a DAO and iterative decentralization.

speakers.name: Christoph Jentzsch
speakers.description: Christoph is a theoretical physicist, former core-dev of Ethereum (2014/15), co-founder of slock.it, author of TheDAO, business angel and today co-founder and CEO of corpus.ventures. His wealth of experience, vision, and understanding of Ethereum is dedicated to build the next generation of web3 products.

title: Tokens: A legal view 6 years after TheDAO, ICO boom, security tokens, and NFTs
description:
Tokens are a major use case for Ethereum since the beginning. The experience of TheDAO in 2016 and the countless ICOs that followed, raised many questions regarding its legal status. This led to the rise of Security Tokens, DAOs, and many experiments with token-based ownership structures. NFTs expanded the possible cryptoeconomic models.
We will discuss learnings of the past with the knowledge of today and will dare an outlook on the future with a combined experience of ~35 years in this space.

speakers.name: Denis Vuckovac
speakers.description:
Born in former Yugoslavia in 1988
Left for Germany as a refugee in 1992
Finished studying Industrial Engineering in Germany in 2013
Finished a PhD in Machine Learning in 2019
Involved in Bitcoin and Ethereum since 2016, attended devcon IV in Prague in 2018
Worked as a Data Scientist until the end of 2021
Started inat scholarship in 2022 to finance and educate students in Bosnia and Hercegovina

title: learn2earn - learnings from educating & financing the next batch of web3 developers
description:
The next iteration of ‚Äúthe web‚Äù is not going to build itself - and people in developing countries are not going to participate in this (r)evolution without some guidance and financial support. 
See what can be achieved by handing out scholarships to students in developing countries and guiding them in their learning process towards becoming proficient in the web3 ecosystem.

speakers.name: Jannik Luhn
speakers.description: Hello!

title: Rolling Shutter: Minimizing MEV on Rollups

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Similar to and likely even more than L1s today, rollups will suffer greatly from malicious MEV extraction. Fortunately, rollups also provide an excellent opportunity to fix this problem at the protocol level. To this end, we present Rolling Shutter: A general frontrunning protection system that can be integrated into most rollup implementations. It uses threshold encryption to hide the users' transactions from the sequencer, limiting their power to effectively reorder or censor transactions.

speakers.name: ioannis_sachinoglou
speakers.description: Senior Blockchain Security Engineer at ChainSecurity. Particularly interested in software verification and static analysis. MSc in Computer Science from ETH Zurich.

title: Security Pitfalls when building with DeFi Legos
description: The explosion of DeFi has led to the creation of protocols e.g., on-chain funds, which allow users to manage funds they don't own and interact with multiple protocols. This raises many security challenges, allowing users to steal those funds. In the talk, we describe some common patterns people employ and some pitfalls they should be aware of.

speakers.name: Rachael Amy
speakers.description: people opsing @ gitcoin // product liaising @ cabindao

title: Operation Dumbass - How not being the smartest person in the room is a public good
description: While having to ask, ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs that?‚Äù ‚ÄúWho‚Äôs that?‚Äù or ‚ÄúWhy‚Äôs that?‚Äù feels, at best, juvenile or, at worst, completely immoral in web3‚Äôs DYOR culture, being the person unafraid to ask questions is a good thing: it offers the opportunity for others to learn with us, often providing the space for someone to say, ‚ÄúI was wondering that too!‚Äù This talk is for the imposters as well as the know-it-alls, as it can hopefully serve as a reminder that we have all been The Dumbass at some point in our lives.

speakers.name: Konstantin Panarin
speakers.description: researcher at Matter Labs, zk-snarks enthusiast

title: zkSync zkEVM: design, challenges, optimizations
description: In my talk, I'm goint to speak in detail about zkEVM that backens zkSync 2.0. I'm going to give some high-level overview of chosen strategy, provide reasoing why we have prefered modular approach for zkEVM over monolitic one and decided to go to EVM compatilibilty instead of equivalence. I will laso dive a bit deeper inside technical part of  zk-EVM and speak about crusial design choices and  some fun tricks and optimizations that help us to reduce the overall complexity of the system.

speakers.name: Batu Inal
speakers.description: TBD

title: Building web3 businesses on FoundationOS
description:
FoundationOS was created with the intention of being the easiest way to build a web3 business using NFTs. Our workshop will show you exactly how to do just that. 

We‚Äôll discuss:
- How to refer bids & asks to the Foundation Protocol to earn fees
- How to write smart contracts to configure those fees dynamically
- Dream up more complex business models and how build them on FoundationOS

speakers.name: Justina Petraityte
speakers.description: Justina is Developer Success Lead at 3Box Labs where she focuses on improving the developer experience when building applications on the Ceramic network. Prior to joining 3Box Labs team, she has been working in the Developer Relations space, focused on data science and machine learning, for over 4 years helping open source projects to build successful developer products and vibrant communities around them.

title: Building scalable dapps using composable and sovereign data
description: Data layer is a key component of any application. While Ethereum has been serving as a robust platform for building applications, storing and querying data that goes beyond financial transactions remains a challenge. In this workshop we explore the tools and techniques that enable developers to build feature-rich applications using a decentralized data layer for storing and accessing user-generated data while using SIWE for enabling users to use their Ethereum accounts to access applications.

speakers.name: Ian Norden
speakers.description: Studied biochemistry in grad school, left with my masters in 2017 in order to work on algorithmic cryptocurrency trading bots. Started working for/with Vulcanize in 2018. At Vulcanize I‚Äôve worked on EIP-1559, as a core contributor to the cosmos-sdk, and on various IPLD projects/contracts (ethereum and tendermint/cosmos IPLD schemas and codecs).

title: Make any blockchain interoperable with IPLD
description:
The interoperability layer for off-chain blockchain data is IPLD. Structured hashlinked data combined with content addressability is the basis of Laconic Network‚Äôs data indexing layer. This workshop will use Ethereum's Beacon Chain.
- IPLD, IPFS & FILECOIN
- Make any blockchain data content addressible
- Transform data structures with annotations in IPLD
- Writing the required IPLD tooling
- Understand IPLD data structures & shcemas
- Register multi-format types
- IPLD codex
- Free Beer

speakers.name: Vanina Ivanova
speakers.description:
Vanina has more than 17 years of experience in advertising and online marketing. She has ran and managed huge digital marketing projects in the fintech industry, and has been a part of the team of a major cloud storage provider. 


For the past 5 of years, Vanina has been running marketing for Ambire (formerly AdEx Network) and the company‚Äôs two products: the smart crypto wallet Ambire Wallet and Ambire AdEx,  a decentralized ad network.

title: The Web3 We Deserve
description: The Web3 crowd has always strayed away from Web 2.0 primitives - but are we missing out on adoption opportunities because of this? This talk is an exploration of the Web 2.0 tools we can employ in Web3 development and marketing in order to speed up adoption.

speakers.name: Jeremy Musighi
speakers.description: Jeremy Musighi is Head of Growth at Balancer Labs, supporting the community-driven growth and sustainability of the Balancer protocol. He has also been a crypto investor, speaker, and consultant since 2013, as founder of Immutable Capital. Previously, Jeremy founded, grew, and sold two consumer Web2 companies.

title: An Optimistic Collaboration: Balancer & BeethovenX

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Balancer's recent deployment on Optimism was accomplished through a unique partnership between two decentralized communities based on two different chains, who came together to launch a key DeFi primitive on one of Ethereum's most promising L2's. This project was the first of its kind and an interesting case study for teams throughout the Ethereum ecosystem and beyond.

speakers.name: Christian Montoya
speakers.description: Senior Product Manager, MetaMask Snaps Studio. Ethereum, MetaMask and MyCrypto user since 2017. Junior solidity developer. NFT addict.

title: Building the Future of Web3 with MetaMask Snaps
description: I will give an introduction to MetaMask Snaps, the decentralized platform for extending MetaMask with custom APIs and features. I have presented this in the past at ETH Rio, ETH Miami, and ConsenSys Connect NYC. Here's a recording of my first talk on this topic: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XL3OduRT8js

speakers.name: aleph_v
speakers.description: Smart contracts lead at Element Finance, previously I did ZKP and L2 R&D at 0x, smart contract auditing and math research

title: Optimistic Systems for Blockchain Introspection
description: Most protocols on ethereum require responses to actions that happen onchain, currently the blockchain must hold state for each of these actions in order to respond to them. This talk explores a solution to blockchain introspection that uses a play on optimistic roll ups and governance to trade-off liveness for flexibility and efficiency. This system gives developers new tools to respond to blockchain actions in ways that may be too complex to implement in smart contract form.

speakers.name: Alexander Guy
speakers.description: Alexander is a data driven growth marketer with a track record of growing companies across a number of industries. After more than a decade working in SaaS, Alexander fell down the rabbit hole with NFTs, DeFi and Web3. He now leads Marketing and Growth for Zerion, the smart & social web3 wallet with over 220k monthly Active users and over $1B in trading volume.

title: Express Yourself: On-Chain Behavior, Generative Traits and NFTs as Onboarding Tools
description:
Many Web3 projects use NFTs to entice new people to their dapps or reward loyal community members. Yet the methods projects use are unfortunately often direct copies of Web2 gamification tactics They don‚Äôt add to user experience or offer value to the user.

I will explore the concepts of generative NFTs & SBTs and show how they can offer web3 builders the ability to move beyond these tactics to help users express their on-chain identities and design unique experiences with built-in utility.

speakers.name: Micmac.eth
speakers.description: Writer at Edge & Node, member of Developer DAO, and founder of Crypto Creatives.

title: Onboarding jr developers to technical writing
description: We'll be covering the importance of technical writing, the value it adds to the web3 ecosystem, and how many jr developers could land a technical writing job easier than a developer position. This makes it easier for jr devs to get their first job in the industry.

speakers.name: Julien Niset
speakers.description: Julien is co-Founder and Chief Science Officer of Argent. He holds a PhD in Physics with a focus on Quantum Information and Quantum Cryptography. Julien is the author of three patents: for quantum random number generation, distribution and use in novel cryptographic schemes. He previously founded  a startup working on Ultra-Fast Quantum Random Number Generators, then worked in the security in IoT.

speakers.name: Itamar Lesuisse
speakers.description: Itamar is co-founder & CEO of Argent, the first smart wallet for crypto, backed by Paradigm. He previously founded and led Peak, the leading mobile brain training platform. It grew to 60 million users and was acquired by Lagardere in 2016. Prior to Peak, Itamar worked at Amazon and VISA and BCG. While at Visa, Itamar authored four payment-related patents and managed the development of V.me, Visa's new ePayment solution. At Amazon, Itamar launched new product lines. He holds a Masters in CS.

title: Why Account Abstraction is a Game-Changer for Dapps
description: Native account abstraction on L2 is a breakthrough for the usability and security of crypto. It‚Äôs also the only way to scale self-custody. This talk explains what account abstraction is and why it matters for Dapps and their users. We‚Äôll provide specific examples of features that it uniquely enables, such as session keys, fraud monitoring, multicall, social recovery and more. The end result is the unlocking of new experiences and use cases that can move the needle for crypto‚Äôs adoption.

speakers.name: Jonathan Miller
speakers.description: Jonathan is co-founder of Level 7 Leadership - a leadership development firm focused on training high performing leaders in decentralized environments. He is also currently co-leading the marketing department at GitcoinDAO.

title: DAO Leadership: Leading without a title
description:
DAOs have invited us to explore new kinds of leadership that operate well in highly decentralized, fully remote environments with global teams coming from a multitude of backgrounds. Especially in environments without formal hierarchies, a common question emerges - how do I lead, even though I'm not a "leader"?

In this talk, participants will learn more about:
- What leadership is?
- How to set yourself up as a leader in a leaderless environment?
- What specific skills will set you apart?

speakers.name: Antonio Salazar Cardozo
speakers.description: Antonio Salazar Cardozo is the CTO of Thesis, Head of Engineering of Tally Ho, and a software pragmatist who values great software that is written for humans first. As a relatively outgoing engineer, he‚Äôll likely look at your shoes instead of his when he‚Äôs talking to you.

title: Open Borders: Using UX & Design for Crypto Adoption and Accessibility
description: It's no secret that the UX/UI experience in many crypto projects is less than desirable. Michael Gluzman (CDO at Thesis*), uses his experience working with big, corporate brands to create not only a better crypto UX experience, but one that's optimized for mass adoption and accessibility for everyone (even your mom). The more equitable future we all want is ours to create... so how do we design for it?

speakers.name: Hadas Zeilberger
speakers.description: Researcher at Connext. Incoming PhD student at Yale Applied Cryptography lab. Software engineer -> cryptographer.

title: Optimistic timeouts
description: In my talk, I will discuss how the length of optimistic timeout windows are chosen. The security of optimistic systems depends on choosing the lengths of these windows correctly, as there needs to be enough time for an honest actor to report fraud. Factors that effect the length of the window include user activity, the number of trusted honest actors, and the trade off between security and latency. I will also discuss cryptographic techniques to shorten the length of these windows

speakers.name: Dan Finlay
speakers.description: Dan Finlay is a co-founder at MetaMask, where he has managed the group for over 7 years. He thinks we can do a lot better, but we can't do it alone.

title: Delegatable Eth: Safer, more Scalable Composition
description: Making wallets that safely connect to sites is actually a very similar problem to connecting contracts to each other, or social network connections. Join MetaMask co-founder Dan Finlay as he shares a pattern for evm contract composition "Delegatable Eth" that allows easy to reason about but high security composition, all with scaling benefits that can combine with just about any layer of the stack you like.

speakers.name: danny
speakers.description: L1 research at the Ethereum Foundation

title: Danny Ryan placeholder
description:
I have a few things I'm considering talking about

* Shipping is hard - difficulties, contextual uniqueness, and what we can learn from other processes and projects
* Context - where we are and laying out the progression from here
* Design decisions - the post-merge technical stack and why it looks the way it does
* Building Ethereum for the future -The Ethereum L1 community never takes the easiest path from point A to B. Why? The metagame of architecting a sustainable foundation

speakers.name: Ashley Liu
speakers.description: Ashley is a service and product designer, as well as an entrepreneur. She is proficient in guiding the translation of insights into strategic and innovative product solutions. Her 12+ years of working experience in end-to-end design processes across all spectrum of industries. She constantly analyses, designs, and evangelizes design thinking for Blockchain/Web3 space.

title: Beyond the technology: A secret of designing a blockchain service

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Suppose the most disruptive blockchain solution starts penetrating our daily life. Yet, many mainstream users are uncomfortable experiencing blockchain services, while everyone still talks about the tip of the iceberg - UI/UX or even research. This talk will present a design thinking method and study for you to learn an exhaustive and holistic framework. It will be the foundation and driver for everything, including how the blockchain integrates the overall experience for the community and team.

speakers.name: Diego Losada
speakers.description:
Diego Losada holds a Degree in Economics and Business Administration at Universidade de A Coru√±a (Spain) and has over 15 years of experience in IT Consultancy. His specific expertise in the management area relies on consulting services in Linux administration.

He is the co-founder of EOA Blockchain Labs Spanish company and founder of the "Ethereum on ARM" project in late 2016.

title: Install, set up and start an Ethereum node on an ARM board (premerge & postmerge)
description:
Our main goal is to contribute to the network decentralization by making it easier and affordable for regular users to run nodes (and staking) on resource-constrained devices as well as helping to test the next major Ethereum upgrade (The Merge).

In this workshop we will show from scratch how to install and set up an Ethereum node both for Execution Layer, Consensus Layer and validators.

speakers.name: Antonio Salazar Cardozo
speakers.description: Antonio Salazar Cardozo is the CTO of Thesis, Head of Engineering of Tally Ho, and a software pragmatist who values great software that is written for humans first. As a relatively outgoing engineer, he‚Äôll likely look at your shoes instead of his when he‚Äôs talking to you.

title: Against Monoculture: Applying the Rules of Nature to the Web3 Ecosystem
description: While monoculture is the rule in the human-planned agricultural industry, it is exceedingly rare in the natural world. Wild forests and fields are teeming with thousands of different organisms ‚Äì so many that no single contagion can take down the whole. This is how ecosystems endure, grow, and thrive. And just like in nature, diversity is what will make the Web3 ecosystem strong and resilient to attacks: a diversity of clients, pools, community members, ideas, digital wallets, and more.

speakers.name: Maksim Izmaylov
speakers.description:
Maksim Izmaylov is a serial entrepreneur with the background in software engineering and law. He thinks that blockchain and other technologies can help us create a better world, e.g. reduce inequality.

He founded two travel startups, Roomstorm and Winding Tree, and Travel Tech Con, a conference for startups and software engineers from the travel industry.

title: Decentralization and Sustainability: A Case Study
description: Sustainable behavior should not be just about offsetting carbon, eating less meat, and taking shorter showers. These efforts are dwarfed by the fact that most human activities are facilitated by intermediaries that extract 20-30% transaction fees. Decentralization and DAOs offer a surprising answer to this conundrum.

speakers.name: Roberto Saltini
speakers.description: Roberto is currently leading the Dependable Distributed Systems research team at ConsenSys. His main research interests revolve around the design, analysis and formal verification of distributed protocols.

title: Formal Specification and Verification of the Distributed Validator Technology protocol
description: In this talk, we present our work on formally specifying and verifying the Distributed Validator Technology (DVT) protocol, using the verification-ready programming language Dafny, to ensure that the DVT protocol behaves as expected. You will learn how to read the formal specification, how to use it to write your own implementation of the protocol, what properties we have formally proven to be guaranteed by the protocol and what the future directions of the DVT protocol and our work are.

speakers.name: Adrian Hamelink
speakers.description: Cryptography engineer @ Aztec

title: Survey of aggregation and batching techniques for SNARKs
description: In the last few years, many techniques have been discovered to speed up SNARKs using proof aggregation and batching. This talk is a survey of some of these primitives, which are described using a framework for designing modular and recursive SNARKs.

speakers.name: Emilie Raffo
speakers.description:
Emilie Raffo is a founding partner and the sales director of ChainSecurity, a top-tier blockchain security company specialized in smart contract audits. ChainSecurity served many large DeFi protocols such as MakerDAO, Compound, Curve and others.

She is also a 2021 best-selling author in Switzerland. Her book "le Futur des Esp√®ces" explains blockchain, cryptocurrency and smart contracts to the novice, and explores how these technologies  can foster innovations in monetary policy & governance.

title: 2022 statistics on DAO governance
description: A quick recap of 2022 governance statistics for DAOs: Who holds voting power in the largest DAOs? What are the average participation levels? How have the participation levels evolved in light of new governance incentivization mechanisms? In which large DAOs can we find the highest participation levels and what are they doing right?

speakers.name: Moises Ruiz Diaz
speakers.description: Cybersecurity Engineer

title: Explotando Smart Contracts hasta su destrucci√≥n total
description: Las auditorias de Smart Contracts, a pesar de todos los da√±os, robos, estafas en las que se ven afectados los proyectos deFi a trav√©s de vulnerabilidades explotadas por expertos, aun hoy en dia son vistas como un simple "check" en el cumplimiento del proyecto haciendo que no se tenga en cuenta la seguridad desde el inicio y utilizarla de manera cross durante todo el ciclo de vida de desarrollo.

speakers.name: Josselin Feist
speakers.description: Josselin Feist is a principal security engineer at Trail of Bits where he leads the blockchain team, participates in security assessments, and designs automated bug-finding tools for smart contracts. He holds a Ph.D. in static analysis and symbolic execution and regularly speaks at both academic and industrial conferences. He is the author of various security tools, including Slither - a static analyzer for Ethereum smart contracts and Tealer - a static analyzer for Algorand contracts.

title: Building secure contracts: Use Echidna like a pro
description: In this workshop, attendees will gain hands-on experience with Echidna - an open-source smart contract fuzzer - to build secure smart contracts. Echidna has been used in many professional audits, and fuzzing is a key component to increasing the contracts‚Äô security. Attendees will learn how to define and write invariants and how to use Echidna efficiently. By the end of the session, they will know how to integrate property testing into their development process and write more secure code.

speakers.name: Jonadas Techio
speakers.description: Jonadas Techio is a certified Blockchain Solutions Architect and Web3 Evangelist at Axur Cybersecurity (axur.com). He is also a senior researcher, with more than 11 years of academic experience working at the Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul, University of Chicago and University of Leipzig. He is the author of the ebook ‚ÄúDigital Risks in Blockchain and Web3‚Äù, available for free download at https://bit.ly/3G33wTO. He is also the author of the TecnoFilo podcast.

title: Digital Risks in Blockchain and Web3
description: The talk introduces the main types of risks and vulnerabilities that affect companies and users of blockchain and Web3, as well as key safety precautions. Risks include: (1) technological vulnerabilities (e.g., 51% attacks, sybil attacks); (2) vulnerabilities of implementation (e.g. affecting wallets and smart contracts); and finally (3) user-oriented attacks (e.g. Ransomware, Malware, Blind Signing, Rug Pulls and Phishing).

speakers.name: David Kretzler
speakers.description: After graduating from DHBW Karlsruhe in cooperation with the SEW-Eurodrive GmbH & Co KG in 2016 with a bachelor's degree in Business Informatics, I began my master's degree in Computer Science at TU Darmstadt. In 2018, I started a parallel Master's degree in IT-Security. My Master studies in Computer Science were completed in May 2019 and in IT-Security in October 2019. I have started my PhD at the Applied Cryptography Research Group at TU Darmstadt on October 1st, 2019.

title: Prisma: A Tierless Language for Enforcing Contract-Client Protocols in Decentralized Applications
description:
Typically, contracts and clients are written separately in different programming languages. This makes distributed program flow hard to reason about and increases the potential of errors which can lead to financial losses.
We propose PRISMA, a tierless language for dApps, where contracts and clients are defined in one unit. Communication is in direct-style, similar to async/await. This enables expressing distributed program flow via standard control flow and prevents mismatching communication.

speakers.name: Jonathan Prieto-Cubides
speakers.description: I am a Colombian researcher and explorer who loves visiting new cities and learning about new cultures, languages, food, and life in general. I am especially interested in formalizing mathematics and, more recently, in constructing proof checkers and programming languages.

title: Juvix: towards a more robust and reliable alternative for writing validity predicates
description: Juvix is a new programming language designed to be more reliable and trustworthy than existing languages for writing smart contracts in general, but with special attention to writing validity predicates on the Anoma ledger. The language features static typing, special support for compiling to the C language, and a variety of other language features. In this talk, we'll be showing off some of these features and how Juvix can be used to write a fungible token.

speakers.name: Steve Newcomb
speakers.description: Steve Newcomb is a product/engineering led serial entrepreneur who has co-founded four successful venture backed mission-driven startups. He funded and sat on the board of Node.JS & jQuery, and was a senior fellow at the UC Berkeley School of Engineering. He is best known for co-founding Powerset which became Microsoft Bing and is now the CPO at MatterLabs.

title: zkRollups and Layer 3
description: Steve Newcomb, CPO of Matter Labs, will be exploring how zkRollups can scale beyond just Layer two solutions and discuss what's coming in Layer 3. We will discuss key issues like native versus non-native bridges, impact on security, ways in which Layer 3 can inherit Ethereum security, and what to expect in terms of transaction speeds and gas fees.

speakers.name: Shugo
speakers.description: Co-founder/ CEO Phi

title: What is the„ÄÄweb3 metaverse?
description:
Existing metaverse land projects are finite. An operating entity prefers to sell a finite amount of land to make a profit. As a result, the land becomes expensive, which makes the metaverse closed and exclusive.

Essentially, Web3 needs to be inclusive and a network where everyone can participate. Focusing on the inclusive nature of the Internet, we aim to construct a metaverse in which the laws of the Internet world, rather than the laws of the physical world, are applied.

speakers.name: Jonadas Techio
speakers.description: Jonadas Techio is a certified Blockchain Solutions Architect and Web3 Evangelist at Axur Cybersecurity (axur.com). He is also a senior researcher, with more than 11 years of academic experience working at the Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul, University of Chicago and University of Leipzig. He is the author of the ebook ‚ÄúDigital Risks in Blockchain and Web3‚Äù, available for free download at https://bit.ly/3G33wTO. He is also the author of the TecnoFilo podcast.

title: Wallets as identities on Web3: what they are, how to create them and how to keep them safe
description: Workshop teaching participants what wallets are, what types exist, and how they connect and allow users to interact with blockchains. After those explanations I show how to create "hot" wallets (Metamask extension + Rainbow mobile), how to save seed phrases and how to use them for account transfer and recovery. At the end, I present a series of practical security tips involving keys and seed phrases, accompanied by examples of the most common frauds and ways to avoid them.

speakers.name: Steve Newcomb
speakers.description: Steve Newcomb is a product/engineering led serial entrepreneur who has co-founded four successful venture backed mission-driven startups. He funded and sat on the board of Node.JS & jQuery, and was a senior fellow at the UC Berkeley School of Engineering. He is best known for co-founding Powerset which became Microsoft Bing and is now the CPO at MatterLabs.

title: zkSync 2.0 workshop
description: Steve Newcomb, CPO of MatterLabs, will build a dApp on zkSync 2.0.

speakers.name: Tynan Richards
speakers.description: Blockchain Security Engineer for ChainSecurity

title: Underhanded Solidity
description: A brief description of the exploit behind the winning submission to the Underhanded Solidity Contest 2022.

speakers.name: Alan Estrada
speakers.description: Web 3.0 builder. Co-founder of Open Web Academy, Nativo NFT and Burrito Battle. Learning of blockchain since 2016.

speakers.name: Irving Cancino
speakers.description: Google Professor Lv2 , Blockchain Enthusiast ‚ãà, Building for Open Web Academy and in search of a free education.

title: NEAR Certified Aurora Developer

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
Aurora Network is the EVM of NEAR Protocol. It is in the top 10 of EVM's by TVL on DefiLlama.com. Running over NEAR Protocol make it a fast and secure  network to run solidity smart contracts.

NEAR Certified Aurora Developer is an official NEAR Protocol program that certify developers as Solidity developers on Aurora. This is a full week training being runned online by Open Web Academy. 

In this talk you will found details about what is Aurora, NEAR Protocol and certification programs.

speakers.name: Mariano Conti
speakers.description: Mariano Conti saw the birth of Defi up close and is one of its first real world users. During his time at MakerDAO, he helped build the Maker Protocol and Dai Stablecoin, the first decentralized stablecoin built on Ethereum. He's currently an angel investor, NFT collector, and friend of Ethereum.

title: Living on Defi: 3 years later
description: Join Mariano Conti as he gives an update to his widely shared 2019 Devcon V talk which covered living exclusively on Defi.

speakers.name: David Carvajal
speakers.description: Mechanical and Electronics engineer, blockchain developer and CTO at Tropykus Finance. Passionate about financial inclusion and sustainability. Have been part and led of several projects involved in agriculture and energy. Co-founded Cannvest, a blockchain powered investment platform for the cannabis industry in Colombia.Currently, working at Tropykus on how to close the credit gap for the people of LATAM using DeFi.

title: Latin America's agricultural potential unleashed
description: Latin America is the most biodiverse region in the world, yet one of the least explored. In this talk, we will discuss how can data feeds, micro lending, real time insurance and blockchain, can leverage the development of sustainable farming processes having a primary impact in lower income communities that produce specialized products for more developed markets.

speakers.name: ANDRXS
speakers.description: Raised in Moscow. Educated in Switzerland. Shaped in New York City. Building human-computer interfaces for the past 12 years. Author of a ‚Äútwo-swipes‚Äù interface. In crypto since 2017. Current product chief at LinkDrop

title: What design principles will shape the future of crypto products
description:
I will cover the following topics:

1. Quick introduction. ‚Äî **1 minute**
2. The role of a product designer in web3. ‚Äî **2 minutes**
3. What is the difference between designing web2 and web3 applications ‚Äî **5 minutes**
4. What UX patterns and design principles every designer in crypto should know? ‚Äî **10 minutes**
5. Closing thoughts and Q&A ‚Äî **2 minutes**

speakers.name: Andrei
speakers.description: Dev @ Kleros

title: Proof of Humanity: the Soulbound Update
description: Proof of Humanity is a system combining webs of trust with reverse Turing tests and dispute resolution to create a sybil-proof list of humans. The new version being developed brings soul ids, requiring each unique human to be mapped to an unique id. This talk will give an overview of this new version and the implications of soulbound identity in areas such as governance, reputation, access and others.

speakers.name: Federico Kunze K√ºllmer
speakers.description: Federico Kunze K√ºllmer is Co-Founder of Evmos, a protocol designed to enable seamless interoperability between Ethereum and the IBC-enabled blockchains of the Cosmos ecosystem. This latest effort is part of his multi-year work building the foundations of the Internet of Blockchains, a new and hyper-scalable paradigm that sees blockchains as independent projects to be connected in a web. Fede has been a core contributor to a number of Cosmos projects including Tendermint, the Cosmos SDK, IBC, Gra

title: Empowering dApp Developers with the Infrastructure for Interoperability, Revenue Generation, Shared Security, and More
description: Developers have flocked to the Web3 space to build dApps, but the barriers to entry can be quite high, and it‚Äôs often a challenge to monetize what‚Äôs built to sustain ongoing development efforts. Infrastructural solutions can enable devs to offload the challenges of making their dApps work seamlessly with users, wallets, and assets across blockchains and major ecosystems like Cosmos and the EVM.

speakers.name: Erin Koen
speakers.description: Erin worked from 2006-2016 as a foreign exchange options broker at ICAP and assorted joint ventures thereof. There, he managed the negotiation and execution of complex options transactions between sophisticated counterparties and covered clients on three continents. He earned his MBA from NYU Stern School of Business in 2017. Because it provided zero help in getting a job in crypto, he learned to write code at Lambda School in 2019 while spending a good portion of his time experimenting in DeFi.

title: The Treasury Dilemma: How DAOs can maximise opportunities and turn idle treasuries into strategic assets
description:
Treasuries help DAOs fund critical development, attract contributors and grow the network. But they also serve as a powerful way to turn idle cash reserves into yield-generating returns.

In this talk, we‚Äôll explore:

* The principles of DAO treasury management
* How Ethereum-based d‚Äôapps like Enzyme can serve as effective treasury management solutions
* What DAO tooling is needed? This includes risk management policies, trader delegation, 24/7 NAV reporting and more

speakers.name: James Geary
speakers.description: James is building Channel, a web3 creator-community platform. He previously worked at Zora, Numerai and ConsenSys, and studied CS at Stanford.

title: Channel: a composable media network
description: Channel is building tools for podcasters and their fans like nonfungible memberships, token-gated RSS and community treasuries. https://www.channel.xyz/about

speakers.name: Antonio Salazar Cardozo
speakers.description: Antonio Salazar Cardozo is the CTO of Thesis, Head of Engineering of Tally Ho, and a software pragmatist who values great software that is written for humans first. As a relatively outgoing engineer, he‚Äôll likely look at your shoes instead of his when he‚Äôs talking to you.

title: Monetary Maximalism: Moving Beyond the Bitcoin vs. Ethereum Mentality
description: Unlike many Bitcoin maximalists, Matt Luongo (CEO of Thesis*) doesn‚Äôt believe the technology is ‚Äúdone‚Äù. His belief in a person‚Äôs right to finance drives him‚Äîand the projects he grows under Thesis*‚Äîto push the edges of the protection technology can extend. The cross-chain rivalries, as fun as they are, are ultimately a distraction. Luongo‚Äôs sights are set elsewhere: growing cross-chain harmony and uniting Bitcoin and Ethereum to support and improve one another.

speakers.name: Alex Bazhenov
