speakers.description: Alex has been in crypto since 2017 and currently works as a senior software engineer Thesis where he is working on a decentralized and fully-open-source web3 wallet.  He has previously worked in high frequency trading in the TradFi world as well as a centralized cryptocurrency exchange.

title: How Wallets Keep You Safe.  A look at the past, present, and future of wallet security.
description: A walk through some famous vulnerabilities affecting web3 wallet users and their mitigations - as well as well as an overview of some attacks that are currently possible that can be fixed with improved UI, UX, or security practices.

speakers.name: Ryan Noble
speakers.description:
Heavily distracted by gaming, now focusing on it formally. 

History in dapp development but will tinker with any language or platform I can implement with

title: The State of Web3 Gaming
description:
A talk covering the industry landscape, a few notable projects in prod, some insights on traditional gaming's interpretation of Web3 gaming and their forays into the space.

Then primarily focusing on the development space, tooling and the hurdles involved in innovating in moving into the space. 

Ending with some case studies from our own community of builders using the ChainSafe Gaming SDK

speakers.name: Han Liu
speakers.description: Dr. Han Liu is a senior research scientist of University College Oxford Blockchain Research Centre and the founder of Committable. He obtained his doctoral degree in software engineering from Tsinghua University, China. His research focuses on blockchain, smart contracts, cryptocurrency, trustless technology and software engineering. He has published over 30 top-tier academic papers and was invited to speak on smart contract security at Devcon IV and V.

title: Committable: A decentralized open-source protocol for Ethereum and Web3
description: This talk introduces the Committable open-source protocol for Ethereum and Web3. The core insight is a trustless monetization technology that tokenizes commits as NFTs. Each NFT reflects developer contributions via unbiased abstractions of development processes. Committable establishes an open-source economy where participants are incentivized to own contributive NFTs and earn with them. This talk also describes Committable‚Äôs integrations with popular open-source projects, e.g., go-ethereum.

speakers.name: Antonio Salazar Cardozo
speakers.description: Antonio Salazar Cardozo is the CTO of Thesis, Head of Engineering of Tally Ho, and a software pragmatist who values great software that is written for humans first. As a relatively outgoing engineer, he‚Äôll likely look at your shoes instead of his when he‚Äôs talking to you.

title: The Web3 Credit Union: Building the first-ever wallet-based DAO with Tally
description: Tally Ho! is the first Web3 wallet built and owned by its users. We‚Äôre open source, accessible to everyone, 100% community owned, and believe your portal to Web3 is a public good. The next step in our evolution will be to launch the Tally Ho! DAO. Join us as we talk about the potential, power, and challenges that creating the first wallet-based DAO will face.

speakers.name: Han Liu
speakers.description: Dr. Han Liu is a senior research scientist of University College Oxford Blockchain Research Centre and the founder of Committable. He obtained his doctoral degree in software engineering from Tsinghua University, China. His research focuses on blockchain, smart contracts, cryptocurrency, trustless technology and software engineering. He has published over 30 top-tier academic papers and was invited to speak on smart contract security at Devcon IV and V.

title: Committable: the open-source infrastructure for Ethereum and Web3
description: This talk introduces the Committable open-source protocol for Ethereum and Web3. The core insight is a trustless monetization technology that tokenizes commits as NFTs. Each NFT reflects developer contributions via unbiased abstractions of development processes. Committable establishes an open-source economy where participants are incentivized to own contributive NFTs and earn with them. This talk also describes Committable‚Äôs integrations with popular open-source projects, e.g., go-ethereum.

speakers.name: Adam Gagol
speakers.description: Adam is the CTO and Co-Founder at Aleph Zero. He received Ph.D. in mathematics for his work on applications of probabilistic methods in combinatorics. During his doctoral studies, he was a beneficent of a SET project for interdisciplinary research and SSDNM fellowship for mathematical sciences. While his main domain is combinatorics, he is open to new technologies and has 4 years of experience in data science and machine learning applied in neuroscience research.

title: Beyond ZKPs: Rough systematization of blockchain privacy
description: For now, blockchain privacy is associated almost exclusively with ZKPs (mostly ZK-SNARKs, recently also ZK-STARKs), but in fact it is only one of privacy paradigms, which has its limitations. During the talk, Adam will present a rough framework describing what can and can not be achieved with ZKP, TEE, MPC, and FHE, in the context of privacy on blockchain.

speakers.name: John Shutt
speakers.description: John Shutt is a smart contract engineer at Risk Labs, the team behind UMA, Across, and Outcome. He has been working on cryptocurrency, anarchist hackerspaces, and encrypted messaging systems for over a decade.

title: Using an Oracle to Secure Quadrillions of Dollars for Thousands of Years

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: This talk explores the hard problem of oracle correctness and security with a large-scale and long-term perspective. How can we build a generalized truth machine to stand the test of time? I will outline an optimistic oracle system where the active clients of the oracle are also the dispute resolvers, acting cooperatively. The weight of their total value secured, like the weight of the stones in an arch, is what holds the oracle structure together, allowing the TVS to scale up and down safely.

speakers.name: Raphael Mazet
speakers.description: Rapha√´l is the co-founder and CEO of SimpleFi, a data analytics platform for DeFi (Decentralized Finance). He has founded several blockchain-based social impact and DeFi protocols since 2016, including Alice.si. Rapha√´l is former lobbyist, a French-British british coder and currently lives in sunny Lisbon.

title: DeFi: Dos and Don'ts in bulls and bears
description: Ever wondered who is making money from LPing? And whether yield farming actually makes a profit? We've analyzed the most (and least) profitable accounts in DeFi, and present the strategies that generate the best returns in both bull and bear markets. We'll also give insights into how to avoid getting rekt on your LP and yield farming investments. And we'll explain how you can generate your own analytics to get deeper insights into DeFi.

speakers.name: Kohei.eth
speakers.description: I build DAO staff. I‚Äôm currently building a delegation tool "Beam" and running a weekly recap newsletter & podcast "This Week in DAOs". I previously led Japan Team at Index Coop. 23, from Japan.

title: How to delegate your voting rights
description: Delegation is a top priority for DAO governance, yet many people still delegate to Influencers, random selection on the spot, or do not participate in governance activities while having their voting rights. This presentation will share the importance of delegation and how to find the best delegate for you.

speakers.name: Henri
speakers.description: I explain to people what StarkNet is and how they can build cool stuff on top of it

title: Why are people getting excited about ZK Rollups
description:
People often associate L2s with more transactions and lower costs. But there is much more to it.
I'll explore concepts such as:
- Computational complexity: giving more computation power to dapps
- Account abstraction: redefining user experience
- L3s: building the cross chain futur we dreamt for
- Storage proofs: Blockchain analytics from another chain, on chain
- Trustless bridging: enabling more than just moving money

speakers.name: Klaus Kursawe
speakers.description: Klaus has first started working on Byzantine Consensus during his PhD in 1998, where he build a fully asynchronous consensus layer. He then explored and published in other areas of digital security including secure hardware, privacy preserving technologies, and security for critical infrastructures, before returning to further work on Byzantine fault tolerance. He currently works for Vega protocol.

title: Fair Ordering Protocols and MEV

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: This presentation sums up work done on 'fair' ordering protocols that attempt to control MEV by implementing a distributed sequencing protocol which eliminates the ability of single or small groups of validators to control the order of transactions. Issues around the proper definition of 'fairness', integration, limits, and the relationship to commit&reveal schemes will be covered.

speakers.name: Milos Novitovic
speakers.description:
For the last three years since I joined the Web3 industry, I mainly worked as a product manager, discovering, shaping, and developing different Web3 projects.
For the last year and a half, I joined our R&D department and focused on generating and validating early-stage ideas while focusing on cutting-edge technology.
I worked and shaped each 3327 experiment (https://3327.io/projects/) and worked on the most of MVPW‚Äôs products (https://mvpworkshop.co/portfolio/)
https://bit.ly/3AbLPAC

speakers.name: Uros Kukic
speakers.description: I'm a long-time solidity developer and a researcher at 3327. Always interested in new technologies and getting a clear understanding of various topics.

title: How to Stay up to date with all the movements and the rise of new technologies
description: Following a vast technology field with thousands of projects, protocols, tools, and frameworks is complex. Inspired by ThoughtWorks, we decided to map all these Web3 technologies, present them using a radar metaphor, and give them as a public good. This initiative helps developers understand different ecosystems and technology stacks in the Web3 universe. It further allows them to create their radars. This talk will introduce this methodology framework to help tech teams make better decisions.

speakers.name: Roberto Saltini
speakers.description: Roberto is currently leading the Dependable Distributed Systems research team at ConsenSys. His main research interests revolve around the design, analysis and formal verification of distributed protocols.

title: Formal Verification of the Safety of the Fork Choice Python Reference Implementation
description:
The Ethereum Consensus Layer Fork Choice is not only responsible for providing liveness to the Ethereum Beacon Chain, but also to ensure some critical safety properties like that honest validators will never be slashed.
In this talk, we present our work on formally verifying fundamental safety properties of the Fork Choice Python reference implementation. We also touch on future formal verification work of the Ethereum Consensus Layer.

speakers.name: Qinwen Wang
speakers.description:
China Community Lead at Web3 Foundation
Polkadot Network Councilor
Co-Producer of Virtual Niche ‚Äî the World‚Äôs First Crypto Art Exhibition
Top NFT Collector to Curate Sotheby's Natively Digital 1.2ÔºöThe Collectors
Co-Founder of REAL Cam

title: NFT Trends to Revolutionize Decentralized Social
description: From Mona Lisa and Girl with a Pearl Earring to Cryptopunks and BAYC, a crypto-native culture has been formed. Each community contributor can be represented by NFTs, whose ownership can easily be verified. The greatness of NFT lies in its mission to make up for the lack of "digital ownership" of "non-standard virtual objects" in the online world left by Sir Tim Berners-Lee. We are exploring a way to magnify the usage of NFTs in social media with easily verified ownership.

speakers.name: Chuck Ko
speakers.description: Chuck is currently the VP of Product at imToken after working on some of the world's largest e-wallets including PayPal, Paytm and Alipay.

title: Mass adoption - Token-centric design for an average person
description:
Token-centric design consists of:
1. Token Centric: focuses on accurate and real-time tracking, securing and presenting the state and value of a token. A combination of robust data architecture, value added layer to support well defined UX to provide a reliable, comprehensive and comprehensible view. 
2. Universal account: abstracts blockchain address that user can easily relate to, cross-chain and cross accounts. A more intuitive UX becomes feasible.

speakers.name: Juan Benet
speakers.description: Juan Benet is founder and CEO of Protocol Labs, a research, development, and deployment lab driving breakthroughs in computing to push humanity forward. Benet studied Computer Science at Stanford University and is passionate about knowledge, science, and technology. In 2018, Benet was named one of Fortune magazine's "40 under 40," recognized for his work creating IPFS.

title: What will the internet look like in 2050?
description: A global computer-based communication network has fundamentally changed our social, cultural, and political landscape over the past 30 years. There has been no previous communication revolution of this speed or intensity. This communication tool gives us the power to completely restructure our entire existence, both on an individual and collective level. , Juan will situate its emergence within the context of our  technological evolution, and try to pontificate its potential development.

speakers.name: Han Liu
speakers.description: Dr. Han Liu is a senior research scientist of University College Oxford Blockchain Research Centre and the founder of Committable. He obtained his doctoral degree in software engineering from Tsinghua University, China. His research focuses on blockchain, smart contracts, cryptocurrency, trustless technology and software engineering. He has published over 30 top-tier academic papers and was invited to speak on smart contract security at Devcon IV and V.

title: TMI: Tokenomics Made Easy
description: This talk introduces TMI as a design and research tool for tokenomics. The core contributions of TMI are twofold, i.e., i) a domain-specific language for modeling tokenomics designs and ii) a language runtime to automatically generate token simulations and check specified economic properties. TMI creates a standard for Web3 participants to develop common understanding on tokenomics and further facilitate the improvement of it. This talk also describes case-studies of popular projects with TMI.

speakers.name: Maxim Legg
speakers.description: I am Founder and CTO of Superchain Network. We are building core Web3 infrastructure and will launch our cross chain data services as a consensus indexing protocol next year. I have worked on a series of blockchain projects since 2016 building on Hyperledger, Bitcoin, Stella and Ethereum. Previously I was Lead Engineer at an Innovation Lab for investment banks in London. In summary I have been 4 years full time in crypto and I have 18 years‚Äô experience in software engineering and infrastructure.

title: The Web3 Business Model
description: Web3 is overly centralised. Dapps claiming to be ‚ÄúWeb3 native‚Äù are usually built on top of a handful of Web2 technologies. Furthermore, the centralisation of Web3 dependencies has lead to an abuse of user data, central points of failure and control, and has resulted in a lack of provenance. I present the Web3 business model, principles and key projects that are making a Decentralised and open Internet a reality and share my experience of building a decentralised protocol.

speakers.name: Alberto Centelles
speakers.description: I'm a mathematician and a cryptography researcher at Heliax. My current focus is on finding new ways to bring private decentralised systems closer to the real world.

title: Private bartering with Taiga
description: Private decentralised exchanges enable users to trade digital assets without giving up custody of these assets to a third party. Taiga provides general programmability for private bartering, thus enabling the surge of applications such as subscriptions or content-based bartering. Taiga is designed from the ground up using the state of the art in proving systems, Plonk, leveraging the value of validity predicates to avoid race conditions and programmability.

speakers.name: Brian Sztamfater
speakers.description: Software Architect, Tech Entrepreneur and Author with +12 years of experience developing apps for +25 global startups / enterprise / Fortune 500 companies. Made in üá¶üá∑.

title: ClojureScript: A language for making secure, privacy-focused decentralized mobile messenger at Status
description: ClojureScript is a not so popular programming language. At Status, we happily incorporated it as one of our main languages to build a secure, privacy-focused decentralized mobile messenger. Also, and not surprisingly, Clojure took the second place of "most loved languages" category in the latest StackOverflow industry survey, just behind Rust. Let's quickly dive into the pros and cons of using ClojureScript using our experience at building Status Mobile Ethereum Wallet.

speakers.name: Ivan
speakers.description: Ivan Liljeqvist is the co-founder and CEO of Moralis. He is responsible for setting the company‚Äôs strategic vision, developing its culture and managing and directing its agendas. Ivan is an international speaker, educator, developer and data scientist. He co-founded Moralis with Filip Martinsson in 2021, after building a tool that would allow developers to create decentralised apps (dapps) without any specific programming knowledge of Web3.

title: Building High-performance Dapps with Moralis
description: A talk given by Ivan Liljeqvist, the founder of Moralis (IvanonTech) about how you can quickly and easily build high performing dapps with Moralis, the full-stack webflow for developers looking to build in web3. We can also provide a talk from Lizette Kuld, head of people at Moralis (LizBitcoin) about building world class web3 teams.

speakers.name: Rodrigo Mendoza-Smith
speakers.description: Rodrigo is Founder & CEO of @quine_sh and @GitNFT. Prior to this, Rodrigo held data-science positions at a number of startups, government labs, and investment funds. Rodrigo earned a PhD in Mathematics from the University of Oxford, where he also pursued postdoctoral research in neural network verification and Machine Learning. Rodrigo‚Äôs interests now lie at the intersection of OSS, Web3, and the future-of-work. In his spare time, he enjoys playing chess, swimming, and coding.

title: Unlocking permissionless work via Machine Learning and Soulbound tokens
description: In web3, permissionless work refers to a labour market in which any qualified individual can contribute to the development of a project in exchange for fees or network equity. For a market of this kind to be meritocratic and truly decentralised it must implement interfaces for algorithmic experience quantification and talent allocation. In this talk we discuss how Machine Learning, open source data, and SBTs can systematise such interfaces and unlock permissionless work for web3 developers.

speakers.name: Jannik Luhn
speakers.description: Hello!

title: DAOplomacy: A Board Game Between DAOs
description: We present DAOplomacy, a board game to be played between DAOs. Not only will it be loads of fun, it will also provide the participants a playground to experiment with different governance mechanisms and decision making processes. The low-risk but high engagement environment is the perfect opportunity for all types of DAOs to learn how to compete and cooperate with each other.

speakers.name: Manank Patni
speakers.description:
Manank has been a Blockchain Developer for 4 years and is currently a blockchain developer at Spheron Network. Previously he has worked with Demodyfi, Hacera, Algorand, EPNS, and Hyperledger where he worked on several blockchain products.
He has a good speaker background with several sessions presented at the Hyperledger Global Forum USA 2020 and Open Source Summit Japan 2020 where he shared the work he did with the Hyperledger Cello project.

title: To many custom chains - Which one to choose ?
description: Web3 world suddenly started booming with multiple chains providing different USPs, but these USPs come with amazing Pros and a few cons, before starting any project, the decision to pick a chain drives major decisions in the future, thus it needs to be taken carefully, this talk will help attendees which chains satisfy their needs and what sort of bottlenecks they might hit in the future.

speakers.name: iFirebrand
speakers.description: Firebrand. Pragmatic Futurist. Author. Dad. üõ† Recreational dev. Web3 & NFTs Solutions Executive. ü¶áüîäValidator.

title: Ukraine & crypto: what worked, what broke down, and why we need trust systems to rebuild

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: This talk is synthesis of crypto projects and initiatives launched as a reaction to the Russian war on Ukraine. Topics may range from fundraising to planning for DAO style insurgency coordination in the event of collapse of centralized command and control. The talk will cover my experience working with NFT projects, the Ukraine DAO, fundraising (and spending!) with unchain.fund, and contrasting to my experience from 2014 working with Razom for Ukraine and United Help Ukraine (and other NGOs).

speakers.name: Yu Du
speakers.description: Mr. Du Yu is  the Vice Chairman of IEEE Computer Society Blockchain Committee,  the head of Wanxiang Blockchain Labs, and member of the National Blockchain and Distributed Ledgers Standardization Committee in China. He has been in charge of the operations, strategy, R&D, incubation and investment of Wanxiang Blockchain since 2015.

title: Bring Ethereum community to massive adoption by leveraging the influence of traditional standard organizations
description: IEEE is the world‚Äôs largest technical professional organization dedicated to advancing technology for the benefit of humanity. This talk will first introduce how IEEE‚Äôs Blockchain Standard Committee develop blockchain standards with experts from Ethereum community and also other blockchain communities. Then we will show how IEEE could bring massive traditional scholars and developers to Ethereum community using the influence of IEEE. Finally, this talk will initiate a program that helps Ethereum

speakers.name: Mischa Tuffield
speakers.description: Mischa is CTO at Boson Protocol. he is a data, privacy and decentralization geek. He has a PhD in Computer Science from the University of Southampton supervised by Professor Sir Nigel Shadbolt, and a MSc in AI from the University of Edinburgh. Mischa has been building on top of Ethereum since 2017 where he built and designed the Monolith Contract Wallet as CTO. He has been building startups since 2008.

title: Boson Protocol - An optimistic fair exchange protocol for commerce
description:
e-Commerce is broken, built by tech giants extracting maximum profits from all.
Boson Protocol (BP) tackles this by enabling automated, trust-minimized exchange of on-chain value for off-chain assets via an optimistic design. BP has been built for the EVM and leverages decentralised infrastructure without the reliance on a centralised entity to enable the fair exchange of on & off-chain assets through tokenized claims. This talk details how BP enables fair exchange via decentralised commerce.

speakers.name: Pedro Alcocer
speakers.description: Data science and machine learning lead on the Lens Protocol at the Aave Companies.

title: Machine Learning and the Lens Protocol: How to do ML with web3 vibes

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Machine learning is typically a compute-intensive task that is prohibitively expensive to do on-chain. In this talk I‚Äôll discuss strategies that Aave and the Lens API have used for training and deploying machine learning models in a way that maintains the transparent and trustless ethos of web3. I‚Äôll also cover how we developed some of the models used in the Lens API and how to contribute your own models to the Lens ecosystem.

speakers.name: Sergio Demian Lerner
speakers.description: Sergio Demian Lerner - Widely recognized as a leading security and cryptocurrency researcher, and a serial entrepreneur, Sergio has co-founded several technology companies such as RSK Labs, Coinspect and ASICBoost. Since 2011, Sergio has collaborated to strengthen the security of the Bitcoin and Ethereum protocols and reference codes, discovering and responsibly disclosing 12 vulnerabilities. In 2015, Sergio collaborated in the design of the Ethereum Ethash mining algorithm and audited Ethereum.

title: FlatDB: Scaling Ethereum by Improving the State DB I/O Efficiency
description: The efficient management of the EVM world state is one of the most important topics in scaling EVM-based blockchains. Yet, only two trie management strategies have emerged: Geth and Erigon.  In this talk we present FlatDB, a new database engine based on hashtables, that is specifically designed to store the world state in Geth-like nodes for all EVM-based blockchains, bringing a 50x speedup in read speed compared to LevelDB or RocksDB, while providing better write performance than LevelDB.

speakers.name: Sam Kazemian
speakers.description: Sam is the Founder of algorithmic stablecoin FRAX (currently a top 5 stablecoin by market cap) and an expert in stability economics. Kazemian‚Äôs crypto journey started at UCLA in 2013 where he began mining crypto in his college dorm room and also became one of the earliest people to mine Doge. He also founded Everipedia, a blockchain-based Wikipedia, and helped put US 2020 election results on the blockchain.

title: The future of algorithmic stablecoins and why it matters
description: The talk will focus on (1) The future of algorithmic stablecoins following recent events, key narratives from the Terra collapse, potential regulation, gradual recovery. (2) Expand on what constitutes a robust collateralization strategy and how FRAX kept a steady peg in May (3) Ideal tokenomic model for a stablecoin: how can algo stablecoins function in all conditions? (4) Clarify the purpose of stablecoins in the wider crypto ecosystem.

speakers.name: Kris Kaczor
speakers.description: Transparency bringer at L2BEAT. Open source maintainer at dEth. Ex. Senior Software Engineer at MakerDAO.

title: Tips and tricks for cross-domain devs
description: Cross-domain development raises new interesting challenges. Maintaining two sets of smart contracts that suppose to talk to each during all sorts of network conditions is not exactly trivial. There is a good reason why bridge hacks are so popular. This talk is about lessons learned from building the official DAI bridge for Optimism and Arbitrum rollups.

speakers.name: Kevin Owocki
speakers.description: Kevin Owocki is the founder of Gitcoin.co ‚Äî Where builders & funders come together to build the open web.  Gitcoin has delivered $60mm worth of value to OSS devs in the last several years. He has a BS in Computer Science, 15 years of engineering leadership experience in Open Source Software and Web Startups. Kevin is a community organizer in the Boulder Colorado Tech Scene.

title: Decentralized Society + Coordination = Regenerative Society  üå±‚ú®
description:
A few months ago, Vitalik Buterin, Glen Weyl, and Puja Ohlhaver released their paper Decentralized Society: Finding Web3's Soul. In this paper, we learned how SoulBound tokens and DIDs/VCs could be used to  coordinate a diverse set of actors with a rich data set of attestations about them - allowing plural Identity that creates cooperation across social distance.

In this talk, we explore the concepts of DeSoc + the eventual outcome of a Regenerative Decentralized Society.

speakers.name: Jonas Klemm
speakers.description:
Jonas works on the stablecoin protocol Gyroscope, where he focuses on integrations and governance. 

He previously worked on the Research Team at Binance and the Innovation Team of the European Central Bank, where he focused on market research and stablecoins. Jonas holds two MSc in International Business and a BSc in Industrial Engineering and has strong interest in institutions and governance.

title: Sybil challenges: How to avoid 'DAO-capture' by airdrop farmers
description:
A problem in bootstrapping DAOs is the presence of ‚Äòairdrop farmers‚Äô: users who interact with a new protocol from multiple addresses hoping to receive a future airdrop to each address.

The core team at Gyroscope rolled out a new approach to control for airdrop farmers: ‚ÄòSybil Challenges‚Äô.

Each of the 19 sybil challenges proxied for identity or activity on multiple platforms: be it Minecraft, Discord, or DeFi. Weighting and layering these checks allows filtering for plausibly unique actors.

speakers.name: Max Hampshire
speakers.description: Max is Developer Relations for Nym. He was previously a smart contract developer, writer, and artist.

title: Presenting the Nym Mixnet: Layer-0 Network Privacy for Dapps
description: This talk will cover the overall network architecture of Nym and the technologies it provides: the Mixnet and our private credential scheme Coconut. Following this it will explore the types of privacy enhanced apps Ethereum developers can build to utilise Nym's privacy features, such as private Walletconnect servers when sending transactions. Finally it will explain how Eth developers can integrate wallets and applications with Nym.

speakers.name: Kevin Owocki
speakers.description: Kevin Owocki is the founder of Gitcoin.co ‚Äî Where builders & funders come together to build the open web.  Gitcoin has delivered $60mm worth of value to OSS devs in the last several years. He has a BS in Computer Science, 15 years of engineering leadership experience in Open Source Software and Web Startups. Kevin is a community organizer in the Boulder Colorado Tech Scene.

speakers.name: Justin Holmes
speakers.description: International touring musician; blockchain bluegrass and video game traditionals.

title: The Coordination Song üåé‚ú®üéµ
description:
You've heard that public goods are good.  You've heard that crypto can regenerative the world.  But have you heard the song?

Join noted web3 musiciian Justin Myles for a musical ensemble about coordination, regenerative crypto, public goods.

speakers.name: Viktor Tron
speakers.description: Viktor Tron is the president of the Swarm Foundation. He worked for the Ethereum Foundation since the start and became team lead of the Swarm project. Viktor is committed to the ideal of a free voluntary society, he has a keen interest in decentralisation, cryptography, networking, data structures and algorithms and believes in technology and innovation as the conduit for peaceful social change.

title: data economy - a solarpunk vision
description: This talk reassesses the role of blockchain consensus and emergent ecosystem as the conduit for planetary agorism. On the premise that the world wide web is the platform that implement this vision, recent trends of web3 are to be evaluated for their ability to express a fair data economy, i.e., a  traceable supply chain with a permissionless marketplace. The roadmap is clear; the execution is inevitable therefore the future is bright.

speakers.name: Dapplion
speakers.description: Dapplion is currently the Team Lead for Lodestar, the Ethereum Consensus TypeScript client maintained by ChainSafe Systems. He is also currently the Merge Coordinator for Gnosis Chain and one of the original developers at DappNode.

title: Beacon Chain Experimentations... without explosions.
description: The Ethereum beacon chain is a spectacularly engineered protocol that will live through many future iterations and modifications. It has already been adapted for use as other protocol implementations such as Gnosis Chain leverage open-source protocols for experimentation. How can other chains leverage protocol work from Ethereum for their use? Forking and adopting modified designs is the essence of open-source development, but what tradeoffs do each protocol make with their adaptations?

speakers.name: Audrey Tang
speakers.description: Founder of DRK Lab. Web3 builder. Crypto enthusiast since 2015.

title: Lean in: Women in Web3
description: Through the discussions with Web3 female practitioners, explore the opportunities, dilemmas, and challenges faced by women in the blockchain field. Discuss how to resolve the problems and move forward.

speakers.name: Jaya Klara Brekke
speakers.description: CSO of Nym, decentralised privacy system and fellow at the Weizenbaum Institute in Berlin. Author of several social sciences papers including "Hacker-engineers and Their Economies: The Political Economy of Decentralised Networks and ‚ÄòCryptoeconomics‚Äô."

title: Philosophy of a privacy preserving token economics
description: Surveillance is still at the core of the internet ripe for abuse the minute a government, CEO or Supreme Court lose their minds. Cryptoeconomics promised to shift the business model from centralised and surveillance-based to decentralised privacy preserving infrastructures. Taking stock of that promise the talk outlines the missing piece of the business model, too often lost between the creativity of cryptoeconomic infrastructural incentives and their bootstrapping by ferocious flows of finance.

speakers.name: Julien Niset
speakers.description: Julien is co-Founder and Chief Science Officer of Argent. He holds a PhD in Physics with a focus on Quantum Information and Quantum Cryptography. Julien is the author of three patents: for quantum random number generation, distribution and use in novel cryptographic schemes. He previously founded  a startup working on Ultra-Fast Quantum Random Number Generators, then worked in the security in IoT.

speakers.name: Itamar Lesuisse
speakers.description: Itamar is co-founder & CEO of Argent, the first smart wallet for crypto, backed by Paradigm. He previously founded and led Peak, the leading mobile brain training platform. It grew to 60 million users and was acquired by Lagardere in 2016. Prior to Peak, Itamar worked at Amazon and VISA and BCG. While at Visa, Itamar authored four payment-related patents and managed the development of V.me, Visa's new ePayment solution. At Amazon, Itamar launched new product lines. He holds a Masters in CS.

title: The Invisible Wallet: How to Make Crypto Magic
description: If ‚Äúany sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic‚Äù it‚Äôs clear that wallets are far from advanced. Seed phrases, fees, approving each transaction; the list goes on. Clunky technical hurdles at every step. How can we fix this by making the technology disappear? In other words, how can we build an invisible wallet? The answer lies with account abstraction. This talk explains how it enables session keys, seedless recovery, gasless transactions and more... magic.

speakers.name: Kevin Owocki
speakers.description: Kevin Owocki is the founder of Gitcoin.co ‚Äî Where builders & funders come together to build the open web.  Gitcoin has delivered $60mm worth of value to OSS devs in the last several years. He has a BS in Computer Science, 15 years of engineering leadership experience in Open Source Software and Web Startups. Kevin is a community organizer in the Boulder Colorado Tech Scene.

title: Transcending Individualism & Collectivism üë±ü§ùüåé
description: Individualists & Collectivists do not agree how to organize society. Individualists have a focus on soveirgnty of their individual needs, self sufficiency, privacy, whereas collectivists are focused on group needs, doing whats best for society.  In this talk we will transcend both perspectives and find new ways that individualists & collectivists could work together in the web3 era.

speakers.name: Loie Taylor
speakers.description: Loie is a facilitator, nurturer, and organizer. In her role as a People Operations lead, she likes to weave workplaces full of compassion and growth. With over 4 years hacking "decentralized HR" in crypto projects, she's deep in the future of work that web3 is birthing. Her roots are in Restorative Justice & activist communities, and she's branched out to start the People Ops Guild & open source the learnings on decentralized people-management that this space has uncovered.

speakers.name: Stefania Chiorboli
speakers.description: People Lead at Rook.

speakers.name: Melanie Davis
speakers.description: Contributor Experience @DXdao_ I DAO and DeFi enthusiast

speakers.name: Ben Perez
speakers.description: I love organisation design, purposeful work, and belonging based on inclusion, ownership and real representation and autonomy

title: Seasons of a Crypto Org: Contributor Care in Bull & Bear
description: From hypergrowth to hard times, members of the People Ops Guild have charioted organizations through extreme weather in the crypto space. Bull markets > massive hiring > rising excitement > too much buidl > burnout > bear markets > layoffs > morale slumps. And so the cycle repeats. Wherever your org is in this process, we‚Äôll touch on what works and what doesn‚Äôt at the various stages as it relates to recruitment, values alignment, contributor wellbeing, and more.

speakers.name: Lane Rettig
speakers.description: Lane Rettig is a writer, hacker, entrepreneur, and investor deeply fascinated by the intersection of technological and social systems, and committed to architecting and building human-centric software. He's been working full time on blockchain R&D since 2017. He was formerly an Ethereum core developer, and now focuses his efforts on Spacemesh, a  a next-generation smart contract platform based on a novel consensus mechanism.

title: Lessons from the Future: Why account abstraction is so hard
description: At Spacemesh we're implementing several ideas that have been proposed in the Ethereum ecosystem such as account abstraction, state expiry, and verkle trees. It's easier to add these to a novel layer one than to bolt them onto an existing network like Ethereum. This talk will review how we've implemented these features, the challenges we encountered, and how we overcame them.

speakers.name: Vita Salvioni Guttmann
speakers.description: Vita is the Chief of Staff at the Urbit Foundation. Prior to that she worked in investing at Pantera Capital, with Arianna Simpson, and at Bridgewater Associates. She also consulted with Fred Ehrsam and the CCI on creatives projects to bring a mass appeal to crypto, and she advised artists from blue-chip art world on NFT launches.

title: Urbit has what DAOs need
description: DAOs are not truly decentralized, autonomous, nor organized... yet. The web3 stack currently is a bandaid, patching up and partially covering a large problem area of web2. Urbit provides two key advantages to Ethereum developers: a place for off-chain state and compute, an interoperable identity system and a unified software stack that makes it possible for communities to build their own tools.

speakers.name: Jonathan Accelnorm
speakers.description: Paralegal, researcher (decentralized justice & government), cybersecurity student. Temporary resident of Venezuela at times from 2017 through 2022, inviting panelists from Venezuela.

title: A Decentralized Society Sandbox for Venezuela and the World?
description:
Despite all the crypto revolution hype, Venezuelans remain bound to a regime that imposes oppression within deteriorated infrastructure.

What if we took the main enablings of Ethereum for a decentralized society sandbox in collaboration with an oppressed society?

The people of a peninsula in Venezuela are working on conducting a referendum and living the dream of freedom and liberation. Come learn about why this is necessary, projects that can be offered, and what assistance is needed.

speakers.name: Travis Cannell
speakers.description: Travis is the Head of Product for Orchid Labs where he oversees the development and growth marketing for the company. Prior to joining Orchid, Travis spent 14 years as a user acquisition manager for Fortune 500 companies such as Intuit and Experian.

title: Probabilistic Rollups: Scaling, Large Numbers, and Lotteries
description: Might it be possible to send a payment with each CPU instruction? How about with each data packet going over a network? I‚Äôll describe the overhead and tradeoffs between using different layer two rollup solutions through the lens of trying to send nanopayments, a critical design constraint for Orchid‚Äôs ecosystem. Orchid‚Äôs ‚Äúprobabilistic rollup‚Äù is compared to optimistic rollups and zero-knowledge rollups so you can understand a third way of rolling up transactions by harnessing probability.

speakers.name: Daniel Fowler
speakers.description: Dan Fowler has been involved with the development of Ethereum and Music over the past 7 years. Previously mentoring startups from within the industry, and leading Strategy and Operations at JAAK, he has been engaged with and helped shape the growth of this emerging industry from conception. He is currently Director of Open Source Projects at HIFI Labs where he is leading the development of open source and public good work.

speakers.name: timdaub
speakers.description: Tim has focused on developing blockchain & media applications at Ascribe, BigchainDB, COALA IP, Ocean Protocol, and is now working on an implementation for Soulbound token within the EIP process: EIP-4973 (Account-bound tokens).

title: Creating a new stage for musicians on Ethereum through commoditized access to data
description: Ethereum is redefining how an artist can develop a career and engage with their fans on their own terms through NFTs and DAOs. However, innovation is stymied by platform-lock and siloed databases. Unlocking utility and scale requires robust infrastructure, which should be composable and open source by design, levelling the playing field for experimentation. This talk will discuss how socially scalable ETL platforms for music NFTs can help musicians create novel interactive experiences.

speakers.name: Itamar Lesuisse
speakers.description: Itamar is co-founder & CEO of Argent, the first smart wallet for crypto, backed by Paradigm. He previously founded and led Peak, the leading mobile brain training platform. It grew to 60 million users and was acquired by Lagardere in 2016. Prior to Peak, Itamar worked at Amazon and VISA and BCG. While at Visa, Itamar authored four payment-related patents and managed the development of V.me, Visa's new ePayment solution. At Amazon, Itamar launched new product lines. He holds a Masters in CS.

title: Are we on a road to nowhere?
description: ‚ÄòWe‚Äôre so early‚Äô. ‚ÄòDon‚Äôt be skeuomorphic‚Äô. 8 years after the Ethereum whitepaper was published, there‚Äôs no shortage of excuses for why crypto has had so little impact on people‚Äôs daily lives. But when will this change? This talk is a call to arms to the community to move on from ponzis and profile pictures. To do this, we discuss the new possibilities that the latest developments in Ethereum enable. And we‚Äôll share our existing and future research for helping Ethereum solve real world problems.

speakers.name: Mike Schneider
speakers.description: Crypto analyst & stablecoin researcher with stablecoins.wtf

title: Stablecoins on Ethereum with focus on risks
description: The risk of stablecoins have become a central topic in the public discussion of defi since the crash of UST and the Terra ecosystem. At stablecoins.wtf, we are informing the market on relevant stablecoin metrics and educating about the different risks associated with the different designs & mechanisms of stablecoins. This risk perspective could be interesting in a panel discussion on stablecoins!

speakers.name: Jonathan Accelnorm
speakers.description: Paralegal, researcher (decentralized justice & government), cybersecurity student. Temporary resident of Venezuela at times from 2017 through 2022, inviting panelists from Venezuela.

title: Governance & Coordination Toward Decentralized Society (DeSoc)
description:
Before we get a decentralized society (DeSoc), coordination toward this goal and governance of pre-sovereignty activities are essential.

DeSoc initially has an emphasis on identity, which can enable the governance of decentralization ideals, manifestations of will, and governance once sovereignty is obtained.

This panel will explore how identity, governance and coordination can be approached for transitioning society toward decentralization beyond financial applications.

speakers.name: Erik Marks
speakers.description: Erik Marks is the Lead Engineer of MetaMask Snaps Platform. He's contributed to MetaMask and Ethereum since 2018, during which time he helped write standards like EIP-1193 and shipped features like the custom network API, MetaMask Swaps, MetaMask Flask, and now Snaps.

title: Getting Started with MetaMask Snaps
description:
[MetaMask Snaps](https://bit.ly/3u8bDKh) is the next phase in [MetaMask](https://metamask.io)'s evolution. First previewed at Devcon V in 2019, we are now focused on growing the Snaps platform and ecosystem, and new features are added every month.

In this workshop, you'll build a Snap from start to finish with the MetaMask Snaps dev team. In the process, you'll learn about all the features you can make use of for Ethereum, Layer 2's, zero knowledge cryptography, and beyond.

speakers.name: Drew Tozer
speakers.description: Drew Tozer is the lead UI/UX designer at Shipyard Software. She‚Äôs based in Nova Scotia. She works on DeFi projects, such as Clipper, MIDAO, WTF Crypto, Foundation for Art and Blockchain, and Codex Protocol. Her UI/UX and Systems design work has been exhibited in Japan, Italy, and Germany. She graduated with a B.A. of Design from NSCAD University in 2020 and also studied interaction design at the Hochschule f√ºr Gestaltung Schw√§bisch Gm√ºnd. Outside of work, she‚Äôs a farmer and linocut printmaker.

title: Data + Empathy: How to approach UX Decisions in Web3

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Data has been useful in Web2 UX/UI design for quantifying user actions to understand what‚Äôs working and not working, but it doesn‚Äôt tell you why they‚Äôre doing that. When you pair participatory design with data design, you can get an effective picture of how and why people use the product. But, the problem is user research is becoming increasingly data heavy. Web3 enables more participatory design because people are aware of their data and are conscious of this type of exploitation.

speakers.name: Tyler Perkins
speakers.description: CMO at Matter Labs

title: Escape Hatch Mechanisms

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
Zero-knowledge rollups are often hailed as scaling solutions that retain the security of Ethereum, but escape hatches, or the mechanism that enables withdrawals if the rollup provider goes down, are often overlooked.

In this lightning talk, we will generally talk about what escape hatches are, why their important, and the properties we should look for in them.

speakers.name: Josh CS
speakers.description: I‚Äôm currently a Developer Relations Engineer at Ankr.com and an active contributor to DeveloperDAO.com and PEEPLE.WORK. I completed my BSc in Business concentrating in Supply Chain Management and Analytics from VCU's School of Business and a Minor of Mathematics in May 2021. What am I passionate about? Coding for humanity. Preserving our home planet. Restoring global food security. Previously, I was a teaching assistant with buildspace.so.

title: My Journey into Web3: Deploying your NFT First Smart Contract
description:
My formal education was at a STEM-focused in high school, but I explored the restaurant industry in college and switched from mechanical engineering to business. When I graduated, job prospects in the tech industry were slim for me - Web3 and Developer DAO changed this for me. Ankr made it a reality.

In this workshop, we'll go over how to deploy your first NFT Smart Contract.

speakers.name: Evan Miyazono
speakers.description: Evan Miyazono leads Network Goods at Protocol Labs, supporting differential technological development in support of human flourishing with new coordination tooling and incentive mechanisms.  This includes designing and deploying mechanisms, identifying and using metascientific leverage points, building new career affordances, and developing better research practices. Prior to leading Network Goods, Evan previously led PL Research.

title: Impact certificates powering regenerative cryptoeconomics
description: How do we incentivize and reward high-impact bets on valuable projects like infrastructure?Regenerative cryptoeconomics intends to combine a cultural paradigm shift with web3 tooling to incentivize positive externalities in a financially sustainable way. Evan will describe specific tools, instruments, and mechanisms; share developmental achievements made so far; and describe how those directions can improve the chances that the world will be improved with user-empowering, web3 driven tech.

speakers.name: Fernando Zavalia
speakers.description: Dapps Engineer @ Decentraland

title: Merkle Proofing the Metaverse
description:
Explain how Decentraland enables the submission and curation of thousands of assets with little to no cost in a single transaction.

To do so, I‚Äôll:

- Introduce the Merkle Tree data structure and algorithm used to verify data integrity.
- Explain its use in bitcoin to validate block transactions integrity and its use on smart contracts to optimize token airdrop claims
- Explain Decentraland‚Äôs solution for the curation of on-chain 3d models
- Explain how it can be used along IPFS

speakers.name: Leonid Logvinov
speakers.description: I'm a software engineer focused on blockchain, DevEx, infra and performance. I've used to work at Quora, 0x, MakerDAO and TokenFlow. Currently working at dŒûth.

title: Profiling Solidity contracts
description: We've recently built an advanced Solidity profiler. It allows you to see where the gas is spent, but also look at the diffs. The diffs could be shown method by method, which results in a more clear output and makes it easier for a developer to react on a regression as well as localizing and understanding it. During this talk, I would like to share my experience building a profiler as well as show some examples of  how we could interpret the results to make our smart contracts more efficient.

speakers.name: Milos Novitovic
speakers.description:
For the last three years since I joined the Web3 industry, I mainly worked as a product manager, discovering, shaping, and developing different Web3 projects.
For the last year and a half, I joined our R&D department and focused on generating and validating early-stage ideas while focusing on cutting-edge technology.
I worked and shaped each 3327 experiment (https://3327.io/projects/) and worked on the most of MVPW‚Äôs products (https://mvpworkshop.co/portfolio/)
https://bit.ly/3AbLPAC

speakers.name: Vladimir Lelicanin
speakers.description:
I am a software architect and developer working on developing internet services and applications since 1997.
During the last two decades, I led multiple famous Web2 and Web3 projects and companies, and in the previous ten years, I worked as a professor and head of the web development department.  
Within the MVP Workshop, I lead an R&D department 3327.

title: How to innovate in Web3? Start with a problem rather than a solution
description:
Innovation in new technologies is complex. In Web3, this uncertainty is at its maximum. The project's success depends on the hype rather than user needs, resulting in failed or "one-hit wonder" projects that will fall into oblivion. Yet, web3 innovations can be engineered by following the proper process.
This workshop aims to teach the participants an innovation methodology suitable for cutting-edge technology teams, designed to minimize the risk and produce innovations that will serve humanity

speakers.name: Will Villanueva
speakers.description: A former eth2 core researcher, Will Villanueva is currently the CEO and Cofounder of Element Finance.

title: Cryptoeconomics Dive: Fixed Rate Primitives as the Intermediating Liquidity Between Maker, Compound and AAVE
description:
Fixed Rate Primitives, when used as collateral can work as the intermediating layer of liquidity between borrowing and lending protocols.

These primitives can introduce a stable rate or fixed rate borrowing module, which lets platforms such as Maker, which can use fixed rates as collateral, set the borrow rate and arbitrage activity for the lending and borrowing space as a whole.

speakers.name: Tyler Perkins
speakers.description: CMO at Matter Labs

title: Decentralizing ZK Rollup Sequencers
description:
Decentralization is critical if we want robust, resilient layer-2 infrastructure. 

In this talk, we present Matter Lab's approach to decentralizing zkSync's sequencer, why it matters, and the considerations in design.

speakers.name: Will Villanueva
speakers.description: A former eth2 core researcher, Will Villanueva is currently the CEO and Cofounder of Element Finance.

title: The Economics of DeFi, What is next?

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: This panel should cover the current landscape of DeFi, current cryptoeconomic studies around it and what is coming next/what is setting the stage for the future framework of DeFi.

speakers.name: Dragana Koprivica
speakers.description: After my master‚Äôs studies (2018) focused on Innovation and Technology Management, I worked for several IT companies in R&D, on the development of new products. For the last 2 years, I was working on establishing innovation pipeline for an IT start-up in order to find the product-market fit with several products. In March 2022, I directed my carrier towards web3 industry by joining a R&D (https://3327.io/projects/) department and focusing on early idea validation in cutting edge technologies.

speakers.name: Vladimir Lelicanin
speakers.description:
I am a software architect and developer working on developing internet services and applications since 1997.
During the last two decades, I led multiple famous Web2 and Web3 projects and companies, and in the previous ten years, I worked as a professor and head of the web development department.  
Within the MVP Workshop, I lead an R&D department 3327.

speakers.name: Dragana Koprivica
speakers.description: After my master‚Äôs studies (2018) focused on Innovation and Technology Management, I worked for several IT companies in R&D, on the development of new products. For the last 2 years, I was working on establishing innovation pipeline for an IT start-up in order to find the product-market fit with several products. In March 2022, I directed my carrier towards web3 industry by joining a R&D (https://3327.io/projects/) department and focusing on early idea validation in cutting edge technologies.

title: Faster than innovation: How to use cutting-edge technologies to innovate in web3

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
Innovation is unpredictable and challenging to manage. That is why every R&D team requires an effective innovation process. In the web3, the technology landscape moves at a breakneck pace, making this challenge even more complicated: how to innovate faster than the fastest industry? 
This talk will present the importance of having a comprehensive innovation pipeline as a backbone for successful web3 innovation. True mastery depends on many factors that can be managed when spawning innovations.

speakers.name: Sriharsha Karamchati
speakers.description:
I'm Harsha, the co-founder at https://questbook.xyz - A decentralized grant orchestration tool.
I have set up the grants program for Polygon from Scratch along with their core team, and I am one of the signatories for the $2M grants fund at Polygon. Investor in web3 companies like Gnosis SAFE.

title: Grants as GTM in web3 & Delegated Domain Allocation - 80 applicant interviews. 100+ Grant Proposal Reviews
description: Grants are used as a GTM in web3. We have built a decentralized grant orchestration tool for DAOs to run their grants programs. Launched a grants program from scratch for Polygon after interviewing 80+grant applicants & reviewing 100+ proposals. We have now partnered with Solana, Harmony & AAVE protocols for their grants. I present the insights from the grants programs across the world, explaining both the reviewer and applicant side of the story. I also talk about the latest development of dele

speakers.name: Joe Andrews
speakers.description: Cofounder @ aztec

title: A new DeFi Primitive - Private DCA Trading with Aztec Connect
description:
Trading on decentralised exchanges is missing a key primitive, **privacy**. In traditional markets, an OTC desk enables large orders to trade without moving the price on chain this is missing and everyone can see everything.

ZKP's deployed in production allow us to implement private trading on Ethereum. This talk looks into:

1. How to uses ZKP's to give privacy on Ethereum
2. How to build a private dollar cost averaging smart contract using Aztec Connect
3. A code walkthrough and a demo

speakers.name: Tomas Bayer
speakers.description: Project Manager in Ackee Blockchain

title: From managing the International sales of tractors to managing projects in Smart contracts auditing company
description: Tomas will lead an audience through the similarities in a traditional sector such as sales of tractors and in the Web 3 space. Visiting farmers on the field is not that far from getting to know a projects in Web3 space as you might think! Have you never been to a cowshed? Don¬¥t worry, the differences between a traditional farming and the yield farming will be explainded same as a similarities between hacking a code and hacking an emission level on your favorite tractor!

speakers.name: Jennifer Parak
speakers.description: Jennifer currently works as a Software Engineer at Chorus One. Having started her career working with Microservices in a Java/Spring Boot environment, she's had the chance of working in the smart ecosystems/iOT space and is keen to branch out to emerging technologies such as blockchain tech, following her passion to solve hard technical challenges in a constraint environment.

title: Spin it up - spin up your own eth2 validator on testnet
description:
Outline: 
1) Intro 
-necessary components of a eth2 validator setup
-steps involved in spinning up a validator on testnet
-common terms (eth2 clients, beacon node, remote signer, slashing)

2) Embark the journey of becoming an eth2 validator 
-generate keys 
-make a deposit 
-spin up a remote signer 
-start the eth2 validator client connected to an already synched beacon node

3) Experiment with the setup 
-Query from the beacon node
-Spin up two validator
-Exit the validator

speakers.name: Mark Lurie
speakers.description: Mark Lurie is the CEO & Co-Founder of Shipyard Software. He is a serial entrepreneur and investor who previously founded 2 venture-backed startups. Previously, Mark was an investor at Bessemer Venture Partners, where his investments included Twilio. He is currently a Venture Partner at FJLabs and a board member of GMO Trust (issuer of the first Yen-backed stablecoin) and the Foundation for Art & Blockchain. He has an MBA from Harvard Business School and a BA in Economics from Harvard College.

title: Why DAOs Matter: An Evolution, Not Revolution
description: Society is at a bifurcation point as it continues to become increasingly complex with the ability to communicate instantly, transmit money globally, provide services across arbitrary borders, and use computing to amplify our efforts exponentially. While these transformations continue to evolve, governance has remained stagnant. If complex systems don‚Äôt evolve, they tend to collapse. DAOs allow people around the world to join and collaborate in communities with transparent and enforceable rules.

speakers.name: Cuauhtemoc Ramirez H
speakers.description:
‚ÄòTemo‚Äô is a Sr Software Engineer with over 12 years of experience in software development with multiple companies.

His passion is to build amazing and meaningful products and services that are used by millions of people. He has experience as a software architect and leading multidisciplinary teams. Currently he is building the Clipper DEX, and other DEXes, as Tech Lead at ShipyardSoftware.

He holds a Bachelor in Computer Systems Engineering, and he is currently getting his Master in AI.

title: "The Graph": Use Cases for Successfully Deploying On Ethereum
description: This workshop will explain use cases for the graph including subgraph set up and backend integration. The goal is to teach users how to set up a subgraph project and deploy it to Ethereum mainnet.

speakers.name: Michael O'Rourke
speakers.description: Michael is Co-Founder and CEO of Pocket Network, a blockchain data ecosystem for Web3 applications. Previously, he owned and operated a blockchain development agency, and was on the ground level of Tampa Bay‚Äôs largest Bitcoin/Crypto meetup and consultancy. Michael first got into bitcoin in 2013, and in 2016, began writing smart contracts and making discoveries in API services for Ethereum that provided a unique perspective on providing scalable infrastructure services in a decentralized manner.

title: Believing in the Supranational
description: Early Web3 adopters believe that DAOs have the potential to completely change the way that humans think about cooperation, collaboration, coordination and collective resources. DAOs present a unique opportunity for communities and organizations to rethink how we work together to provide more equitable participation and incentives. In this presentation, I will discuss how blockchains through DAO governance are really human coordination technology with collective belief systems.

speakers.name: Alan Keegan
speakers.description: Alan is the head of Growth and Strategy at Sense Finance (formerly at Bridgewater)

title: The Web3 Yield Curve
description:
I want to give a talk about the impact that the existence of staking yields on ETH post merge will have on pricing throughout DeFi, and versus TradFi assets.

The two below articles contain most of the core concepts.  I want to focus more on the consequences of staking acting as an RFR going forward and less on price in the talk.

https://misterkeegan.medium.com/the-ethereum-tightening-3e4c2e8db61e
https://misterkeegan.medium.com/the-web-3-0-yield-curve-5cd943342659

speakers.name: Thomas Howard
speakers.description: Angel investor and builder since 2016. Co-founder DeFi Nation, Mosendo (DAI wallet), PowerTrade options exchange.

title: The Trouble With DeFi Options and How to Fix Them
description: After digging into dozens of DeFi protocols and witnessing many failures Tom draws on his experience starting a centralized options exchange to outline the challenges with each approach and provide some ideas for creating a viable DeFi options protocol.

speakers.name: Adrian Sutton
speakers.description: Adrian is an escapee from the world of centralised finance but is now making amends by contributing to the Ethereum core protocol as a Lead Blockchain Protocol Engineer at ConsenSys.  He is a core dev on both the consensus and execution layers, leading development of ConsenSys Teku and contributing to Hyperledger Besu. When he's not coding he can be found discussing Ethereum and answering questions on pretty much all the Discord servers, and Telegram chat rooms and‚Ä¶

speakers.name: Jim McDonald
speakers.description: Jim has worked on internet infrastructure for over 30 years, including running one of the first public access internet services. He has worked on hardware and software, in startups and multinationals, in technical, management and leadership roles. His current focus is on Ethereum staking, decentralized infrastructure, and advanced validator strategies.

speakers.name: Ois√≠n Kyne
speakers.description: Co-founder of Obol Labs and building Distributed Validator Technology for Ethereum.

title: "It's 10pm, do you know where your mnemonic is?"
description:
Many stakers set up their validators nearly two years ago, and will soon need to revisit them to obtain the rewards they have earned since.

This panel provides a refresher for what stakers did, and why they did it.  It discusses protecting mnemonics and keys, and what can be done if they are misplaced or compromised.

Bringing together experts on validating key creation, protection and use, this is a wide-ranging discussion that will be useful for all stakers and potential stakers.

speakers.name: Thibault Meunier
speakers.description: Thibault is a research engineer working on distributed systems. He is focused on making emerging technologies interoperable with current web standards. At Cloudflare, he works on IPFS, Ethereum, and alternatives to CAPTCHA systems.

title: Secure HTTP for your Ethereum application
description: For wallets, decentralized exchanges, DeFi insurer, or DAO management, most Ethereum applications are relying on HTTP. This setup allows applications to be accessible by current web users, with minimal modifications. It also enables developers to leverage common web engineering practice. However, these HTTP endpoints have to be secured, and trust provided by the decentralized-network has to be carried to end-users. HTTPS is not enough. This talk will present the setup of a browser based Ethereum

speakers.name: James Beck
speakers.description: James Beck is the Director of Content and Communications at ConsenSys, where he has spent the last 5 years telling the story of Ethereum to journalists and individuals around the world. Prior to ConsenSys, James worked in public affairs and led US politicians and journalists on delegations to China to improve understanding between the two countries. James is an enthusiastic member of the queer underground NYC dance scene, and also is a volunteer street tree steward in NYC.

title: Ethereum Won‚Äôt Be The Money Layer of the Internet if People Think It‚Äôs an Earth-Destroying Scam: Four Ways to Change the Narrative.
description: 2021 was the breakout year for web3. Yet despite the millions of new users, a Morning Consult survey found that while 83% of consumers are aware of crypto, only 26% have a positive opinion. How do we as a community shift the narrative? I will share four ways to communicate web3‚Äôs benefits, relying on insight from our survey of 20k people in 15 countries around the world, updates on MetaMask Learn, and the inspiring stories of creativity and entrepreneurship enabled through web3.

speakers.name: Kevin Owocki
speakers.description: Kevin Owocki is the founder of Gitcoin.co ‚Äî Where builders & funders come together to build the open web.  Gitcoin has delivered $60mm worth of value to OSS devs in the last several years. He has a BS in Computer Science, 15 years of engineering leadership experience in Open Source Software and Web Startups. Kevin is a community organizer in the Boulder Colorado Tech Scene.

title: Decentralizing from Company => a DAO üèõüîúüï∏‚ú®

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Gitcoin Grants 1.0 was a centralized monolithic application.  With the launch of Gitcoin Grants 2.0 and GitcoinDAO, Gitcoin is being decentralized to be stewarded by the community that it serves.  Join leaders from GitcoinDAO discussing the why/what/how of decentralizing Gitcoin Grants.  In this talk we discuss why networks & DAOs are the most powerful primitives for working in web3, and what there is to be learned about progressive decentralization from the Gitcoin story.

speakers.name: Dhaiwat
speakers.description: 21 year old web3 builder and educator. Developer Advocate @ Ankr. Developer DAO gang

title: Building and deploying decentralized frontends to the permaweb
description:
It is important that web3 frontend devs are made aware of the fact that the most popular stack (nextjs + vercel) is a very centralized one and is prone to censorship. 

In my workshop I'll try to do this by showing them how they can deploy a fully client-side React app permanently to the Arweave network.

I've already written a well-received article on the topic: https://twitter.com/dhaiwat10/status/1539629375892512768

speakers.name: dhadrien
speakers.description: Founder @Sismo

title: ZK Attestations = Web3 Cookies
description:
How to prove that you donated to Gitcoin grants or that you voted for a specific DAO proposal without giving out your Ethereum address? 

You can prove - in a SNARK - that you own an Ethereum account part of a group (e.g Gitcoin donors or DAO voters) and receive a ZK Attestation!

Built as a new primitive, ZK Attestations are a reputation and access control tool used by on-chain (e.g governances) and off-chain apps.

They enable users to fully leverage their on-chain data, with privacy.

speakers.name: Jim McDonald
speakers.description: Jim has worked on internet infrastructure for over 30 years, including running one of the first public access internet services. He has worked on hardware and software, in startups and multinationals, in technical, management and leadership roles. His current focus is on Ethereum staking, decentralized infrastructure, and advanced validator strategies.

title: Withdrawals and the Capella hard fork
description: The next consensus hard fork, codenamed Capella, brings with it the long-awaited ability to receive consensus rewards on the execution chain.  This talk discusses the details of how rewards are issued, what steps validators need to undertake to obtain rewards, and how consensus and execution rewards differ in their value and how they are awarded to validators.

speakers.name: Lautaro Petaccio
speakers.description: I'm Lautaro Petaccio, I'm a Software Developer at Decentraland. I've been a Software Developer for quite some time and I've recently joined the Web3 world.

title: NFTs interoperability between metaverses
description:
Taking into consideration the enormous quantity of NFT projects in the blockchain, we'll explore a way of interconnecting those projects to expand their functionality and open them to new markets, making NFT holders capable of interacting with them in the metaverse.
I'll show Linked Wearables, a mechanism created by Decentraland that, by using a representation of their NFT for the metaverse and an API to map the NFTs to their metaverse assets, can create a link to interoperate between them.

speakers.name: Gaston Irigoyen
speakers.description:
Gaston Irigoyen is Co-Founder & CEO of Pomelo, the fintech that enables every company to offer its own financial services in the Latin American, in only weeks.
Irigoyen is a professor of Fintech and Digital Business at the Universidad de San Andr√©s, was one of the first Google employees in Argentina and, after a five-year stint, left the company to found Guidecentral, purchased in 2016 by WikiHow.

title: Fintechzation and financial inclusion
description:
The first time the statement "every company will be a fintech" came up was in an Angela Strange presentation.
And as time goes by, this statement becomes more and more real, and the thesis serves as an inspiration for this panel. In it, we will explain fintechization, growth, the reasons, the following steps, and also we will talk about the future.

speakers.name: Ben Wenger
speakers.description: Ben is the VP of Architecture for xx network, where he architected xx cMix and leads cMix software development; he is also responsible for recruiting xx nodes and for launching the xx network itself. He studied electrical engineering at Cal Poly Pomona and was recruited by Dr. David Chaum as a key member of a rapid prototyping team  focused on Augmented Reality solutions. He developed embedded software, designed electrical and optical systems and was responsible for scientific computing.

speakers.name: Ahmed Shehata
speakers.description:
I have more than 9 years of experience in software engineering and product management. I lead startups to go from an idea to a production-ready digital products serving millions of users like Tempo.Fit (AI powered Fitness), Orcas.IO (Tutoring platform) and Buseet (Mass trans).

I'm currently managing and leading the Frontend and Mobile teams at xxnetwork. I led testing and launching the xx messenger. I'm also responsible for architecture, design and development of new features and products.

title: How to build a Communications dApp that is Shielded From Surveillance
description:
Internet communications can be easily tracked. How can we develop a communications dApp that is privacy preserving?

Learn how to build a  a decentralized mixnet which hides traffic and can be used to interface with both Web2.0 systems and blockchains. Learn how you can use make your dApps private and build a dApp which protects people at their most vulnerable.

speakers.name: kumavis
speakers.description: kumavis founded MetaMask and now leads their Security Research team. Contributor to MetaMask, LavaMoat, Endo, SES, Ethereumjs, js-libp2p.

speakers.name: naugtur
speakers.description: Full-stack developer and technology researcher. JS Security Engineer at MetaMask working on LavaMoat and Endo. Started using Node.js at v0.8 and never stopped. Enjoys innovating and teaching security, diagnostics and maintainability. One of the oldest members of meet.js Poland community - both as a speaker and organizer.

title: The Attacker is Inside: Javascript Supplychain Security and LavaMoat
description: We all use open source, it is the wealth of the commons that forms the foundations we all build on. While this is incredibly empowering, we may be inviting the devil to dine with us. This talk examines software supplychain attacks in the javascript and crypto ecosystems and how to keep your app, wallet, and users safe. We'll look at the free and opensource tool LavaMoat that protects MetaMask.

speakers.name: Matt Deible
speakers.description: Coming from a background in artificial intelligence and reinforcement learning, Matt now leads development of the order routing algorithm and smart contracts for odos.xyz

title: An Overview of AMM Mechanisms
description: The talk will give an exhaustive overview of the different AMM algorithms currently deployed on major distributed ledgers, as well as the underlying intuition behind their design. Building up from the basic principles of AMM design, the talk will then cover the algorithmic mechanisms used in the various different algorithms including Constant Sum, Constant Product (Uniswap V2), Uniswap V3, KyberSwap, StableSwap (Curve), CryptoSwap (Curve V2), Solidly Stable pairs, Clipper, Dodo, and RFQ systems.

speakers.name: James Key
speakers.description: James Key is the CEO and founder of Autonomy Network. James is a self-taught blockchain engineer with nearly five years of experience working with Web3 infrastructure.  Prior to founding Autonomy Network, James implemented Proof of Stake on Flow, a developer-friendly blockchain built by Dapper Labs. James has held positions at Chainflip, and Blockchain Intelligence Group, where he worked closely with the FBI. He studied and researched Quantum Computing Research at University of BC.

title: Automation: Developing For Better UX into Dapps
description: Automation is missing in Web3 UX. DEXes don‚Äôt have robust stop-loss features; NFT games are limited to PvP interactions; DAOs handle payments manually. As a result, when these features are implemented for Web3 applications they are handled in a centralized manner, defeating the purpose of creating a decentralized alternative. Autonomy offers an off the shelf, on-chain solution to allow decentralized projects to keep up with their centralized counterparts.

speakers.name: Julia Hardy
speakers.description: Julia Hardy is an investigator at Chainalysis specializing in DeFi and web3 investigations. In the past year, Julia has investigated over 20 hacks, tracking the movements of over $12 billion USD worth of stolen funds.

speakers.name: Adam Hart
speakers.description: Adam Hart is a training specialist at Chainalysis specializing in DeFi and web3 investigations. He built the Chainalysis Ethereum Investigations Certifications course and has presented on Ethereum and DeFi on-chain analytics at various industry events.

title: The $10B Problem - web3 Security Against Coordinated Adversaries
description: Bored Ape Yacht Club Discord hacked, Ronin Bridge compromised, the news articles are fraught with Ethereum exploits. Chainalysis has identified that these attacks are often executed by a small circle of well-funded, well-coordinated adversaries. In this session, Chainalysis examines how these actors operate, how we investigate the flow of funds to try to disrupt attacks, and how the web3 community can work together to raise costs for attackers using the transparency of public blockchains.

speakers.name: Everett Hildenbrandt
speakers.description: Everett Hildenbrandt is a formal modeling engineer and product owner at Runtime Verification. His interests include automated system analysis via symbolic model checking, rigorous software development via carefully designed development practices, and applying these techniques to the software used in the other sciences (eg. physics, biology)

title: Security-Oriented Development

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Security and application safety, for many software developers, are afterthoughts. Pressure to deliver exasperates this further, often leading developers to not consider security at all. In blockchain ecosystems security is essential, so that means that the bulk of the security work gets pushed off to the auditors at the end of the development pipeline. We will discuss techniques software developers can use to incorporate best security practices into their entire development lifecycle.

speakers.name: Will Harborne
speakers.description: Will Harborne is the founder and CEO of DeversiFi. Before venturing into crypto full-time in 2017, Will was a technology consultant at Cambridge Consultants and IBM. Will entered crypto full-time when he joined Bitfinex in 2017 to lead the incubation and launch of Ethfinex Trustless which successfully scaled to the point where users could expect the same performance as a centralised exchange, which is when Ethfinex evolved into DeversiFi in 2019.

title: Layer 2 as the gateway to the multi-chain ecosystem
description: The talk will focus on the state of the fragmented multi-chain ecosystem and how L2s on Ethereum can continue to scale and help with the growing alt-chain development.
