Having transformed into a Layer 2 hub which allows users to gain access across the multichain through one application, DeversiFi can speak to the vital part L2s play in the multi-chain ecosystem and strategies that can be implemented by other builders that aim to bridge the gap in these fragmented user experiences.

speakers.name: Barney Mannerings
speakers.description: Barney Mannerings is freeing the markets. He is the co-founder of Vega, one of the first blockchain networks purpose-built to support decentralized derivatives, backed by Coinbase and other prominent VCs. Barney sits at the intersection of institutional finance and crypto, having founded Vega after building two versions of the London stock exchange matching engine and working in capital markets in London for 15 years.

title: Delivering Censorship-resistant DeFi Markets
description: Derivatives are critical to the efficiency of global financial markets, and the size of global derivatives markets are projected to exceed $36 billion by 2026. Traditional financial markets are often opaque, permissioned, and littered with gatekeepers and intermediaries. Decentralized finance can serve as an inclusive alternative ‚Äì an unstoppable financial system that everyone can be a part of, to unlock the benefits of global capital flow and free markets.

speakers.name: Krinza Momin
speakers.description: Krinza is a developer advocate at Ankr, a web3 infrastructure company. She is also championing the DevRel team at Developer DAO. Krinza embarked her professional journey as a data scientist and soon switched to web3 with an aim to onboard the next wave of developers and users in building the future of the web.

title: No-code, No problem
description: Blockchain technology is at an inflexion point. On the cusp of unlocking opportunities for hundred and thousands of developer to build and create the future of internet, the no-code tool revolution in web3 is dismantling the narrative that building cool stuff is only for super shadowy developers. Perhaps, here's to enabling everyone to have a crack at their ideas with no-code/low-code.

speakers.name: Chirag Titiya
speakers.description: Chirag is the Platform Engineer and Blockchain developer at Biconomy. Prior to joining Biconomy, Chirag has worked in web2 fintech space as backend engineer and has more than 4 years of experience building in the web3 space. Over the past couple of years he has worked as DeFi engineer, technical product manager, and research. He played a key role in developing the relayer network at Biconomy. He holds a Bachelor‚Äôs Degree and a Master‚Äôs Degree from IIT -the Indian Institute of Technology.

title: Driving Ethereum Adoption through account abstraction
description: The talk will focus on how the next generation of dApps on Ethereum will have web2-like intuitiveness. We will discuss how smart contract wallets, account abstraction & easy to build transaction legos will build a web3 experience that's gasless & chainless ensuring a one-click experience for the users.

speakers.name: ~sarlev-sarsen
speakers.description:
liberty, growth, crypto, hijinks, innovation, agency.
-------------------------------------------------------
allocating capital via grants from the urbit foundation.
-------------------------------------------------------

title: Human Scale Computing for Intuitive Digital Experiences

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Urbit offers the operating system layer for bringing computing back to a human scale where user's intuitions more closely map to reality. By rebuilding the networked computing stack with native e2ee and p2p networking, cryptographically owned and sybil-resistent identity, and a low-maintenance personal server, the experience for users is an intuitive understanding of privacy, security, and identity, thus enabling humanity's strongest social technology (and crypto-industry shibboleth): trust.

speakers.name: Lenka Hudakova (Lenkla)
speakers.description:
Project lead for initiatives tackled by the Sustainable Ecosystem Scaling team at MakerDAO (X-Ray, Transparency Dashboard, etc.). 
Previously community lead & global events manager at the Maker Foundation. 
Actively onboarding more newbies into crypto (CryptoWomen, ETH/Web3 CPH meetup, event speaking). Supporting DAOs contributors' experience & exploring the field of decentralized HR practices together with People Ops Guild peers & Groundw3rk DAO operators.

speakers.name: Loie Taylor
speakers.description: Loie is a facilitator, nurturer, and organizer. In her role as a People Operations lead, she likes to weave workplaces full of compassion and growth. With over 4 years hacking "decentralized HR" in crypto projects, she's deep in the future of work that web3 is birthing. Her roots are in Restorative Justice & activist communities, and she's branched out to start the People Ops Guild & open source the learnings on decentralized people-management that this space has uncovered.

speakers.name: Melanie Davis
speakers.description: Contributor Experience @DXdao_ I DAO and DeFi enthusiast

title: Buidl the Buidlers: how you can create the next generation of web3 contributors through education, peer review, and professional development
description:
We all know there are not enough qualified people in the world to fill all the roles Web3 is asking for. We‚Äôve got to *create* those people! Join our workshop to learn ways for developing good contributors.
We‚Äôll start with an open office session where you can ask us your most burning questions. Then we‚Äôll move into workstations where you can get 1on1 guidance on specific aspects of Web3 talent building. This means web2 to web3 conversion AND sharpening contributors who are already web3 native.

speakers.name: Adrian Eidelman
speakers.description: Co-founder of RSK and Head of RSK Blockchain technologies at IOVlabs

title: Securing bridges with HSMs, our experience with the RSK PowPeg
description: Bridges' security has been a hot topic in crypto lately. RSK is a Bitcoin sidechain platform with a 2-way peg protocol called Powpeg. The PowPeg has matured from its inception in 2018 as a federation and now includes many decentralized qualities. Its last evolution protects private keys stored in special-purpose powHSMs based on tamper-proof secure elements, only signing transactions proven valid by enough cumulative work. This talk can be helpful to other devs working on similar problems.

speakers.name: Dominic Horn
speakers.description: Dominic Emanuel Horn is a freelance product designer building digital products with clients like motius, siemens, zeiss and others. I care about designing products with emotion, that look & feel great to the point that people will post on social media about it.

title: Social composability design: how DAOs can leverage it for the future of work
description: Effective communication is a strategic advantage that DAOs are failing to leverage due to a fragmented and inefficiently designed tool landscape. Let's look at how the new communication platform Common Ground aims to establish a collaborative network effect. Coupled with a sophisticated social graph, it could herald a new age of work where you know the reputation of new members, and quickly outpace traditional companies

speakers.name: layerzero
speakers.description: Born in BOGOTA, COLOMBIA. Joined in early 2021  the Sustainable Ecosystem Scaling (SES) Core Unit of MakerDAO. The mandate of SES CU is to identify scaling bottlenecks of MakerDAO and sustainably grow the protocol‚Äôs moats. @layerzero is in charge of managing at SES legal projects, incubating new legal Core Units and grants with the objective of improving the legal resiliency of the protocol.

title: DAOs: towards an open ecosystem of legal innovation
description: In spite of all of their potentials,  DAOs expose its participants to unprecedented legal risks and challenges. In this talk, I focus on the challenges MakerDAO has faced in its path to decentralization and the strategies implemented to mitigate legal risks of the protocol, its workforce and governors . We want to share our experience and also invite the community to discuss and collaborate: we believe in an open, permissionless ecosystem of legal innovation based on open source legal resources.

speakers.name: Greg M
speakers.description:
CTO & Co-Founder @ ChainSafe

ex: Lodestar, web3.js

Passionate about wallets.

title: Re-imagining the DevEx/Ux of Wallets & Dapps
description: How can we re-invent the wallet experience as the next wave of users enter the space. Using techniques such as SQRL-ing, and assuming multi-chain first we can reshape the way we think about wallets.

speakers.name: Antonio Salazar Cardozo
speakers.description: Antonio Salazar Cardozo is the CTO of Thesis, Head of Engineering of Tally Ho, and a software pragmatist who values great software that is written for humans first. As a relatively outgoing engineer, he‚Äôll likely look at your shoes instead of his when he‚Äôs talking to you.

title: The United Federation of Web3: Lessons from Solarpunk Science Fiction for Building a Web3 Utopia
description: We often envision Web3 as an ecosystem with the potential to evolve into a solarpunk utopia. But what are the roots of the solarpunk (and, lesser known, hopepunk) vision? Answer: science fiction. By tapping into the works of solarpunk visionaries like Ursula K. LeGuin and Kim Stanley Robinson, Star Trek, and Dune (among others), what technical, philosophical, and social developments can we unlock to build our most hopeful Web3 world? (w. LJ Jackson & Michael Haley from Thesis, more to come)

speakers.name: 0xdeniz
speakers.description:
ü¶Ü  Core unit facilitator of DUX team @MakerDAO, working on governance UX and tooling
üß†  PM & creative facilitation, 5y of crypto
üíô  wagmi

title: DAO Governance Design Jam

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Premiered during devconnect in Amsterdam earlier this year, the DAO Governance Design Jam is a workshop focussed on common DAO governance issues. Leveraging design-thinking methodologies, we will guide participants through the innovation process‚Äîalternating between divergent and convergent thinking. At the start of the workshop we will pick a workshop goal based on what resonates most with the group, upon which we will facilitate the creative process and open-source the resulting innovations.

speakers.name: Jodi Callender
speakers.description: Jodi Callender has worked at the intersection of real estate, economic development and operations for 12 years. She is currently a GitcoinDAO Steward and a co-lead of the Operations team where she focuses on building operational excellence in the DAO's user support and accounting functions.  She has also held senior policy and project management roles at the NYC Mayor's Office, the WeWork Companies, and NYC Economic Development Corp. Ask her about her cat, Garbanzo.

title: Why DAOs must develop as change management machines and what their contributors can learn from nonprofits and the public sector
description: DAO organizational structures are rich and diverse, but their beauty lies in the power and dynamism of individuals collaborating to build protocols and community.  Before joining GitcoinDAO as co-lead of the DAO Ops workstream, I worked in  private, non-profits, and public sector organizations, and believe DAO leads can learn from the ways other leaders managed change, created pathways for individual growth, and cultivated a cultures biased to communication and action.

speakers.name: David Chaum
speakers.description: David Chaum is a pioneer in cryptography and privacy-preserving technologies, and is widely recognized as the inventor of digital cash. His work on cryptographic ‚Äúvault systems‚Äù contains the 1st proposal for a blockchain, containing all but 1 element detailed 26 years later in the Bitcoin white-paper. He is credited with creating the first digital currency, eCash, in 1995. David founded the International Association for Cryptologic Research and has a Ph.D. in computer science from UC Berkeley.

title: The Future of Democracy Hinges on Privacy Development in Web3
description: In this talk David Chaum will propose how 5 fundamental cryptographic solutions can help solve some of the failings of modern democracy: multiparty computation, sample voting, metadata shredding, frictionless value transfer, and digital credential mechanisms. He believes that we can build Democracy 3.0 through using these solutions to address four paramount problems facing democracies: accurate news, enhancing representative democracy, revamping voting, and increasing prosperity.

speakers.name: Vanessa Conyers
speakers.description: Vanessa Conyers has sixteen years of experience in architecture and draws on that experience to blend blockchain technology with physical space. She was the product designer for Oya Protocol, a p2p e-commerce protocol that was a finalist at HackMoney 2020. She is currently working on systems to help DAOs meaningfully own and control real-world assets through off-chain custodians with on-chain bonds, rather than simply trusting a legal entity or multi-sig.

title: The Visions of an Architect Dreaming of a Better World

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: How can real-world communities create a better future together through DAOs and blockchain technologies? There are massive usability challenges for wallets and tokens that exclude most regular people and big gaps between real-world assets and DAO governance. Coming from an architecture and design background, I will explore a model for linking global DAOs with local communities through bonded custodians, shared real estate property, and local airdrops. We have to dream together, not in a bubble.

speakers.name: James Corbett
speakers.description: I have a history of putting blockchain products in production, such as trading platforms, merchant scale wallets, validators and other key blockchain infrastructure. Through that journey I identified key issues in the user and developer experience for public blockchains. I founded the Superchain Network to build core Web3 infrastructure and we are aiming to launch our cross chain data services as a consensus indexing protocol next year.

title: Web3 UX is broken - a vision for a cross chain and protocol aware wallet
description: Web3 UX is broken. There have been many protocol innovations that improve on key areas like fragmented liquidity, cross chain bridging and provenance, but not for wallets. I present a vision for a protocol aware wallet that allows the user to express their intent and work in concert with protocols to orchestrate money legos, multicall strategies and multiple hops. It is built on solid foundations of fully indexed and community driven data protocol.

speakers.name: Nicol√°s Garc√≠a
speakers.description: Security Researcher at OpenZeppelin

title: Damn Vulnerable DeFi - Foundry version
description: A little talk about how it was to rewrite all the levels from the [original version](https://www.damnvulnerabledefi.xyz/), the advantages of using Foundry instead of Hardhat, how to set up the environment to play the different challenges and how to contribute.

speakers.name: Sam Cassatt
speakers.description: Sam Cassatt is the CEO and Founder of Aligned, a Web3 infrastructure firm offering a suite of products and services for high performance computing, mining, staking and liquidity provisioning. A notable Web3 investor, Sam founded NeptuneDAO, an investment vehicle that has deployed more than 10,200 ETH in liquidity to various DeFi protocols. Sam was previously Chief Strategy Officer of ConsenSys and played a pivotal role in the development of the early Ethereum ecosystem.

title: The Hardware for the Next Generation of the Internet
description: Today, the DeFi market is valued at $186.55 billion, but in order for it to continue to scale and reach mainstream adoption, the creation of a new structure of hardware, custom-built for the rapidly growing needs of Web3, is required. Hardware, as it is today, is not optimized to empower the growing Web3 movement. Decentralized, distributed, open-source and permissionless access to the internet requires high performance computing infrastructure that is faster, more efficient, private and secure.

speakers.name: Shawki Sukkar
speakers.description:
I like to build stuff. I previously worked on layer 1 oracles, a cross-chain DeFi dashboard, a protocols engineering course, and web2 products.

I am interested in decentralized social networks and I am building some new stuff there.

shawkisukkar.com

title: Product-driven protocols
description:
I want to talk about:
-The importance of decentralizing the social graph, and how it enables permissionless innovation. Talk about Twitter APIs as the reason why we need to make APIs public goods (shawkisukkar.com/2022/twitter-api)
-The main technical components (network, identity, and storage), and their current state.
-Explore different social protocol architectures (Lens, Farcaster)
-What do we need to do to make it happen and the importance of being a Product-driven protocol.

speakers.name: Pablo Larguia
speakers.description:
Co-Founder & CEO SenseiNode, the first nodes and staking as a service provider in Latin America. 
Singularity University GSP14 Alumni, NASA campus in Mountain View CA. Founder of Red Innova
the largest community on innovation, technology and entrepreneurship in Latin America. Founder of Bumeran, biggest online recruitment company in the region and Board Member Universidad Di Tella, Argentina.

title: Why Latin America will embrace Ethereum as their economic development platform by 2030
description:
Latin American governments had been working for the last 2 decades trying to have a common currency, as the Euro in the EU, failing to achieve consensus because of their unstable macroeconomics and the lack of a common vision.
Current system is broken and corrupt: no clear rules, inflation and unpredictability has a negative impact on the population. Introducing a new thesis on why Ethereum will unify the region, ending decades of stagnation.

speakers.name: Kirill Fedoseev
speakers.description: Researcher and Developer at Gnosis Chain

title: Trustless bridges in the Ethereum Beaconverse
description: We will share our vision on the bright future of the Ethereum Beaconverse and how it is being connected with our amazing Gnosis Chain roadmap. We will suggest and discuss a way of building a fully trustless, arbitrary message bridge between two Ethereum post-merge networks. Such bridge is primarily based on the implementation of the beacon chain light client in the EVM.

speakers.name: Everett Hildenbrandt
speakers.description: Everett Hildenbrandt is a formal modeling engineer and product owner at Runtime Verification. His interests include automated system analysis via symbolic model checking, rigorous software development via carefully designed development practices, and applying these techniques to the software used in the other sciences (eg. physics, biology)

title: Security lifecycle - from 0 to deployment and beyond
description: In what stage of development does security start? What techniques should I apply? At what stage should security stop being a priority? There are no correct and unique answers to all of these questions, and it depends on different factors such as the project's design and code, potential risks in the smart contracts, and resources available, among others. Join this panel to learn how to plan your lifecycle security strategy by listening to the opinions of security experts in the ecosystem

speakers.name: James Waugh
speakers.description: Founder of üî•_üî•

title: DAOs to tokens, then tokens back to DAOs
description:
Explained longer version below in notes but:

6 years ago we only had a handful of tokens and a single DAO, since then there's been tens of thousands of both, with the majority talking about 'governance' - While at the same time, the amount of innovation when it comes to token distribution or governance have been left in the dust. This talk will explore what new DAO primitives we might unlock in the future and how tokens could collapse back into non-transferable DAO shares.

speakers.name: Loie Taylor
speakers.description: Loie is a facilitator, nurturer, and organizer. In her role as a People Operations lead, she likes to weave workplaces full of compassion and growth. With over 4 years hacking "decentralized HR" in crypto projects, she's deep in the future of work that web3 is birthing. Her roots are in Restorative Justice & activist communities, and she's branched out to start the People Ops Guild & open source the learnings on decentralized people-management that this space has uncovered.

title: Parental Leave in DAOs: How and Why
description: DAOs gravitate towards a gig economy/freelancer culture, but we can do way better in terms of social support & benefits for contributors. Parental leave benefits boost diversity, retention, contributor happiness - and can be implemented in a DAO. Come learn how!

speakers.name: Morgan Moskalyk
speakers.description:
üï∞Ô∏èüîßü™µ ‚Üí @matterdirect ‚Üí @bertram999

Software Engineer

title: Roll Up with Whl: Apprentice as a Timesensing Alchemist ‚òÇ

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Unravel Peers relationship with Time & IRL activities symbolizing a type Wheel of Fortune for Lore creators to earn a fee or plant a tree. Adopt gratitude & minting w.r.t alchemical signs for spiritual embodiment. Learn how the pendulum swing of collective action against Degen Chaotism places into question astrologically tethered market movements. To open, we will invoke an optional mudras hand exercise to warm the mind. ‚òº

speakers.name: Nick Emmons
speakers.description: Nick Emmons is co-founder and CEO at Upshot, the leading NFT appraisal platform. He previously led blockchain engineering at John Hancock and Manulife, where he started one of the first public blockchain projects to come from a large institution. Outside of work Nick is a full-time degen, pursuing his passions for CryptoDickbutts and impact throughout the space.

title: DeFi x NFTs Unlocking New Wave of Possibilities
description: The nascent intersection of DeFi and NFTs provides a wide range of new opportunities as teams build exotic new financial primitives with NFTs at their core. Accurate real-time appraisals at scale are a critical infrastructure component of this evolution. Upshot is building the most accurate NFT appraisal engine in which employs a novel machine learning approach combined with human expertise. Upshot Co-Founder & CEO, Nick Emmons, explores some of the interesting problems Upshot is solving.

speakers.name: Xochitl Cazador
speakers.description: Xochitl Cazador leads Ecosystem growth at Celo Foundation. She has extensive experience shaping strategy into execution to drive growth and scale operations. Xochitl is the granddaughter of Mexican migrant farmworkers and one of the first in her family to graduate from college. She understands firsthand how access to basic financial tools can change lives. Xochitl holds a master‚Äôs degree from Stanford Graduate School of Business.

title: Reimagining DeFi for Good
description: As total value locked on Defi has boomed in the crypto industry, the full potential of decentralized finance is far from realized. All major Defi protocols require substantial over collateralization. Meanwhile the people who benefit most from credit have the least access. My talk will explore use cases that focus on public goods and positive externalities to democratize wealth and technology.

speakers.name: Marisa Rowland
speakers.description: Marisa Rowland is the VP of Product at Tlon, the primary developers of Urbit, which is a peer-to-peer network of personal servers built on a clean-slate software stack. Prior to joining Tlon, Marisa was the VP of Product at Arable. She is currently based in the California Bay Area.

title: To Grow Your Own Society, First Own Your Tools
description: Marisa Rowland (VP of Product at Tlon) maintains that DAOs are the future of organizing, but the tools they rely on should be held to a higher standard. For this vision to become a reality, a few issues need to be resolved: data-privacy, durability, and the ability for communities to be able to build, then easily distribute, their own tools. This talk explores how Tlon's flagship OS, Landscape, offers a solution for DAOs in one unified environment.

speakers.name: Josef J
speakers.description: Josef is an active member of [Parallel Polis](https://paralelnipolis.cz/en), the base of the Prague cypherpunk community and the HQ of the Institute of Cryptoanarchy. At the IoC he is occasionally organinzing Ethereum meetups (since 2016). He is also the founder and maintainer of the local nonconformist hackerspace [Bordel](https://bordel.space).

title: Asset rights abstractions - a case for smart contract wallets

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
Smart contract wallets (SCW) have a potential to streaml UX and increase compatibility of asset and dapp contracts. 

Well positioned SCW can overcome needs for devs to integrate increasing number of standards. Instead SCWs can improve composability between dapps and decrease the amount of TXs needed, enabling dev to focus on core features rather than handling custom or niche cases of asset contracts. 

PWN Safe is an example of such wallet enabling selfcustody of lending collateral.

speakers.name: Isaac Sheff
speakers.description: Dr. Isaac Sheff is a Senior Research Scientist working with Heliax, and leads project Typhon. His research is primarily in distributed systems, with emphasis on security and heterogeneous trust. Isaac designs distributed protocols and algorithms with strong guarantees, real implementations, and broad applications.

title: Chimera Chains: Multi-Chain Atomic Transactions
description: Chimera Chains are a new technique allowing atomic, multi-chain transactions. We take advantage of overlapping validator sets to provide well-defined atomicity guarantees. Chimera Chains don't sacrifice safety or liveness for state controlled by each base chain: only cross-chain atomicity is at stake. Heliax is working on building Chimera Chains using Heterogeneous Paxos as part of project Typon. Chimera Chains will someday help Ethereum applications work seamlessly with other chains.

speakers.name: Herman Obst
speakers.description: Herman Obst is an industrial engineer from Facultad de Ingenier√≠a, Universidad de Buenos Aires, Argentina. He has been leading multiple software projects, ranging from projects in the healthcare industry, data science and blockchain. In 2021 he co-developed a tool to help Tornado Cash users maintain their privacy and for better measure the privacy provided by its anonymity pools. He also co-authored the book ["Data science in Julia for Hackers"](https://datasciencejuliahackers.com/).

speakers.name: Federica Sof√≠a Moletta
speakers.description: Federica Moletta is a Systems Engineering student at the Universidad Tecnol√≥gica Nacional in Buenos Aires, Argentina. She is passionate about cutting-edge technologies, such as Blockchains and Zero Knowledge Proofs. She got acquainted with Cairo and ZKP by implementing a template that allows SNARKS produced by Circom to be verified by a starknet contract, creating a bridge between SNARKS and STARKS. Currently, she is working on reimplementing the Cairo VM in Rust.

title: Improving performance of provable computations using Rust
description:
We reimplemented the Cairo VM in Rust to increase its performance. We will show an MVP that is between 10 and 100 times faster than the previous Python implementation.

Executing a program with this VM outputs a trace which can later be used to generate a Proof of the program's execution. Combining Zero Knowledge Proofs with Rollups allow us to have scalability without compromising the security of blockchains.

speakers.name: noturhandle
speakers.description:
Writing: https://scarceobjects.substack.com/ ‚Ä¢ Building: @ButteryMoney ‚Ä¢ Contributing: 
@RnDAO__ ‚Ä¢ Prev: @JAAK_io ‚Ä¢ Main: Gogeta SSB

title: Patterns for Treasury Governance
description:
Treasury Governance is the set of frameworks, policies, and decisions that DAOs, communities, and protocols maintain regarding the capital and resources under their control. 

I propose that effective treasury governance is a precursor to effective DAO governance.

This talk explores the recurring problems faced by DAOs and Protocols with regard to their treasuries and the emerging patterns that convey some fundamental truth about each problem and its most effective solution.

speakers.name: Neville Grech
speakers.description: Co-founder of Dedaub, Ethereum white hat hacker with 15 years experience in Software Engineering, Security and Program Analysis. Neville is the lead author of MadMax, one of the earlier works to apply program analysis techniques to Ethereum. This has since received awards by Communications of the ACM and ACM SIGPLAN. He received his PhD in 2013 from the University of Southampton.

title: Building the Ultimate Bounty-Hunter Toolchain
description: In the past year, Dedaub has disclosed numerous vulnerabilities in deployed smart contracts and received 9 significant bug bounties totaling over $3M. The talk will detail the lessons learnt, tools and experience involved in finding such vulnerabilities. At the core of my presentation, I will describe some key elements of the technology the Dedaub team built to help consistently find real vulnerabilities in the wild and the landscape ahead.

speakers.name: Michal Zajac
speakers.description: Head of Cryptography Research at Nethermind. Enthusiast and researcher of zero-knowledge proof systems focused on their security and efficiency.

title: Vampire, a novel, cheap to verify, zkSNARK
description: In this talk, I would like to introduce Vampire (https://eprint.iacr.org/2022/406) -- a novel zkSNARK that has the smallest communication complexity and on-chain verification cost of all known updatable zkSNARKs.

speakers.name: Herman Obst
speakers.description: Herman Obst is an industrial engineer from Facultad de Ingenier√≠a, Universidad de Buenos Aires, Argentina. He has been leading multiple software projects, ranging from projects in the healthcare industry, data science and blockchain. In 2021 he co-developed a tool to help Tornado Cash users maintain their privacy and for better measure the privacy provided by its anonymity pools. He also co-authored the book ["Data science in Julia for Hackers"](https://datasciencejuliahackers.com/).

speakers.name: Mariano Nicolini
speakers.description:
Mariano Nicolini is an advanced physics student from Facultad de Ciencias Exactas y Naturales, Universidad de Buenos Aires, Argentina. His interest range from statistical data analysis to Zero-Knowledge Proofs.
He has contributed in various software projects related to Data Science and blockchain. In 2021 he co-developed a tool to help Tornado Cash users maintain anonimity and better measure the privacy provided by its anonymity pools. He co-authored the book ‚ÄúData science in Julia for Hackers‚Äù

title: De-anonimizing TornadoCash transactions to understand potential failures in ensuring privacy
description:
Tornadocash focuses on anonymizing transactions. The protocol works as long as it's used properly. At TornadoCash's request, we found ways to effectively de-anonymize transactions. Based on those findings, we developed a tool to help users avoid making mistakes that compromise their transactional privacy. 
Furthermore, this tool also enables the anonimity of the pool to be more precisely quantified by defining the real size of the anonimity set.

speakers.name: Raoul Schaffranek
speakers.description: Raoul Schaffranek studied Computer Science at RWTH Aachen University, Germany, where he obtained B.Sc. and M.Sc. degrees. He wrote his master thesis about compositional modeling and fully automated verification of distributed systems and formalized his findings with the Isabelle proof assistant. After leaving University, Raoul joined Runtime Verification as a formal verification engineer, where he spends most of his time on security audits for the Ethereum ecosystem.

title: Securing ERC20 token integrations beyond 2022
description: Secure ERC20 token integration remains a major problem in the year 2022. In this talk, we argue that the current generation of automated tools is still producing unsatisfying results because they leave one of the biggest potentials untouched: The full blockchain state is discoverable. A path will be outlined on how the next generation of tools can be informed by the blockchain state to find more security issues automatically.

speakers.name: S Mishra
speakers.description: Shreemoy is former academic economist with a PhD in game theory from the University of Texas at Austin. He lives in Seattle, Washington. At IOV Labs he works on a range of projects including blockchain state storage rent, escrows, L2 rollups, stablecoins and payment solutions.

speakers.name: Federico Jinich
speakers.description: RSK/Rootstock researcher, web3 enthusiast!

title: Storage Rent: Avoiding EVM Blockchain State Trie IO "Death Trajectory"
description: Ethereum's chain state (accounts trie, contract storage) does not fit on RAM of ordinary user hardware. This requires more IO operations, limiting transaction processing speed. Eth R&D researchers call this a death trajectory. State Storage Rent is the only known solution concept. Previous proposals on Ethereum have struggled. We propose a new design where the true cost of storing blockchain state is spread across several users. This is far easier to implement and will help manage state size.

speakers.name: Philip Daian
speakers.description: Philip Daian is a Ph.D. candidate in computer science at Cornell Tech, and a steward of Flashbots, a research and product organization that is active within the MEV space. He is particularly interested in the intersection of cryptocurrencies, financial systems, programmable privacy, and formal systems. His past work includes uncovering and publicizing MEV in the ETH community, and seeking to illuminate the dark forest of incentives and mechanisms in which we all co-exist.

title: MEV for the Next Billion: It's time to get serious...
description: We will take a birds-eye view of research, industry, and L1 developments on MEV. We start with the reasons behind the origins of MEV, a years-old warnings to developers. We revisit these against an explosion of research and industry interest in MEV. We cover the big picture of why these topics, including PBS, MEV auctions, MEV ethics, "fair ordering", cryptography, etc. are key to the decentralization and UX of L1. We will attempt to provide a roadmap to avoid the centralizing effects of MEV.

speakers.name: Philip Monk
speakers.description: Philip Monk is the CTO at Tlon, the primary developers of Urbit, which is a peer-to-peer network of personal servers built on a clean-slate software stack. Philip co-authored the Urbit white paper, in addition to engineering the Layer 2, and putting in countless hours of kernel work.

title: The Gang Solves the Gas Crisis
description: Philip Monk (CTO @ Tlon) describes his unique approach to designing the architecture of Urbit's Layer 2, a mechanism referred to as "naive rollups", and explains how its successful implementation enabled significant network growth.

speakers.name: Chandresh Aharwar
speakers.description:
Chandresh lead  the marketing and strategy development of Matic Network(Now Polygon) from the very early days of Matic. He was right at the center of Matic‚Äôs geographic expansion to over 20 different countries. 
He played a huge role in Matic‚Äôs community growth by getting the community outreach to over 100,000 people. 
He is now building UniLend Finance.

title: How DeFi will liberate finance and affect the Global Economy
description:
The future is decentralized, and that certainly applies to the financial sector. 
DeFi's introduction has been a pivotal moment in the history of finance which rose in prominence in 2020.
Decentralized finance has power to change the world economy. With blockchain technology leading the front, this is an emerging alternative financial infrastructure challenging traditional finance, which will bring back privacy and trust.

speakers.name: Phil Fogel
speakers.description: Phil is the Chief Blockchain Officer at Flowcarbon, a pioneering climate tech startup that is using blockchain technology to increase liquidity and transparency in the carbon markets. Backed by Andreessen Horowitz, Fifth Wall, and launching on the carbon negative Celo blockchain, Flowcarbon's flagship token, GNT, is backed 1:1 by a live Verra issued carbon credit. Phil is also a managing partner at Corner3 Ventures and an avid crypto entrepreneur.

title: Stopping Climate Change: The Future of Crypto and Carbon

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Flowcarbon is a pioneering climate-tech company at the intersection of carbon and blockchain. Our mission is to make carbon markets accessible and transparent, enabling billions of dollars to be invested directly into projects that combat climate change. During this talk our team will discuss the intersection of the carbon, sustainability, and blockchain spaces to better educate the general public on who Flowcarbon is, our GNT token, and our broader mission.

speakers.name: Ghassan Murad
speakers.description:
Cofounder & CEO at Flan.design.
Whether it ºs digital or physical, I believe that with intuitive design we can add meaning and value to all of our experiences, minimize friction, optimize interactions, and significantly enrich our way of living.

title: Future of Design
description: Will be talking about how the metaverse industry is changing the way we think about and design interfaces.

speakers.name: Sam Newman
speakers.description: Product Manager at Oasis.app

title: A Brief History of Finance and how it lead to Defi
description:
We explore the history of finance, digging into interesting people and stories that had a lasting influence on what we see today. We will find out how 'money' came to be and why we need it. How did stock exchanges come about? The finance of war,  the subsequent rise of capitalism and communism. The booming 80s to the dot com bubble.

All throughout we will take lessons from these stories that can be applied today. History doesn't repeat itself, but it often rhymes.

speakers.name: Varun Vruddhula
speakers.description: Varun is the founder and CEO of Hashflow.

title: The Gamification of DAO
description:
Historically, DAOs have been used primarily for the governance of protocol capital, while NFTs were for digital art - but that's only the beginning. We believe that the synergies between DAOs & NFTs can be leveraged to create one of the best tools for building strong communities & brand loyalty. 

In this talk, I‚Äôd like to discuss how Hashflow has created such a DAO - one that combines governance, NFTs, and token rewards - to make participation fun and engaging through a gamified experience.

speakers.name: Pablo Deymonnaz
speakers.description: Pablo Deymonnaz is a Software Engineer from the Facultad de Ingenier√≠a, Universidad de Buenos Aires. Since 2021 he's the director of that career in the same institution. From 2015 he has been teaching the courses in Concurrent Programming, focusing on concurrent, multi-thread, computing, and Programming Lab. He specializes in Rust programming, with special interest in cryptography and distributed systems, working as a tech lead of a team that specializes in blockchain projects.

speakers.name: Mauro Toscano
speakers.description: Mauro Toscano is a cofounder and TechLead of Writeonly Labs (https://writeonly.io/), a software company based on Buenos Aires, Argentina. He has worked as a web2 full stack developer before moving to work with zero knowledge proofs on Aleo, where he focused on the research of Zero Knowledge Proofs technologies. With ZK, he worked on the implementation of Vitalik's Minimal Anti Collusion proposal on Aleo's blockchain, and implementing new circuits for everyone to use on the same blockchain.

speakers.name: Matias Onorato
speakers.description: Matias Onorato is the president and TechLead of Writeonly Labs, a software company based on Buenos Aires, Argentina. He is passionate about Devops, Web Development, and technologies such as Blockchains and Zero Knowledge Proofs . He recently got acquainted with Aleo by implementing a voting system with ZKP based on the MACI proposal, and has been working in the standard library for the Leo programming language.

title: Secure voting through Zero Knowledge technology

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: In 2019, Vitalik Buterin laid out the principles for a minimal anticollusion infrastructure (MACI). We implemented this protocol in the Aleo blockchain, which is ideal for the task since it's based on zero knowledge cryptography and zero knowledge proofs. Our implementation is written in Leo, Aleo's programming language, and some Rust to wrap it all up.

speakers.name: Tony Olendo
speakers.description: Tony Olendo is a Developer Education Evangelist at Polygon. He has a passion for Ethereum Developer Education and specifically helping developers in their Solidity journey. He's also a co-cordinator for the Contract Book Club, a smart contract book club run by Developer DAO and Macro.

title: Polygon Developer Education: Introducing Polyceum - Integrated Learning Platform
description: The Polygon Education team has been focused on building an integrated education platform that we call Polyceum. Presently, a lot of Ethereum education is focused on entry-level to intermediate content and the disparity is that we don't have enough learning platforms that will drive communication and adoption of more advanced concepts such as ZK proofs and rollups, L2s and so forth. We are working on a best-in-class learning platform that combines gamification and advanced Ethereum content.

speakers.name: Pablo Deymonnaz
speakers.description: Pablo Deymonnaz is a Software Engineer from the Facultad de Ingenier√≠a, Universidad de Buenos Aires. Since 2021 he's the director of that career in the same institution. From 2015 he has been teaching the courses in Concurrent Programming, focusing on concurrent, multi-thread, computing, and Programming Lab. He specializes in Rust programming, with special interest in cryptography and distributed systems, working as a tech lead of a team that specializes in blockchain projects.

speakers.name: Mauro Toscano
speakers.description: Mauro Toscano is a cofounder and TechLead of Writeonly Labs (https://writeonly.io/), a software company based on Buenos Aires, Argentina. He has worked as a web2 full stack developer before moving to work with zero knowledge proofs on Aleo, where he focused on the research of Zero Knowledge Proofs technologies. With ZK, he worked on the implementation of Vitalik's Minimal Anti Collusion proposal on Aleo's blockchain, and implementing new circuits for everyone to use on the same blockchain.

speakers.name: Matias Onorato
speakers.description: Matias Onorato is the president and TechLead of Writeonly Labs, a software company based on Buenos Aires, Argentina. He is passionate about Devops, Web Development, and technologies such as Blockchains and Zero Knowledge Proofs . He recently got acquainted with Aleo by implementing a voting system with ZKP based on the MACI proposal, and has been working in the standard library for the Leo programming language.

title: The Challenges of making a standard library for a circuit language
description: Leo is a novel functional, statically-typed programming language built for writing zero knowledge private applications. It's designed for devs to build intuitively on the Aleo blockchain. We are taking on the task of building its associated standard library (integers, arrays, hashing functions, among others), which implies facing different kinds of challenges that may seem trivial to solve in most common programming languages but are not in a zero knowledge constraint system.

speakers.name: Juan
speakers.description:
After scaling fintech startups for several years in Product and Sales Operations, Juan discovered DeFi through a beautiful accident. He has ever since been involved in scaling DAOs through governance design, improving frameworks, and connecting great teams together.

Juan is also a proud dad.

title: What Governance can (and should) learn from Open Source Software
description:
Avid to ship an MVP we have rushed to create spaghetti code for governance. This only becomes apparent after approved improvement proposals start colluding in a world of exceptions, and reading the bylaws of a DAO becomes harder than getting a PhD.

Borrowing principles on to write clean code, I'll share insights on how building the **pipelines** for good Governance lead to a better and more decentralized community as it improves:
- Accessibility
- Resiliency
- Openness and Visibility

speakers.name: Gregor ≈Ωavcer
speakers.description: Active in the Ethereum and decentralised storage space since 2015, Gregor is an advocate for privacy, data interoperability and data sovereignty. When Swarm graduated from Ethereum Foundation in 2019, he joined as a co-founder, and serves today as the Director of the Swarm Foundation. Previously, Gregor also co-founded Datafund project, developing decentralised personal data protocol, and started Fair data society ecosystem initiative that focuses on ethical questions and common tools.

title: Quo vadis, DeSoc?
description:
How do you turn a digital self-sovereign society into a tyranny? Do nothing.

Decentralised Society (DeSoc) relies on soulbound tokens (SBT) and promises to set the web3 on a deeper and transformative path that rewards trust and collaboration. However, to achieve a truly positive social impact and action, it is crucial to define the ethics and values of this new society. But how can we determine these? A Philosopher-kings-and-queens DAO might be a solution; using tech in symbiosis with ethics.

speakers.name: Bianca Buzea
speakers.description: Bianca Buzea is a blockchain technologist with a background in Computer Science. She is passionate about education and web3 development. In the past she has been working at a large web2 company, and recently she joined Balancer Labs as a developer advocate.

title: Design and Maintain Liquidity Pools (101)
description: In this workshop, attendees will learn how to design and maintain a successful liquidity pool. We will look at  considerations and common pitfalls when creating a liquidity pools and roll up our sleeves and deploy one. Additionally, attendees will learn about the different use cases for liquidity pools, such as building the foundation for an automated yield-generating platform, token distribution, or governance.

speakers.name: Sergio Demian Lerner
speakers.description: Sergio Demian Lerner - Widely recognized as a leading security and cryptocurrency researcher, and a serial entrepreneur, Sergio has co-founded several technology companies such as RSK Labs, Coinspect and ASICBoost. Since 2011, Sergio has collaborated to strengthen the security of the Bitcoin and Ethereum protocols and reference codes, discovering and responsibly disclosing 12 vulnerabilities. In 2015, Sergio collaborated in the design of the Ethereum Ethash mining algorithm and audited Ethereum.

title: Flyover: fast transferring UTXO-coins into EVM-based blockchains over federated pegs with optional enforced contracts calls
description: The main goal of the Flyover protocol is to accelerate transfers in and out from a UTXO-based blockchain such as Bitcoin or Dogecoin into an EVM-based blockchains such as Ethereum, over a slow (i.e. 100 confirm.) federated bridge.  The protocol also allows to cryptographically attach metadata to transfers to execute specific sender-defined contracts on the target EVM-based blockchain. The solution is based on an open group of trustless liquidity providers that can advance the calls, for a fee.

speakers.name: Daniel Garc√≠a
speakers.description: Passionate about the environment and software development with a proven track record in high performance computing. A strong believer in disruption driven by computing high performance, I am committed to the era's main societal drivers of change: sustainability, blockchain and crypto.

title: How NFTS can transform the recycling industry
description:
Plastiks is an NFT marketplace that brings People, Organizations and Companies together to fight against plastic pollution.

We are tokenizing and creating NFTs out of the invoices generated by the recovery projects and recyclers worldwide, that states that certain type of plastic and quantity has been recovered, these NFTs becomes plastic credits.

speakers.name: Matthias Egli
speakers.description: Matthias Egli is a principal and founding partner of ChainSecurity where he is responsible for strategy and operations. Before ChainSecurity he protected Fortune500 company networks as a security data scientist at Exabeam. He started his career after his MSc ETH Zurich as a software engineer and later CTO/COO for Dealini, a Swiss StartUp.

title: Read-only Reentrency - a novel vulnerability class responsible for $100m+ funds at risk
description: Reentrancy is one of the first lessons learned when getting started with smart contract development and security. In this lightning talk we will present a novel form of reentrency, the "read-only reentrency" which is mostly unknown, although devastating in today's DeFi world and which has been single-handedly responsible for $100m+ in funds at risk.

speakers.name: Molly Mackinlay
speakers.description: Molly Mackinlay leads protocol design and development for the IPFS Project, the Filecoin Network‚Äôs Lotus implementation, and Libp2p at Protocol Labs - a research, design, and deployment lab for next generation internet protocols. Before Protocol Labs, she spent 5 years at Google as a PM on products like Search, Google Classroom, Forms, and Chrome.

title: Storage + Compute: Bringing Ethereum smart contracts to Filecoin with FEVM
description: Come learn about how Filecoin has brought programmability to storage, and is unlocking computation networks in IPFS and Filecoin! The newly launched Filecoin Virtual Machine is a wasm-ipld hypervisor that runs the EVM as it's first additional runtime - allowing smart contracts that interface with Filecoin state and storage. Learn more about how it works and what's happening next!

speakers.name: Will Villanueva
speakers.description: A former eth2 core researcher, Will Villanueva is currently the CEO and Cofounder of Element Finance.

title: Cryptoeconomics Dive: LP volatility harvesting across yield rates
description:
This talk furthers the concept of volatility harvesting. Currently, Uniswap and other major dexes see a huge part of their trading volume consist of the result of volatility in the market. Value changes and as a result, trading volume spikes and LPs profit.

When extending yield, which is also quite a volatile concept, to AMMs, volatility harvesting is increased further to not only affect value but also the yield that value creates.

speakers.name: Erik Newton
speakers.description: Erik Newton is the Chief Operations Officer at Tlon, the primary developers of Urbit, which is a peer-to-peer network of personal servers built on a clean-slate system software stack. Prior to joining Tlon, Erik was a partner at a family law firm for nearly a decade. He currently resides in the California Bay Area.

title: Slow Computing, Self-Sovereignty, and Sustainability
description: Erik Newton (COO at Tlon) describes how a sustainable internet is an efficient internet and requires that data be easily shareable, via a peer-to-peer network, off-chain. Ethereum created a workable solution for storing and programming high value assets, but off-chain information is generally still stored on centralized third-party servers; attempting to do so on-chain would carry astronomical costs (and be very time-consuming).

speakers.name: Sandra Johnson
speakers.description: Sandra is a researcher at ConsenSys Software, working in the Incentives Systems Analysis and Modelling (ISAM) research area of the Dependable Distributed Systems (DDS) research team. Having worked as a data scientist, researcher, Bayesian network modeller, sessional academic and software engineer, she enjoys applying her wide range of experiences to research within the Ethereum blockchain ecosystem. Sandra lives on the Sunshine Coast, Queensland, Australia.

title: VillageDAO: Incentivising Community participation
description: Incentivisation of a protocol depends on a combination of quantitative and qualitative factors. For example, the design of rewards and penalties is based on expected human behaviour. I discuss a model to capture key aspects of incentivisation of the community to participate in a customer success platform such as VillageDAO. I then introduce various scenarios and their potential impacts on gaining and maintaining tier levels and privileges while allowing for the decay of previous contributions.

speakers.name: Juan
speakers.description:
After scaling fintech startups for several years in Product and Sales Operations, Juan discovered DeFi through a beautiful accident. He has ever since been involved in scaling DAOs through governance design, improving frameworks, and connecting great teams together.

Juan is also a proud dad.

title: Why Clean Money Matters
description:
We're ignoring the most powerful financing that governments impose on us: (debt through) currency.
Let's create a currency that is fully focused on regenerative finance and change the world.

speakers.name: Loie Taylor
speakers.description: Loie is a facilitator, nurturer, and organizer. In her role as a People Operations lead, she likes to weave workplaces full of compassion and growth. With over 4 years hacking "decentralized HR" in crypto projects, she's deep in the future of work that web3 is birthing. Her roots are in Restorative Justice & activist communities, and she's branched out to start the People Ops Guild & open source the learnings on decentralized people-management that this space has uncovered.

title: Transitioning from company to DAO: how to care for contributors & make them effective
description: Maker, ShapeShift, Gitcoin - many crypto companies have resolved into DAOs. How did they do it? What was it like for contributors? This transition brings profound changes in compensation, contracts, decision making, self management - and it can feel like whiplash to contributors & leaders alike. Come for some storytelling & learned best practices on how to maintain vibes & productivity when you turn everything upside down. This is relevant for folks just leaving web2 to join web3 as well!

speakers.name: Everton Fraga
speakers.description:
Former Software Engineer at the Ethereum Foundation, now working for AWS as Sr. Blockchain Specialist. 

Purpose-driven builder, helping a variety of blockchain businesses being built on the cloud.

title: Achieving massive scale with Ethereum RPC nodes on the cloud
description:
Has your application gone viral and you need to quickly scale up Ethereum nodes operation?

Learn with blockchain experts Everton Fraga (former engineer @ Ethereum Foundation, currently Sr. Blockchain Specialist @ AWS) and Tim Berger (Fintech Startups Solution Architect @ AWS). We will walk you through techniques for scaling RPC throughput, allowing for quick turnaround time for scaling based on demand. Most importantly, all that in a very cost-efficient way.

speakers.name: Alexandre Roque
speakers.description: Alexandre is the Product Lead of Namada, bringing private transfers for any asset.

title: Private transfers for any asset (ETH, NFTs, ERC20 tokens and more)
description: Transparency in blockchain makes our financial data available for analysis. Financial privacy should be default and inherent in the systems we use for transacting. Namada is a sovereign chain that enables private transactions for any asset. It uses a multi-asset shielded pool derived from the Zcash Sapling zero knowledge circuit and features a natively integrated Ethereum bridge that allows to transfer ETH, NFTs and ERC20 tokens privately.

speakers.name: Chris Hamer
speakers.description: An ethereum and public goods enthusiast who is currently working for ConsenSys as a Global Trainer for North and South America.

title: Building a Stronger Colombia with Web3
description: Colombia is one of the fastest growing markets for cryptocurrency in South America, only behind Venezuela. Inflation, poor living conditions, low pay and a whole lot adds fuel to the fire here of the publics' desire to gain financial independence. What can be done to help this growth in Colombia and how can Ethereum help them push them into something better.

speakers.name: Austin Przybysz
speakers.description:
Austin is a solution architect by trade and has been involved in data mesh, crypto investing, and Web3 spaces for his entire career.
He leads and develops the overall vision of the solution through to the delivery of the end product.

title: Ethical Data Governance and the Creation of Hybrid Solutions
description: This talk is about how Digital Reef is decentralizing data access management using Polygon Edge to enable distributed computation and data governance at scale. Digital Reef's new system takes advantage of the digital asset capabilities encouraging the decentralization of data policies in a secure framework. In addition, we will focus on how to enhance data privacy and facilitate ethical data management.

speakers.name: antonia.durisch@ammer.group
speakers.description: I'm Ammer Groups Master of Chaos - it's a pleasure to meet you!

title: Heralding into the new era of Web3 payment solutions
description: Ammer Cards is heralding the new era of Web3 payment. With the disruptive solution of a crypto to crypto card, it combines the desire for tradition with the progressive spirit of digitalization. Ammer Card is a multi-asset hardware wallet with an accessible shape of a bank card with NFC capability. It comes with an easy-to-use companion app called Ammer Wallet. The breakthrough? Enabling blockchain transactions on PoS devices in shops within seconds!

speakers.name: Kev Wedderburn
speakers.description: Head of Noir Language at Aztec. BSc Computer Science and Mathematics from Queen Mary University. Two years experience implementing ZKPs including PLONK as a Cryptography Engineer at Dusk Network. Rust specialist.

title: Join Split in 10 Lines
description:
Demonstration of how drawing from a standard cryptographic library can reduce zero knowledge circuit implementations to simple programs of as few as 3 lines.

The Join split circuit is a popular circuit that originated from Zcash and is being used in Aztec. Using the Aztec Noir standard library, we reconstruct the join split in 10 lines hiding all of the circuit complexities involved.

speakers.name: Benjamin Memisevic
speakers.description: I'm a smart-contract/full stack engineer who is in love with De-Fi and blockchain in general. I have been working in the space for 3 years now and have primarily focused on building bonds-on-blockchain, derivative trading and blockchain observavability platforms. i have significant experience in the oracle space having worked with Chainlink for 2 years and have a real passion for ensuring external data arrives un-compromised and in-tact when powering blockchain-applications.

title: Blockchain Analytics 101: Building an Indexer from Scratch
description: A workshop which goes through how to build an EVM observability application and how to interpret the data collected. This workshop aims to empower users to venture into blockchain analytics to identify arbitrage opportunities, high value projects and the centralization of protocol/DAO voting power in a protocol.

speakers.name: Alice Henshaw
speakers.description: Alice is a smart contract engineer at Uniswap. Previously she was a smart contract auditor and researcher at OpenZeppelin.

speakers.name: Sara Reynolds
speakers.description: Sara is an engineer at Uniswap Labs and previously co-founded she256. Day to day she spends time thinking about about smart contracts esp those related to dexes :) , scalability & layer2s, and the culture of web3.

title: EIP-1153: Transient Storage, Everlasting Gains.
description: EIP-1153 adds transient storage opcodes to allow storage to be used cheaply for the duration of a transaction without reads and writes to disk. We‚Äôll see how common solidity patterns used across applications like Uniswap, Opensea, Arbitrum, and Optimism could benefit from this change by analyzing gas savings, code elegance, and new design patterns accessible with this opcode. We'll finish with a demo of the transient keyword and the relative savings associated with using it in smart contracts.

speakers.name: Dhaiwat
speakers.description: 21 year old web3 builder and educator. Developer Advocate @ Ankr. Developer DAO gang

speakers.name: Rahat Chowdhury
speakers.description: Rahat is a hip hop artist turned web developer, indie hacker, and web3 enthusiast. Rahat's passions include advocating for mental health in tech, music, gaming, and mentoring new developers especially in the web3 space. He currently works as a Developer Advocate at Polygon.

title: Filling in the UX Gaps for your dApp
description: Creating dApps for crypto natives has resulted in a poor UX and a difficult onboarding experience for others. In this workshop, we will go over ways to supercharge the user experience. We'll talk about best practices for wallet connection requests, transaction updates, and error handling. By the end of this workshop, you will be able to understand how to build a great user experience for your front ends.

speakers.name: Taylor Monahan
speakers.description: Building MetaMask.

title: The Original Sin
description:
MetaMask's userbase grew from 300k to over 30 million during this last bull run. It was an incredibly optimistic time filled with boundless creativity and progress. It was also a chaotic and painful time that led to many having a negative experience with‚Äîand/or perception of‚Äîweb3 on the whole.

As the market cools, let's look at some of the original choice that have been enshrined over time and decide whether those choices are, in fact, the best choices for the future we trying to build.

speakers.name: Joshua Hay
speakers.description: Community Manager for Truebit.

title: Upstream / Downstream  - How to view and verify data on  blockchains

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: In a world where more and more data and projects are being brought onto Etherium every day, the risk is exponentially increasing in that developers believe these processes are fully auditable and transparent. Is this true? Are we building blockchain projects and platforms assuming all Upstream and Downstream data is fully accurate? This panel discusses some of the challenges in this space and how this data should be viewed moving forward.

speakers.name: Raoul Schaffranek
speakers.description: Raoul Schaffranek studied Computer Science at RWTH Aachen University, Germany, where he obtained B.Sc. and M.Sc. degrees. He wrote his master thesis about compositional modeling and fully automated verification of distributed systems and formalized his findings with the Isabelle proof assistant. After leaving University, Raoul joined Runtime Verification as a formal verification engineer, where he spends most of his time on security audits for the Ethereum ecosystem.

title: Tackling rounding errors with precision analysis
description: Rounding errors in smart contracts can lead to severe security vulnerabilities. In this talk, we'll motivate the importance of rigorous numerical analysis through real-world exploits, and review existing precision analysis techniques. We'll then argue for the development of automated error propagation analysis tools to overcome the tediousness of manual efforts.

speakers.name: Tynan Richards
speakers.description: Blockchain Security Engineer for ChainSecurity

title: Optimizing Solidity Code
description: Tips & tricks to optimize Solidity code and compiler options for gas efficiency and bytecode size. From loop optimizations and efficient comparisons of values to optimizing immutable variables to use less bytecode size. In addition, we will go over the many arguments the Solidity optimizer can take and discuss their effects on the compiled code.

speakers.name: Daniel Perez
speakers.description:
Software engineer with 10+ years of experience and open-source advocate with over 3,000 GitHub stars. Currently Daniel is finishing up his PhD at Imperial College London, where his research is on the security of blockchain systems and applications.  
Daniel is also a co-founder at [Backd](https://backd.fund) and [Gyroscope](https://gyro.finance).

speakers.name: Ariah Klages-Mundt
speakers.description: Ariah is a DeFi researcher with a track record of predicting design problems in stablecoins, including the design issues in Dai that contributed to Black Thursday. He has designed and built a large part of Gyroscope, including new AMMs and stablecoin markets. He is an Applied Math PhD student at Cornell University, for which he was a Bloomberg Fellow and Commercialization Fellow. He worked previously in the financial technology sector.

speakers.name: Lewis Gudgeon
speakers.description: Lewis is a Computer Science PhD candidate at Imperial College London, publishing mainly on DeFi risks. Prior to this he worked as an economics consultant. He holds an MPhil in Economics Research from the University of Cambridge and a BA in Philosophy, Politics and Economics from Warwick University.

title: Security Risks in DeFi: Delineating Technical and Economic Security

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: The frenetic evolution of DeFi makes it hard to understand its principles and risks. In our talk, We delineate DeFi along the axes of primitives, protocol types and security risks. We distinguish technical security, which has a healthy literature, from economic security, which is largely unexplored, connecting the latter with new models and thereby synthesizing insights from computer science and economics. Finally, we outline the open research challenges across these security types.

speakers.name: Josh Lehman
speakers.description: Josh Lehman is the Executive Director at the Urbit Foundation, which funds development grants and supports organizations building on the network. Prior to establishing the Urbit Foundation, Josh was the CTO at Tlon, which fostered the Urbit Foundation as an internal project before it was officially spun off at the beginning of this year. Josh is currently based in California.

speakers.name: Ted Blackman
speakers.description: Ted Blackman has been an Urbit kernel developer for over four years. Previously he worked in distributed systems, full-stack web development, and robotics. He has been founding and working with startups since 2006 and was president of the MIT entrepreneurs club from 2008 to 2010

title: Why Your Web3 Stack Still Sucks
description: Josh Lehman (Executive Director at Urbit Foundation) and Ted Blackman (Engineering at Tlon) discuss how Urbit is the ideal complement for blockchains, specifically as a developer environment for directly shipping apps to users. As a from-scratch, principles-first rewrite of the entire software stack, Urbit provides two key advantages to Ethereum developers: a place for off-chain state and compute, and a unified software stack that makes it possible for communities to build their own tools.

speakers.name: John Adler
speakers.description: Co-founder of Celestia Labs and Fuel Labs. Creator of optimistic rollups. Blockchain skeptic and Twitter troll.

title: Fuel: Scaling Ethereum with the Fastest Modular Execution Layer
description:
Fuel is the fastest modular execution layer. It brings UTXO-based parallel transaction execution, a more flexible transaction format, a more efficient virtual machine, and a superior vertically-integrated developer stack to Ethereum.

From the creator of optimistic rollups, this exclusive talk will discuss how users and developers will be able to leverage Fuel for global scale, without having to sacrifice decentralization or the security of Ethereum.

speakers.name: Nikhil Raghuveera
speakers.description: Nikhil is a Partner in Strategy & Innovation at the Celo Foundation where he manages the DeFi for the People initiative. He is also a Senior Fellow at the Atlantic Council‚Äôs GeoTech and GeoEconomics Centers.

title: Empowering Farmers in Kenya with Credit Delegation and DeFi
description: The Celo Foundation launched an employer-based lending pilot in Kenya with Mercy Corps Ventures, Cinch Markets, Moola Market, and Kotani Pay. This first-of-its kind pilot explored a scalable solution for microloans that allows employees of the agriculture company Cinch to access DeFi loans through text messages and credit delegation.

speakers.name: Gabriel Rocheleau
speakers.description: Smart contracts developer at Enzyme Finance and developer at the Ethereum Foundation (EthereumJS team), where my current focus is the transition from Merkle to Verkle trees.

title: Experiments with the EthereumJS client
description: The idea of the workshop is to present the EthereumJS stack and  then help people to set up a local EthereumJS Client testnet. With a set up and running EthereumJS client, we will then experiment as a group, for example by activating one of the newer EIPs on our own testnet and then sending a custom tx which would make use of the new opcode/functionality.

speakers.name: Oliver Studd
speakers.description: Pioneering decentralised and ethical banking at Valhalla Network DAO.

title: Decentralising the Banking System
description:
How Ethereum can be used to bridge 'decentralised finance' with 'traditional finance' to create a decentralised banking system for the people.

Explaining why decentralised banking systems are vital for healthy economies and to enable small businesses to thrive. Highlighting the real world impact of combining the potential & ethos of blockchain with the power of banking licences to reduce banking crises and inequality, and boost employment, quality of life, and small business growth.

speakers.name: Jorik
speakers.description:
Jorik has a background in compilers, type theory and networking.
They are a cairo-lang experts working at Nethermind. They have contributed to Warp - a Solidity to Cairo transpiler - and the AAVE to Starknet port.
In the process he's had to teach himself zkStarks

speakers.name: Swapnil
speakers.description:
Swapnil has a background in compilers and type theory.
They are a cairo-lang expert working at Nethermind. They have contributed to Warp - a Solidity to Cairo transpiler - and the AAVE to Starknet port.

title: Deving on L2s: Intro to Starknet
description:
An introduction to L2 development featuring StarkNet, cairo-lang and broader tools in the ecosystem which takes you through a toy 'bridged' AMM and teaches you:

- Starknet
- cairo-lang
- Implementation tradeoffs
- Common dev pitfalls
- L1 <-> L2 Messaging (bonus mention of Fossil)
- Test tooling

While the focus of the workshop is on StarkNet this workshop should help developers reason about developing for rollups and how their state interacts.

Hax0rs should bring their own laptop.

speakers.name: Leland
speakers.description: Venture team lead at Galaxy Digital

title: Rollup Hardware Market Structure
description:
* ZKRs require specialized hardware to reduce proof generation time
* In a world with 100s of application specific rollups what does the market structure look like?
* Will is be similar to mining where there are hardware producers, miners (or provers in this case), pool operators, etc? Or will it be radically different

speakers.name: Tom Waite
speakers.description: Engineer at the Tribe DAO who most recently built out the optimistic governance at the DAO using Optimistic Pods. Prior to that he was an early employee at the ZK-Rollup and privacy company, Aztec Protocol.

speakers.name: john sterlacci
speakers.description: co-founder orca protocol

title: Optimistic DAO governance with pods
description: This talk explores the concept of optimistic governance for DAOs. It specifically dives into the technology and architecture for how it can be built out at large DAO sized scale to provide an "express lane" for proposals. The talk will cover several aspects of the optimistic governance implementation built at the Tribe DAO (https://blog.orcaprotocol.org/how-tribe-dao-uses-pods-for-optimistic-governance/) using a technology called an Orca pod.

speakers.name: Amadeo Brands
speakers.description: I have a background in Computer Science & Economics I‚Äôm an early crypto investor, who worked for the first crypto hedge fund in The Netherlands. To date, I‚Äôm a freelance Fundamental Analyst and Token Engineer with a passion for Decentralized Finance #DeFi while working as a freelancer and a DAO Enthusiast.

title: Crypto risks and opportunities
description: Would like to be on a panel to discuss the risks in crypto and the responsibilities/opportunities we have as an industry to move forward and harden the DeFi ecosystem. I work with Curve Finance and FortunaFi on the product and risk side. Would love to share my insights about stablecoins and other crypto-assets in a panel. My view is that we need more real-world asset adoption and risk teams that can educate legacy financial players to explore DeFi and all it has to offer.

speakers.name: Bobbin Threadbare
speakers.description: Bobbin is a project lead of Polygon Miden - a STARK-based ZK-rollup being developed at Polygon. Prior to joining Polygon, Bobbin was ZK researcher at Facebook's Novi, where he led the development of Winterfell, as highly-performant general-purpose STARK prover. Besides Winterfell, Bobbin has made multiple contributions to the field of STARK-based proving systems, including a STARK-based virtual machine (Distaff) and AirScript/AirAssembly languages (work supported by the Ethereum Foundation).

title: Using a hybrid UTXO and account-based state model in a ZK rollup on an example of Polygon Miden

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Many rollups choose to follow Ethereum‚Äôs account-based state model. We explore an alternative approach: a hybrid of a UTXO and an account-based model, specifically in a context of a ZK rollup. This approach offers a number of interesting properties including local transaction execution, support for privacy-preserving smart contracts, and reduced state bloat. In this talk we describe tradeoffs between different state models and cover the specific design choices we‚Äôve made with Polygon Miden.

speakers.name: Everton Fraga
speakers.description:
Former Software Engineer at the Ethereum Foundation, now working for AWS as Sr. Blockchain Specialist. 

Purpose-driven builder, helping a variety of blockchain businesses being built on the cloud.

title: Building production-grade low-code Ethereum serverless applications
description:
In this workshop we'll walk through an opinionated framework that makes it easy to build production-grade serverless applications, using some popular AWS services, including Amazon Managed Blockchain for Ethereum.

The use cases are many: Analytics, Gas tracker, event-based applications, sending transactions, smart contract monitoring and more.

* We'll provide ephemeral AWS accounts for the participants for the duration of the workshop.

speakers.name: nader dabit
speakers.description: Author, teacher, software engineer.

title: Modular Blockchain Development
description:
Like Bitcoin and Ethereum introduced new paradigms for building decentralized apps, we‚Äôre now seeing another shift in how blockchain networks are architected, moving away from monolithic architectures to a modular approach that decouples the various layers like consensus, execution, data availability, and settlement

In this workshop you'll learn the different components of the modular stack, how they work together, and how to deploy a smart contract to a sovereign rollup on a modular network

speakers.name: Gloria Kimbwala
speakers.description: Gloria is a Builder Relations expert for Gitcoin's events team where she recently lead Gitcoin‚Äôs DEI Grants round in GR14. She is passionately using technology to empower people economically and to amplify marginalized voices. She also enjoys creating and amplifying web3 ecosystems built on inclusivity and diversity.  She serves as the Technical Advisor on the Board of Directors for the Black Women Blockchain Council,  and runs the  ‚ÄúAsk Gloria‚Äù advice column in Reinvented Magazine.

title: Be a superhero!  Tangible actions to support diverse builders and show allyship in web3 communities.
description: In this session, we will discuss the need for Diversity, Inclusion, and Belonging and how it affects builder communities. We will also learn actional ways to be a better accomplice to diverse builders, colleagues, and communities. This workshop will address ways to attract, retain, and promote diverse talent as well as advocate for diverse perspectives in policy and personal spaces.

speakers.name: Collin Myers
speakers.description: Collin is the co-founder & CEO of Obol Labs, a R&D-focused team developing a protocol for trust-minimized staking. Before Obol, Collin led global product strategy at ConsenSys and was the global head of BD at Token Foundry.

title: The Past, Present, and Future of running Ethereum Validators
description:
A journey through the where Ethereum staking started, tools to run a validator today, and the overview of how Distributed Validator Technology(DVT) will improve the at-home validating experience

Run through the initial user experience of the [Ethereum Staking Launchpad](https://launchpad.ethereum.org/).

The recent at-home validator experience and tooling.

The future of setting up fault-tolerant validators with DVT.

speakers.name: Janice Taylor
speakers.description: 3X founder, Built early products in digital animation and children's digital safety across 5 major sports league, Creator of healing modality Ahava as it pertains to financial wellness, Founder of EQ exchange, first all women led team in the Music NFT finance space. Author, Award Winner, Oprah Top 150.

title: Solving Financial Inequality In Music
description: The underpinnings of the current financial system (web2) was built with inherent bias towards women and people of colour. The promise of Web3 and the brilliant innovation of Ethereum allows for the first time in history where financial inequality can be addressed. The tools that have and have not been created today in the future hold the promise to solve this inequality. Music and creative endeavours are the great equalizer across all societies. Music is the universal language of Web3.

speakers.name: nader dabit
