He joined ConsenSys to work on the Ujo Music project, one of the first applications to utilize Ethereum outside of finance applications, and helped build some of the earliest NFTs. Later he worked at Infura, Optimism, Foundation and now Holograph where he continues to focus on NFT protocols.

title: The Core of the System is the Virtual Machine
description:
In this workshop, I will give an overview of the Holograph Protocol, demonstrate how developers can utilize it to seamlessly bridge ERC20 and ERC721 tokens across all EVM compatible chains without escrowing the tokens or losing any provenance of the assets (for NFTs). 

The workshop will consist of a short presentation, introduction to the docs and tooling so that developers have a launching-off point to begin building off the protocol, using the CLI and SDK to build multi-chain applications

speakers.name: Ryan Lackey
speakers.description: Ryan Lackey has been a cypherpunk since the early 1990s. After working on anonymous Chaumian blinded electronic cash and dropping out of MIT, he moved to the Caribbean to build his first startup. Co-founder of the world's first offshore datahaven, HavenCo, he also has worked as a war-zone defense contractor, founded a YC-funded startup to Cloudflare, and is now Chief Security Officer of Evertas, the first dedicated cryptoasset insurance company.

title: Notable security incidents since Devcon V

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: October 2019 seems like an eternity ago, and there have been a variety of interesting, sometimes novel, and sometimes repetitive security incidents across the ecosystem since then.  We will discuss those incidents, what went wrong, how they've been resolved, and what lessons have been learned, or new mechanisms put in place, in the service of preventing a repeat.

speakers.name: Charles St. Louis
speakers.description:
Charles St. Louis is the COO and Head of Governance at Element Finance. Previously, he was the Decentralized Governance Architecture at the Maker Foundation and the first mandated member of MakerDAO elected by MKR Holders. 

He's been an active contributor to Ethereum / Ethereum Cat Herders, helping with improving the EIP process, coordination of hardforks, advising of Ethereum.org, and working on Ethereum developer growth strategy.

title: Why Crypto Protocols Are Failing at Governance, and How to Fix It
description:
Governments have failed and evolved over thousands of years. But some web3 projects were built as though they‚Äôd get it right on the first try. That‚Äôs not realistic. And it‚Äôs not working. People don‚Äôt vote, the rules are complex, and protocols aren‚Äôt inclusive.

No one solution fixes all our problems but what we can do is build more adaptable governance systems. With a flexible, upgradeable, and modular foundation, governance systems can increase innovation & participation and decrease turmoil.

speakers.name: Francesco Renzi
speakers.description: Francesco has been in the Ethereum ecosystem since 2017. He loves building and participating in every hackathon under the sun. He's recently founded and leads Superfluid, a protocol for streamable assets.

title: Beyond ERC20 and ERC721
description:
ERC20 and ERC721 have cemented themselves into the EVM. They are so radicated in the the developer mindshare that it seems almost unfathomable to go beyond them, as all infrastructure, protocols, wallets, and explorers support them, and only them.

In this talk I'll go through some of the pitfalls of these standards, some missed opportunities and some of the recent, competing standards. I'll also explain how the growing rollup ecosystem offers an unprecedented opportunity to upgrade token UX.

speakers.name: David Silverman
speakers.description:
David Silverman is a Product Manager at Aave Companies working on Lens Protocol, the Lens API and other tooling to enable developers to build Web3-powered experiences designed for mass adoption.

Previously David was a member of the Core Team of Constitution DAO and a Product Manager at Catchpoint Systems.

title: Building the Experience Layer
description:
The next generation of Web3 apps will draw from multiple protocols on various chains and scaling solutions to create novel experiences for users.

Learn how Aave Companies and other developers are building this new experience layer using tools such as the Lens API to build new applications leveraging data from protocols including Lens Protocol, ENS, POAP, and Proof of Humanity and more.

speakers.name: Connor O'Day
speakers.description: Connor's background is in economics and computer science. He began working at ConsenSys in 2015 followed by Gitcoin in 2019. He initially focused on growing the Gitcoin developer community via virtual hackathons and more recently, following the launch of GitcoinDAO, has transitioned to work full-time managing Grants Ecosystem rounds with the PGF workstream. Today he's excited about growing adoption of the quadratic funding mechanism and experimenting with it in new and unique ways.

title: New Applications for Quadratic Funding
description: Since the inception of Quadratic Funding, the mechanism has been used to fund open source and public goods primarily in Web3. Recently, Gitcoin and others have begun experimenting with QF in new ways to address real-world issues (climate change, health, policy), for specific ecosystems, and localized communities. What other use cases can leverage Ethereum and QF to distribute funding more democratically? Perhaps within governments, charities, as DAO tooling, for semi-public goods, and more.

speakers.name: Aidan Hyman
speakers.description: Aidan is a co-founder and CEO of ChainSafe Systems, overseeing all of ChainSafe‚Äôs work. For fun Aidan likes to read about economic theory while wearing homemade Linux hats.

title: Inclusivity over Exclusivity
description: In my talk I will be discussing the opportunity in creating dapps that create inclusive communities that empower individual participation versus the exclusive communities we see being built today.

speakers.name: Mashiat Mutmainnah
speakers.description:
Celo NFT Ecosystem Lead at Celo Foundation
Education @ Bouys Club Crypto 
Prev. Executive Director @she_256

title: The Case for Centralization: Coordinating More Effectively in a Decentralized World
description: Often times, web3 is pitted against web2, citing centralized systems as the major points of failure for security and user's agency. Even though it is important that we start reverting back to the decentralized web, centralization still has its benefits, specifically in bringing unity around distributed groups. In this talk, we will go over how we can build better tools, infrastructure and communication frameworks to coordinate communities more effectively to grow a decentralized ecosystem.

speakers.name: Thomas Mattimore
speakers.description: Head of Platform (Protocol) at Reserve.org. For much of my career, I have worked in FinTech, building products that bring high-quality financial services to a broader demographic than traditionally available.

title: Challenges & Advances in Decentralized Governance
description:
As more complex systems evolve on-chain, we expect there to be more situations where it would be useful to use a single governance token for multiple systems. However, in these situations, the standard Governor Bravo design becomes easily susceptible to governance attacks by malicious actors.

We will share some of the potential ways to mitigate against these governance attacks as well as share ongoing research into how we can improve on-chain, decentralized governance.

speakers.name: Connor O'Day
speakers.description: Connor's background is in economics and computer science. He began working at ConsenSys in 2015 followed by Gitcoin in 2019. He initially focused on growing the Gitcoin developer community via virtual hackathons and more recently, following the launch of GitcoinDAO, has transitioned to work full-time managing Grants Ecosystem rounds with the PGF workstream. Today he's excited about growing adoption of the quadratic funding mechanism and experimenting with it in new and unique ways.

title: New Applications for Quadratic Funding
description: Since the inception of Quadratic Funding, the mechanism has been used to fund open source and public goods primarily in Web3. Recently, Gitcoin and others have begun experimenting with QF in new ways to address real-world issues (climate change, health, policy), for specific ecosystems, and localized communities. What other use cases can leverage Ethereum and QF to distribute funding more democratically? Perhaps within governments, charities, as DAO tooling, for semi-public goods, and more.

speakers.name: Plinio Braga
speakers.description: Lead UX Designer at Kleros.

title: Designing the court of the future: How we validated the design, turning feedback into improvements.
description: Dispute resolution systems are a key component for true decentralization. This talk will explore the design of Court v.2 highlighting the importance of testing the prototype to early identify issues, learn about users, and improve the UX. In particular, it will focus on how to structure and execute a user testing plan. We will discuss a real use case: Kleros Court v.2, exploring the testing process adopted, and the insights acquired. We'll finish with some tips on creating a testing plan.

speakers.name: Michael Raybman
speakers.description:
I am building NFT marketplaces at Mojito (launched the Liverpool Football Club Heroes collection). Previously he worked in VC at HustleFund, and built dApps at Level K.

As a builder, I was most recently hackathon runner-up at EthSF with a Harberger Tax pixel map game.

(I can submit a more complete bio, but want to keep things simple here).

title: User-Generated Value for NFT's
description:
How do we make NFT's that: 

- Bring value to all consumers, not just wealthy collectors
- Can be stable or grow over time as a function of their use, not purely speculative value
- Motivate use cases outside of membership access.

speakers.name: Brent Martin
speakers.description:
I work for Moonshot Collective as a part of GitcoinDAO.

I've been leading Product Teams since 2016. Started working in crypto with Ethereum in 2017. And most recently started working in Identity in 2018. 

I specialize in early-stage products (0 to 1 stuff), usually built out of Labs from larger organizations.

title: Moving Identity from Web2 to Web3: replacing extractive practices with human-first values
description:
Currently, users of the internet are exposed to identification methods everyday that are harmful. Most people don‚Äôt understand the difference between authorization and verification of a users data.

I would like to cover: 
‚Ä¢ how users rights are being taken away
‚Ä¢ what solutions we can implement to fix this using Web3 tech
‚Ä¢ how we‚Äôve already done so, with some examples

And end by guiding builders with the Web3 Identity Values they should be implementing into what they are building.

speakers.name: Thibauld
speakers.description: Author of the Continuous Organization whitepaper, co-founder & co-CEO of Fairmint, the decentralized platform that makes community ownership easy. Prior to launching Fairmint, Thibauld served as Partner at The Family, an early stage accelerator, where he spearheaded investment & research on blockchain and cryptocurrencies. He's also the co-founder of LaPrimaire.org, a non-profit created to crowdsource the best candidates for public offices.

title: Generalizing DAOs: The Case for Distributed Automated Organizations
description: DAOs have captured the world's imagination to create more open & transparent organizations. The past years have shown that DAOs are great to collectively manage specific assets like on-chain commons (protocols), public goods or co-owned investments. To change capitalism, we need to generalize the values of DAOs to non-decentralized private organizations. This talk will present the case for Distributed Automated Organizations, a generalization of DAOs for non-decentralized entities.

speakers.name: Florian Glatz
speakers.description:
Trained as a lawyer and software developer with many years of experience working full-time in the blockchain space, Florian is aware of the key issues at the intersection of crypto assets and regulation.

Florian Glatz has co-founded and led the German Blockchain Association (Bundesblock) as President for its first four years. He advises political decision-makers at the German and European level on blockchain regulation.

speakers.name: Marina Markezic
speakers.description: Marina is the co-founder of EUCI, which aims to propel EU regulation to become Defi-friendly. Since 2017 Marina has been advising crypto projects on governance and legal matters with a focus on decentralization, DeFi and NFTs. She previously led the advisory team of blockchain accelerator cofound.it and co-founded a crowdinvesting platform.

title: The influence of crypto regulation on open blockchains: opportunities and challenges
description: With the wider adoption, the use of open blockchains and dapps built on top of it is becoming progressively regulated by governments all over the world (especially in the EU and the U.S.). Understanding and adjusting to these regulations is becoming a reality for many projects in the ecosystem, especially the ones facing the users and the community. What will be the impact of regulation on the Ethereum ecosystem and how it might change the existing use cases, designs and utilities?

speakers.name: Mihai Cosma
speakers.description: Former central banker working on the public good of the future.

title: Are we building a dystopia? Ethereum inflation, staking and fees
description:
Who are your stakeholders? Holders, stakers, builders, users, traders, or someone else? The answer *should* drive incentive design at the protocol and app layers. 

Drawing lessons from economic history and blockchain data to tease out unintended consequences: was EIP-1559 bad for users? Will staking yields increase inequality?

speakers.name: thewanderingeditor
speakers.description: A philosopher and editor who got into the space to try and save crypto from itself. Worked in various privacy projects across multiple chains since 2016

title: Stop Trying to Design Governance Systems to Reach the "Right" Decision
description: Several recent high profile governance votes have been criticised for reaching poor decisions. But proposed solutions invariably attack the problem from the from angle. It's irresponsible to design crypto governance to do anything more than capture the voices of all engaged participants. Other issues -- whether it's low voter turnout, whale control, or greedy short-sighted voters -- need to be tackled from outside. The urge to bake correct decision making into the system itself must be avoided.

speakers.name: Victor Manuel Mendoza Echeverri
speakers.description: A pesar de ser ingeniero electricista, hoy me desempe√±o como desarrollador de software, pues entend√≠ que las habilidades se adquieren con pasi√≥n y dedicaci√≥n de diversas maneras; y a eso me dedico, a seguir aprendiendo y creciendo individualmente pero tambi√©n de la mano de personas que me inspiran.

speakers.name: Camilo Rivera
speakers.description: I am from San Juan de Pasto, south of Colombia. I live in Medell√≠n and I have been working since a little more than 3 years ago lika a software developer at Unergy, a renewable energy company of LATAM. I am passionate about cybersecurity and blockchain. My favorite language is Python because since I learned it I know that I could build very big things.

title: Los retos de desarrollar en Web3 con un prop√≥sito sostenible
description: Llevar la sostenibilidad a la web3 es todo un reto de cara a las decisiones y renuncias que el equipo de desarrollo debe tomar en medio del proceso.

speakers.name: Isaac Lee
speakers.description: Isaac is the Interim Chief Information Officer at ZKSpace. Isaac has been instrumental in the technical development of ZKSpace, a layer 2 ecosystem comprised of three major components: ZKSwap, an innovative Layer 2 AMM DEX powered by ZK-Rollups technology; ZKSquare, a payment service; and ZKSea, an NFT minting center and marketplace. Z

title: ZKSea: A Layer 2 NFT Marketplace
description: An NFT marketplace called ZKSea will be introduced. In-depth evaluation of speed, security, scalability & cost-effectiveness of the platform. Analyze the history of successful collaborations with well-known companies. Introduce the current partnership with a legendary football player and discuss the advantages.

speakers.name: Nirvaan Ranganathan
speakers.description: Nirvaan Ranganathan is the Program Manager at Climate Collective where he leads collaborative efforts towards tokenizing natural capital and fostering a regenerative finance ecosystem on Celo. He has a background in software engineering, financial services, climate sciences, and music.

title: ReFi in the Real World: Tangible Insights From Web3's Builders Leading Regenerative Finance Projects
description: Regenerative Finance predates Web3. But how does this reimagining of human-made economic systems solve the world's cascading crises? Hear from ReFi-focused builders solutioning real-world use cases that empower local economies to regenerate global ecologies. Topics include harnessing geospatial integrations for smart contracts (Astral Protocol), implementing localized DAO governance mechanisms (Kolektivo), modeling community currencies (Longtail), and fractionalizing carbon offsets (Toucan).

speakers.name: Beth McCarthy
speakers.description:
Beth is a Berlin-based researcher and strategist. By day, she's working in people, ops & culture at Toucan. By night, she dives into the collective organization and decentralized governance space.
She's involved in Dept. of Decentralization, the Sphere and Trust. Beth is passionate about the cypherpunk potential future of Web3. She enjoys geeking out at the intersection of art, philosophy, law, and computational systems of behavior.

title: Building through the Bear Market: Scaling Antifragile, Adaptable Companies & DAOS

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
Panel with seasoned web3 veterans who have weathered past down cycles to emerge with strong networks, regenerative ethos, skill at identifying opportunities for sustainable growth, and practical optimism for where we can emerge next.

Focus on ReFi; mutually beneficial cooperation with institutions and regulators; strengthened connections between web3 x real-world applications in climate tech, art and decentralised science; and adaptable responses to systemic problems like burnout.

speakers.name: Shumo Chu
speakers.description: I am co-founder of Manta Network. I graduated as a PhD from University of Washington Computer Science and Engineering, where I was advised by computer scientist Dan Suciu. I obtained my bachelor degree from Wuhan University, China. Before Manta, I was a research scientist at Algorand and assistant professor at UCSB.

speakers.name: Brandon H. Gomes
speakers.description: Mathematician | Software Engineer | CTO @ Manta Network

title: P0xeidon VM: an EVM design with composable and modular privacy
description: In this talk, we present P0xeidon VM (PVM), an EVM equivalent smart contract platform developed by p0xeidon labs, brings effortless and scalable privacy to EVM chains and L2s. Different from top-down solutions like ZKZK-Rollup , P0xeidon takes a bottom-up approach: it deploy privacy primitives like fungible token/non-fungible token circuit, private voting circuit, etc in EVM-precompiles and expose them as composable contract function calls and thus is more practical and has cheaper cost.

speakers.name: Nicol√°s Villegas
speakers.description: Engineer and mathematician, have been building technology for the last 8 years. Became interested into blockchain while taking cryptography courses at University. I have been part of the blockchain ecosystem for 3 years now.

title: Energy-related initiatives that are changing the crypto ecosystem
description: In this session we will talk about how different energy-related initiatives around the world are leveraging in the crypto ecosystem and how they are they bringing to the blockchain meaningful business models that have a positive social, environmental, and economic impact on society.

speakers.name: Nirvaan Ranganathan
speakers.description: Nirvaan Ranganathan is the Program Manager at Climate Collective where he leads collaborative efforts towards tokenizing natural capital and fostering a regenerative finance ecosystem on Celo. He has a background in software engineering, financial services, climate sciences, and music.

title: ReFi Under the Hood: insights from the builders behind leading Regenerative Finance projects
description: Talented builders in the emerging ReFi space will showcase a variety of use cases, tokenization approaches, and development tooling from projects innovating at the intersection of web3 and climate action. Topics include geospatial integrations for smart contracts from Astral Protocol, localized DAO governance mechanisms from Kolektivo, community currency simulation and implementation from Longtail Financial, and approaches to tokenizing and fractionalizing carbon offsets from Toucan Protocol.

speakers.name: Sep Kamvar
speakers.description: Sep Kamvar is a computer scientist, artist, entrepreneur and the co-founder of Celo.

title: Making Money Beautiful
description: How can we harness the unique talent of people, the strength of communities, and the health and biodiversity of global ecosystems to propose economic solutions for the mutual benefit of all? Through universal basic income (UBI), nature-backed currencies, and the creation of new money without new debt, web3 tools can lead to greater financial inclusion, redefining money and its impact on the world, with a vision to create prosperity for all.

speakers.name: Mashiat Mutmainnah
speakers.description:
Celo NFT Ecosystem Lead at Celo Foundation
Education @ Bouys Club Crypto 
Prev. Executive Director @she_256

title: NFTs with Purpose: Minting Non-Fungible Experiences with African Creators
description: Over 60% of African creators are independent artists with no structure to remuneration and government pays flat fee for royalties. In some African communities, artists are targeted and cannot even claim their earnings in public documents. In this talk, we want to explore how to build easy, culturally conscious pathways and tooling for African Creators to launch NFTs and non-fungible experiences with their global communities and empower them to take control of their financial prosperity.

speakers.name: Judd Rosenblatt
speakers.description: Judd is a serial entrepreneur who is trying to allow humans to think better and be better versions of themselves. He started AE as a bootstrapped alternative to VC funding‚Äîhoping eventually to build an agency-increasing brain-computer interface operating system. Or, at least, to draw sufficient attention to the importance of designing technology focused on increasing human agency that, when someone inevitably designs a ubiquitous BCI OS, it doesn't resemble a dystopian future novel.

title: The Golden Age of BCI is coming
description: As the 21st century matures, another revolution is coming: Brain Computer Interfaces (BCI). The same way the steam engine machinery unlocked massive amounts of human effort and time, BCI stands to do the same by making the way humans interact with digital products massively more efficient. Imagine a world where to-do lists are a thing of the past. Instead, you just think. In that same world, patients with ALS and disabilities need not a computer‚Äôs mouse, just their thoughts to communicate!

speakers.name: Jesus Ligero
speakers.description:
I'm currently working on Polygon hermez in the protocol team.
Basically I develop smart contracts and use zero knowledge languages like Circom or zkasm.

title: Explain Hermez2.0 bridge
description: Explanation on how the bridge will work on Hermez2.0, a ZK-EVM project.

speakers.name: Gon√ßalo S√°
speakers.description:
Gon√ßalo, currently co-founder of the ConsenSys Diligence team, has 20+ years of experience in offensive security.
Notable achievements range from cracking DRM algorithms to breaching a major international consumer electronics retailer.

While studying Aerospace engineering, Gon√ßalo also built 3 startups (AdTech, BioTech, Mobile). Passionate about turning MVPs into production-ready products, he has also mentored a fair share of entrepreneurs in the past 5+ years.

title: The evolution of offensive security in web3
description:
Incentives for offensive security work are so misaligned that it has lead to a shortage of security talent and some consequential inadequate timelines for projects to engage in such security practices.
During this talk, we will take a look at the status quo and provide solutions.

speakers.name: Marysol Mauricio
speakers.description: Marysol Mauricio majored in International Business. She is a blockchain consultant and is an education mentor of women on web3. She also co-runs crypto Epic Queen a community to welcome women as creators of crypto and web3. In addition, she is governor in Blu3 LATAM DAO, the mission is empowering women, non-binary and trans people to learn, explore and build their careers and visions in the web3 space.

speakers.name: ANA KAREN  RAMIREZ TELLEZ
speakers.description: MIT INNOVATOR UNDER 35. She is the founder and CEO in Epic Queen, a EDTECH Startup  that seeks to close the gender gap in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Maths) by giving EDUCATION to more than 80 thousand  girls and women. In 2018, Epic Queen was named as one of the 100 initiatives of digital social innovation that are transforming Latin America. In Ana Karen is Crypto Queens Founder, where they educate women in crypto with an NFT project to give crypto scholarships

title: How I create social impact with my NFT collection: Cryptoqueens
description:
Do you know that 81% of cryptocurrency buyers identify as male.

We create an NFT project to involve more women
as creators of the new internet: WEB 3.0 

With focus in LATINAS
‚Äç
We believe that these new technologies will fundamentally change the way we work, exchange money and create assets both virtual and real.

We believe women need to be creators of the new internet and be part of this.

A new era of the internet is dawning and women deserve to be building the future.

speakers.name: ANA KAREN  RAMIREZ TELLEZ
speakers.description: MIT INNOVATOR UNDER 35. In Ana Karen is Crypto Queens Founder, where they educate women in crypto with an NFT project to give crypto scholarships

speakers.name: Rob Solomon
speakers.description: CFO, DIMO

title: Beyond the Airdrop
description: How are tokens used to build aligned ecosystems consisting of users, device manufacturers, app developers, and more? Organizations need to consider intricacies like airdrops and token distribution, but how do they navigate licensing, staking, and arbitration? What role do delegated teams play in connecting different parties?

speakers.name: Nikos Andrikogiannopoulos
speakers.description: Nikos founded the company when he realised that there was a critical need to help blockchain networks remain dependable as they scale up. Having spent a decade at one of the oldest telecom, media and technology strategy consulting firms in the world, and an MBA and a MS (Electrical Engineering & Computer Science) from MIT, his technical and business background is the foundation of Metrika‚Äôs mission.

title: Ensuring the health of the Ethereum blockchain as Proof of Stake emerges
description: As Ethereum moves toward Proof of Stake post merge, network-wide monitoring will be critical to further the blockchain‚Äôs scale, adoption and decentralization efforts. Nikos/Metrika will discuss what blockchain operational data can tell us about network performance and how communities can leverage publicly available tools to help maintain the health of a protocol, become better node operators, and support the Ethereum network‚Äôs continued decentralization in the long run.

speakers.name: Lewis Tuff
speakers.description: Lewis is an accomplished engineering leader with over a decade of experience in the ever-evolving financial space. He‚Äôs led and spearheaded technical teams and initiatives at companies such as Goldman Sachs, UBS, and Revolut. Currently, Lewis is the Vice President of Engineering at Blockchain.com, valued at $14 billion, where he is responsible for the technology underpinning the company‚Äôs services.

title: A Guide to 83M+ Users: Building Scalable Blockchain Applications on Ethereum and Beyond
description: Blockchain scalability is an important factor on the road to mainstream adoption and a priority for Web3 teams today and in the future. Which challenges do engineers face when building on Ethereum as it relates to scalability?  How can technical teams overcome these issues and develop high-performing applications to accommodate short and long term industry growth? And how do scaling solutions - such as Gen 2 blockchains with higher scaling at the protocol level - fit in?

speakers.name: ana belen
speakers.description:
I'm a womxn in tech enthusiast; DAO contributor and Ethereum community lead in M√©xico.
I'm helping the community grow of Ethereum in mexico with @ethereum_mexico and Governor in H.E.R. DAO and H.E.R. DAO LATAM.

title: How web3 ecosystem its impacting womxns life
description: Why and how womxn are being impacted by web3, but also how womxn are important for the growth of the ecosystem and social environment

speakers.name: Beth McCarthy
speakers.description:
Beth is a Berlin-based researcher and strategist. By day, she's working in people, ops & culture at Toucan. By night, she dives into the collective organization and decentralized governance space.
She's involved in Dept. of Decentralization, the Sphere and Trust. Beth is passionate about the cypherpunk potential future of Web3. She enjoys geeking out at the intersection of art, philosophy, law, and computational systems of behavior.

title: Practical Steps for Building Regenerative Culture
description:
This workshop will draw on collective knowledge and skill-sharing on tackle some critical issues in building regenerative culture, including:
- Identifying where your project experience cultural debt, and how to target those areas for solutions
- How to measure success and use analytics to iterate over time
- How to incorporate conflict resolution into cultural practices 
- Incorporating "resource budgets" (carbon, attention/bandwidth) to reduce negative climate and psychological impacts

speakers.name: John Wolpert
speakers.description: John Wolpert works for ConsenSys Mesh R&D and is the co-chair of baseline-protocol.org.

title: Baseline Protocol and blockchain as key to a better loose coupling design pattern.
description: The baseline protocol is the standards body focused on the use of zero knowledge cryptography and public blockchain to enable any state machine to prove information consistency with any other compliant state machine, and to prove to a third party, in a loose coupling manner, some attribute of that information without having to send the cleartext and leak data.

speakers.name: Florian Glatz
speakers.description:
Trained as a lawyer and software developer with many years of experience working full-time in the blockchain space, Florian is aware of the key issues at the intersection of crypto assets and regulation.

Florian Glatz has co-founded and led the German Blockchain Association (Bundesblock) as President for its first four years. He advises political decision-makers at the German and European level on blockchain regulation.

speakers.name: Marina Markezic
speakers.description: Marina is the co-founder of EUCI, which aims to propel EU regulation to become Defi-friendly. Since 2017 Marina has been advising crypto projects on governance and legal matters with a focus on decentralization, DeFi and NFTs. She previously led the advisory team of blockchain accelerator cofound.it and co-founded a crowdinvesting platform.

title: How can regulation influnce the design of your product?
description: The Ethereum ecosystem has seen tremendous growth in the last years. DeFi and NFTs have reached more users than ever before. Another unique trend has been evolving recently, the upcoming regulation addressing specifically these types of dapps. In the workshop, we will cover the most important principles that will have the biggest effect on the existing decentralised applications, such as the limitation of decentralised stablecoin issuance, prohibition of interest earning, KYC requirements, etc.

speakers.name: Elmer Morales
speakers.description: Founder at Campus DAO, the B2B metaverse platform. Hacker, Web3 software engineer, ex Microsoft, ex Accenture.

title: Discovering New Business Models in Web3
description: Learn and discover new business models that can be achieved with decentralization and Web3 technologies.  We will cover case studies and practical applications you can adopt today in your business.

speakers.name: Craig Schuster
speakers.description:
I am a Nebraska native who lived in Hong Kong for 7 years. Covid cut me off from my finances in Hong Kong & needed to recover my funds. Crypto was a utility.

I've taught Language Arts in Hong Kong for 9 years. In Hong Kong. The migrant issue was right in front of my face. Philippine and Indonesian woman working 24 hours a day, 6 days a week, doing all house chores, child rearing, elderly care, running errands and unable to send money to their loves ones without paying 10% in fees.

title: Helping migrant/refugee families learn about digital currency remittances
description:
My name is Craig, I founded a new DAO called RemittDAO. We're not yet official, but it's gaining support fast. The DAO's mission is to educate migrants/refugees who send remittance payments to their loved ones back in their respective countries. THESE are the people who blockchain can help the most. We achieve this through education, field organizing, and hosting meet ups, & marketing.

The remittance industry is setting records again after covid. This is the future of social crypto.

speakers.name: Elmer Morales
speakers.description: Founder at Campus DAO, the B2B metaverse platform. Hacker, Web3 software engineer, ex Microsoft, ex Accenture.

title: Building a Corporate Campus in the Metaverse
description: The next generation of the internet is unfolding in front of us. Web3 and the metaverse are new frontiers businesses must pay close attention to. We will highlight why organizations must act today, or find themselves operating in worlds led by their competitors. We will cover how organizations can adopt Ethereum and other Web3 technologies to build new worlds and business models.

speakers.name: Yijia
speakers.description:
Co-Founder and CEO at Curio Research
Civilization addict

title: Governance in On-Chain Virtual Worlds
description:
At Curio, we build on-chain virtual worlds leveraging unique properties of the blockchain, such as governance, interoperability, and persistence. We believe that the EAs and Epics of our decade and beyond will arise from fundamental innovations in player interactions.

During this workshop, we will discuss our experiments in on-chain world governance, and engage the audience in a real-time gameplay. We will demonstrate unique opportunities players have in shaping these virtual worlds.

speakers.name: Maxwell James Kanter
speakers.description: Maxwell is currently the Talent Lead for the Public Goods Funding workstream at GitcoinDAO, and in 2022 he graduated from the Harvard Graduate School of Education with a Masters in Learning Design. He's passionate about lifelong learning, talent coordination, public goods, and dancing to techno.

title: Playfulness and Lifelong Learning in DAOs
description:
This talk will explore how playfulness and lifelong can be leveraged in DAOs. 

Play isn‚Äôt just recreation, it‚Äôs a tool for human growth and development. Playfulness allows us to enter states of immense creativity, empathy, and risk taking. As web3 builders we can utilize playfulness as a tool to address our shared needs in DAOs and build better worlds. 

The main goal of this talk is to drive home the fact that playfulness is a tool we can use to redesign organizations and do our best work.

speakers.name: BlockMia
speakers.description: Co-Founder/Early Contributor of Mystiko.Network

title: Privacy in Web3
description:
Topic: Privacy in Web3 - if on-chain, it is not privacy. 

Key messages:
- why zk? 
- pain points in privacy in web3? 
- the application and comparison of zk application in privacy
- Why Mystiko Network

Reference:
1) Mystiko.Network's Mission at the Dawn of Web¬†3.0  https://twitter.com/MystikoNetwork/status/1541581400557572098
2) How Much More Private Can ZK Get? An Order of Magnitudehttps://www.coindesk.com/sponsored-content/how-much-more-private-can-zk-get-an-order-of-magnitude/

speakers.name: Iv√°n Torroledo
speakers.description: Ivan has +7 years of experience in software development and technology applied to data analysis in various industries such as financial and mass consumption. His experience combines working in the startup ecosystem and strategic consulting in technology.

title: Is capable Blockchain of fixing emerging economies development challenges via financial industry?
description: Emerging economies are facing great inequality and development challenges, due to sociopolitical instability of our countries and the high exposure to negative events of a globalized world. Blockchain emerges as the solution through access to global tools that are at the level of even developed economies. We will discuss how blockchain, within the fintech industry, democratizes access to financial services beyond national borders, solving one of the biggest challenges for development in LATAM

speakers.name: Dmitriy Ryajov
speakers.description: I've been working on p2p technologies since 2016, first as an IPFS/libp2p maintainer and later as an Ethereum light client researcher with Metamask. I'm also the main author of the nim-libp2p implementation used by the Nimbus Eth2 client and I have been heavily involved in the initial implementation and deployment of the Nimbus client. Currently I'm the tech lead of the Codex project.

title: Data Durability in Decentralized Networks

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Durable decentralized storage networks is a missing piece in the web3 story. Whilst decentralized storage networks have been around for quite a long time, the lack of incentives, strong data availability and durability guarantees make these networks unsuitable for a wide array of applications. Decentralizing twitter, youtube and other important pieces of the legacy web wont be possible without solving the durability puzzle.

speakers.name: Andrew
speakers.description:
Andrew Shatyrko

Founder of Crypto Marketing Agency
Marketer and entrepreneur

Influencer: 1 500 000 followers on Instagram
 (https://www.instagram.com/andrew_shatyrko/)12 years in digital marketing
Certified Digital Specialist
Master Trainer accredited by IPACT

title: Crypto Marketing Agency
description:
What is the marketing of a crypto project based on?
TOP10 Marketing Mistakes
Cryptocurrency/NFT Marketing Differences
Marketing from 0 to Infinity
Gift: Typical marketing plan for a crypto project in 2022

speakers.name: William Le
speakers.description: Will Le leads the Research and Innovation team at the Celo Foundation. Prior to Celo, Will had stints at IDEO.org, GiveDirectly, Gates Foundation, and Bain Capital. Will is passionate about the intersection of web3, emerging markets, and financial inclusion.

title: Crypto in the Wild: Designing for Emerging Markets
description:
Much has been said about the potential of blockchain to foster financial inclusion, particularly in emerging markets. However, many projects struggle with translating concepts and technology to on-the-ground implementation.

In this workshop, we take a human-centered design approach to educate builders about the ways they can ensure what they build are ultimately resonant with the populations they hope to serve. We will draw from past pilots from Kenya, Ecuador, the Philippines to facilitate.

speakers.name: Steve Ngok
speakers.description: Steve is a Partner at DoraHacks, the hacker movement, and Web3 developer incentive platform and co-founder of Dora Factory, a DAO-as-a-Service infrastructure. Steve is passionate about supporting brilliant founders in Web3 and frontier technologies. Steve has a B.A. in Economics from Tsinghua University.

title: Sustainable tokenomics for Ethereum ecosystem grant DAOs
description: With the help of Quadratic Funding, MACI, and more Web3 native tools, Public Goods and projects have been thriving in the Ethereum ecosystem. Community grants or Grant DAOs will play a crucial role in the future growth of Ethereum. How can community grants become more sustainable? Could there be a sustainable tokenomics designed for a GrantDAO that can properly incentivize grantors, and donors and create a positive-sum game? How can we improve on existing tools?

speakers.name: Deepak
speakers.description:
Deepak is the founder of Kresko, a novel capital-efficient synthetic asset protocol, launching on a L2 near you.

Previously, Deepak helped build Celo‚Äôs security team. He is has 15 years of Cybersecurity experience with expertise in incident response, operations, and social engineering. He has a Masters in Information Security, from Purdue.

title: Beyond security audits: a comparative framework to model risk for DeFi protocols
description:
In this workshop, we will present a 5-part framework that can be used to assess risk in DeFi protocols. 

The framework uses a simple point based system and is designed to be flexible. That is, a quick back of the napkin calculation or an in-depth analysis of the protocol. This is also applicable to broader DeFi and Web3 protocols.

It allows one to compare different protocols on different dimensions of interest. 

This workshop can be changed into a talk as well if needed.

speakers.name: Dane Lund
speakers.description: I am the Head DAO Architect of Alliance DAO. I began my career as a corporate governance attorney after graduating from Harvard Law School. Through a winding career in investment banking and investing in public and private equities (and debt), I gained an appreciation for how a broad range of businesses are designed and governed. I entered Web3 with a policy mission to increase the adoption of DAO governance. I write on DAO governance and Web3 policy.

title: Integrating DAOs into Traditional Businesses
description: DAOs are powerful tools for existing corporate structures. Soon, we will see trustless voting systems become interoperable with corporate structures as we realize that DAOs can be used to solve specific problems in tandem with existing entities. In this talk, I will discuss how DAOs can augment infrastructure projects, neighborhood associations, union voting, alumni associations, and hyper-local government.

speakers.name: Shantelle Awomoyi
speakers.description: web3 evangelist. current product ex engineer. Building DAOra labs & Partnerships at Blu3 DAO

title: Interoperability in infrastructure
description: We are at a pivotal time in Web3 history where infrastructure is needed more than ever. Join the DAOra team in discussing how interoperability is helping to mold the space and create new avenues for communities to build foundations that foster creation and togetherness.

speakers.name: Theo Beutel
speakers.description: Theo has a background in organisational theory and is stewarding the governance working group at VitaDAO. He is also contributing to the governance of other impact DAOs across DeSci and ReFi, such as LabDAO and PsyDAO. He is advising GIZ on sustainability matters in blockchain and used to work at Colony and Bundesblock.

title: User-friendly governance for DeSci, ReFi and other impact DAOs
description: DAOs are becoming more mainstream, e.g. in decentralised science (DeSci) and regenerative finance (ReFi). Their new stakeholder groups are not necessarily experienced in crypto, nor should they need to be. This makes the design of governance frameworks and DAO tooling particularly challenging. In this workshop, we will discuss the state of the art of governance in selected impact DAOs and jointly work towards best practices for mainstream-facing DAOs for DeSci, ReFi and other areas of interest.

speakers.name: Miguel Piedrafita
speakers.description: 20-year-old maker. Building anonymous sybil-resistance your grandma could use @worldcoin, and hundreds of other projects in my free time.

speakers.name: Tiago Sada
speakers.description: Head of Product @ Worldcoin

title: Introducing World ID: Anonymous sybil-resistance for everyone
description: Introducing World ID: A new sybil-resistance solution allowing applications to cryptographically prove a user is human and hasn't performed a certain action before, powered by zero-knowledge proofs and biometrics.

speakers.name: Eduardo Andres Ospina Serrano
speakers.description:
Eduardo Ospina is a passionate and creative innovator in clean energy, hardware, software, and blockchain technology. 

He has a master's degree in electrical engineering, is the inventor of a patent for improving the efficiency of solar energy, and is the CEO and co-founder of Unergy, a decentralized platform for financing clean energy projects in emerging markets.

title: Why a clean energy-based cryptocurrency could save the world
description:
100 years ago Henry Ford planned to create an energy-based currency to replace gold, and blockchain is the perfect tool to achieve this vision.

Today the world needs to invest 2.4 trillion dollars in clean energy assets to avoid a climate disaster. So we need to create a clean energy-based cryptocurrency, with tangible energy assets as collateral, that generates compounded interest by selling energy.

speakers.name: Weiwu Zhang
speakers.description: Over 7 years experience in blockchain, from alt currency design to trading algorithms, served as blockchain architect in Commonwealth Bank of Australia (biggest financial institution in Australia). R3 global architect office. Architect for 3 altcoins and 7 ICO projects.

title: Tokenizing brands : 3 key learnings
description: Tokens are a unique way to generate Brand ‚Äì Users connections.  There is a world in terms of what users can do with tokens, and leading Brands such as La Praire, Hugo Boss are already exploring this world with us. Connections are the key. We have realized that the value of the token comes from connections, together with goods and services. It‚Äôs clear for us now that tokens are the integration point for web3 and token technology should be built around this concept.

speakers.name: Marysol Mauricio
speakers.description: Marysol Mauricio majored in International Business. She is a blockchain consultant and is an education mentor of women on web3. She also co-runs crypto Epic Queen a community to welcome women as creators of crypto and web3. In addition, she is governor in Blu3 LATAM DAO, the mission is empowering women, non-binary and trans people to learn, explore and build their careers and visions in the web3 space.

title: Empowering women trough a DAO
description: Blu3 LATAM DAO has the mission of empowering women, non-binary and trans people to learn, explore and build their careers and visions in the web3 space to achieve financial freedom through our bilingual structure. We want to make aware that More Latin women deserve access to new technologies, we want them to see web3 as a place where women are welcome, and where they can have influence.

speakers.name: Brendan Graetz
speakers.description:
- founder of [DApps Dev Club](https://dappsdev.org/), a tech meetup group in Singapore to learn smart contract and DApp development
- head of Developer Experience at [RSK](https://developers.rsk.co/), doing all sorts of cool things, including dev docs, online courses, ambassador programs, and chilling at events like DevCon;)
- author of ["The Ledger of Pueblo"](https://leanpub.com/ledger-of-pueblo), a fictitious parable which introduces blockchain without any tech mumbo-jumbo.

title: 0x0B Lessons Learnt from Educating Blockchain Users and Developers
description:
The future of the Internet is decentralised, and it is web3. But not everyone is ready for it yet. How can we help everyone cross the chasm?

This talk will take you on a journey, from DevPortals to UX design, from webinars to in-person conferences, from web2 to web3... and the key lessons learnt along the way.

speakers.name: Massil Achab
speakers.description: ML background (academic + professional life), moved to crypto a few years ago. Now working at Nethermind and embrassing L2 scaling.

title: Aave on Starknet
description: Deployment of Aave protocol on Starknet network: design details, implementation choices, important changes.

speakers.name: Nazeeh Vahora
speakers.description: I'm a frontend engineer who loves to code üë®üèª‚Äçüíª and build things üõ†. I like sharing my technical knowledge and experiences in my articles üîñ. I'm also looking forward to publishing video tutorials.

title: Building on The Graph Protocol

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
In my talk, I'm gonna talk about [The Graph Protocol](https://thegraph.com/), and how to build and deploy our own GraphQL API using data stored in the Ethereum blockchain. Why should we use the Graph Protocol?  The drawbacks of fetching data from the blockchain, its limitations, and how using graph API we can overcome those limitations.
In the end, I'm also gonna give a glimpse of how we can use a sub-graph with IPFS and what are its advantages

speakers.name: Ulysse Ramage
speakers.description: Passionate about video games and computer science since he was very young, Ulysse has graduated from the Swiss Institute of Technology and worked at Amazon before creating APWine in 2020 and moving full-time into DeFi. With a growing interest in art and design, he thrives to make yield derivatives accessible and easy to use as the UI/UX lead for the app.

title: Lessons learned making the jump to Web3
description: There are more and more people looking to join Web3, coming from a traditional Web2 world. More and more founders starting projects in crypto and DeFi. This talk tells the story of how we started APWine and what we learned after two years in the industry.

speakers.name: Retro
speakers.description: Retro is a contributor at MakerDAO a part of the Sustainable Ecosystem Scaling Core Unit (SES). SES is a research & development core unit that aims to build sustainability and resiliency for the protocol by delivering tools, research reports, frameworks, and other timely solutions for challenges the protocol faces from an operational and organizational perspective. Retro is a multi-discipline supporting the delivery of budget frameworks, educational material, and tooling.

title: Cross Functional Collaboration - How a DAO Can Coordinate Work
description: DAOs are teams of independent contributors that work together for a common good. How can independent teams collaborate and coordinate work on tasks that require cross-functional disciplines? We'll take a look at a couple of frameworks and tools in use today at MakerDAO which support this process. Governance is also limited in their abilities to 'force' independent teams to do work. We'll also talk about some of the mechanisms in play that create incentives, and alignment at a strategic level.

speakers.name: Mario Havel
speakers.description: Protocol supporter and researcher working within Ethereum Foundation, co-founder of Bordel Hackerspace. Mario have been building and educating local communities in Bratislava, Prague and Barcelona, inspired many people to live crypto native and contribute to FOSS ecosystems.

title: Building Parallel Economy using Ethereum
description: Ethereum is one of the most important tools enabling us to build free parallel structures. Parallel Polis is a humanitarian concept popularized by Czechoslovak dissidents and carried on by cryptoanarchists and cypherpunks in recent years. From their experience of living solely in cryptoeconomy for past 8 years, we learn how Ethereum is an irreplaceable tool for crypto native life, business and social structures.

speakers.name: Niusha Moshrefi
speakers.description: I am co-founder of TeleportDAO. Previous researcher in UBC blockchain lab. I have been doing research in distributed systems and developing smart contracts for more than 3 years.

title: How to design a secure bridge?
description:
Bridges are protocols that connect different blockchains together. Based on their design, they can be limited to token transfer, or they can exchange arbitrary data between blockchains. There are two main types of bridges: validator-based bridges and relay-based bridges. We explain the architecture of both and discuss the advantages and disadvantages of each of them.
We also talk about the biggest hacks in the history of cross-chain space and how to prevent them from happening in future.

speakers.name: Isaac Sixtus Chizaram
speakers.description:
Isaac Sixtus Chizaram is a Brand Experience Designer with over 5 years of professional experience in design and a track record in brand communication, community management and marketing design on a global scale.

He‚Äôs currently working with Hovercast as an Interactive Designer. Currently  serving as a Council member for CuratorsDAO, Visual oversight for NEAR Protocol‚Äôs Guild of the Year ‚ÄúHuman Guild‚Äù

He has given talks/workshops at design/OS conferences around the globe

title: Brand Design Principles for Web3.0
description:
Lately the internet evolved from Web1, Web2 to Web3 and there has been a lot of buzz considering the influx of Defi, Gamefi and NFT project in the ecosystem . Designing for this current Web involves a lot of strategies in order to build trust and empathy, I will sharing principles for brand design and it‚Äôs relevance in the Web3 space.

LINK TO SLIDE: 
https://app.pitch.com/app/presentation/c3fd78de-460d-4d13-a221-e0566de7816b/2a2703c8-e4a0-4d46-8c7c-534f762cbf38

speakers.name: Joel Thorstensson
speakers.description: Joel has been working on decentralized identity since he joined uPort in 2016. Since then he co-founded 3Box Labs, the creators of Ceramic network.

title: Soulbound data: how verifiability enables pluralistic identity
description: Identity is an emergent phenomena based on interactions between people and the world. So far most of the data available about ethereum users are financial transactions. With Soulbound tokens we get some more granularity, but what if we could store and query data about social interactions, DAO contributions, scientific experiments? This talk explores how Ethereum can be leveraged to build a high throughput data system, from which a more pluralistic form of identity can be derived.

speakers.name: Gaspard Peduzzi
speakers.description: Gaspard is a young entrepreneur from the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in Lausanne where he was involved in research projects focused on Blockchain Technologies and Cryptocurrencies. He co-founded APWine, a DeFi protocol building the interests market through derivatives and yield tokenization.

title: Building a risk management framework in a highly composable ecosystem
description: The Decentralised finance space has opened a broad new range of opportunities for the construction of revenue generating strategies, embracing the new ‚Äúmoney lego‚Äù paradigm.  We observe an important lack of risk analysis and global understanding of the security premises of the different yield generating strategies. We describe the challenges of establishing a risk assessment methodology in this space.

speakers.name: Tomiwa Ademidun
speakers.description:
Founder of atila, an easy way to start scholarships and grants using crypto

https://atila.ca
https://atila.ca/profile/tomiwa/blog

title: Funding Ideas Forever with Perpetual Crypto Funds
description:
Perpetual Crypto Funds are funding structures with the potential to last forever. These funds use the interest generated from staking to fund operations while the principal stays untouched. For cryptocurrencies with deflationary properties, the principal also appreciates in value over time.

This revolutionary method of funding ideas is well suited for funding long term goals.

speakers.name: Leonardo Bautista Gomez
speakers.description: Team Leader and Senior Researcher at Miga Labs

title: Analysis of Ethereum 2, Consensus Clients
description: This talk will present a comparison of the Ethereum 2 Consensus Layer clients. We compare them in terms of hardware performance but we will also look at rewards and more intricate aspects of them. This analysis is aimed at operators running validators.

speakers.name: KAREN TEOH
speakers.description: Research interests at the nexus of game theory, law and economics.

title: Why DAO's Need a Legal Structure
description:
Would you roll your own cryptography or create your own library from scratch?

Failure to choose legal structures means simultaneously choosing to make organisations from scratch - while ignoring a history of design patterns and precedents that lawyers have used for decades. 

This talk covers DAO and smart contract hack issues and how existing Common Law jurisdiction corporate law structures would have covered them off, from Uniswap Endowment to Beanstalk

speakers.name: steven Haft
speakers.description: Founding Team EARTH DAY, Producer DEAD POETS SOCIETY, Former SVP AOL &TIME, Current Climate Lead, Consensys.

title: Greening Ethereum After The Merge
description: Steven Haft has been working with the UN Climate Agency on behalf of consensys for 4 years- and can share strategies for greening the product and projects with the developer community.

speakers.name: KAREN TEOH
speakers.description: Research interests at the nexus of game theory, law and economics.

title: A Brief Overview of Legal Systems and Frameworks for Developers
description:
This workshop aims to provide context for DEV's and DAO workers about the context of international and local legal environments, from past to present and future, including jurisdiction, nationality and legal enforcement (civil and criminal).

This will assist them in interviewing and hiring lawyers to work with them on their projects and DAO's.

speakers.name: Wouter Kampmann
speakers.description: Wouter Kampmann is currently working as team lead of the Sustainable Ecosystem Scaling Core Unit (SES) at MakerDAO. The SES team performs research, analysis, and bootstrapping work on the challenges and solutions for scaling up MakerDAO. Its mission is to remove the barriers between decentralized workforce, capital and work. Previously, Wouter worked as the Head of Engineering at the Maker Foundation.

title: The history and future of decentralized operations at MakerDAO
description:
MakerDAO is one of the foundational projects in Ethereum that originally created DeFi. The project has a rich history of gradual decentralization and, today, is one of the largest and most advanced DAOs in the space.
In this talk I will outline the evolution of decentralized operations and governance at MakerDAO. We will have a look at a few of the most recent scaling challenges, how they developed, and how MakerDAO is dealing with them.

speakers.name: KAREN TEOH
speakers.description: Research interests at the nexus of game theory, law and economics.

title: Legal Structures for DAO's
description:
This is workshop for DAO workers to  explore how their DAO's would fit within existing Common law legal structures, as well as the limitations thereof. 

Have an investment DAO? A public goods DAO? A charitable DAO? A DAO providing key infrastructure that holds intellectual property but also generates revenue? What if the DAO provides services that contravenes national laws in some, but not all Jurisdictions?

Major DAO use cases and patterns are explored

speakers.name: sam
speakers.description: New to web3 and DeFi in general. Looking to make an impact, while also absorbing every bit of information from all the giga-brains in this space!

title: Introduction of new product
description: I am writing on behalf of Liquity - we are looking to launch a new product at the end of Q4 that will take into account game theory quite a bit. We think it would be a good opportunity for us to showcase the solution and also get a good gage of community feedback. Our CEO, Robert, would be the one speaking at the event if it we were to be provided with the chance to showcase this.

speakers.name: Asaf Naim
speakers.description: Before becoming an entrepreneur, Asaf has been an experienced accountant, holding an MBA in business taxation. Fascinated by technology, Asaf boasts vast expertise in the banking and finance industry with prior roles at Bank Leumi and Ernst & Young, as well as having led multiple startups in Israel and the United States. Wanting to take his passion for crypto and blockchain to the next level, Asaf founded Kirobo to offer crypto enthusiasts a one-stop-shop for DeFi services.

title: The Future of DeFi: Growth, Potential, and Perils
description: Even though the DeFi field has come a long way, decentralized finance still faces many challenges, specifically in the areas of safety, security, and accessibility. It‚Äôs no secret that while DeFi has solved many problems within traditional finance, it also made way for novel concerns, too. Smart contract failures, the lack of sustainability, and lost assets are only a few examples. Now is the time to assess these challenges and build a stronger future for DeFi.

speakers.name: Ulysse Ramage
speakers.description: Passionate about video games and computer science since he was very young, Ulysse has graduated from the Swiss Institute of Technology and worked at Amazon before creating APWine in 2020 and moving full-time into DeFi. With a growing interest in art and design, he thrives to make yield derivatives accessible and easy to use as the UI/UX lead for the app.

title: Simplifying UX flows in Web3 dApps
description: UX is often an overlooked aspect of Web3, and this talk will convey why it is so important to move the ecosystem forward as well as teach the lessons and patterns we've learned working on such a product for two years.

speakers.name: Irene
speakers.description: Community building since 2017, "Red" is a representative with various DAOs and protocols including APWine and Harvest Finance, and believes for DeFi and DAOs to be successful, the crypto ecosystem must look beyond just voting mechanisms, and focus on decentralizing the entire business organization associated with a protocol.

title: Derivative Diversity: Using Community to build Trillion Dollar Bridges
description: DAOs are much more than just voting. A Decentralized 'Organization' cannot be the same five devs who launched the protocol simply because they have installed voting mechanisms and regulators have  made it clear that pseduo decentralization does not protect the founders or the protocol from prosecution. In order to realize an ecosystem beyond just stores of value, communities must be much more effectively utilized to build out the business organization of DAOs associated with protocols to ensure

speakers.name: LEE DONG KWANG
speakers.description: I don't know what that means.

title: A new method for online pruning and migration
description:
Various attempts have been made to reduce the accumulated data of the blockchain.
Ethereum is also making efforts to reduce capacity such as state expiry and statelessness.

The existing state db had difficulties in managing the reference count due to hash overlap. To solve this problem, we developed a method to eliminate hash duplication and maintain the merkle trie hash. This makes it possible to dynamically delete old data and migrate.

speakers.name: E.G. Galano
speakers.description: Eleazar "E.G." Galano is the Co-Founder and General Manager of Infura, the pioneering and leading provider of scalable Web3 infrastructure and developer APIs. Coming from a background in blockchain infrastructure, scalable web services, and infrastructure automation, E.G. was previously the Director of Site Reliability at Los Angeles based hotel software start-up KEYPR (now Intelity), and an early employee of cloud gaming company Gaikai, which was acquired by Sony in 2012.

speakers.name: Tim Myers
speakers.description: Principal System Engineer at Infura

title: Decentralizing Infura
description: Infura has provided a centralized API service to help grow the Ethereum and Web3 ecosystem since we launched in 2016. In 2023 we will be launching Decentralized Infura. This talk will go over the details of the decentralized protocol and the transition to it. We will also discuss why this is necessary at this point in the growth of the ecosystem and the emergence of a multi-chain future.

speakers.name: Ivan
speakers.description: Started as microelectronics engineer a long time ago and went through all low-level embedded development, desktop apps and high-load services straight to web3. Traiting it as future of IT and excited to being able to contribute.

title: Deploying Solidity smart-contracts to Solana using Neon-EVM

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Neon-EVM is the L2 implementation of Ethereum Virtual Machine for Solana Blockchain. This makes it possible to deploy and debug your Ethereum-native project with almost no modifications to Solana and even interact with native Solana liquidity from within your Ethereum smart-contracts. In this demo I'll show you how easy it is to deploy Solidity smart-contract into Solana and how to interact with Solana SPL tokens using this Solidity smart-contract.

speakers.name: Karl Floersch
speakers.description: Ethereum optimist. Worked at the Ethereum Foundation on PoS & Eth2, then co-founded Plasma Group & Optimism to build Ethereum L2 technology which funds public goods. Currently optimistically scaling Ethereum and making impact=profit.

title: Superchain: Path to the Monolithic Multi-Chain
description:
Traditional mono-chain and multi-chain narratives do not capture the inevitable evolution of blockchain architecture. Over time we will see the multi-chain backend infrastructure become unified with atomic sequencing and frontends that provide the experience of interacting with a single chain. This is the Superchian future.

This talk will paint the Superchain vision and lay out the practical engineering challenges which we need to overcome in Ethereum to realize it.

speakers.name: Isaac Patka
speakers.description: Isaac Patka is a developer and founder in the DAO space. He is a core developer in the Moloch Mystics building Moloch v3, and a member of DAOHaus where he built DAO composability tooling to enable Moloch v2 DAOs to directly control Gnosis Safes through Zodiac modules. He is the co-creator of Logos, a framework-agnostic DAO furthering the adoption of Web3 governance in IRL communities.

title: Exploiting inattention & optimism in DAOs
description: Many DAOs have adopted Oracle based tools to make gassless votes executable. I demonstrated an exploit of one such oracle that was possible because the other users on the oracle app were undercapitalized or not paying attention. This type of attack highlights the weaknesses and risks of many assumptions people have about the attention span of DAO members, and execution conditions. I will show common misconfigurations of tools that are the most risky, and show people how they can fix them.

speakers.name: Griff Green
speakers.description:
Cofounder of Giveth, Commons Stack, & dappnode. Community manager for TheDAO, led the crisis response effort for TheDAO Hack and first Parity Multisig Hack from every angle, co-founder of the White Hat Group and led the creation of Token Engineering Commons. Advisor for PolygonID, PolygonHermez, brightID, Doingud, and steward for Gitcoin, ENS & Optimism.

I also lead 2 crypto focused burning man camps ;-)

title: The biggest web3 opportunity no one is talking about!
description:
$10.5 Trillion were spent, not invested, SPENT in 2021 in the US alone, and this is a global sector.
This sector has a for-loss model... the capital providers, despite creating an abundance of value that is in high demand, are losing money had over fist, and web3 has the solution.

You missed Bitcoin, you missed Ethereum, don't sleep on this.

speakers.name: Lauren Luz
speakers.description: Communications Steward of Giveth, Product Lead for the GIVeconomy, and Steward of the Token Engineering Commons. Passionate about using web3 tooling to create regenerative systems around the creation of public goods.

title: The global paradigm shift around public goods
description:
Historically, public goods creation has been dependent on sacrifice: Nonprofits rely on volunteers & beg for donations while governments force taxes on their people to generate the funds to create value for society. Neither one incorporates efficient feedback mechanisms,

Web3 has proven we can turn public goods projects into competing microeconomies, enabling effective feedback mechanisms, honest value production, and the creation of more abundance for all of society.

speakers.name: Lauren Luz
speakers.description: Communications Steward of Giveth, Product Lead for the GIVeconomy, and Steward of the Token Engineering Commons. Passionate about using web3 tooling to create regenerative systems around the creation of public goods.

title: The global paradigm shift around public goods
description:
Historically, public goods creation has been dependent on sacrifice: Nonprofits rely on volunteers & beg for donations while governments force taxes on their people to generate the funds to create value for society. Neither one incorporates efficient feedback mechanisms,

Web3 has proven we can turn public goods projects into competing microeconomies, enabling effective feedback mechanisms, honest value production, and the creation of more abundance for all of society.

speakers.name: Arya Tabaie
speakers.description:
Arya is a developer in the gnark team. Previously, he worked at RBC Bank where he developed and maintained an in-house ZKP and anonymous credentials library.

His other interests include mathematics, active transportation and music.

title: gnark: Fast zkSNARKs in Go
description:
We present gnark an open-source and actively maintained library.

It provides implementations of the Groth16 and Plonk proof systems, along with a frontend API to compile arithmetic circuits into SNARK-friendly constraints.

A underlying module, gnark-crypto, is of independent interest, by providing fast implementations of field arithmetic and pairing-friendly elliptic curves, among other primitives.

speakers.name: Alex P.
speakers.description:
Alex is an Italian polymath, world-traveler, and Experience Designer - with expertise in Distributed Governance, Collaborative Economics and Game Theory. 

In the startup world since he was 17, before ƒÄut he dedicated to multiple things - spanning from chess to poetry reading and commodity trading. 

Since 2016 he has dedicated entirely to his passion for Web3, Self-Sovereign [Organizations / Identities / Cities] and collective autonomy.

title: Trifolds (Role-sets) as the foundation for Autonomy & Coordination in DAOs.
description:
1. 
Without Roles, there is no coordination. 
Without Coordination, there cannot be DAOs.

2.
On-chain, role-based membership & governance is the foundation for the next generation of DAOs.

3. 
Trifolds (role-sets) as the atomic unit of DAOs

4. By claiming Roles directly on the Blockchain - Tasks, Governance & Voting routines can be assigned to a specific Role. 

5. Identity as a State: from individual to collective identity.

speakers.name: brantly.eth
speakers.description: A director of the ENS Foundation, the top delegate for the ENS DAO, and former director of operations of the ENS core team.

title: Year 1 of ENS DAO: Analysis, Problems, & the Future of DAOs
description: As of Devcon 6, the ENS DAO will be nearly 1 year old. I'll discuss why we created the ENS DAO, it's critical role for the ENS protocol, it's early successes (involvement of new people, lots of activity, etc), it's biggest problems (declining token delegation, declining interest, centralization of supply, etc), issues raised by the contentious EP 6.1, and then look to its future, solutions to the problems I described, and the future of DAOs in general.

speakers.name: Henri Stern
speakers.description: Thinks about your data online. Co-founder at Privy. Former Filecoin consensus researcher at Protocol Labs.

title: Privacy and web3 -- where UX and coordination meet
description:
Developers increasingly have to decide whether to include off-chain user data into their products. "Can I take on a phone number? Do I build beyond a user's wallet and on-chain data?"
This is increasingly leading to two stacks: one is all client-side and on-chain, built for pseudonymous power users; and one which ingests user data into silo'ed databases to build richer UX, web3 in name only.
Let's chart a path to a self-sovereign web3 - tokenomics built for user-controlled data.

speakers.name: Awosika Ayodeji
speakers.description: Founder, Web3bridge

title: Reaching the next billion users for Ethereum leverage the African numbers
description: The talk will explore how the growing African population especially the young population which is projected to be 80% of the 2billion subsaharan African population by 2025 can be leverage on to earn Ethereum next billion users

speakers.name: Murat Akdeniz
speakers.description: Murat founded the first Social Ethereum Wallet, Mirian in 2017. After hearing his users complain about the wallet's lack of network awareness, he joined Blocknative to lead products that provide the best real-time transaction data and gas prices, powering some of the most important apps in the ecosystem today from Metamask to Curve. Murat continues to champion web3-onboard which is an open source dapp UX tool, and applies his learnings at Polymarket as Principal PM.

title: Meeting user expectations in your dapp
description: How to meet the user expectations of experienced ethereum users and newcomers to the ecosystem alike as a dapp developer. Transacting in ethereum starts with transaction intent & connecting your wallet, but after connecting and interacting to make a transaction, how can you make sure users transact confidently? I'll cover real time status updates, covering for edge tx cases, getting them the best and most accurate gas price, and allowing them to speedup or cancel transactions from your dapp

speakers.name: Willy ShapeShift
speakers.description:
#Buidl the change you wish to see in the world. Download @shapeshift and donate for free on @Givethio
 ‚ú®ü¶ä #bestdayever 

Head of Decentralization for the Fox Foundation
foxfoundation.io

title: Scaling DAOs: Vertically, Horizontally, and into other Dimensions
description:
Can DAOs scale? Should DAOs scale? If yes, how?

- Learn about the various types of scaling and how to apply these to DAOs
- Explore the latest experiments in scalable organizational structures (ie. subDAOs), governance processes, and communities
- Understand the DAO Human Action Trilemma (https://twitter.com/owocki/status/1531728875335524352) and mitigation techniques
- Contrast DAOs vs. traditional orgs and discuss how "the invisible hand" of laissez faire markets can drive coordination

speakers.name: Ahmed Castro
speakers.description: Ahmed Castro is a dev and content creator in the Youtube Channel Filosof√≠a C√≥digo and dev.to. Ahmed specializes on Blockchain, Smart Contracts, DeFi, NFTs, play to earn, oracles, Layer 2 and more. He strongly believes that decentralization and autonomy brings great benefits to everyone, that's why he focuses on learning and spreading about Web3.

title: Ship Secure and Scalable with Layer 2
description:
This workshop is intended to onboard developers to Layer 2. We will discuss the different types of Layer 2s and what to expect on the future. We will also equip developers with the tooling needed start creating DApps, tokens and protocols on both Optimistic and ZK Rollups.

1. Why Layer 2?
2. State Channels vs Plasma vs Rollups
3. Types of Rollups
4. Deploying on an Optimistic Rollup step by step
5. Is it hard to code on ZK Rollups on 2022?
6. The future of Layer 2s

speakers.name: Vincent Wen
speakers.description: Vincent Wen is an Engineering Manager at Messari, the leading provider of crypto market intelligence products. Prior to becoming a full-time degen in the crypto rabbit hole, Vincent worked as a Software Engineer at Microsoft and Technology Associate at Bridgewater. Vincent graduated from the University of Waterloo in 2015 with a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics. There, he majored in Computer Science and learned the skills necessary to become the shadowy super-coder he is today.

title: The Road to Standardized Subgraphs
description: This talk will dive through how to build the subgraph infrastructure that is consistent across the board in order to enable the transformation of raw blockchain data into meaningful metrics.

speakers.name: Malcolm Navarro
speakers.description: Malcolm Navarro is a senior software engineer at Messari. As a full-stack engineer, Malcolm has contributed to a wide range of projects from developing blockchain data ingestion to front-end product development. Prior to his time at Messari, Malcolm was the VP of Technology at Templum, where he worked on a security token issuance platform. He also spent time as an Assistant VP at Merrill Lynch, and an Application Developer at JP Morgan. Malcolm graduated from Syracuse University.

title: The Key Tools Crucial For DAO Governance
description: This panel would discuss the infrastructure and tools needed to be built to allow for easier DAO development and decentralized governance

speakers.name: Tom Dunleavy
speakers.description: Tom Dunleavy is a Senior Research Analyst at Messari who publishes Enterprise research focused on the intersection between traditional finance and crypto. Prior to Messari, Tom spent four years as the Vice President of Institutional Investment Consulting at Meketa Investment Group, and also worked for seven years in investment management at State Street. Tom graduated from Bentley University in 2011 with a Bachelor of Science degree in Finance and afterward earned both his CFA and CAIA Charter.

title: Future of L1s in Bull/Bear Markets
description: This panel would explore how market conditions, both bullish and bearish, affect the L1 ecosystem.

speakers.name: Zubin
speakers.description:
Zubin was a lawyer for over 15 years and then taught himself to code. After a stint at Google Engineering, Zubin felt the call of blockchain tech and is now a Developer Advocate at Chainlink Labs.
