Zubin is extremely interested in developing tools and knowhow where his legal and engineering background can be combined to provide solutions for DAOs to decentralize and automate governance in a way that is transparent and clear to non-technical DAO members.

title: Decentralizing DAO Governance with Decentralized Oracles
description:
A knowledge sharing session on how we can move forward the challenge of decentralizing governance in DAOs.  Currently DAOs are still far from being D or A in meaningful senses.  

These are complex problems, but Oracles do provide solutions that bring us closer to the ideal.

Oracles can help in 
- proposals & voting, 
-delivering votes on-chain, 
- cryptographic truth, 
- off-chain computional heavy lifting, 
- reducing gas fees, 
- decentralizing data delivery to the chain etc

speakers.name: Zubin
speakers.description:
Zubin was a lawyer for over 15 years and then taught himself to code. After a stint at Google Engineering, Zubin felt the call of blockchain tech and is now a Developer Advocate at Chainlink Labs.

Zubin is extremely interested in developing tools and knowhow where his legal and engineering background can be combined to provide solutions for DAOs to decentralize and automate governance in a way that is transparent and clear to non-technical DAO members.

title: A CanDID Conversation on Decentralized Governance
description:
Decentralized identity systems empower users to manage their ID credentials using "self-created decentralized identifiers" (DIDs). 

DIDs shift control of pieces of credential data into users‚Äô hands. 

Decentralized identity proposals, have  several challenges.For example,  
- bootstrapping an ecosystem of credential issuers, 
- user-managed keys (and the risk of their loss), 
- handling sybil attacks,  
- correctly detecting bad actors, etc

Can canDID meaningfully address these?

speakers.name: Zubin
speakers.description:
Zubin was a lawyer for over 15 years and then taught himself to code. After a stint at Google Engineering, Zubin felt the call of blockchain tech and is now a Developer Advocate at Chainlink Labs.

Zubin is extremely interested in developing tools and knowhow where his legal and engineering background can be combined to provide solutions for DAOs to decentralize and automate governance in a way that is transparent and clear to non-technical DAO members.

title: Contribute to Decentralization by running your own Chainlink Oracle Node
description: This will be a hands on technical walkthrough of how to setup, run and use a decentralized oracle node using the Chainlink platform.

speakers.name: AtHeartEngineer
speakers.description: Aspiring polymath doing R&D on the privacy and scaling team

title: Rate Limiting Nullifier
description: RLN (Rate limiting nullifier) is a construct based on zero-knowledge proofs that enable spam prevention mechanisms for decentralized, anonymous environments.

speakers.name: Kevin Nielsen Garcia
speakers.description: Kevin Nielsen is an entrepreneur from Madrid, Spain working on Boardroom, a DAO governance aggregator helping members make faster, smarter, and informed decisions. He's an avid music enthusiast, casual writer, and shares a fascination for human and economic coordination problems with the rest of his industry colleagues.

title: How DAO metagovernance will usher in true stakeholder capitalism
description: DAOs are reinventing coordination and reframing the theory of the firm. The external boundary between communities is being removed as we distribute governance power to diverse stakeholders with varying mandates to push. Metagovernance allows them to lobby for those interests *across* ecosystems instead of controlling proxies with similar interests vying for position in a single firm - essentially enabling DAOs to keep other DAOs accountable to the interests of external constituencies.

speakers.name: trent
speakers.description:
- ethereum ecosystem work & All Core Devs call
- creating with @StatefulWorks
- one of many building the @ProtocolGuild

title: Funding Ethereum with the Protocol Guild
description: This talk will include an overview of Ethereum Public Goods, existing funding mechanisms and their limitations, our design responses to shape the Protocol Guild, and an update on the 2022 Pilot.

speakers.name: Ainura Sagyn
speakers.description:
Ainura Sagyn leads Operations at ARTISANT.io. ARTISANT - is a digital fashion WEB3 platform. Previously software engineer, founded Tazar, one of the promising green-tech start-ups in Central Asia.
Also, co-founded of online magazine sheisnomad.com, since 2018 has taught coding basics +2000 schoolgirls in all regions of Kyrgyzstan. Conducted dozens of meetups & conferences for developers in Kyrgyzstan.
Ainura holds a BS in Computer Engineering, MS in Image Processing, and Computer Vision

title: Fashion 3.0: Avatars, Metaverse, Freedom, Sustainability.
description:
Creation of a new layer of fashion that helps Earth to breathe, and allows creators to be truly free. It is a new concept of how without over-consuming and polluting one can look fabulous. Fashion is the business of identity. It helps define yourself and signal it to the world. 
Fashion is making up 10% of our carbon footprint in global emissions, which is more than all international flights and maritime shipping combined.‚Ä®
TRADITIONAL FASHION NEEDS REFORMATION.
DIGITAL FASHION IS A REFORM.

speakers.name: Ayoung Jeon
speakers.description: Developer and Community Relations Lead @ NEAR Foundation

title: Building for Mass Adoption and a Diverse Web3
description:
How do we build for mass adoption? What does that even mean, and how do we think about getting there? Why is it important to build for diversity? 

- Current landscape
- Accessibility and lowering the barrier to entry
- Flexing our DEIB muscles (diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging)
- Community and developer outreach
- Takeaway points to remember as folks build/create/collaborate

speakers.name: Anton
speakers.description: Building open primitives @Mover. The only web3 card you need.

title: Why web3 primitives are not used outside DeFi? And how to fix it.
description:
Why do majority of protocols are appealing only within our crypto world? Why when protocols touch real world we call them institutional? What is the difference, and how you as a developer can fix it? 

In this short presentation you will:
- receive an eye opening information about the need to innovate and interact with real world. 
- receive tools, infrastructure, and knowledge to extend your primitive to offline users.

speakers.name: Matthew Carpenter-Ar√©valo
speakers.description: Matthew Carpenter-Ar√©valo is a writer & entrepreneur. A former Google, Twitter and World Economic Forum Manager, Matthew founded, managed and sold Centrico Digital, a Latin America-based marketing automation consultancy. Since then, Matthew founded Crypto, Climate and Carbon, a blog space that seeks to onramp environmentalists and crypto-skeptics into the regenerative finance space. Matthew is a Rhodes Scholar, Oxford Graduate, and he's contributed to TechCrunch,TheNextWeb and Business Insider.

speakers.name: Marcus Aurelius
speakers.description:
Emperor of Rome; Governor of Tunisia

Just kidding ;P

While I did study philosophy in school, my professional background is in data science and software engineering. I've been in the Web2 data world for almost a decade, but became fascinated by the opportunity to use smart contracts to revolutionize entire segments of the economy via novel coordination mechanisms.

I'm excited to leverage my technical skillset to fight climate change with cryptoeconomics at KlimaDAO.

title: ReFi and Colombia: Making Reforestation Profitable
description: Colombia is one of the most biodiverse countries on the planet: almost 60% of Colombia's landmass is forest and the country has over 50,000 species of plants. Despite its unique natural wealth, Colombia's forests are under threat from extractive industries such as oil production, mineral extraction, and monoculture agriculture. Crypto provides an opportunity to fight back: my talk will discuss ReFi as a tool to make not destroying the forest more profitable than destroying it.

speakers.name: Anastasia Uglova
speakers.description: Anastasia is Head of Communications and Ecosystem Development at Lighthouse, the open metaverse navigation engine. Most recently, she ran enterprise content at Notion and earned her M.S. at UT Austin, where her research focused on privacy, identity, and interoperability standards to prevent another Cambridge Analytica in the metaverse. Previously, she's worked at NPR, NBC, Cato Institute, and the U.S. Senate, and spent six years advancing women‚Äôs education and workforce development in Rwanda.

title: Averting Cambridge Analytica in the Metaverse: Identity, Privacy, and Agency on the Blockchain and Emergent Digital Worlds
description: The metaverse is here, but we have barely scratched the surface of interoperable user-centric preferences, identity, access controls, informed consent, and metadata in web2 spaces. Are we ready for immersive, persistent environments that involve our biometrics and greater levels of complexity for consent management? Emerging out of surveillance capitalism and building anti-authoritarian, censorship-resistant tech requires developers to shift how they evaluate and prioritize tradeoffs.

speakers.name: Ryan Betts
speakers.description: Ryan is Head of Design at Fission, where he works on UX patterns for local-first edge apps, both on-chain and off.

title: The Wallet Stack
description:
The word "wallet" gets used a lot, but is rarely defined. Whether you are new to web3 or a seasoned veteran, it is a source of endless confusion. Even worse: maybe you don't know you're confused? Let me untangle the semantic puzzle of a ‚Äúwallet."

Expect to walk away with a sharper picture of how "wallets" work, what needs to be considered for better "wallet" UX, and clearer language to use with your peers.

speakers.name: Kevin Ghim
speakers.description: Lead Product Manager at MetaMask

title: Web2 to Web3 Social Networks
description: In order to have the ultimate social impact, primitive layers of the network need to be created. MetaMask starts with security and safety as social primitives for developers to build trustable web on top of it. Some of the things we're working on are Delegatable ETH (POC MobyMask), list subscribing/sharing, and indexing trustable addresses/nodes. Without these, as a society, will never be able to achieve true coordination with trust and data sovereignty at the center of the network.

speakers.name: Tim Beiko
speakers.description: Tim Beiko runs the AllCoreDevs calls for Ethereum.

title: Ethereum Roadmap Overview
description: An overview of what's happened on Ethereum over the last year and the big upgrades to come.

speakers.name: Marcus Aurelius
speakers.description:
Emperor of Rome; Governor of Tunisia

Just kidding ;P

While I did study philosophy in school, my professional background is in data science and software engineering. I've been in the Web2 data world for almost a decade, but became fascinated by the opportunity to use smart contracts to revolutionize entire segments of the economy via novel coordination mechanisms.

I'm excited to leverage my technical skillset to fight climate change with cryptoeconomics at KlimaDAO.

title: KlimaDAO: Building a Climate-Positive Reserve System
description:
Climate change is the most pressing issue of our times. KlimaDAO accelerates climate action by creating a macroeconomic system that incentivizes individuals and organizations to support projects that contribute to the health of the planet.

Based on Olympus mechanics and taking inspiration from the extractive petrodollar system, KlimaDAO is building a regenerative global economy, with the KLIMA token as the reserve cryptocurrency, backed by a diverse treasury of tokenized carbon.

speakers.name: Darren Langley
speakers.description: Darren Langley is the General Manager of Rocket Pool. He is passionate about Ethereum and staking. He is dedicated to lowering the barriers-to-entry for Ethereum staking so that everyone can participate.

title: How to build a decentralized Ethereum liquid staking protocol?
description:
Liquid staked Ethereum is a reliable source of yield and is fast becoming a key primitive in DeFi. Come hear from Rocket Pool about their experience designing a decentralized Ethereum liquid staking protocol.

How do you create a decentralized protocol for staking? What are some of the design trade offs in token design? What tools are available today? What challenges exist due to current L1 structures? What opportunities exist in future upgrades?

speakers.name: Darren Langley
speakers.description: Darren Langley is the General Manager of Rocket Pool. He is passionate about Ethereum and staking. He is dedicated to lowering the barriers-to-entry for Ethereum staking so that everyone can participate.

title: Becoming a Rocket Pool node operator
description:
Join the Rocket Pool decentralized Ethereum staking protocol! 
We give you a walk-through of the steps to become a Rocket Pool node operator.

speakers.name: Bhargava Shastry
speakers.description: I have been a security engineer in the Solidity team, Ethereum foundation for over three years now. I enjoy breaking software and previously pursued it as the topic of my PhD dissertation at the technical university of Berlin. I have been applying my expertise in understanding how to threat model a compiler and find bugs that matter.

title: Finding and understanding miscompilation bugs in the Solidity compiler
description: This talk introduces the audience to the threat posed by miscompilation, wrongly compiled bytecode that changes program semantics unintentionally due to a bug in the compiler. It then outlines the approach we have taken to proactively find such bugs. This involves generating semantically valid Solidity programs and differently testing them for behavioral divergence. Using this approach we have found more than 15 miscompilation bugs that have all been fixed. An attempt is made to understand them.

speakers.name: Suji Yan
speakers.description: Founder of Mask Network

title: How to Decentralize Social Media - Use twitter as a case study
description: Centralized social media platforms in Web2 are stifling innovations of third parties and hitting the glass ceiling in their own growth. Decentralization is the most optimal way out for new builders and giants themselves. Witnessing how Web3 technologies (blockchain, cryptography, P2P networks) have shaken the order in the global economy gives us enough faith for the rise of a new order in the digital public discourse. Mask Network is at the forefront of decentralizing social media.

speakers.name: Ren Crypto Fish
speakers.description:
Ren is an engineer at Electric Capital interested in decentralized finance, mechanism design, and on-chain communities.

Previously Ren was a quantitative researcher building algorithmic trading systems and strategies at large tradfi firms and assisted with public policy research at the Federal Reserve during college.

title: Querying EVM State Variables with Token Flow
description:
With the way that Ethereum storage is organized it is almost impossible to query storage directly. It is because memory locations are actually hashes of variable slots and keys. This is why so many rookies ask the same question over and over again: ‚ÄòHow can I iterate over mappings (e.g. balanceOf of any ERC20 token)?‚Äô and are so surprised to hear: ‚ÄòYou cannot!‚Äô.

Learn how to do so with Token Flow + walk through on how EVM storage works

speakers.name: Etan Kissling
speakers.description: üêº

title: Light Clients after the Merge
description: The merge unlocks a new era of truly light clients that can stay in sync with the Ethereum network using just 20 bytes / second. All obtained data can be verified in a trust-minimized manner, reducing the risk of a rogue centralized API provider serving incorrect data. This talk describes the latest advancements in CL light client protocols.

speakers.name: Alex Van de Sande
speakers.description: Alex joined the Ethereum foundation in 2014 and was lead of the Wallet and Browser project as well as many other contributions. During his term in the foundation he also founded ENS with Nick Johnson. He has also since worked on many projects, trying to help onboard users in a multisig account (Unilogin) and worked at the Defi project Balancer Labs. Alex is currently a delegate and public goods stewards for ENS.

title: ENS Public Goods update: ENS for social media, ENS referrals and more!
description:
ENS, everyone's favorite naming service has launched a DAO with many working groups, working on things beyond naming. Among them:

* A social media bounty for incentivizing cross compatibility between web3 social apps
* A referral program for ENS developers
* A token incentive for Ethereum Core developers to keep working on Eth
* A small grants application for self-serving grants

Join me in this talk and learn all that we do beyond displaying .eth on twitter! 
Plus, free ENS pins!

speakers.name: Errol Drummond
speakers.description:
Aleo: Head of Education
Ethereum Foundation PSE: Applied cryptographer working on Halo2 and MACI
CryptIst: Co-founder (mini zk focused conference in Istanbul: https://www.cryptist.org/)

title: ZK Education - what we should actually teach people
description: ZK tech is emerging as a phenomenally popular tool, but due to its complexity we are having trouble teaching people about it. The analogy of an ID at a bar gets the core idea across, but provides nothing in terms of how it actually works, or more importantly, how to build with it/what you can do with it. This talk will show that zk tech is just circuit satisfiability in disguise - and from there it is easier to see what you can do with it

speakers.name: Lucas Manuel
speakers.description: Lucas has been working in the Ethereum space since 2017, starting at EY as a smart contracts engineer, then MakerDAO as a smart contracts engineer in DeFi summer, then working as a smart contracts tech lead at Maple Finance since December 2020.

title: From Concept to Mainnet - How to Deploy Safe Smart Contracts
description:
This talk will outline:
- Github review standards/repo management
- Smart contract styling for maximum auditability and security
- Smart contract testing with Foundry/Dapptools (unit, fuzzing, symbolic execution, invariants, economic simulations)
- Proper Documentation
- Release management
- Internal auditing approaches
- External auditing approaches
- Smart contract critical systems monitoring using Tenderly and PagerDuty
- Deployment

speakers.name: Aayush Gupta
speakers.description: 0xPARC

title: Non-interactive, Unique Nullifiers: The Key to The Next Era of ZK
description: ZK app systems are being held back because there isn't an anonymous way to prove that you aren't double claiming/double posting. In this talk, we explore the variety of nullifiers and present a new signature scheme that would enable things like zk airdrops or other zk systems that require uniqueness.

speakers.name: Juan Carlos Bell Llin√°s
speakers.description: Im a political scientist, with specialization in urban planning and magister degree in conflict management. Have been working in DAOs for over 2 years. Right now Im a steward of the Token Engineering Commons and of GravityDAO.

title: Conflict management as critical infrastructure for tokenized projects.
description: Conflict is something that we experience everyday, with multiple scales, contexts and characteristics. Becoming competent to manage it as individual is a great human skill for everyday life, but also on organizational environments, like DAOs, having the ability to deal with the conflict between individuals fosters coordination, wellbeing and healthy relationships.

speakers.name: TheRise.eth
speakers.description:
Fundador & miembro de la comunidad de WeOwnThisMarket.com
Investigador y trader activo del mercado de criptomonedas desde el a√±o 2016.

title: La importancia de crear una comunidad latina fuerte
description: Aprovechando la situaci√≥n actual de Latinoam√©rica en el √°mbito geopol√≠tico tenemos la responsabilidad de aprovechar las oportunidades derivadas de la crisis, inflaci√≥n y pol√≠ticas/practicas da√±inas de los gobiernos actuales. Esto lo podemos hacer mediante v√≠as educativas, sumado al liderazgo ya existente en estos pa√≠ses latinos. El objetivo de esta charla ser√° hacer hincapi√© en los beneficios que el desarrollo de eth-dapps traen a sus miembros y por que LATAM debe fortalecer su presencia.

speakers.name: Anastasia Uglova
speakers.description: Anastasia is Head of Communications and Ecosystem Development at Lighthouse, the open metaverse navigation engine. Most recently, she ran enterprise content at Notion and earned her M.S. at UT Austin, where her research focused on privacy, identity, and interoperability standards to prevent another Cambridge Analytica in the metaverse. Previously, she's worked at NPR, NBC, Cato Institute, and the U.S. Senate, and spent six years advancing women‚Äôs education and workforce development in Rwanda.

title: Privacy, identity, and interoperability in the metaverse
description:
Interoperability isn't just a technical requirement. It is a prerequisite for an open and agentic metaverse -- the metaverse we envision, no merely the one we inherit by failing to make thoughtful system architecture and design choices.

Our talk will discuss the standards and user-centric permissions needed to enable consensual, privacy-respecting discovery, navigation, and identity management across the open metaverse -- and the tradeoffs builders must evaluate to make this a reality.

speakers.name: Hilina Damte
speakers.description:
Hilina Damte is the Co-Founder of G&H Blockchain and Managing Partner at PayWay Ethiopia. She is an expert in technology entrepreneurship, fintech, and blockchain.


Winner of a Binance Pitch Competition at the Africa Blockchain Conference, Hilina is using blockchain to revolutionize the agricultural industry in East Africa. She is passionate about fintech and financial inclusion.

title: How NFT has Impacted African Creative Industry
description: African Artists have been impacted greatly with benefits of NFTs. African Artists have been able to showcase their work and more importantly monetize greatly. Use cases of how NFTs have impacted Artists focused in Ethiopia, Kenya and Nigeria.

speakers.name: Jacob Caban-Tomski
speakers.description: Developer on BLS Wallet project at Privacy & Scaling Explorations. Passionate about developing solutions to scale the Ethereum ecosystem to the rest of the world through rollups & L2s. When I'm not coding you'll find me eating spicy noodles, jamming out to EDM, or on a bike.

title: Onboard The World Into Your Rollup dApp with BLS Wallet
description:
Bringing non-web3 native users into a dApp is always a fraught, friction filled experience, even with cheaper transaction costs on rollups. In this talk, we will show you how you can modify a dApp using BLS signatures & a smart contract wallet to:
 
 - Embed a wallet directly in your dApp, and allow users to eject by swapping its public key.
 - Bundle multiple transactions into one and submit to an aggregator to lower friction & save on gas.
 - Pay for your user's transactions.

speakers.name: Rainbow Nelson
speakers.description: Regenerative community builder and ecosystem weaver, I help B-corps and forward-thinking governments grow healthy online communities. For 20 years I‚Äôve been helping cities and get noticed with my words, now I help city mayors and other place builders to improve the quality of people's lives by creating international communication strategies that attract investors from the metaverse and the real world.

title: Planting Trees with Carbon Negative NFTs
description: The Cartagena Turtles Club (CTG.TRTL.DAO) will restore 57 hectares of mangrove forest to the south of Cartagena, Colombia through the sale of carbon negative NFTs to sequester up to 40,000 tonnes of CO2e. The project will impact six of the United Nations SDGs improving the lives of displaced Venezuelan migrants, protect the city from coastal erosion, support women, create ecotourism opportunities and help artisanal fishermen recover their livelihoods.

speakers.name: Michael Woudenberg
speakers.description: Michael Woudenberg is a senior engineering manager at Chainalysis Inc. leading software development of advanced blockchain analytics software as a service (SaaS).  Prior, he was a senior staff operations research analyst for Lockheed Martin and an applied research lead for autonomy, AI, and ML. His experience also includes program management for cyber, electronic warfare, and directed-energy R&D portfolios at Raytheon and advanced avionics at Honeywell Aerospace.  Michael is a veteran of the U.S

title: Demonetizing Cyber Crime; Tracing Funds through Blockchain Analytics
description: Crypto currencies are exploding across the financial markets, and with that, illicit actors are using crypto to extract revenue from cyber attacks such as ransomware, crypto hacking, and other cybercrimes.  State and non-state actors are also using crypto as a method to bypass sanctions and anti-proliferation laws, obfuscate money laundering, and anonymize cyber criminals.  Join us as we explore blockchain analytics, crypto tracing, criminal attribution and the public and private partnerships re

speakers.name: Dalip Tyagi
speakers.description: Dalip leads Developer Relations organization at Polygon. In his role, he is responsible for cultivating a vibrant developer ecosystem and establish Polygon as the solution of choice for scaling their Web3 applications. Developer relations team supports developers of all sizes through various community, education, evangelism and technology partnership programs. Previously, Dalip spent 16+ years in the big tech including Amazon Alexa, Facebook and Microsoft.

title: Developer Productivity and Tools

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
Share how Polygon is contributing to the open-source projects and working with partners to reduce friction in development. Talk will focus on three main themes- ZK, Partnerships, and analytics. 

Talk about internal tooling, best practices of setting up Infra, and supporting the multi-blockchain paradigm of polygon.

speakers.name: S√∏ren Peter Nielsen
speakers.description:
S√∏ren is chair of the board in Dai Foundation which has as its mandate to safeguard certain assets of the Maker protocol. He was Head of Product in Maker Foundation from 2018 until its dissolution in 2021.
S√∏ren has worked with IT in 40 years both in the private and public sector.

title: Case Study: How does a DAO protect its intangible assets?
description:
Trademarks and Copyrights are traditionally important centralized means to protect a brand and assets. But how does a DAO handle this?
This presentation will be a case study of how this is being handled for MakerDAO where the non-profit Dai Foundation owns trademarks and copyrights to the protocol software.
Hear about the activities to protect existing and new DAO assets and the governance processes to make them available as public goods for the DAO and its members.

speakers.name: Zubin
speakers.description:
Zubin was a lawyer for over 15 years and then taught himself to code. After a stint at Google Engineering, Zubin felt the call of blockchain tech and is now a Developer Advocate at Chainlink Labs.

Zubin is extremely interested in developing tools and knowhow where his legal and engineering background can be combined to provide solutions for DAOs to decentralize and automate governance in a way that is transparent and clear to non-technical DAO members.

title: Decentralized & Automated Governance - A Conversation Between a Lawyer & Engineer
description:
GOAL: discuss the key attributes  & ideals of DAOs that create challenges that affect developers , participants and regulators.  

Many of the key tenets of DAOs sit uncomfortably with traditional regulatory paradigms.  This is good - it is a sign of evolution.  

Bringing together the different perspectives is the best way to co-create the future rather than just try and predict it.

speakers.name: Antonio Salazar Cardozo
speakers.description: Antonio Salazar Cardozo is the CTO of Thesis, Head of Engineering of Tally Ho, and a software pragmatist who values great software that is written for humans first. As a relatively outgoing engineer, he‚Äôll likely look at your shoes instead of his when he‚Äôs talking to you.

title: Bad maps are worse than no map at all: Transaction enrichment and safety in Tally Ho

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Come see a revolution in web3 cartography! Wallets today have done a great job of security theater: every action requires confirmation, and if you‚Äôre lucky the confirmations include a slew of data that‚Äôs supposed to help you understand what it will do. Tally Ho‚Äôs transaction enrichment provides the infrastructure to rework this approach completely. Meet a wallet that will tell you what you‚Äôre actually doing, not how much code you have to read to guess.

speakers.name: Daniel Zachary Goldman
speakers.description: Techie @ Arbitrum

title: An (in-progress) History of Layer 2
description: An overview of the layer 2 technology, from the earliest Bitcoin lightning channels to the cutting edge of Optimistic and ZK-rollups, and (speculatively...) beyond!

speakers.name: Brian Wilkes, CFA
speakers.description: I am a data scientist and financial analyst currently working on a grant from the EF PSE team.  I am fascinated by a future enabled by zero knowledge technology, including both scalability and privacy.   Outside of web 3 work, I am a husband and father of a 2 year old I like to carry up mountains in Colorado.  I am generally interested in everything, but you will catch my attention with music (I play bass), skiing, and anything Ethereum related :)

title: ZK Proof Performance and Security Metrics
description: ZK tech seems to get almost mystifying treatment from both regular users & even builders using different zk compilers and libraries.  Beyond the moon math, there are quantifiable differences between the circuits deployed in the Ethereum ecosystem that can help users and builders understand what they are interacting with.  Join us as we explain our methodology for collecting and quantifying these differences in a format digestible for the non-math professor.

speakers.name: Kelsie Nabben
speakers.description: Kelsie is a researcher at RMIT University, Centre for Automated Decision-Making and Society and Blockchain Innovation Hub, BlockScience and Metagov. As a social scientist, she is interested in resilience, governance, the culture and history of decentralised technology communities, and the social outcomes of automation.

title: Finding Frameworks for Viable DAO Governance
description: This panel explores governance theory and practice in human-machine organisation. We draw on the ‚ÄòViable System Model‚Äô by Beer to explain the governance surface of a DAO, before delving into practical design and participation insights, grounded in deep ethnography and engineering design in Dgov. This includes purpose, governance (or ‚Äòsteering‚Äô), operations, and environment. Listeners can expect to learn new mental models for organisation design, and greater insights into DAO communities

speakers.name: Alison Haire
speakers.description: Ally is a Developer Advocate at the Filecoin Foundation. She is a coder, engineer and tech enthusiast who believes in the benefits technology can bring to everyday life. She has a passion for helping people by sharing knowledge and working closely with developers and open source communities around the world.

title: The Real Actors of the Filecoin Virtual Machine (FVM): The Community building the tools of programmability on Filecoin
description:
The Filecoin Virtual Machine is introducing smart contracts (called Actors) to the decentralised data storage network of Filecoin. 
Building an EVM-compatible and native layer 1 blockchain on top of the decentralised layer 0 storage network of filecoin takes an open source village.
The FVM Early Fil-ders have been working on this and this will highlight their builds and working with a developer community.

speakers.name: Clarence Liu
speakers.description: Clarence Liu is the CTO of Owl Protocol & Vulcan Link, he has over 10 years of software engineering experience, before pivoting to BD for various blockchain projects in 2017, and co-founding Tacen in 2020, raising over 19 mil USD. Clarence has traveled the globe speaking on blockchain, legal regulations, and technology; most recently he was a key panelist at Paris Blockchain Week speaking on DAOs. He has now joined the Owl Protocol dynamic NFT project with Leo Vigna, CEO & Founder of VulcanLink.

title: Standards for Dynamic NFTs
description: Owl Protocol is building standards for Dynamic NFTs (DNFTs) and believes that these standards are the first step to fostering universal accessibility to DNFTs. With standard interfaces for how NFTs should interact with one another, be combined, or crafted in recipes, only then can developers build usable UIs for non-coders and artists to create true interactive NFTs. Game developers will also benefit from intuitive APIs, and set encoding attributes for NFTs, so that they can be portable.

speakers.name: Alex Smirnov
speakers.description: Alex Smirnov is the CEO and co-founder of deBridge. He previously co-founded Phenom which was a blockchain research and development company, and he has also led a team that has won numerous hackathons and developed various blockchain solutions and dApps.

title: Cross-chain interoperability ‚Äì The next wave for DeFi and NFTs
description: We already live in a multi-chain world with more than 100 public blockchain networks available. The major problem is that this leads to vital problems of ecosystem fragmentation, such as fragmentation of technologies, liquidity, and even competitive environments. This is solved by a generic messaging protocol like deBridge which acts as a secure interoperability layer for Web3 and enables transfers of value and messages between blockchains.

speakers.name: Gabriel Zanko
speakers.description:
Gabriel Zanko. 18+ years experience in Finance having worked for companies such as PwC and Nokia -Siemens

Founder and CEO of MobileyourLife (Tech Investment Banking ). Having raised up to 30MM USD for technology including Blockchain. And Urano Capital a Deep tech Fund for Renewable energy and Decentralized Networks

Investor/ Advisor and Researcher.

title: How Decentralized Networks can empower Science and Impact Investments
description: How DeFi, Decentralized economies and Networks onchain can empower real science projects for our planet and interconnect onchain capital with offchain

speakers.name: Jacob Eliosoff
speakers.description: Jacob Eliosoff (@JaEsf) is a NYC-based computers guy who has worked at startups, in finance, as a teacher and now with cryptocurrencies. Like most people who run a crypto hedge fund, he is "in it for the tech". His role model is email and his nemesis is a wire transfer.

title: USM: a simple, decentralized (immutable), tightly-pegged stablecoin
description: People love stablecoins, but centralized coins like USDT/USDC still dominate. USM ("minimalist USD") is our contribution to the still-sparse "true crypto" stablecoin category: immutable, simple, fully collateral-backed (ETH only), premine-free - an open-source public good. In 2022 we shouldn't need to settle for stablecoins that depend on governance, much less multisigs, opaque collateral or bank accounts. https://github.com/usmfum/USM/blob/master/README.md

speakers.name: Charles Anderson
speakers.description: Charles Anderson is the Founder & CEO of NEST¬Æ who comes from a UN background. In 2017 he began structuring the worlds‚Äô first anonymized distributed technology based, genuine end-to-end encrypted, direct service engagement systems alongside varied DeFi and FinTech methodologies. He holds eclectic back and front-end development experience, multiple patent filings with all features and solutions being built in-house by nearly 60 developers, whom Charles manages directly.

title: Individual Encryption & Self-Sovereign, Autonomous Control Across Web3+
description: Intrinsic to ‚Äòcentralized institution‚Äô terminology lays the fact that its functionality axiomatically pertains to the delineated set of participants whose finite activity is arranged in accordance with a single or set of geographically constrained governing bodies. After joining or engaging then one may choose within set options for a specified effect. This is the methodology mirrored in the current, Web2 sphere. Yet decentralized technologies should not be conceptualized for continual...

speakers.name: Tyler Perkins
speakers.description: CMO at Matter Labs

title: Optimistic vs ZK Rollups
description: Top layer-2 projects discuss the benefits and disadvantages of different approaches to scaling Ethereum via Layer-2s

speakers.name: James Brown
speakers.description:
James Brown, co-founder of SmartTokenLabs.

Learned coding on a Commodore64. Have written an MMO server, done some game programming, designed and coded at a bank's innovation lab and lately doing Ethereum, Ethereum wallet and hardware/firmware development.
Fully equipped rambling hiker, known to occaisionally be stuck down a hole in the middle of the night, with an owl.

title: Smart token powered hardware build

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Ethereum real world integration hardware workshop: build a simple lock mechanism, mint a token to operate and write a wallet script using EIP5169 scriptURI interface

speakers.name: Avihu Levy
speakers.description:
Avihu Levy
Head of Product & Blockchain Research
Avihu has a B.Sc. (Summa cum Laude) in Electrical Engineering and Physics from the Technion. He has 8 years of experience in security research of network protocols and mobile devices. Avihu is a blockchain enthusiast and has worked on several projects in the field.

title: Recursion - increasing throughput, speed and efficiency
description: Recursion is the next step in taking rollups to new levels of throughput, speed and efficiency. How? With STARKs we can generate a proof that attests to the correctness of large computations. With recursion, we can prove several proofs, each one attesting to the correctness of a large computation.

speakers.name: odysseas_eth
speakers.description: ‚Ñ£ibes ‚ÑØngineer  @nomadxyz_ | sovereign individual ìÄÄ ‚ãÉ shitposter ìÅÄ ‚ãÉ system design, rust, solidity (üî•,‚öíÔ∏è) ‚ãÉ‚õì

title: The problem with cross-chain governance
description: Protocols are deploying on many chains and the multichain world is here to stay. A Decentralized and secure cross-chain governance solution is needed for this new reality but is hard to do well. The best solution for this right now requires two components: a secure messaging channel and a standardized interface for accepting cross-chain calls. Nomad and Gnosis have provided the best solution for providing secure cross-chain messaging and a standardized interface so that DAOs can scale.

speakers.name: odysseas_eth
speakers.description: ‚Ñ£ibes ‚ÑØngineer  @nomadxyz_ | sovereign individual ìÄÄ ‚ãÉ shitposter ìÅÄ ‚ãÉ system design, rust, solidity (üî•,‚öíÔ∏è) ‚ãÉ‚õì

title: An primer on Interop
description:
A primer on Interop. 

A short introduction to everything regarding interoperability.
- What's the problem we are solving with interoperability
- Why is it important?
- What's its formal definition (correct cross-chain communication) (some light math)
- What are the main design schools and their tradeoffs
- Why the Optimistic pattern is the way to go

speakers.name: Layne Haber
speakers.description: Layne is Cofounder and Research Lead at Connext which creates interoperability technology. She has been building infrastructure for Ethereum since 2017, and before that worked in digital health.

title: Crosschain Security Considerations for the Degen in All of Us
description: Crosschain applications (xApps) are often considered too risky, but this viewpoint is divorced from reality. People **will** use these applications and it is our responsibility to understand the security implications. xApp developers must be able to reason about concurrency and asynchrony across two different networks, as well as understand the trust assumptions introduced by the data transport layer. By understanding this, we can allow users to engage in risky behavior in the safest way.

speakers.name: Evan Saulpaugh
speakers.description: esaulpaugh/headlong

title: headlong: A Contract ABI and RLP library for the JVM
description:
I describe how I implemented the solidity Contract ABI specification to make encoding and decoding faster and therefore more scaleable while also improving usability. headlong can parse any function signature or JSON description at runtime and do the type-checking of inputs before encoding and of outputs during decoding.

I also discuss how the command-line interface uses human-to-machine and machine-to-machine RLP-based serialization formats to consume arguments and produce results.

description: In this presentation, a member of the FIlecoin Green team will provide an overview of our work, and discuss how leveraging web3 tech & crypto-economic incentives can help us drive collective action towards enhancing global climate action.

speakers.name: Marc Johnson

description:

In this workshop, we will provide a detailed overview / demonstration of the tooling we've developed to monitor and mange the energy use metrics of the Filecoin Network (https://filecoin.energy/) and explain how these tools can be applied to other web3 networks for their own use.

description: Ethereum will require a layer 3 for truly decentralising DApps ( most DApps have a centralised hosting but a decentralised contract) and enabling more flexibility for developers to build more robust applications on Ethereum while leveraging Ethereum ecosystem shared security and composability.

speakers.description: NodeReal is a one-stop infrastructure and solution provider that embraces the high-speed blockchain era. It provides scalable, reliable, and efficient blockchain solutions for everyone, aiming to support the massive adoption, growth, and long-term success of the Web3 ecosystem.

It provides scalable, reliable, and efficient blockchain solutions for everyone, aiming to support the massive adoption, growth, and long-term success of the Web3 ecosystem. From our speech, we will focus on how to cross the chasm from web2 to web3, what is the structure of NodeReal and how we offer services for developers to launch projects easily.

speakers.name: Leonard Tan
speakers.description: CTO of Web3Auth (fka. Torus)

title: Time-locked recovery factors for secret sharing
description: Verifiable delay encryption allows us to construct time-locked secret shares which reveal themselves after some time. Paired with share refreshing, this allows users to automatically recover their account after a set amount of time even if they have lost secret shares, without compromising key security. Setup requires no user input which allows for a streamlined UX, and we show a demo of this functionality by generating and recovering a private key using this technique.

speakers.name: Zhen
speakers.description:
Zhen loves canales, key management and cats.

Making non-custodiality more accessible with Web3Auth as a co-founder, previously worked on Peace Bridge (ETH-ETC bridge), and state channel stuff.

title: Can we mimick traditional Multi-Factor Account flows with cryptographic natives?
description:
Today, traditional MFA flows today are designed without non-custodiality in mind.  

In this talk we explore how we can improve non-custodial security and reduce loss of keys by leveraging on flows that users are already familiar with - be it device OTPs, biometrics, cloud providers or other MFA factors. Which flows can be mimicked by cryptographic natives, or smart contracts and to what degree? Presented via our quantitative & qualitative studies on how users perceive the differences in flows

speakers.name: Mohammad Shahbaz Alam
speakers.description: Shahbaz is a Full-Stack Developer, Open Source Evangelist, Developer Advocate @ Web3Auth, and a Mozilla Representative. He loves teaching and sharing his learnings at conferences and meetups related to Authentication and Authorization, Blockchain infrastructure, and Web Security.

title: Using OAuth tokens to Generate Blockchain private key!
description:
We have extended OAuth 2.0 to support authentication using OpenID Connect. Let‚Äôs extend one more step to generate a blockchain private key.

In this talk, I will show how ID Token received from Social/Identity Providers can be used to generate a blockchain private key using tKey, a non-custodial open-source library.

speakers.name: Emily Furlong
speakers.description: Emily is Co-founder and leading Product at Otterspace, and contributor to Shark DAO and Cabin DAO. She was previously Product Manager for Creator Monetization at SoundCloud. Her academic background is in Political Philosophy and Social Psychology and she is excited by the potential of Web3 to improve how groups of humans coordinate and self-govern.

title: From Attention to Ownership - Rethinking Product and UX Frameworks for Web3
description: Many prevailing Product and UX frameworks were developed in the Web2 era and based on lessons learned from social networks, marketplaces and platforms. In this talk I will first explore several frameworks, whether they are still useful in Web3, and to what extent. Then I will propose new models of approaching Product, UX journey design and growth for Web3. In order to level-up the UX of Web3, we both need to adopt familiar principles while evolving the product discipline for this new era.

speakers.name: Matthew Fontana
speakers.description: Matthew Fontana is the Head of Ecosystem of the Streamr Network, a decentralized real-time data infrastructure project. Matthew helped develop the world's first decentralized real-time data marketplace in 2018, has co-founded companies in education and travel and holds a degree in electrical power engineering.

title: Decentralized wallet-to-wallet real-time communication
description:
A breakdown of how the Streamr Network Pub/Sub, built on Ethereum and WebRTC can power decentralized and verifiable communications between Ethereum based wallets.

We'll live demo a group wallet IM where every message payload is cryptographically signed by the author, and flows through a decentralized data transport network to reach any number of subscribers in under a third of a second.

speakers.name: Anton Buenavista
speakers.description:

Anton has been involved in the crypto space and developer community since 2012. He has taken a keen interest in game theory, consensus mechanisms, and scalability.

title: How EIP-5115 allows super composable yield bearing assets
description: Most if not all yield-generating avenues have different interfaces and behaviors. EIP-5115 (https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-5115) proposes a standardized API for wrapped yield-generating tokens. In this talk, we'll explore the various use cases this EIP can enable, such as having a lending DAI position in Compound earning DAI interest and COMP rewards, then tokenizing it further on Pendle to lock in future yield or creating another fixed-income asset.

description:

This talk will provide a brief overview of xToken‚Äôs efforts to standardize and productize these primitives, providing projects with seamless access to the suite of tools they need to bootstrap their protocols.

title: Solidity Optimizer
description: Summarizing some changes in the solidity optimizer. With the introduction of `--via-ir`, several popular "optimization tips" are no longer required. The talk will try to highlight this.

title: Unlimited size contracts using Solidity
description:
Ethereum currently have a limit of 24KB for a contract size which cause a major pain for many Solidity devs. I would present all available options to address this issue using Solidity language during the workshop and provide cons and pros of them.
* External libs
* Transparent and uups proxies
* EIP-2535
* Static precompiled router proxy 
I will also provide gas optimization tricks for above methods.

description: The year 2022 marks a milestone for institutional investors of the Ethereum ecosystem. Previously, there was no direct way to leverage your ETH holdings to secure the network. At the same time, incentivation changes instantly when PoW mining is disabled. To participate, institutions require solutions from dedicated services providers. KYC-walled gardens for these investors solve some of the problems but create more unkowns as well. This talk will give an overview of issues to be tackled.

speakers.name: Leo Alt
speakers.description: Leo is the Formal Verification Lead at the Ethereum Foundation where he also contributes to the Solidity language and compiler.

title: Wen Yul FV
description: Yul is the IR language used by the Solidity and Fe compilers. Besides its IR role, it is also widely used by the optimizooors - remarkable creatures that feed off gas units. However, there are not many code analysis tools that target Yul. Most formal verification (FV) tools for Ethereum target EVM bytecode, and a few analyze high-level Solidity invariants. In this talk we will discuss the advantages of analyzing Yul over EVM/Solidity, and go through a range of existing tools.

speakers.name: Kris Decoodt
speakers.description: Lunarpunk catherder working as a Steward and DAO Operations Lead at Gitcoin. In the web3 space for +5 years (Swarm City, Aragon, Giveth, Commons Stack - cofounder & Gitcoin). Previous experiences in advertising and marketing in big tech. Not a specialist, more an all-rounder with a lot of focus on processes & efficiency in communication, strategy & project management and a never ending passion for Public Goods.

title: DAO Operations: an evolution of DAO governance @ GitcoinDAO
description:
So, DAOs are the future, but how are we currently doing?
But how have we actually been governing DAOs? What works and what doesn't? 
Kris has been leading DAO operations for one year now at GitcoinDAO and witnessed the Good, the Bad and the Ugly. What have we learned? Where can we do better? 
A quick overview of how Gitcoin morphed from a centralized company into a DAO, and how its operating system evolved and continues to evolve over time.

speakers.name: Yoseph Ayele
speakers.description:
Yoseph is an entrepreneur building at the intersection of Web3 and Africa. He is a contributor to the Ethereum Foundation, Wildfire DAO, and Soul Aether amongst others. 

He co-founded and was CEO of the Edmund Hillary Fellowship (ehf.org), a community of 500+ top tier entrepreneurs and investors from 68 countries. He built a new immigration program for entrepreneurs with the New Zealand government, and ran it as a public-private partnership. He is from Ethiopia, and grew up in East Africa.

title: Borderless Africa - a new narrative

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: If Ethereum is a digital nation, millions of Africans will flock in masses to become citizens. Why? A fair chance to participate in an open borderless economy, and ultimately self-determination. Web3 is unleashing a generation of African talent trapped within the confines of the old gated economy. A new narrative places Africa differently through the Web3 lens. Why should Ethereum builders take African talent and markets seriously? Where are low hanging fruits for win-win scenarios?

speakers.name: Rob Rico
speakers.description: Roberto (Rob) Rico is a binational, Mexican-American. He was born and raised in Los Angeles, California. Rob is a licensed lawyer from California. He began his work in the oracle space in 2018 with Honeycomb. Honeycomb was a node operator and a data marketplace for the Chainlink network. In 2020, Honeycomb pivoted to API3 and created the software for API providers to connect directly to Web3 without needing node operators. Rob co-leads API3 LatAm and open-banking efforts.

title: What is an Oracle / Que es un Oraculo
description: This is a bilingual talk (10 minutes in Spanish, 10 minutes in English, followed by 5 minute Q&A) on the topic of Oracles. Oracles are a critical infrastructure piece of Web3, but very little attention has been placed here. This talk will explore: what are oracles, the history of oracles, why they are needed for security, the need for smart contracts to consume transparent data, the current state of oracles, and where the industry is moving towards, with an emphasis on LatAm.

API3 and the ANU Quantum Optics Group bring the first Quantum Random Numbers to blockchain, offering a truly random, secure, and free public random number utility to dApps and Web3.

title: Ethereum Attestation Service

The Ethereum Attestation Service is a free and open protocol for on-chain attestations on EVM-compatible blockchains. It is a generalized service that allows anyone to register a schema for their particular use case, and then make attestations following their schema.

In addition, we provide a resolver contract for advanced use cases, such as on-chain verification of attestation data,

speakers.name: Mara Schmiedt

Prior to joining Coinbase, Mara managed Business Development at Bison Trails and served as Strategy Manager at ConsenSys. She is passionate about open source technology and has led various initiatives including the development of the eth2 launchpad and distributed validator technology (DVT). She is an active angel investor and serves as an advisor to various projects.

title: The Staking Economy: From Monolith to Modularity
description:
The staking industry is on the verge of a new and exciting innovation cycle. The modularisation of the staking technology stack, led by advances in middleware solutions such as DVT and MEV Boost as well as ancillary components including on-chain validator rating systems, will create a new playing field for existing operators, product builders and solo stakers.

This talk is a data-rich analysis of key trends and developments driving the growth of the staking economy and what lies ahead.

This panel seeks to discuss key trends and developments driving the growth of the staking economy and what lies ahead.

speakers.name: Raphael Haupt
speakers.description: Rapha√´l Haupt founded Toucan, web3 building blocks for a regenerative economy. He believes Web3 has the opportunity to build a new financial ‚Äî and really economic system ‚Äî that is in line with our planetary boundaries. He's excited about empowering others to embed regenerative practices into the heart of their protocols, projects and communities.

title: How Web3 builders can unlock climate action at scale

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: My talk will focus on regenerative finance‚Äôs (ReFi) first building block: tokenized carbon credits. As a new planet-positive primitive, tokenized carbon credits can be integrated into dApps on Ethereum and the wider web3 ecosystem, enabling developers to encode climate-positive actions into their products. Ultimately, a DeFi economy that incorporates carbon credits will be our chance at turning the global economy from one that is extractive to one that is regenerative.

speakers.name: Solange Gueiros
speakers.description: Blockchain developer focused on Bitcoin, Ethereum and smart contracts. MSc in digital currencies. She has been working with technology for over 20 years. Speaker in world conferences since 2018, also she won awards at Ethereum hackathons. She was listed in Cointelegraph Brazil top 50.

title: How to automate DeFi
description: Smart contracts are NOT self-executing, it means that they can't trigger or initiate their own functions at arbitrary times or under some conditions. This workshop will teach you how to automate DeFi operations, such as mint a token, transfer balances, do an arbitrage, according to the conditions pre-defined in the smart contract. Chainlink Keepers will be used to do it.

speakers.name: Andy Boyan
speakers.description: Andy Boyan, PhD.'s past life as a Professor of Communication led him deep into the weeds of social science exploration of game mechanics and player effects. Turning this experience to Web3 after going down the 2017 crypto rabbit hole, Andy worked for Status, Ava Labs, and Chainlink Labs before Co-Founding Infinity Keys, creator tools for providing Web3 treasure hunt questing. He is definitely not an agent of the Elder Gods come to prepare the earth for a cold reign of starlit oblivion.

title: Composability and Gamification

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
Web3 tech provides features that have been practically unexplored by game designers. Games use DeFi mechanics, or self-custody and P2P marketplace mechanics, but few have used composability to create new game experiences for incentivization.

This presentation by PhD in gaming Andy Boyan will explore composable Web3 mechanics that designers and developers can think about in gamification design using examples from Loot, Dark Forest, Infinity Keys, and more.

speakers.name: Matthias Tarasiewicz
speakers.description: Matthias Tarasiewicz is a senior developer, technology consultant, research designer and project coordinator. He is an enthusiast for immutable and unstoppable code and an Open Source evangelist. Focus areas: Open Source Hardware, Web3, privacy and decentralization. Director of the RIAT Institute and CSO of RIAT Labs. Matthias has a background as digital artist, writer and curator.

title: The past, present and future of Crypto Stamps (Austrian Post & RIAT)
description: Austrian Post introduced the world's first "Crypto Stamp" in 2019. Realized as a physical snail-mail stamp with a digital twin NFT, it serves as first contact to crypto for many. Crypto stamp is a complex mainstream product with hardware security, as well as on-chain bridging mechanisms. A novel system has been developed by RIAT Labs (Drop all Tables) in 2022. In this talk, the past, present and future of Crypto stamps will be presented.

speakers.name: Andrew Trudel
speakers.description: Core Contributor at Kwenta, previously Synthetix. Founder of DeFi.Marketing. Ethereum and DeFi fanatic.

title: Creating a DAO from an existing DAO
description: The Synthetix ecosystem has fostered the independence of multiple projects recently. Kwenta, the leading interface for Synth and Synthetic Perp trading, is one of those examples as it was voted into existence via the Synthetix DAO. This experimental process of creating new DAOs from existing DAOs is a powerful way to bootstrap the growth of a new project while remaining decentralized and benefiting both parties.

speakers.name: Chris Buckland
speakers.description: A developer and researcher in the L2 space. I've worked with state channels, watchtowers and am now a developer at Arbitrum, Offchain Labs helping to building the next generation of L2 protocol - rollups.

title: Demystifying L2 transactions
description: Transactions executed on rollups have a different lifecycle to L1 transactions. In this hands-on workshop, for devs and users alike, we‚Äôll use Arbitrum as a demonstration tool to send transactions, follow them through their different stages of finality and analyse what fees they pay.

speakers.name: Vadim
speakers.description: Co-founder of Zerion

title: How crypto proved itself in Ukraine
description: During recent events in Ukraine, crypto got a chance to serve people and governments like never before. A lot of people in Ukraine and Russia acknowledged crypto and stablecoins as viable tools to hedge against local economies in periods of crisis. During this talk there will be showcases and stories of what has been done and learning from it.

speakers.name: Eric Chen
speakers.description: I'm the CEO and Co-founder of Injective Labs. Before founding Injective, I worked as a cryptography researcher and trader at Innovating Capital where he led innovative market-neutral trading efforts in the blockchain space as well as investments into prominent companies such as 0x, ChainLink and Cosmos. Eric has extensive knowledge about blockchain protocols and traditional finance along with a native understanding of both eastern and western blockchain-based protocols and communities.

title: Ethereum Scalability in a Cross-Chain World
description:
The cross-chain world is quickly gaining prominence with Ethereum continuing to lead the way. 
The suggested talk will focus on scaling Ethereum developer infrastructure that can further boost user experience and improve efficiency to enable wider adoption of Ethereum. The overall talk will also delve into the technical upgrades coming up within the crypto ecosystem that will enable more seamless cross-chain transfers with Ethereum across both the L1 and L2 ecosystems.

speakers.name: Nathan H.
speakers.description: I‚Äôm Nathan and I work for a layer one called syscoin that is bringing evm and rollups to Bitcoin through merged mining which allows btc miners to simultaneously mine both coins at the same time. As a result we have about 25% of the btc hash rate and it‚Äôs growing more every month. I am passionate about blockchain and it‚Äôs potential to change finance and the internet into a more equitable, fair, and transparent tool for all of humanity.

title: Routing rollups to Bitcoin
description:
Running rollups to BTC through merged mining and game theory of chain choice concerning how layer 2s will consider security.
Or said another way
In proof of stake, security is equivalent to base layer collateralization. We want to argue that subnets and base layers like solana will eventually go rollup route and use eth as base layer due to largest collateralization. We also want to argue that btc presents an alternative base layer to rollups through merged mining by freely recycling hash rate

speakers.name: Brent Annells
speakers.description: Big and small tech start ups in web1, web2 and web3. Try to make the complex simple. Chief Marketing Officer at Smart Token Labs. Kernel Block 4 alumni. Former brand and partnerships lead at Facebook and Uber. Trying every day to be the best Dad I can.

title: Decentralised brands : myth or moat ?
description: Brands are coming to web3. Most with a toe-in-the-water via drops, colabs or virtual land. What is the true potential of recognised consumer brands entering the space? Will they innovate through genuine shared ownership and decentralisation that disrupts existing models and categories ? Or will they tinker at the edges and stay true to the command and control model of web2 ? How do we as a community support and influence their contribution to our vision of a decentralised web?

speakers.name: Adrian Manning
speakers.description: Adrian is a co-founder and director of Sigma Prime. He has a background in physics but has spent the last few years working on the Ethereum consensus protocol, building the Lighthouse client. He is primarily focused in the networking aspects of the client and the protocol.

speakers.name: Diva
speakers.description: I've been working with sigp for two years and a half in networking land and very happy to join

title: Reducing beacon chain bandwidth for institutional and home stakers
description:
This talk gives an overview of the networking infrastructure of beacon nodes and details some of the recent research being done significantly reduce the growing bandwidth requirements of the Ethereum consensus layer.
In particular, we will discuss the network requirements of gossipsub, how long-lived subnets can be the cause and a potential solution to high bandwidth usage as well as preliminary results from experiments with an experimental extension to the gossipsub protocol, episub.

speakers.name: Juan Pablo Ramirez
speakers.description:
Juan Pablo Ram√≠rez is Blockchain & Crypto Lead at Bancolombia and supports the blockchain strategy for Grupo Bancolombia and all the banks where the group has a presence.
 
He has more than 14 years of professional experience, 11 of them in the financial sector and, specifically, more than 6 years in the blockchain and crypto world. He is curious, experimental and results-oriented, highlighting them as his main attributes.

title: How to build a stablecoin to support the LATAM economy
description: Latin America has been living the effects of the global economy changes in a resilient way. Inflation and governments have created scenarios where purchasing power is lower every day, and foreign currencies convertion rates increase at the same pace. However, despite these changes, Latin America has created a way to maintain a steady economic growth in some regions. Stablecoins are a path to keep developing the economy and give access to newer assets classes and democratize its access.

speakers.name: Tomohiro Nakamura
speakers.description: Chief Technology Officer at Startbahn

title: Missing pieces for making all creatives in the world protected with NFT
description:
By using ERC721 or other NFT standards, representing creatives and recording ownership history are easy. However, the infrastructure at an industry-wide level is not since not only Ethereum developers but all kinds of people such as artists, collectors, galleries or organizations for cultural affairs will use it.
We need many steps towards it like KYCs for artists and institutional participants, multi-sig wallets so enterprises can distribute permissions and NFC tags to manage physical assets.

speakers.name: Remco Bloemen
speakers.description:
Designing and building protocols at Worldcoin.
Seasoned gas golfer. Rustacean. Thoroughbred engineer and startup artist. Math/physics nerd. Father. Bicycle maximalist.

title: Privacy-preserving proof-of-personhood for a billion people.
description:
We build a 10‚Åπ people privacy-preserving proof-of-personhood. It takes only cents on-chain, can handle hundreds of requests per second, and anyone can use it, even on an old 32-bit android phone. It's build on Semaphore, boosted with recursive proofs and L2-esque sequencers. I'll share what we've learned, what we've build and where we go from here:
Topics: Semaphore, Plonky2, recursion, recursive batch proofs, private information retrieval, deep learning in ZK.

speakers.name: Solange Gueiros
speakers.description: Blockchain developer focused on Bitcoin, Ethereum and smart contracts. MSc in digital currencies. She has been working with technology for over 20 years. Speaker in world conferences since 2018, also she won awards at Ethereum hackathons. She was listed in Cointelegraph Brazil top 50.

title: Women, let's be web3 developers!
description:
Solange Gueiros has been a female Blockchain developer since 2017 and has noticed that there are few women in this space.
In 5 years working with Ethereum she has grown a lot and now she is a speaker in many conferences, sometimes being the only Brazilian speaker and a woman.
Sol says: "I love teaching and would like to inspire other women to be developers like me. I'm going to tell you a little about my trajectory and show you ways and tips for you to become a blockchain developer.

speakers.name: Leo Lin
speakers.description: With around 20 years of rich cross industry experiences in IoT and digital security, Leo initiated the establishment of IoT+Blockchain Joint Innovation Center and Blockchain IoT Module Alliance. Prior to found aitos.io, Leo Lin served as China General Manager at Gemalto, the global leading digital security company. Leo Lin holds an Electrical Engineering bachelor degree from Zhejiang University and an EMBA from the China Europe International Business School (CEIBS).

title: A token incentivized way to build global renewable infrastructure for carbon-neutrality
description: Carbon neutrality is THE biggest issue of this century while it faces deadlock for decades. We are integrating Blockchain(trust), IoT(connect), token(incentive) into a WEB 3.0 solution to buildup a global renewable infrastructure through massive human cooperation. Without politics plot and middleman hurdle, let‚Äôs connect every carbon carer in the world and build renewable infrastructure for the people, by the people.

speakers.name: Alberto Viera
speakers.description: Mechanical Eng. with a Ph.D. in Internal Combustion Engines. You might ask yourself, "What is this guy doing here?" The old saying goes, "Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life." I've been very passionate about blockchain since around 2013, so I decided to switch careers to join something that I believe is part of the future. Since then, I joined the Moonbeam project in June 2020 and have worked in Developer Relations.

title: Moonbeam: Expanding Ethereum to Polkadot
description:
## Summary
Moonbeam is an Ethereum-compatible L1 in Polkadot, and provides a unique opportunity and a interoperabiity hub for Eth Developers to tap into the Polkadot Ecosystem. 

## Talk Outline
In this presentation, I'll be giving a high-level overview of what Moonbeam is. We'll go through its main characteristics, as well as talk about unique interoperability scenarios that can be generated using different General Message Passing protocols between Ethereum <> Moonbeam.

speakers.name: Sanaz
speakers.description: I got my Ph.D. in Computer Science and Engineering specializing in Cryptography, Privacy, Security, and Distributed Systems and Applications. I am currently working as a Protocol Engineer at Status.im, developing Waku which is a stack of modular privacy-preserving and incentivized Peer-to-Peer (P2P) protocols to be the messaging layer of the Ethereum blockchain.

title: Waku-Rln-Relay: Spam-protected and Anonymous Gossip-based Routing Protocol with Built-in Economic Incentives

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: We present Waku-Rln-Relay  as an anonymous gossip-based routing protocol featuring a privacy-preserving peer-to-peer (p2p) economic spam protection mechanism that outperforms its counterparts i.e., PoW. It uses zero-knowledge proofs to enable global identification and removal of spammers while preserving anonymity.  Spam protection is achieved by limiting the messaging rate of each network participant. Spammers that violate the messaging rate get financially slashed while slashers are rewarded.

speakers.name: Corey Petty
speakers.description: Dr. Corey Petty started his blockchain focused research around 2012 as a personal hobby while doing his PhD candidacy at Texas Tech University in Computational Chemical Physics. He then went on to co-found The Bitcoin Podcast Network and still serves as a host on Hashing It Out. Corey entered the data science/blockchain security industry for a few years attempting to fix vulnerabilities in ICS/SCADA networks before transitioning to Status as Chief Security Officer. Now he works on infrastructure

title: How to ethically build public good infrastructure
description:
We at Status have been working to enable an interface to Web3 since our inception. We bought into the principles of this ecosystem, and have spent extraordinary effort to not compromise on those ethics while we continue to create applications that are easily accessible while also maintaining our user's rights. 

This talk is an overview of this journey, lessons learned, the fruits of this labor, why we're doubling down on this process, and why you should to.

speakers.name: Simon
speakers.description: experience architect, crafting journeys for people to meet, have fun and co-create in the web3 space

title: Member experience design
description: How to design a member experience: from hearing about the community to feeling like a member, passing by minting a soulbond token.

speakers.name: Simon
speakers.description: experience architect, crafting journeys for people to meet, have fun and co-create in the web3 space

title: Member experience design
description: How to design a member experience: from hearing about the community to feeling like a member, passing by minting a soulbond token.

speakers.name: Mohak Agarwal
speakers.description: Mohak Agarwal is the founder of ClayStack, a decentralized liquid staking protocol to unlock the liquidity of staked assets. Mohak has been an early proponent of Proof of Stake and prior to ClayStack, he founded WolfEdge Labs, a Staking as a Service company to run validator nodes on various proof of stake networks.

title: Why liquid staking is not a winner-take-all market and how it incentivizes decentralization

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: A competitive liquid staking market incentivizes effective stake decentralization across PoS networks as liquid staking protocols compete to provide both a resilient staking architecture and a refined user experience. The latter comprises building utility-driven integrations. This results in stake decentralization as over a long period of time several protocols compete against each other to have users stake their assets via them.

speakers.name: Antoni
speakers.description: Polygon Enterprise Lead at Polygon. Co-founder of Polygon Hermez and PolygonID

title: Web3 Impact: Bringing use cases to reality
description: From the Next 2 Billion (N2B) to the Green Initiative Polygon is cooperating with other web3 companies to create a positive impact on the real world.

speakers.name: 0xfoxxy
speakers.description:
VP Engineering, Music NFT project
former Tech lead @DEX

title: Shipping product like a hackathon
description:
Learnings from being part of and organizing more than 20 hackathons, how can DAO:s and projects learn from the hackathon methodology of rapid prototyping and bringing in fun into shipping stuff!

How to successfully compete in a hackathon, learnings, and mistakes. From A-Z, and how to make contributions fun and meaningful.

speakers.name: Peter Porobov
speakers.description: Upala digital identity founder. Peacemaker.

title: Price of forgery digital identity. Measuring human uniqueness score in dollars with Upala.
description: Upala protocol allows to measure price of forgery for any human verification method. The protocol creates incentives for bots to break verification methods and grab money as a bounty. This model allows to measure forgery price very accurately and respond to new exploits quickly. It also allows to unify different identity system under single standard - price of forgery score.

speakers.name: Patrick Pfeiffer
speakers.description: Working at Bitfly, making beaconchain more accessible

speakers.name: Stefan
speakers.description: Stefan Starflinger is a vienna-based fullstack developer at Bitfly. He attended the University of Vienna and graduated with a master's degree in business informatics. Currently he's working on multiple crypto related projects, namely Ethermine, Beaconcha.in and Ethermine Staking.

title: Run your own beaconcha.in
description: In this workshop we will show participants how to setup and run the [beaconcha.in-explorer](https://beaconcha.in) for existing networks (mainnet, prater, sepolia) as well as for custom networks. Also we will explain how to analyze the network using the explorer and how to monitor validators. By doing this workshop we hope to learn about problems people are running into while trying to run the explorer on their own and improve the usabilty of the explorer in general.

speakers.name: Ferit Tun√ßer
speakers.description: I have been working in crypto since 2018 as a software engineer, at Kleros, to build the first decentralized dispute resolution protocol. Which made me develop expertise in dispute resolution, as expected, and in curation systems, as we built decentralized curation mechanisms on top of our novel dispute resolution mechanism. Kleros Tokens and Kleros Curate are two notable products and are used in Etherscan, Un

title: Accurate and Relevant News Powered by Decentralized Curation
description: News is a public good and it has problems with incentivizing accuracy (consider misinformation, or simply fake news) and relevance (we want to reward news that has the biggest impact, not any news that is not just fake) on information that is curated. In this presentation, I am going to talk about how we can utilize decentralized curation to create a solution to these problems.

speakers.name: John Humphreys-Ramos
speakers.description: John is the Marketing Manager for Cumulus Encrypted Storage System (CESS). He currently focuses on growth strategies to introduce CESS into Europe, North America and Latin America.

title: A Decentralized Storage Protocol for Large-Scale Commercialization
description:
CESS is a decentralized storage protocol for large scale commercialization. We aim to deliver scalability for businesses in WEB3.0 as well as WEB2. This is achieved through our proprietary technologies and innovations. 
CESS is composed of three layers; Cumulus Encrypted Storage System (Storage Functionality), Network Infrastructure (Blockchain Layer) and CESS Ecosystem (Application Layer).
CESS resolves many prominent issues within the commercial decentralized storage industry.

speakers.name: Anthony Georgiades
speakers.description:
Anthony Georgiades ‚Äì Co-Founder 
While performing his duties as President, Anthony is also a General Partner at Innovating Capital, a technology fund focused on disruptive companies and digital assets that has incubated Pastel Network since day one. Anthony previously spent time on the investment team at First Round Capital and on the operations teams of various startups. He studied finance, management, and computer science at the University of Pennsylvania‚Äôs Wharton and en

title: Key vulnerabilities and security concerns developers should be aware of //Unlocking the future of the metaverse requires more security features for developers
description:
Having a decentralized network with minimized trust ensures optimal network security
Distributing the number of nodes running on the system across a diverse base of users, entities, and systems so that no single entity is running a significant number of nodes is extremely important for the network's security.Falling victim to hacks that are ‚Äòoperated‚Äô by a network of validator nodes that may be heavily centralized, semi-permissioned and managed by a small group of stakeholders...

speakers.name: Noah
speakers.description: Noah is a Core Contributor on Synthetix.

title: Cannon - Docker for the EVM
description: This talk will introduce Cannon (https://usecannon.com/) a command-line tool inspired by Docker and Terraform for managing blockchain deployments. We'll demonstrate a variety of use cases, which will be relevant to developers of all skill levels, including rapid prototyping, improved e2e testing, streamlining remote network deployments and more.

speakers.name: Viraz Malhotra
speakers.description: Builder on Ethereum Œû üë®‚Äçüíª | Smart Contract Developer
