title: EVM - The heart of the ethereum ecosystem
description: It will be a short Intro about EVM which aims to create awareness around newbie devs/people coming into the web3 space.

speakers.name: Cedoor
speakers.description: Blockchain Software Engineer. Working on usable, open, decentralized technologies for a real user-centric web.

title: Anonymous signalling on Ethereum

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Semaphore is a protocol, designed to be a simple and generic privacy layer for Ethereum DApps. Using zero knowledge, Ethereum users can prove their membership of a group and send signals such as votes or endorsements without revealing their original identity. The talk will describe the protocol, the main concepts and some use cases. A simple demo will also likely be used to show how Semaphore can be used to create DApps and solve real problems in the ecosystem.

speakers.name: Tobias Schubotz
speakers.description: Tobias is part of the team building Gnosis Safe, the de-facto standard for teams, communities and DAOs managing digital assets collectively on Ethereum. Tobias is passionate about resolving security and usability challenges with regards to self-custody. His main goal is making dapps more accessible by bridging the gap between technology and users‚Äô needs. In the wake of the initiation of SafeDAO, Tobias is leading product and operations inside the core team.

title: Smart contract accounts as generic web3 account standard
description:
We believe the next crypto adoption cycle will be driven by a focus on usability, security and flexibility for all users. EOAs have onboarded many, but traditional wallets suffer from security concerns preventing mass adoption.

This talk will present the trade-offs between contract accounts and traditional wallets controlled by single private keys. We will present proposals and ecosystem developments that are being developed to create an integrated, collaborative, and flexible web3 ecosystem.

speakers.name: Joe Petrich
speakers.description: Joe is Head of Engineering at Courtyard where he is building the future of physically backed NFTs.

title: Proof of Integrity - Combining On and Off Chain Data to Enable Revealable NFT Metadata
description: Storing data on chain can be expensive, but users want assurances of their NFT's metadata integrity. By creating a "proof of integrity" created by hashing uniquely identifying metadata and storing that on chain, developers can mint NFTs with unrevealed metadata and reveal the metadata off chain while having a way to prove that the metadata was always associated with a given token.

speakers.name: Angela Kreitenweis ‚Äì akrtws
speakers.description:
Angela is the founder of the Token Engineering Academy (TE Academy). It‚Äôs the first educational organization in this new field - that combines Computer Science, Economics & Game Theory, AI & Optimisation, Behavioural Economics, and more.
Angela has worked in early-stage startups since 2008 and collected first-hand experience developing new business models on both sides, at founding teams and VC investors. In 2018, she decided to leave Web2 and co-founded the Token Engineering Community.

title: TE Academy Incentives: Make people do stuff.
description: Token Engineering is a new crypto-native discipline to design, verify and optimize cryptoeconomic systems. TE Academy/tokenengineering.org offers a unique curriculum of courses and #OpenScience programs as a community-driven organization. In this talk, I‚Äôll provide an introduction to the incentive layers of TE Academy, combining fungible and non-fungible tokens, reputation, access rights, and monetary rewards, all optimized toward building open knowledge and managing common resources.

speakers.name: Hsiao-Wei Wang
speakers.description: Ethereum Foundation - Consensus R&D Team

speakers.name: Dankrad Feist
speakers.description: Ethereum Researcher

title: [Layer 1 Protocol] Danksharding + Data Availability Sampling (DAS) Workshop
description: [Danksharding](https://notes.ethereum.org/3t5cbN7cQnG6VxjgNMKymA) and [Data Availability Sampling (DAS)](https://hackmd.io/@vbuterin/sharding_proposal) are the two main Ethereum layer 1 scaling mechanisms in the near future. This workshop is organized by the Ethereum Foundation Consensus R&D team.

speakers.name: Sonal Patel
speakers.description:
I currently focus on accelerating the enterprise use of zero knowledge cryptography and distributed ledger technologies.

I‚Äôm the Head of Operations at ConsenSys Mesh- an incubator and enabler for Web3 technologies, where I lead operations for our Baseline Protocol Applied Research & Development Unit and advise other companies.

I‚Äôm also Chair of the Ethereum Training Quality (EthTQ)Work Group through the Enterprise Ethereum Alliance (EEA).

title: The Baseline for Enterprise Adoption of DLT
description: The Baseline Protocol is an open source project and standard for synchronizing workflows between parties in a framework that enables enterprises to synchronize complex, multiparty, business processes with privacy and without moving data from systems of record. The standard combines cutting edge technologies like zero knowledge cryptography and distributed ledger technology to transform existing business processes into entirely new models, while prioritizing information security.

speakers.name: Christian St.Louis
speakers.description: Cofounder at Component.fi, a decentralized finance R&D firm that specializes in building products and contributing to protocols with a high aptitude for understanding complex data. Previously worked on data problems in ad tech and have two degrees from Queen's University in Math and Data Science.

title: Building Automated DeFi Strategies Using Data
description: At Component (https://www.component.fi) we're building a product called Blueprint which leverages our DeFi data aggregator to enable the creation of sophisticated investment strategies. In this talk, we'll show how Blueprint can be used to build personalized investment strategies. We'll start with a simple concept and through customizable rules and parameters we'll shape it into a fully automated and executable on-chain DeFi strategy.

speakers.name: Hsiao-Wei Wang
speakers.description: Ethereum Foundation - Consensus R&D Team

title: [Layer 1 Protocol] Let's run and contribute to Consensus Pyspec
description:
[Ethereum consensus pyspec](https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs) is an executable specification that serves as a reference for consensus layer devs. It is also used for creating the test case vectors for client teams.

In this lightning talk, we will have a tutorial on how to run [Ethereum consensus pyspec](https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs). And bonus, learn how to write a test by yourself!

speakers.name: Chris
speakers.description: Chris Shei is an open-source contributor, influencer, and founder in the Web3 space. Having worked at Near protocol, and contributed to OSS projects such as Open Zeppelin, Chris recently founded Thresholds (backed by First Round, Coinbase, Spark), a company that simplifies access to DeFi + Web3 for institutions. His crypto content has racked up over 300,000+ views on TikTok.

title: Decreasing friction for crypto non natives
description: Onboarding non-crypto natives is the holy grail of any web3 protocol or platform, but providing a smooth onboarding process seems practically impossible when users have to on-ramp into crypto, create a wallet, manage private keys, sign transactions, and off-ramp back into fiat. In this talk, I‚Äôll step through various tools, resources, and examples of how other companies have successfully tackled these various pain points, and how to think through implementing your own seamless solution.

speakers.name: Pablo Sabbatella
speakers.description:
Tech entrepreneur, ex hacker. I love technology, security, economy and innovation.
I am dedicated to researching and divulging the crypto and DeFi ecosystem in Latinamerica.
Founded Defy Education in 2021, where we focus in educating and training people and companies across the region, to get them into the ecosystem. We are developing the human resources the industry needs to keep growing and showing companies and governments how Blockchain technology can be used.

title: Challenges to bring DeFi to one million people in Latam
description:
What does DeFi need in order to give solutions to the 30% unbanked in Latin America? What is the role of product managers? What is the role of education? Should the government be involved?
How will we face this challenge? What are we doing from Defy Education nowadays to onboard all this people? Are we looking for users or for builders?
I have been talking about this for a long time and divulging Crypto & DeFi in many events

speakers.name: Surya
speakers.description: Surya has been a blockchain researcher for the past 7 years. He started analysing and visualising Bitcoin transactions in 2015, and Ethereum transactions in 2017, and has been working at Chainalysis since 2017. Surya created the blockchain engineering systems responsible for acquiring new blockchain data and labelling before migrating to Chainalysis Research where he researches advanced data science techniques to apply to blockchain analysis.

title: Visualising Ethereum
description: The Ethereum blockchain is one of the richest public datasets available. By looking at local user networks of various DeFi protocols, we can create a semantic graph to analyse and visualise the global behaviour of the Ethereum network. Various time slices provide insightful visualisations that can be compared against each other telling a story of what on-chain activity was like and how it evolved. ie What did activity look like running up to the 2018 peak? What about running up to the 2021 peak?

speakers.name: Jack O'Holleran
speakers.description:
Graduated from the University of Nebraska, where I was a starting receiver and special teams player for the Cornhuskers football team. I am passionate about blockchain solutions and NFTs. 
I am Co-founder and CEO of Skale Labs, the only Multichain Layer 2 Ethereum Network, working to solve the blockchain scalability problem by facilitating processing between blockchains and decentralized applications. I maintain a strategic advisor role at Aktana which I also co-founded.

title: The shift to a Multichain Web3 Ecosystem
description: Why is Scalability so Critical to Blockchain and Web3 Technology? Fundamentally, scalability in blockchains refers to transaction processing speeds. Two key factors limit Bitcoin‚Äôs scalability: block size and block time. Layer-2 scaling solutions exist to provide the capacity, while Ethereum will continue not as an application layer but serve as a trust layer. In this way, Ethereum may soon be able to declare its scalability problems over once and for all.

speakers.name: roger BELTRAN
speakers.description: INVERSOR EN CRIPTOMONEDAS DESDE HACE 3 A√ëOS,

title: CRYPTOVIAJANDO, VIAJA PAGANDO CON CRIPTOS
description: LAS CRIPTOMONEDAS COMO MEDIO DE PAGO HAN TENIDO UN AVANCE MUY POTENCIAL, ACTUALMENTE MI PROYECTO CRYPTOVIAJANDO POR MEDIO DEL CUAL VIAJO POR TODA COLOMBIA PAGANDO CON CRIPTOMONEDAS COMO ETHERIUM, DAR A CONOCER A LAS PERSONAS QUE HAY PLATAFORMAS EN LAS CUALES PUEDES PAGAR VUELOS CON CRIPTO. ESPERO SEA TENIDO EN CUENTA

speakers.name: Brenda Loya
speakers.description: Co-founder and CEO of Tellor and self taught solidity dev. Previously I was part of Daxia, a decentralized derivatives protocol that lead to the creation of Tellor. Prior to crypto I was an Economist/Supervisory Statistician at the Department of Labor. I led teams to develop statistical software and create and publish Principal Federal Economic Indicators.

title: Best practices for your oracle architecture
description: Best practices for your oracle architecture.  In an instant hacks of financial protocols or misunderstandings of the inner workings of a contract can lead to huge losses with often little recourse. Settlement price or oracle manipulation have been a known issue long before Defi came along. Whether it is traditional products or traders that watched as Crude oil prices went negative in 2021 or yet another Defi hack we can all apply best practices for mitigating these risks. Let‚Äôs build robust Defi

speakers.name: Mihailo Bjelic
speakers.description:
Mihailo is an IT engineer with 10+ years of experience in building technology products and platforms. In pre-crypto life, he founded or co-founded three startups and led multiple teams of various sizes, in two different industries. 

He is active as a researcher (one of the most acknowledged contributors on the Ethresearch platform), mainly focused on scaling solutions and multi-chain paradigms.

title: State of Ethereum Scaling and Infrastructure
description: There are many directions to be pushed to scale out the Ethereum ecosystem, and aggregating multiple scaling solutions together will become the most important strategic approach for scaling and infrastructure development.  It is becoming increasingly clear that there cannot be one solution to rule them all, a suite of scaling products need to be developed in order to bring mass adoption and onboard the first billion users to Ethereum.

speakers.name: Ale Machado
speakers.description: Alejandro is a co-founder of the Open Money Initiative and a product strategist at Bitrefill, the world's most popular site to buy real-world goods and services with cryptocurrency, including being able to pay water and electricity bills in El Salvador. He will talk about his observations on the ground in El Salvador, where the average citizen doesn't have a bank account, but does have a mobile phone, and a better-than-average awareness of bitcoin and its benefits.

title: Living on Ethereum
description: To maximize the real-world utility of the Ethereum network, ether and ERC20 stablecoins must be increasingly used as money. This means being able to pay for goods and services without going through exchanges or banks. This talk will give a short history of the best efforts so far at onboarding merchants, dive into the anthropological reasons why this is a hard problem, and share our learnings on some recent successes on growing the number of crypto consumer purchases.

speakers.name: Martin Derka
speakers.description: Martin is a Senior Research Engineer and the Head of New Initiatives at Quantstamp. He enjoys getting his hands dirty with clients in order to help them solve hard problems, such as mitigating economic manipulations in DeFi. Martin holds a Ph.D in Computer Science from the University of Waterloo. Before Quantstamp, Martin was a startup CTO, software engineer in a big-tech company, and an academic research in graph theory and computational geometry.

title: The Blockchain Bridge That You Dream About

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: In the times where scalability of blockchains depends on multiple layers, and when interoperability holds for an essential blockchain feature, bridges become critical infrastructure parts. They are meant to hold liquidity, asked to operate quickly, but they cannot benefit from the security guarantees of an on-chain application, because they inherently contain off-chain components. In this talk, we discuss the properties of a bridge that is secure and meets all the needs for it to be useful.

speakers.name: Maggie Love
speakers.description:
Maggie Love is Co-founder and Director of Business Development at W3BCLOUD, a is leading compute and storage infrastructure provider powering web 3 protocols. 

Maggie is the Founder of SheFi, which empowers women and non-binary folks to take ownership of their financial freedom through crypto education, experimentation, investing and community. To date, she has onboarded over a 700+ people to web 3.

title: Zero to Node Hero: Run An Independent Validator Node Across Chains

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Zero to node hero workshop: taking someone through every step of provisioning their own RPC and validator nodes. Go from independent 1 server deployments to multi-server deployments in the workshop. Attendees will be able to spin up and manage their own nodes with easy to use open source software.

speakers.name: Sanket Shah
speakers.description: Head of Strategy, Polygon

speakers.name: Mihailo Bjelic
speakers.description:
Tech maximalist. Etherean. Co-founder 
@0xPolygon

title: Crypto Economics : Why it matters?
description:
Crypto economics is the most misunderstood topic in crypto. It's not a number go-up. If done right it has the potential to build sustainable economics around web3, and disrupt traditional ways of working. 
The talk we are proposing is to ensure we can discuss the things that matter while designing tokenomics, the value accrual mechanism for tokens, what to focus on as token designers & learn about it as investors

The Audience for the talk would be crypto-curious folks, investors, researchers

speakers.name: Kathleen Chu
speakers.description: Kathleen is the head of communications at Polygon. She is a communications professional who is passionate about utilizing technology to make the world a better place. In addition to more than a decade in journalism at Bloomberg, Kathleen has expertise in marketing, PR, and blockchain.

title: Why L2 Protocols Are Paramount for Alleviating Ethereum‚Äôs Carbon Emissions Even Beyond the Merge
description: This talk explores and explains different approaches to Ethereum scaling and the importance of the Layer-2 ecosystem in creating a sustainable and environmentally friendly web3 sector.

speakers.name: Thomas Bertani
speakers.description:
Thomas Bertani is a crypto native since 2012, mostly known for being the founder of Provable Things and project lead at pNetwork.

Provable Things powers solutions complementing blockchain technology with Trusted Computing. It backs the longest-running oracle service in the blockchain space as well as pNetwork, a solution enabling cross-chain composability for decentralized applications. 

In 2018 Thomas was nominated by Forbes Italy as one of the top 5 young leaders in financial tech.

title: Cross-Chain for Various Networks. Is it needed?
description: Ethereum as been a catalyst for the growth of new ecosystems, from the DeFi movement to NFTs. This traction triggered multiple L2 scalability solutions to flourish: Polygon, zkSync, Optimism and more as well as cross-chain solutions. Yet, with all these innovation, the Ethereum Ecosystem is still fragmented. This talk explores how pNetwork creates invisible connections between various chains and layered networks alike to empower dApp builders and users across 15 different Blockchain Networks.

speakers.name: Thomas Bertani
speakers.description:
Thomas Bertani is a crypto native since 2012, mostly known for being the founder of Provable Things and project lead at pNetwork.

Provable Things powers solutions complementing blockchain technology with Trusted Computing. It backs the longest-running oracle service in the blockchain space as well as pNetwork, a solution enabling cross-chain composability for decentralized applications. 

In 2018 Thomas was nominated by Forbes Italy as one of the top 5 young leaders in financial tech.

title: Cross-Chain for Various Networks. Is it needed?
description: Ethereum as been a catalyst for the growth of new ecosystems, from the DeFi movement to NFTs. This traction triggered multiple L2 scalability solutions to flourish: Polygon, zkSync, Optimism and more as well as cross-chain solutions. Yet, with all these innovation, the Ethereum Ecosystem is still fragmented. This talk explores how pNetwork creates invisible connections between various chains and layered networks alike to empower dApp builders and users across 15 different Blockchain Networks.

speakers.name: Jawy
speakers.description: Entusiasta de la criptografia, y la seguridad informatica. Cypherpunk, ingeniero en seguridad informatica de profesi√≥n.

title: Auditoria de seguridad en smart contracts y blockchain con herramientas de an√°lisis est√°tico
description: Explicar el uso de herramientas de c√≥digo abierto para hacer auditoria en smartcontract y blockchain, hablar de los procesos de seguridad y ciclo de vida seguro dentro del desarrollo de smartontract.

speakers.name: Cl√©ment Lesaege
speakers.description:
Cl√©ment Lesaege has an engineering degree from University of Technology of Compi√®gne (France) and a Master of Science in Computer Science from Georgia Institute of Technology (US).
He is a founder and CTO of the decentralized court protocol Kleros and a founder of the sybil resistance project Proof of Humanity. He works on crowdsourced and smart contract enforced dispute resolution systems.

title: Proof of Humanity: A Sybil resistant list of humans
description:
[Proof of Humanity](proofofhumanity.id) is a system combining webs of trust, with reverse Turing tests, and Kleros disputes to create a sybil resistant list of humans.
The Sybil resistance it provides is used to provide Universal Basic, detect sybil attacks in gitcoin quadratic funding, make NFTdrops and power a democratic (1 person -> 1 vote) DAO.
In this talk we will discuss the mechanisms used by Proof of Humanity, its challenges, its uses and the proposed improvements.

speakers.name: Pavel Kireyev
speakers.description: Pavel Kireyev teaches about AI x Web3 to MBA, executive, and PhD students at INSEAD and develops ML infrastructure for NFT markets. He led ML projects at QuantCo, helping the company grow to 100+ employees, and designed machine learning-based NFT appraisal models at Upshot, which are now used by projects like Genie.xyz and NFTfi. He wrote about NFTs at the Harvard Business Review and aims to bring Web3 to the mainstream through education and AI x Web3 research and infrastructure development.

title: The Future of Artificial Intelligence in Web3: NFTs, Metaverse Tech, and Decentralized ML
description: AI research has made huge leaps in the past few years, while NFTs and other Ethereum-based technologies have entered the public consciousness. How will these worlds merge over the next 5 years? We discuss AI x Web3 use cases, including NFT market intelligence, search and discovery, creator tools, bots, autonomous marketplaces, and decentralized ML. We offer a survey of existing  tools that dApp devs can use immediately to improve their projects and discuss what we're likely to see in the future.

speakers.name: Jason Lee
speakers.description: Jason is currently the BD and Partnerships Lead for Phantom, one of the most used wallets in the Web3 space. He has been in the space since 2017 and has been exclusively working on wallets and custody products for the entirety of his Web3 career.

title: Phantom- The future of Multi-chain wallets
description: Phantom a highly used wallet plans on going Multi-chain with Ethereum this year. We are a wallet provider focused on usability in a space where the user experience is often sacrificed or overlooked. We are building a first class experience where users can interact with Web3 in a simple and easy way. In this talk we will talk about how we became one of the most used wallets in the space and how we're building out an  Multi-chain experience with best practices that onboards the next billion users.

speakers.name: Doug Petkanics
speakers.description: Doug is Founder and CEO at Livepeer, where he focuses on protocol research and software development. Livepeer is building an open source video infrastructure platform for web3, which leverages decentralization to drive down costs and meet the needs of developers building video streaming applications at scale. Prior to Livepeer, Doug was founder and VP Engineering at Hyperpublic (acquired by Groupon) and Wildcard.

title: Five years of work protocols on Ethereum. What have we learned?
description: While many people know about the countless protocols Ethereum has enabled across crowdfunding, DeFi, and NFTs, there is a lesser known category of work protocols that have leveraged the Ethereum network for over 5 years now to harness idle compute, bandwidth, storage, and human resources to form global utility networks. This talk will highlight the lessons learned across many layers including economic incentives, payments, security, and gas optimization amongst leading work protocols.

speakers.name: Henry de Valence
speakers.description: Henry de Valence is the founder of Penumbra, a fully shielded cross-chain DEX and proof-of-stake network.  Previously, he worked at the Zcash Foundation building Zebra, a modular Zcash fullnode implementation, and at Chain, Inc, building ZK proof infrastructure: Bulletproofs, the Ristretto group, Merlin transcripts, and curve25519-dalek.

title: Penumbra: Building a Private DEX with ZKPs and Threshold Cryptography
description: ZKPs allow transactions to prove their state transition was valid, without revealing anything about what it was.  But this isn't enough, because useful applications require shared state, which ZKPs can't provide.  In this talk, we'll describe how to break this barrier by combining ZKPs with flow encryption, a new threshold crypto primitive, to allow private interaction with public shared state, and how Penumbra uses this technique to build a private DEX.

speakers.name: Christian St.Louis
speakers.description: Cofounder at Component.fi, a decentralized finance R&D firm that specializes in building products and contributing to protocols with a high aptitude for understanding complex data. Previously worked on data problems in ad tech and have two degrees from Queen's University in Math and Data Science.

speakers.name: Mattias Lightstone
speakers.description: Software Engineer at Component Fi

title: Using The Graph and Dune to power on chain actions
description:
Indexing protocols like The Graph and Dune analytics are great for getting insights on application-specific protocols. However, most are used strategic planning rather than being directly actionable. This workshop teaches developers how to make these insights actionable, by building simple programs in 3 steps:

1. Fetching indexed data streams from public data providers
2. Passing streams through models to generate signals
3. Generating and submitting transactions based on those signals

speakers.name: Ken Smith
speakers.description: Ken Smith is the founder of NextBlock Solutions, a blockchain consulting company that provides training and educational services to web3 organizations. Ken is an Ethereum node operator using the RocketPool protocol and a member of the Node Operators Association (@NodeOperators) and has been active in the Ethereum and other blockchain communities since 2014.

speakers.name: Darren Langley
speakers.description: Darren Langley is the General Manager of Rocket Pool. He is passionate about Ethereum and staking. He is dedicated to lowering the barriers-to-entry for Ethereum staking so that everyone can participate.

speakers.name: Mike Leach
speakers.description: Mike is an entrepreneur with a software engineering and business background. In 2019, he founded Bamboo Financial Technologies to provide Ethereum-based investment products, and in 2022 he co-founded the Node Operator Association, an industry group aiming to improve the health of the Ethereum network by promoting decentralization in the burgeoning professional staking industry.

speakers.name: Ariel Zimroni
speakers.description: VP Product @ BloxStaking, developing ssv.network decentralized infrastructure for Ethereum staking.

title: Options for Small and Independent Stakers: Q&A with the Ethereum staking protocols
description: The Node Operator Association presents a roundtable discussion with the various Ethereum staking protocols to discuss opportunities for small staking operations. Discussion will include qualifications,  application processes, costs, risks, and advantages. Join us to learn how small businesses and solo stakers can partner with the various staking protocols to increase revenue.

speakers.name: Faina Shalts
speakers.description: Faina Shalts is a Lead Blockchain Engineer at ConsenSys. Since joining in 2018, she has worked on Truffle‚Äôs open source tool suite. She now leads the Layer 2/Scaling team at Truffle, seeking to make Layer 2 adoption as easy as possible for developers.

title: Layer 2 Developer Tooling: Where We Are and Where We're (Hopefully) Going
description: Overview of the developer tooling ecosystem for Layer 2 development, covering currently available tools as well as providing a look at the Layer 2 development workflow. Concludes with the challenges particular to developing applications on a Layer 2 protocol, and a discussion of current unmet needs. The goal of this talk is to spur discussion and ideation around how developer tooling can grow to bring more developers into Layer 2 protocols.

speakers.name: Pablo Sabbatella
speakers.description:
Tech entrepreneur, ex hacker. I love technology, security, economy and innovation.
I am dedicated to researching and divulging the crypto and DeFi ecosystem in Latinamerica.
Founded Defy Education in 2021, where we focus in educating and training people and companies across the region, to get them into the ecosystem. We are developing the human resources the industry needs to keep growing and showing companies and governments how Blockchain technology can be used.

title: Security and risk mitigation using DeFi
description:
Different kind of risks when using DeFi and how to mitigate them:
- Economic risks
- Infosec risks & hacks
- Smart contract risks

We will see examples of hacks and how to avoid them.

speakers.name: Kenny
speakers.description: Founder of Shell Protocol

title: Using an NFT to build a community and govern a Web 3 protocol
description: Governance tokens are a poor way to build a community. Without a community, it‚Äôs impossible to decentralize a protocol‚Äôs governance. In contrast, NFTs are a great tool to build a community, especially social NFTs such as Crypto Punks. People actually identify with their NFT, even making it their profile picture, whereas no one identifies with their governance tokens. This talk is about how we can use NFTs to build a genuine community around a protocol.

speakers.name: Anomit
speakers.description: Building PowerLoom https://powerloom.io

title: Leveraging Ethereum's decentralized computing with decentralized storage protocols for easy access to audit proofed DeFi data
description:
At present, access to data, insights, analytics on DeFi protocol data and insights are possible only via centralized indexing services APIs, either by paying expensive subscription fees or relying upon a project hosting their version of one of such indexing services that suffer from accuracy, precision and synchronization problems.

Building upon a personal experience of hacakthon solutions along with working on a protocol in the same space, I propose a way to empower meaningful access to data

speakers.name: Jagdeep Sidhu
speakers.description: Jag Sidhu is the CTO of Blockchain Foundry and a co-founder of the Syscoin project, a decentralized cryptocurrency, as well as its current lead developer.

title: Solving the Blockchain Rubik's Cube
description: The Endgame for Blockchain Technology ‚Äì how Syscoin solves the blockchain trilemma; scalability, decentralization and security. Live and untouchable since 2014, Syscoin combines the best of Bitcoin and Ethereum into a single powerful and secure programmable blockchain development platform. Merge-mined with Bitcoin for the Proof of Work Security plus 100% Ethereum-compatible smart contracts with 96% lower transaction fees.

speakers.name: Ken Smith
speakers.description: Ken Smith is the founder of NextBlock Solutions, a blockchain consulting company that provides training and educational services to web3 organizations. Ken is an Ethereum node operator using the RocketPool protocol and a member of the Node Operators Association (@NodeOperators) and has been active in the Ethereum and other blockchain communities since 2014.

title: Does it make sense to aggregate and average feeReceipent rewards using a smoothing pool?
description: This talk presents a statistical model and python code that can be used to model feeRecipient tips using a set of binomial, Gaussian, and Bayesian modeling techniques. We will explore if the ideal of pooling these fees, similar to how POW miners have been pooling their hash power,  makes sense for Ethereum validators.  We will present the results of modeling one such feeReceipent pooling contract to determine if such a model adds value to other validating Ethereum Node operators.

speakers.name: Keith Salzman
speakers.description: Zero Knowledge Developer

title: The Baseline Protocol - Solving secure multi-Enterprise coordination with blockchain
description: The Baseline Protocol is an open-source initiative that combines advances in cryptography (ZKPs), messaging, and consensus-controlled state machines (DLTs) to deliver secure and private business processes, event ordering, data consistency, and workflow integrity at low cost. The Baseline Protocol provides a tech-agnostic framework that establishes a common frame of reference, enabling confidential and complex collaborations between enterprises without sensitive data transmission in any form.

speakers.name: Yale ReiSoleil
speakers.description:
Having worked in investment and trading management for 25 years, I have learned that the biggest challenges in trading are not fundamentals vs. technicals.

In 2016, I became interested in cryptos when I realized the current financial system is designed to make people lose money. Last year, I started figuring out how technologies like NFT could help creators and all traders break the win-lose zero-sum cycle.

title: EIP-5173: NFT Future Rewards (nFR) standard for non-zero-sum trading

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
EIP-5173 creates a **giving circle** in trading practice among the creators, buyers and sellers. With the on-chain royalty & Future Rewards Payments to a chain of ownership, each buyer and seller pays it forward by giving some to get more in the end.

1) **Selling doesn't stop your earning:** Still earn more after selling by participating in a chain of ownership the Future Rewards (FR) framework.

2) **Pay less:** No profit in a trade, pay no fees.

3)**End the zero-sum game.**

speakers.name: Mudit Gupta
speakers.description: Mudit is the Chief Information Security Officer at Polygon. He's a security researcher by the day and an ethereum developer by the night.

title: Securing bridges
description: I have categorized various bridges into three categories with distinct features and security properties. The talk will explain the security model used by these different category of bridges and discuss how bridges can be made more secure.

speakers.name: Mudit Gupta
speakers.description: Mudit is the Chief Information Security Officer at Polygon. He's a security researcher by the day and an ethereum developer by the night.

title: Security beyond smart contract audits
description: Most of the DeFi protocols now get audits done for their smart contract but they don't realize that there are other attack vectors as well that they should be securing themselves against. This talk discussed things other than smart contract audits that every company should do to keep them and their users safe.

speakers.name: Althea Allen
speakers.description: Head of comms for Privacy and Scaling Explorations, an Ethereum Foundation-supported team.

title: Participant Experience Design
description: User experience design is traditionally focused on driving user engagement and behaviors that serve business goals. How do goals and processes change when designing for commons or public goods? How does conventional design wisdom help us, and when can it lead us astray? What new patterns, strategies or challenges emerge when we consider the user as a participant rather than a customer?

speakers.name: Praneeth
speakers.description: Investment Partner @ Ethereal Ventures

title: The nature of game playing in a digital utopia
description: Inspired by the account of 'The Grasshopper' by Bernard Suits (wherein there is a broader philosophical discussion of what it means to play a game, and how game playing is the ultimate goal of a utopia), the discussion would be centred on how this analogy might hold water (in a slightly different way) around a digital utopia with not just humans but other sw-enabled agents (especially ones that could function ina  closed loop manner).

speakers.name: Douglas Horn
speakers.description:
Douglas is the founder and CEO of GoodBlock, architect and whitepaper author of the Telos Network, and leader of the Telos Core Developers.

Today, Douglas focuses on creating foundational Web3 tools to empower individuals to work together effectively in trustless ways beyond traditional governance structures to better fight back against the rising risks of authoritarianism and ecological collapse.

title: Empowering Governance with the Decide engine: A Field Report from an On-Chain Board Election.
description: Governance, as Douglas Horn puts it, has not seen technological innovation in centuries. But he knows that the transparency and efficiency of blockchain technology can be harnessed to change the course of elections as we know them - and allow DAOs to truly function as intended. He spearheaded the development of the Decide Voter app this past year - a powerful tool that allows anyone to access efficient, transparent, and independently verifiable elections and votes.

speakers.name: Jess Hawkins
speakers.description: Jess does applied math at Cowri Labs, the team behind Shell Protocol. She is also a doctor completing her anesthesiology residency.

title: How to talk to your kids about bonding curves
description: This is a layperson‚Äôs introduction to the use, design and technical architecture of bonding curves. I discuss why and how bonding curves are used and their relationship to liquidity concentration in a liquidity pool. I cover strengths and limitations of traditional bonding curve shapes to help beginners get an intuition for AMMs. I then touch on some of the novel approaches to bonding curves (Uniswap v3) and conclude by introducing the Proteus AMM (from Shell v2) to design custom bonding curves.

speakers.name: Juan Pablo Ramirez
speakers.description:
Juan Pablo Ram√≠rez is Blockchain & Crypto Lead at Bancolombia and supports the blockchain strategy for Grupo Bancolombia and all the banks where the group has a presence.
 
He has more than 14 years of professional experience, 11 of them in the financial sector and, specifically, more than 6 years in the blockchain and crypto world. He is curious, experimental and results-oriented, highlighting them as his main attributes.

speakers.name: Luis Miguel Arroyave
speakers.description: Used to be lawyer of the biggest financial institution in Colombia, but after investing, researching and participating in DAOS for years, the blockchain technology and digital asset economy seduced me enough to get a full time job as a blockchain bussines and strategy analyst.

title: Programmable money, interoperable, and without borders as new horizon of financial services
description: The tokenization of money represents a much greater opportunity than that safeguarding traditional value, since by giving FIAT money the same characteristics as those that Erc-20 token has, a large number of use cases can be developed, benefiting both the crypto native economy and the economy in general, since programmability, auditability, and interoperability are the basis for the generation of a new financial system that is more transparent, innovative, interoperable and accessible.

speakers.name: Rosco Kalis
speakers.description: I am a software engineer that has worked in crypto for the past 5 years. In that time I created multiple developer tools as well as revoke.cash

title: Why security is a UX problem
description:
Since crypto grew more mainstream on the past years, scams have been on the rise as well. Protecting users, especially newcomers is incredibly important if we want to grow crypto in the years to come.

But a big reason why these newcomers fall for scams is that they don't know what they are doing. One part of solving that problem is education, but another, more sustainable solution is to make sure that users understand what they're doing without needing significant education.

speakers.name: Puncar
speakers.description:
Governance enthusiast, core contributor at GitcoinDAO, co-founder of Governance House, recognized delegate on MakerDAO, co-founder of Bankless Consulting, and previously ran a meta governance and protocol ambassador program at Index Coop.
Leading preparation of How-to-DAO book in cooperation with web3 thought leaders

title: Why dictatorship always win!?
description:
A workshop will demonstrate why decentralized governance is inefficient and would have no chance compared to dictatorship in terms of efficiency. 

It will be a practical workshop where multiple groups will be assigned different governance structures but with the same goal. And after 15-20 minutes, we will compare the results. 

Last 10-15 minutes, we will discuss where the tradeoff is worth it and decentralization is welcome.

speakers.name: Ece Belgin
speakers.description:
As a female blockchain developer and community leader, Ece Belgin has been organizing pieces of training and she is building communities about cryptocurrencies and blockchain since 2017.

She is the founder of ETHIstanbul and organizes meetups and seminars at institutions such as Boƒüazici University and gives lectures about blockchain and Ethereum for beginners and advanced level participants.

title: Ethereum in Developing Countries
description: As a female blockchain developer and early cryptocurrency investor from Turkey; I will convey the answers to the questions of what is the perspective on cryptocurrencies (mostly Ethereum) in developing countries, especially in the Middle East; how interested are the administrations in blockchain developments, and what opportunities are offered to those who want to improve themselves, with comprehensive research and a quick and entertaining presentation.

speakers.name: Boris Spremo
speakers.description:
Boris is working to bring Web3 into mainstream: products for NFTs in real life, Metaverse, and games. 

He led operations and partnerships at Fayre Labs and Boson Protocol,   where he outlined Web3 ecosystems for commerce, and built Portal, a Metaverse experience for brands to sell physical products as NFTs. Before, he co-founded Trustology, a custody project, and led blockchain innovation at BNY Mellon.

Advisory roles include gaming guilds, ESG startups, and mentorships at Outlier Ventures

title: Ethereum ecosystem and open economies of tomorrow

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
For the past 25 years, we have relied on opaque digital platforms to provide market infrastructure for finance, commerce, and more. 

With the widespread adoption of Web3 on the horizon, we are now able to reframe how we buy and sell products and services. 

Web3 applications form organic ecosystems (ReFi, DeSci, dCommerce), transparent, codified, verifiable, to remove information asymmetries between market participants, and form a public (goods) infrastructure for new, efficient economies.

speakers.name: Annie Pei
speakers.description: Annie Pei is a Digital Account Director with Ditto PR, a PR and digital agency that specializes in representing Web3 and emerging tech clients. Her background as a senior producer at NowThis, combined with her production experience at broadcast/digital news outlets like MSNBC and CNBC, have led her to pursue social media strategy full-time in emerging tech spaces.

title: When Web3 on Bitcoin?: Featuring members of the Stacks Ecosystem: Hiro, ALEX, the Stacks Foundation and Trust Machines
description: While Bitcoin is the world‚Äôs most profitable and oldest blockchain, Bitcoin supporters are continually hit with the same criticism ‚Äì you can‚Äôt build on Bitcoin. Enter Stacks, the fully decentralized Layer 1 blockchain that connects directly to Bitcoin via its PoX consensus mechanism and makes the world‚Äôs original blockchain programmable. With the help of Clarity, Stacks‚Äô smart contract language, devs can build anything from DeFi that leverages the capital locked in Bitcoin to Bitcoin NFTs.

speakers.name: Kenny
speakers.description: Founder of Shell Protocol

speakers.name: Aleeza Howitt
speakers.description: Aleeza leads business development at Cowri Labs, the creators of Shell Protocol. She enjoys exploring the crypto ecosystem and helping projects integrate with Shell v2. She is also a co-creator of several indie crypto projects, a board member of the U.S. Basic Income Guarantee Network, and a Ronin Institute Scholar. Her background is at the intersection of alternative currencies, universal basic income, and decentralized systems.

title: Defining DeFi Primitives
description: People often talk about the idea of ‚Äúmoney legos'' but is there any consensus on how to define a DeFi primitive? We will share our definition of a financial primitive, both philosophically and with an example (a Solidity interface). We then open up the discussion to audience participation, to freely discuss ideas about how to define financial primitives in DeFi, followed by a brainstorming session in which we try to break down some popular DeFi tools or protocols into smaller logical components.

speakers.name: Sreeram Kannan
speakers.description: Sreeram Kannan is Founder of Layr Labs, which is building EigenLayer and an associate professor at the Department of Electrical & Computer Engineering at the University of Washington, Seattle, where he leads the UW Blockchain Lab. He was a postdoctoral scholar at University of California, Berkeley and a visiting postdoc at Stanford between 2012-2014 before which he received his Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering and M.S. in mathematics from the University of Illinois Urbana Champaign.

title: EigenLayer: Permissionless feature addition to Ethereum
description: We propose EigenLayer, a re-staking collective for Ethereum. EigenLayer is a set of smart-contract, that allows consensus layer stakers to grant smart-contracts the ability to impose additional slashing conditions on their staked ETH, thus allowing the extension of cryptoeconomic security to new services. EigenLayer can become a staging network where ETH features like Danksharding and PBS can be tested in live production before becoming integrated into core ethereum.

speakers.name: Mateusz Rzeszowski
speakers.description: https://www.linkedin.com/in/matrzeszowski/

title: Reputation- and identity-based governance for DAOs
description: We need to rethink existing governance models and balance them with overlooked models from political philosophy. We need to create sybil resistance and foster meritocracy instead of defaulting to plutocracies in the DAO model.

speakers.name: Annie Pei
speakers.description: Annie Pei is a Digital Account Director with Ditto PR, a PR and digital agency that specializes in representing Web3 and emerging tech clients. Her background as a senior producer at NowThis, combined with her production experience at broadcast/digital news outlets like MSNBC and CNBC, have led her to pursue social media strategy full-time in emerging tech spaces.

title: How to build an L2! A Scaling Solution for Building on Blockchains
description: Stacks has become the biggest and fastest-growing Web3 project that is built on Bitcoin within a year of mainnet launch. But rapid growth brings scalability problems. That‚Äôs why earlier this year, Hiro introduced hyperchains: An open-source solution designed to manage the high throughput workload of the rapidly growing Stacks ecosystem. Hiro‚Äôs head of engineering, Sarala B., breaks down all that is possible with the upcoming scalability layer.

speakers.name: Ryan Boder
speakers.description: Someone at API3.

title: The Blockchain API Problem
description: Blockchain oracles are among the most crucial infrastructure for the decentralized web but they're often overlooked in day to day conversation in favor of more directly user-facing topics such as layer 1's, layer 2's, DeFi protocols, and NFTs. Here we'll discuss the blockchain oracle problem, why it matters, why it hasn't been solved yet, and how to approach it more practically by focusing on APIs and first-party oracles.

speakers.name: Annie Pei
speakers.description: Annie Pei is a Digital Account Director with Ditto PR, a PR and digital agency that specializes in representing Web3 and emerging tech clients. Her background as a senior producer at NowThis, combined with her production experience at broadcast/digital news outlets like MSNBC and CNBC, have led her to pursue social media strategy full-time in emerging tech spaces.

title: Building with Clarity ‚Äì An Introduction to the Human Readable Smart Contracts Language
description: While many developers are familiar with languages such as Solidity and Substrate, Stacks runs on  the smart language known as Clarity. Former Consensys employee turned Hiro Community Manager Joe Bender chose to leave the Ethereum ecosystem in favor of Stacks largely because of the advantages Clarity holds over other smart contract languages. Clarity is predictable, decidable, human readable and gives insight into the Bitcoin blockchain ‚Äì the fundamental layer on which web3 will be built.

speakers.name: Sai Krishna

title: Making dApps delightful
description: The successful deployment of Ethereum scalability solutions, such as Polygon, has substantially accelerated the adoption curve for blockchain & Web3 apps. However, all of these apps suffer 1 crippling problem: they look intimidating and impossible to use, by 99% of the world a.k.a the next 100 million crypto users. For a new technology to succeed and achieve mass adoption, it needs to improve upon the existing status quo and avoid inconveniencing its user base. This is where good design comes in

speakers.name: Jouni Helminen
speakers.description: Jouni is currently Director of Design at Aave, working with a team of talented designers and engineers on Aave, Lens Protocol and more. He has worked on design for over 20 years - focusing on open source and decentralisation on projects like Enzyme Finance, Aragon, Matrix.org, Ubuntu/Canonical. His passion is crafting exciting, fun and easy to use software that makes use of step changes in technology to give value and enjoyment to many levels of users across the world.

title: Lens Protocol - UX of Decentralised Social Media
description: Having a portable, shared social graph and p2p value transfer between users (instead of ad driven mechanics and walled gardens) offers interesting, fresh possibilities for creators, users and devs. We would like to share experiences designing and building Lens Protocol - from protocol design to innovative UX patterns in an upcoming app to help with mainstream adoption. Also - how to easily add shared social features to your own app!

speakers.name: Aleeza Howitt
speakers.description: Aleeza leads business development at Cowri Labs, the creators of Shell Protocol. She enjoys exploring the crypto ecosystem and helping projects integrate with Shell v2. She is also a co-creator of several indie crypto projects, a board member of the U.S. Basic Income Guarantee Network, and a Ronin Institute Scholar. Her background is at the intersection of alternative currencies, universal basic income, and decentralized systems.

title: Composability Is A Commons: Shell Protocol v2
description: DeFiers often appeal to the ‚Äúmoney legos‚Äù analogy. But the vision assumes DeFi primitives are composable with each other, which they often aren't! How do we design composability into DeFi architecture at the smart contract level? In this talk, I discuss why composability is a commons and why that‚Äôs important to consider as builders. I‚Äôll give a brief history of DeFi standards/protocols and show why their evolution led to enclosure and inefficiencies, and then discuss our approach with Shell v2.

speakers.name: Sreeram Kannan
speakers.description: Sreeram Kannan is Founder of Layr Labs, which is building EigenLayer and an associate professor at the Department of Electrical & Computer Engineering at the University of Washington, Seattle, where he leads the UW Blockchain Lab. He was a postdoctoral scholar at University of California, Berkeley and a visiting postdoc at Stanford between 2012-2014 before which he received his Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering and M.S. in mathematics from the University of Illinois Urbana Champaign.

title: Hyperscaling Data Availability for Ethereum Rollups
description: We propose EigenSpace, a hyperscale data-availability solution, which maximizes the rate at which rollup data can be committed onto Ethereum. EigenSpace can achieve the optimal commitment rate of ~1GB/s with 10,000 nodes having 0.2MB/s connections, thus eliminating any tradeoff between scaling and decentralization. EigenSpace builds upon Danksharding, and uses Ethereum re-staking to provide cryptoeconomic security, while being highly customizable for each rollup.

speakers.name: Delroy Bosco
speakers.description:
Lead, Decentralization & Governance at Polygon (Previously Matic Network)
A Product Manager with over 10 years of experience in Product Management and Development with additional experience in Marketing, Content, and Recruiting.

title: Staking & decentralization
description: PoS ecosystems are currently dominated by Retail entrees where they solidify position on the network and centralize the network. The discussion would address the decentralization of stake which is currently a problem on most of the networks.

speakers.name: Carolina Pinzon
speakers.description: Carolina is a Senior Frontend Developer at Shopify. She is part of the Blockchain team, where she combines her passion for Frontend development and decentralized applications. Originally from Colombia, Carolina is currently living in Vancouver, Canada.

title: The challenges and learnings of implementing wallet connection on Mobile
description: Web3 is mostly a desktop experience, but we spend most of our time on mobile devices. How can we bridge the gap between Dapps and Mobile, especially in such a crucial step as the wallet connection? In this talk, we want to share the failures and learnings we had while developing GM Shop, the first tokengated experience built for mobile that partnered with the biggest NFT brands such as Doodles, Invisible Friends, and Cool Cats.

speakers.name: Marcel Jackisch
speakers.description: Lead Protocol Engineer @ Toucan

title: Building cross-chain ReFi applications
description:
Toucan Protocol is building cross-chain ReFi applications based on message bridges that go beyond token bridges. 

In this workshop, we would like to show you how message bridges can be utilized to send messages from one L1 or L2 to another. 

If you want to build something with tokenized carbon, we show you how our SDK in combination with message bridges can be used to let your project join the collective fight against climate change.

speakers.name: Mihailo Bjelic
speakers.description:
Tech maximalist. Etherean. Co-founder 
@0xPolygon

title: State of Ethereum Scaling and Infrastructure
description: There are many directions to be pushed to scale out the Ethereum ecosystem, and aggregating multiple scaling solutions together will become the most important strategic approach for scaling and infrastructure development.  It is becoming increasingly clear that there cannot be one solution to rule them all, a suite of scaling products need to be developed in order to bring mass adoption and onboard the first billion users to Ethereum.

speakers.name: Omar Syed
speakers.description: Omar Syed is a blockchain architect who organized the Shardus project in 2017 to build a linearly scalable blockchain. Over the past three decades, Omar has been involved with helping large organizations such as NASA, Yahoo, and Zynga build scalable, fault-tolerant, distributed systems. Omar holds a B.S. and M.S. from Case Western Reserve University with a specialization in Artificial Intelligence.

title: Solving Blockchain‚Äôs Scalability Trilemma with Dynamic State Sharding
description: Omar Syed and Nischal Shetty, Co-Founders of Shardeum ‚Äì a EVM layer-1 protocol, can elaborate on how sharding has proven to be more efficient for scaling blockchains and discuss how Shardeum offers developers a linearly scalable protocol to develop dApps in Solidity or Vyper on the Shardeum blockchain. Shardeum offers low gas fees forever, linear scalability, cross shard composability, low latency, immediate finality, and secured auto-scaling for developers by utilizing dynamic state sharding.

speakers.name: Aqeel
speakers.description: Aqeel Mohammad is a Product Strategist, and Design specialist focused on leading market adoption and consistent user experiences across Web 3. He has extensive experience leading human centered design organizations with a focus on strategy, product definition, and business transformation. Notable projects include leading design and product efforts for the Lighthouse and Nimbus consensus clients along with community development efforts including Devcon, Devconnect, and Web3 UX Unconference.

title: Can't Someone else do it!? ‚Äî Shifting behaviors in Ethereum network participation
description: Decentralization is touted to be at the core of the Ethereum ecosystem and community. Yet we continue to operate in a world of end users trained and programmed not to think about any of the infrastructure services they use, how they run, how secure they are, and how they are managed. The community continues to operate with the mantra of Web 2.0 where someone else can handle it. It is up to us to help shift user behaviors and mental models around what it takes to truly participate in the network.

speakers.name: Matt Ober
speakers.description: Matt Ober is the co-founder and CTO of Pinata Technologies, Inc. In 2018, he and co-founder, Kyle Tut, launched Pinata after discovering the need for a tool they could use themselves. Pinata is the home for NFT media, serving hundreds of thousands of users worldwide. Matt is based in Omaha, NE and would hire his dog if he legally could.

title: Picking The Right Decentralized Data Experience
description: Storing and serving DApp data isn‚Äôt just an engineering decision, it‚Äôs a UX decision. In this talk we‚Äôll discuss common decentralized storage solutions and the key things you need to consider when choosing the right ‚ÄúD-Storage‚Äù option for your DApp

speakers.name: Cairo Smith
speakers.description: Cairo Smith is the CMO for Cowri Labs, building Shell Protocol on Arbitrum. He is a marketer, writer, and director with an extensive background in transmedia and experiential design. He started his career at Niantic Labs, building the technology and social experience which would eventually become Pok√©mon GO. He is based in Los Angeles, but can frequently be found at Cowri Labs headquarters in Hawaii.

title: Traders of the Lost ARG: Building web3 community at the edges of fact and fantasy
description: Cairo Smith (Shell Protocol, formerly Niantic Labs) will discuss his past building alternate reality and war games with the intelligence community, and the ways he has applied that experience to turn the Shell Protocol userbase into a passionate, living entity. He‚Äôll share insight into what makes an unforgettable transmedia user experience, and how to turn a user into a die-hard protocol advocate.

speakers.name: Matt Ober
speakers.description: Matt Ober is the co-founder and CTO of Pinata Technologies, Inc. In 2018, he and co-founder, Kyle Tut, launched Pinata after discovering the need for a tool they could use themselves. Pinata is the home for NFT media, serving hundreds of thousands of users worldwide. Matt is based in Omaha, NE and would hire his dog if he legally could.

title: Bring your off-chain data back to the blockchain with CIDs
description: Ethereum is an incredible tool for securing data, but gas costs and block limits often lead to data moving off-chain. But applications and users still need to be able to trust off-chain data. In this talk we‚Äôll discuss how content-addressable storage can be used to create powerful blockchain applications that don‚Äôt sacrifice data integrity.

speakers.name: Jennifer Sanasie
speakers.description:
Jenn Sanasie is a content director for Windranger Labs, a product lab that is a core contributor to BitDAO, the world‚Äôs largest token-governed treasury with billions in assets and a mission to support the builders of Web3.

Prior to joining Windranger Labs, Jenn worked as an on-camera journalist and commentator at CoinDesk where she regularly covered NFT and metaverse news. She has more than a decade of experience in front of and behind the camera, and is a co-founder of Streambed Media.

title: Experimentation Pay Offs: How Governance & Authentic Community Contributes to the Success of a DAO
description: The idea of governance mining or similar attempt to create extrinsic reward systems to attract high-value participation in DAOs have had varying results. However, we shouldn't stop experimenting with new tools and ideas, and ways to community properly with members. Join this session to learn about the most difficult aspect of incentivizing governance, when and what part of the governance process you should focus on and optimize at any given time, and how to activate high-impact contributors.

speakers.name: Pat Sissons
speakers.description: I am a staff front end developer at Shopify on the blockchain team.

title: Standard Commerce Gates: Building a new system agnostic protocol for gating the buyer journey
description: We see token gated commerce as an emergent pattern for merchants to connect wallet enabled buyer communities to merchandise (exclusive or not). Standard gates allow merchants to control access to merchandise through gate configuration and merchandise binding. Any gate authored by any system should be processable on any other system, allowing buyers to seamlessly pass through merchandise gates across system boundaries. Let's talk about how we can build this protocol.

speakers.name: Jon Allen
speakers.description: Jon Allen is a managing partner at Mirana Ventures, and core contributor to BitDAO. He also co-founded Blockchain at Berkeley, San Francisco Blockchain Week, and Dekrypt Capital. Jon has extensive experience working with enterprise clients, large consulting firms, and has contributed to 30 ICOs. His time is split between Mirana Ventures and growing the BitDAO ecosystem. At BitDAO, Jon‚Äôs involved in the building of Game7, EduDAO, ZKDAO, and helped form the recent partnership with PleasrDAO.

title: Better Governance for DAOs: Nuanced Voting and Membership NFTs
description: In many parts of the world, society votes by secret ballots (take elections for example); however, DAOs present a new way to spearhead transparent participation. Blockchain projects and DAOs have often defaulted to the view of $1 = 1 token = 1 vote, but this isn‚Äôt ideal. To avoid doxxing the entire payroll of a DAO, new models of NFT membership and governance models act as an engagement solution within DAOs.

speakers.name: Katya Michaels
speakers.description: Community and Content Lead at MEW (MyEtherWallet)

title: Who trusts the trustless? Reducing the technical barrier for decentralized, non-custodial adoption.
description: How do we reconcile the goals of wider adoption with ideals of decentralization and self-custody? Who are we talking to when we advise users to 'review the smart contract'? Do we remain technologically elitist while we claim to democratize finance and reduce barriers to entry? Beyond optimizing UI, we need to think deeply about making the kind of DeFi that can truly make a difference more understandable and appealing to people who will never read code, audit contracts, or submit github requests.

speakers.name: Jon Allen
speakers.description: Jon Allen is a managing partner at Mirana Ventures, and core contributor to BitDAO. He also co-founded Blockchain at Berkeley, San Francisco Blockchain Week, and Dekrypt Capital. Jon has extensive experience working with enterprise clients, large consulting firms, and has contributed to 30 ICOs. His time is split between Mirana Ventures and growing the BitDAO ecosystem. At BitDAO, Jon‚Äôs involved in the building of Game7, EduDAO, ZKDAO, and helped form the recent partnership with PleasrDAO.

title: The Way Forward for DAOs: Structuring a Sustainable Collective
description: Shown through many instances where large corporations, dictatorships, and powerful people monopolize power, governance in today‚Äôs society often does not do its members justice. DAOs present a solution to this; however, many face startup and operational challenges when coordinating their members. This panel discusses how to optimize for a sustainable DAO including the ideal tooling and governance framework.

speakers.name: Paulo Morocho
speakers.description:
Website:
https://allmedgroup.org/dr-ab-paulo-cesar-morocho-escandon/
CV:
https://allmedgroup.org/paulo_morocho_-_chairman__ceo/

title: Do not list tokens on exchanges

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: One of the actions that most harms projects is launching tokens on exchanges, this makes them part of the volatile market. Although at first they feel benefited, after a short time they become prey to trading and these destroy the projects. I have developed two summer and sun protocols to combat these misguided project practices.

speakers.name: Justin Glibert
speakers.description: cyberspace vintner and digital physicist.

title: MUD: The fabric of Autonomous Worlds

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
0xPARC Autonomous World's division has been working on MUD: a framework to build Autonomous Worlds on top of Ethereum.
MUD solves the hard problems we have encountered building on-chain games: Dark Forest, zkDungeon, Ember, and more. MUD can be thought of as an operating system on top of the EVM: it is a set of software running next to full-nodes, in a game client, on the EVM, and in zkSnarks that enables rapid development of on-chain games.

speakers.name: Rachel
speakers.description: Design strategy for Privacy & Scaling Explorations

title: Designing public goods using ZKPs
description: In this talk, designers reflect on the common threads that run through a constellation of tools and applications built with ZKPs. We share mental models being explored and strategies for fluidly navigating an evolving space. By offering real examples from our design workshops and dApps, we will explore the question ‚Äì How might we materialize abstract concepts to enable internal and external teams to build with ZKPs?

speakers.name: Alejandro Mu√±oz
speakers.description: I'll share my full bio if I get selected. Thanks in advance!

title: Tour of Common Smart Contract Vulnerabilities

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
We will discuss the common pitfalls in the web3 space covering the DAPP and smart contract vulnerabilities drawing from bugs submitted and paid out through Immunefi.

The presentation will include in-depth analysis of critical vulnerabilities such as the Wormhole $10M record-breaking bug bounty, Chainlink, and the Polygon bug that rendered $19B worth of Matic vulnerable.

speakers.name: Tatiana
speakers.description: Tatiana is a blockchain lawyer turned blockchain developer. She moved into blockchain industry and was introduced to Ethereum blockchain in 2017. Since then she is an active member of blockchain communities. She is PhD candidate in Computer Science at the University of Oxford and serial entrepreneur. In 2022 Tatiana was featured in European Forbes 30 under 30 list in technology sector.

title: NFT Your Source Code

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Making your code open source became a mainstream in software development. The community can find your vulnerabilities and advise on best software development practices. Despite all the  advantages of open source code, there are many disadvantages such as violation of your copyrights and unauthorised use. In this talk experienced blockchain developer and lawyer will shed a light on how to protect your software copyright with NFT licence.

speakers.name: Justin Glibert
speakers.description: cyberspace vintner and digital physicist.

title: MUD Workshop
description:
0xPARC Autonomous World's division has been working on MUD: a framework to build Autonomous Worlds on top of Ethereum.
MUD solves the hard problems we have encountered building on-chain games: Dark Forest, zkDungeon, Ember, and more. MUD can be thought of as an operating system on top of the EVM: it is a set of software running next to full-nodes, in a game client, on the EVM, and in zkSnarks that enables rapid development of on-chain games.

speakers.name: Justin Glibert
speakers.description: cyberspace vintner and digital physicist.

title: Digital Physics
description: Digital Physics is the idea that adding "force" -- the ability to impose one's will onto others -- at the core of a protocol might be desirable. All block-chain systems today treat absolute private property as something un-negotiable. I argue that private property is not an axiomatic property of our universe. Building "autonomous universal state machines" that are inclusive to all agents -- aliens, gods, machines -- must use a state transition function that stems from our shared context: physics

speakers.name: Martinet Lee
speakers.description: Martinet is Head of Developer Relations at Quantstamp, the leader in blockchain security. Martinet is well versed in DeFi and NFTs, audited Yearn, and was selected as an ETHGlobal finalist for developing Godmode. In his pursuit to use tech to bring equality to humanity, Martinet founded PaperPlane, a nonprofit helping teachers prepare for computer science education in Taiwan and cofounded Papacode, a board game project that teaches kids programming, especially to those in poverty.

title: Security Considerations for Randomness After the Merge
description: Randomness is a crucial element in dApp development. Besides oracles, `BLOCKHASH` were often used before to introduce entropy into the contract execution. Switching from PoW to PoS, the merge weakens the randomness of `BLOCKHASH` but also introduces `EIP-4399`, which brings `PREVRANDAO` into the EVM and provides a native pseudorandomness from the beacon chain. The talk will provide insight on how to securely use the source of randomness and point out insecure design patterns using `BLOCKCHASH` o

speakers.name: Justin Glibert
speakers.description: cyberspace vintner and digital physicist.

title: Dark Forest Panel
description: Dark Forest is a popular on-chain game built over the last two years by different -- and sometimes un-coordinated! -- groups of developers and creatives. We are bringing some of the most active contributors to cover the history of the project, the latest development, the impact it has had on the Ethereum community, and more.

speakers.name: Yi Sun
speakers.description: ZKP enthusiast and open-source developer of ZK circuits for various crypto primitives (ECDSA, elliptic curve pairings).

title: zkAttestor: Block and State Attestations on Ethereum
description: zkAttestor produces trustless zkSNARK-based on-chain attestations to data from any Ethereum state or block, trustlessly verified on-chain in a smart contract which caches historical block hashes. Use cases include identity, dapp primitives involving history, and on-chain reputation.

speakers.name: Yi Sun
speakers.description: ZKP enthusiast and open-source developer of ZK circuits for various crypto primitives (ECDSA, elliptic curve pairings).

title: ZK Circuits for Non-native Elliptic Curve Arithmetic
description: We present ZK circuit implementations of elliptic curve arithmetic and pairings over a non-native field.  We also discuss applications to ECDSA signature verification, BLS signature verification, and recursive verification of Groth16 proofs.

speakers.name: Chris Dammeyer
speakers.description: Chris Dammeyer / @cdammr / cdammr.eth is a Senior Product Designer at digital design agency MetaLab based in Victoria, Canada. He's also the Design Director for Refraction DAO, which aims to democratize value between new media artists and events, and he's a Resident Artist with Vertical Crypto Art.

title: Designing for Emerging Technology
description: How do you design for a product or market that doesn't exist yet? As a senior designer at MetaLab, a digital product agency, we've been fortunate to work with some of the larger centralized players in the space including Coinbase and DapperLabs. Many of these clients had yet to have a market let alone a client base when they came to us ‚Äî and over the years we've developed a number of design principles when tackling emergent technology which I'd like to share over the course of this presentation.

speakers.name: Chris Whinfrey
speakers.description:
Co-founder of Hop Protocol
Creator of Hop and author of the Hop Whitepaper: https://hop.exchange/whitepaper.pdf
Previously co-founder of Authereum and Level K
Audited Open Zeppelin, dYdX, Augur, Decentraland, and more
Started the first Ethereum meetup in Boston

title: How Cross-rollup Limitations Will Shape Ethereum
description:
As users move to Ethereum‚Äôs diverse rollup ecosystem, the limitations of data and value bridges will impact where projects choose to deploy, where liquidity is concentrated, and where users choose to congregate.

We‚Äôll cover different approaches to cross-layer-2 communication and value transfer from a first-principles standpoint. Then we'll dive into how these trade-offs will shape where users, liquidity, and applications are concentrated and what this means for Ethereum's layer-2 UX.

speakers.name: Lakshman
speakers.description: Previous Ethereum Foundation Research. Now building ZKP-apps at 0xPARC.

title: ZK Identity
description:
One of more exciting new areas in the world of ZKP-applications is identity. How will ZKPs + ledgers like Ethereum change the way humans can express themselves in the coming years?

In this talk, we'll go over a bunch of the exciting work to emerge from the 0xPARC ecosystem in the past year, including apps like cabal.xyz, heyanon.xyz.

speakers.name: gubsheep
speakers.description: gubsheep is the creator of Dark Forest and runs applied ZK research and development at 0xPARC.

title: 0xPARC's vision for ZK: "Programmable Cryptography"

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Historically, cryptographic protocols have been built special-purpose for specific kinds of claims or information hiding mechanisms. zkSNARKs and other new cryptographic tools move us to a world of "general-purpose" cryptography, where we have expressive languages to express claims about digital identity, reputation, and more. We discuss a high-level framework for thinking about where and why ZK might (or might not) be useful for digital applications.

speakers.name: Ben Jones
speakers.description: Ben is Chief Scientist and Musician at the Optimism Foundation.

title: Fixing the Internet with Layer 2 Governance
description:
Web3 opens the door to a new cyberspace‚Äîone not only occupied, but governed, by its citizens.

[The Optimism Collective](http://optimism.io/vision) is our attempt to correct meatspace's market failures with an L2.

But this talk isn't on scaling. It's about...

...the past: why Ethereum is not an opportunity, but a responsibility.

...the present: what we're doing to take this seriously & how it impacts our governance designs.

...the future: the path towards summoning Ether's Phoenix.

speakers.name: Dan van der Merwe
speakers.description: Co-founder of icy.tools, a NFT analytics platform acquired by QuickNode. Now leading the Developer Experience team at QuickNode, aiming to make it easier to build web3 products.

title: Building powerful automations with QuickNode and icy.tools alerts
description: Learn how to harness powerful QuickNode alerts to build any web3 automation you can think of. We will also combine the alerts with QuickNode and icy.tools APIs to show how easy it is to fetch EVM data with these tools.

speakers.name: gubsheep
speakers.description: gubsheep is the creator of Dark Forest and runs applied ZK research and development at 0xPARC.

title: Dark Forest: Lessons from 3 Years of On-Chain Gaming

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: We'll present an overview of learnings from 3 years of building and running Dark Forest, the first fully decentralized MMORTS, including: why ZK is important for games, what a crypto-native game is and why we should care, designing for emergent player behavior, pushing the limits of Ethereum devex, and social consensus and legitimacy - why is Dark Forest more like chess than League of Legends? We'll also hint at 0xPARC's next crypto-gaming experiments.

speakers.name: Samuel Brooks
speakers.description: Samuel G Brooks designs decentralised software. He has designed numerous solutions for startups, enterprise, government and OpenTech, having worked hands-on with Ethereum since its launch. He regularly speaks at technology conferences, meetups and podcasts, and holds several advisory positions on technical peak body boards and committees (Australian Computer Society Blockchain Technical Board; Smart Contracts Group - Standards Australia).

title: Applied Cryptoeconomic System Design
description:
The Token will ultimately be remembered as perhaps the most important innovations of our time.

But, in comparison to legacy software design, everything about decentralised systems design is upside-down. System design for privacy, programmability, access, control, ownership, and monetisation are all inverted and unintuitive, which is why blockchains have difficulty with broad adoption.

This talk attempts to download over 7 years of CTO experience in designing a variety of fully and par

speakers.name: gubsheep
speakers.description: gubsheep is the creator of Dark Forest and runs applied ZK research and development at 0xPARC.

title: ZK Application Design Patterns
description: We build a brief mental model of zkSNARKs and give an overview of application design patterns and techniques for ZK-enabled apps: modeling state transitions (ZK card game), nullifiers, accumulators, managing and accessing state, key exchange, building for compatibility with existing data sets, conditional execution, and more. This talk assumes that you have some basic familiarity with zkSNARKs and have written ZK circuits before.

speakers.name: Ben Jones
speakers.description: Ben is Chief Scientist and Musician at the Optimism Foundation.

title: Music Jamboree with Weird ETH and Friends
description: Ben Jones will perform a variety of Ethereum-related musical songs with a set of web3 guests including Georgios Konstantopulous and Ed Solomon.

speakers.name: Henry Baiz
