speakers.description:
Henry Baiz founded the first internet service provider in Colombia in 1995 and grew it to be the largest service provider in the country, exiting to Bellsouth with over 1000 employees in 2005.
Henry has concentrated in building companies for social impact. His latest endeavor, Gane.com, is the first free mobile service provider with a wallet and education, launched in July 2022. Henry has been an engineering university professor and is an experienced speaker.

title: The next Billion Blockchain users, who are they?  what do they need?
description:
All blockchain users today are Innovators: the first to adopt any tecj product. These are the first 2.5% of the total market. And most of these users are here for investment / speculation, or building only, now real-life use. The mayority of users today are here for Bitcoin only.
Early adopters will be the next billion blockchain users. Who are they? Will they be very different from Innovators? How will they use Ethereum or EVMs in their daily lives?

speakers.name: gubsheep
speakers.description: gubsheep is the creator of Dark Forest and runs applied ZK research and development at 0xPARC.

speakers.name: Ying Tong
speakers.description: Core Developer at Electric Coin Company

title: Recursive ZK Applications and Affordances

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Recursive zkSNARKs are poised to hit production in the next two years. We discuss how to think about the new affordances and potential applications that recursion unlocks for both scalability and privacy. These include proofs-of-proofs-of-knowledge like ETHdos, on-the-fly "programmable" SNARKs, incrementally verifiable computation, distributed proving, and tactics for reducing verification cost or proof size.

speakers.name: Noah Maskens
speakers.description: Co-Founder @ Pigeon DAO

title: Pigeon DAO
description:
Pigeon DAO is a decentralised courier application that connects independent package couriers with customers and allows them to communicate and get paid in crypto through smart contracts to deliver packages.
This minimises the complicated nature of modern supply chains by creating an underlying framework and allows people to generate local domestic supply chains for businesses to utilise and access their local decentralised ecommerce market.

speakers.name: Ying Tong
speakers.description: Core Developer at Electric Coin Company

title: Programming in Zero-Knowledge: Writing PLONKish Circuits
description: PLONKish arithmetisation is a flexible and efficient way to express relations for proof systems. It allows for the use of custom constraints, lookup tables, and copy constraints, which gives performance improvements over the more well-established R1CS arithmetisation.

speakers.name: Asta Li
speakers.description: Asta is co-founder and CTO at Privy (https://privy.io/). She built self-driving robots before working on data rails for web3.

title: How to (not) custody user data
description: Users and developers are on the same page: we want web3 to be built for people, not wallets. But no one wants to be doxxed and privacy and security are table-stakes. Here's what the stack looks like to manage user data in web3 - it's private, end-to-end encrypted, decentralized, and keeps users in control of their data. We'll dive into the weeds of the decentralized permissions network that can power the non-custodial data rails for web3.

speakers.name: Juan Manuel G√≥mez
speakers.description: Control Engineer, Philosopher, with studies in Humanities, languages, sustainability. Chief Blockchain Officer at Unergy, Technical Innovation Leader at XM, Ecopetrol. Passionate about history and technology, Blockchain developer and architect.

title: Electronic signature system notarized by ethereum
description: The design of a mechanism that has been in production since 2019 is presented, which is used by all utilities in the energy sector in Colombia to sign public auction documents, which has a cryptographic component and notarization with smart contracts. Leveraging the strength of ZPKs for identity management.

speakers.name: Juan Manuel G√≥mez
speakers.description: Control Engineer, Philosopher, with studies in Humanities, languages, sustainability. Chief Blockchain Officer at Unergy, Technical Innovation Leader at XM, Ecopetrol. Passionate about history and technology, Blockchain developer and architect.

title: DeFi of Clean Energy
description:
We present the development of a DeFi that allows investing in renewable energy projects through a DeFi mechanism, whose liquidity is supported by environmental assets. There are different mechanisms in this DeFi, such as Liquidity Pools, Swaps, or staking. A smart contract was created to automate the profitability of environmental assets directly to the holders of the tokens. The platform is deployed in Polygon, Layer 2.

Translated with www.DeepL.com/Translator (free version)

speakers.name: Annie Pei
speakers.description: Annie Pei is a Digital Account Director with Ditto PR, a PR and digital agency that specializes in representing Web3 and emerging tech clients. Her background as a senior producer at NowThis, combined with her production experience at broadcast/digital news outlets like MSNBC and CNBC, have led her to pursue social media strategy full-time in emerging tech spaces.

title: The Case for Bitcoin Centrists: Revamping the Narrative on Bitcoin
description: The core values of blockchain tech are built on its potential to better lives worldwide. But in recent years, debates about the tenets and practical uses of Bitcoin have led to divisions questioning whether it can be the end all, be all to the world‚Äôs problems. The truth is that there‚Äôs no such thing as a free lunch; people will need to come to terms with the fact that trade-offs exist when you‚Äôre building a fully decentralized, scalable network. Diwaker Gupta, CTO of Hiro Systems, explains why.

speakers.name: Anjney Midha
speakers.description: Head of Platform Ecosystem at Discord. Previously cofounder and CEO of Ubiquity6 (acquired by Discord in 2021).

title: Discord & Decentralization
description: A rare look into the future of Discord as a developer platform for decentralized project developers

speakers.name: Juan Manuel G√≥mez
speakers.description: Control Engineer, Philosopher, with studies in Humanities, languages, sustainability. Chief Blockchain Officer at Unergy, Technical Innovation Leader at XM, Ecopetrol. Passionate about history and technology, Blockchain developer and architect.

title: Application for transparent payment of state benefits or different aid systems.
description: It is presented how CumbiApp was developed, a system deployed in Layer 2, which aims to attack possible corruption in the different state aid mechanisms, and which also serves for the distribution of benefits through the different public or private aid mechanisms. This application connects government or private entities with end users, manages the traceability of issuance and expenditure of each of the benefits, and allows the different tokens it manages to be redeemed exclusively where the prog

speakers.name: Chris W
speakers.description: Ecosystem at Worldcoin. Working on Ethereum things since 2017.

title: Worldcoin end-to-end: wallets, orbs, AI, biometrics and privacy.
description:
To prove your humanity you open the wallet app and show the QR code to an orb. What‚Äôs in this QR code? How does the orb work? What happens on-chain? Let‚Äôs walk through all the parts.

Worldcoin combines technology from many different fields: hardware, deep learning, zero-knowledge cryptography, mobile wallet apps, etc. I will explain how all these parts work together, by deep diving into the story of a user signing up and using WorldID.

+ Q&A

speakers.name: Saba
speakers.description: Saba is the founder of BLK@, a global Black Web3 ecosystem designed to empower and amplify Black NFT artists, founders and builders in Web3. She is a UN delegate for the Blockchain Commission for Sustainable Development, an advocate for women and BIPOC builders in Web3 and multilingual global citizen. Formerly, the Global Head of Partnerships and Business Development at the Government Blockchain Association, Saba is committed to working with global communities to address equity in Web3.

title: BLK@DevCon: The Future of Web3
description:
BLK@ is global Black Web3 ecosystem designed to empower and amplify Black NFT artists, founders and builders in Web3, w/ a focus on equity. 

Our panel would be comprised of women and BIPOC industry leaders tackling the importance of equity over D&I (Diversity & Inclusion) in Web3; the importance of sharing the work w/industry partners equally committed to equity in Web3; what has been effective & why; lastly why addressing equity initiatives in the Ethereum community would be most impactful.

speakers.name: mastercyb
speakers.description: I am in blockchain since 2011 being early bitcoin miner. In 2013 I started professional investments in blockchain. I am genesis Ethereum investor. In 2016 I created one of the first public investment funds: SatoshiFund. I funded nearly all meaningful blockchains in space. My focus of research is autonomous robotics, consensus algorithms, distributed computing, cryptoeconomics and web3 related stuff. In 2017 started to work on blockchain based Google alternative - Cyber and launched it in 2021.

title: Soft2 challenges, opportunities and applications in consensus computing
description: In 2017 Andrey Karpaty described a new paradigm of computing in which execution paths are defined not by a programmer, but by a neural network. A year ago he reports that Tesla has rewritten 80% of its stack to soft2. Since 2017 cyberCongress team worked on the soft2 blockchain. In contrast to the proprietary soft, we developed a protocol for provable, distributed, and collaborative computation of knowledge graph in consensus on GPUs. It unlocks the new wave of computing and content apps.

speakers.name: Soushiant Zanganehpour
speakers.description: Founder and CEO of Swae

title: Governance in the Age of the DAO: The Right amount of Decentralization and How to Boost Participation Rates
description:
On paper, DAOs are achieving their goals of forming a decentralized organization. On execution, most are so decentralized that they have problems getting anything done. 

Decentralisation should not come at the expense of efficiency in the long run. Progressive decentralisation enables an initial team to search for product market fit on its way toward credible neutrality.

speakers.name: Christopher Cao
speakers.description: Python and Vyper Enthusiast

title: Zero to Hero: How to build a Smart Contract Project in Vyper
description:
# Zero to Hero: How to build a Vyper NFT Project

## Steps on how to build, test, and deploy a NFT project

* Difference between Solidity and Vyper
* Folder Hierarchy Overview
* EIP-721 Standard Methods
* Popular Optional methods (Mint, Burn, Permit)
* Test Contract
* Deploy Contract
* View NFT on OpenSea
* Change baseURI in ipfs and pinata

speakers.name: Felipether
speakers.description: Felipe leads a Brazilian research company dedicated to crypto and is a GP at a private investment firm. He previously founded a p2p video streaming protocol, interfaced with nascent "web3 media protocols" (before they had this name) and developed tech projects in a film production company.

title: "Tokenomics" in a Nutshell: 5 Years in 5 Minutes
description: This is a speed run of token models experimented in the past 5 years. We'll categorize designs and explore allocation, fees and revenue distribution data to see if any performs better than the others.

speakers.name: Ivan Fartunov
speakers.description: Head of Ecosystem at Aragon

title: Roadblocks to decentralisation - Aragon's curved path to a DAO
description:
An honest and transparent first-hand account of Aragon's decentralization journey over the past 18 months. An example:
https://mirror.xyz/capitulation.eth/E8lueNCOgsnmlf0odt5hJIQfdCBhcrUuAa9vrAZy0wM

speakers.name: TechCortes
speakers.description: Developer with +10 years of experience building Social Innovation, startups and technology ecosystems for community empowerment and decentralization. 1st. Miami Dade County Cryptocurrency Task Force.

title: Introduction to IPFS (SPANISH OR ENGLISH)
description:
EN ESPANOL | Introduction to IPFS, Decentralized Storage and more !

In this section we'll cover the basic operations and configurations that new users need when starting out with IPFS. You can find guides for the basics of running the IPFS Desktop app and interacting with IPFS through the command-line!

Have an idea of what IPFS is but haven't really used it before? You should start here.

speakers.name: 0xhank
speakers.description:
I graduated from Tufts University in Computer Science in 2021. Since then, I have built a governance portal prototype for Axie:Infinity, a web3-friendly video game.

I participated with dfdao's guild to win Dark Forest round 6.5, Junk Wars. I have been building Dark Forest Arena, an experimental community-built game mode that focuses on fast, fun game rounds. Throughout this time, I have run and participated in numerous gaming governance and technical projects.

speakers.name: cha0s
speakers.description: cha0s

title: dfdao: Gaming as the Frontier for web3 Coordination
description:
On-chain gaming is the premier testing ground for web3 governance and coordination. At the forefront of this movement is Dark Forest DAO. We are a decentralized community of players and builders on Dark Forest, a highly-regarded on-chain game. Our experiments include:
 Astral Colossus: the first on-chain guild smart contract
 Death of the Universe: a Dark Forest round whose rules were voted on using Snapshot
 Arena: Our bespoke game mode that coordinates players around fast-paced matches

speakers.name: Tomas Cordero
speakers.description: Blockchain enthusiast and Social Impact Entrepreneur

title: NGOs: Sale of digital assets vs. donation based models
description:
Talk about Radicle Drips and Unlock Protocol and how it is being used to develop the whitepaper behind Aura Dogs. 
Unlock: Users can support a particular Animal Shelter of their choice and sponsor them directly via the issuance of NFT memberships for Animal Shelters while shelter provide perks for their supporters.
Radicle Drips: The integration of Radicle 'Drips' smart contracts allow for the direct monthly funding towards participating Animal Shelter organizations. In this way, the

speakers.name: Alejandro Gutierrez - CEO & Operations Lead
speakers.description: Colombian born Alejandro has extensive and demonstrable experience in Supply Chain Management and Finance. He is an early adopter of  Real World Assets in the DeFi space and is  working with the likes of Maker and Centrifuge

title: Closing the Trade Finance gap with DeFi

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: According to the World Trade Organization, small- and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) represent over 90% of the business population, 60‚Äì70% of employment and 55% of GDP in developed economies. Yet, the framework that is preventing SMEs from accessing fundings is the same that traditional institutions have no interest in fixing, as doing so puts their very existence at risk. Alejandro Gutierrez, Defactor CEO, will explore a range of growth opportunities for SMEs where Defi can power up and transf

speakers.name: Alejandro Gutierrez - CEO & Operations Lead
speakers.description: Colombian born Alejandro has extensive and demonstrable experience in Supply Chain Management and Finance. He is an early adopter of  Real World Assets in the DeFi space and is  working with the likes of Maker and Centrifuge

title: Rethinking financial services to unlock inclusive DeFi with Defactor CEO
description: The evolution of fintech has broken through traditional barriers for entry into a variety of financial services. Alejandro Guitierrez, Defactor CEO,explores DeFi as a next step in ensuring that more communities are able to access the financial support necessary to power  economic growth for all. As one of the first platforms to put real-world assets (RWAs) onto Web3, Defactor is on the forefront of rethinking financial services to unlock the potential of inclusive DeFi.

speakers.name: Abraham Cobos
speakers.description:
Host and founder of Espacio Cripto, the leading web3 podcast in Mexico. 
Head of Crypto at Bitso, the leading exchange in LATAM.
#WinAndHelpWin

title: LATAM fixes this (and need this)
description: LATAM is a fertile ground for web3, not because it's cool, but because we need it. During this conference, I will share my experience as Head of Crypto at Bitso (the largest crypto exchange in LATAM with a presence in Mexico, Colombia, Argentina, and Brazil), and as founder of Espacio Cripto (the largest crypto podcast in Mexico and one of the largest in LATAM).

speakers.name: Alex Shipp
speakers.description: Alex Shipp, Chief Strategy Officer at Offshift, is a strategist, writer, and thought leader in the digital asset space with a background in traditional finance, economics, and the emerging fields of decentralized finance, tokenomics, blockchain, and digital assets. At Offshift, Alex contributes to platform tokenomics, produces content, and conducts business development on behalf of the project. Alex  is an expert in private decentralized finance (PriFi).

title: Money, Credit, and Privacy in the Era of DAOs
description:
Let‚Äôs dissect the relationship between privacy, DeFi, and decentralized governance. Looking to the rapidly-emerging networks of DAOs, perhaps it would serve us well to recall and return to the core tenets of blockchain technology and Web3, to consider how we can retain privacy, efficiency, and diligence in these new communities.

Does privacy contribute to, or detract from, robustness in governance models? When does privacy make individuals more accountable versus when does transparency?

speakers.name: Nayana Singh
speakers.description: GM, Product NFT at ConsenSys. Over 20 years of experience building products as a developer, systems architect and product manager. Have a history of taking new ideas and morphing them into viable scalable products. Have been in the WEB3 and NFTs/Token space since 2018

title: Accelerate building NFT dAPPs for any vertical
description: Building an NFT based business whether you are a crypto native or a crypto dabbler does not have to be hard, that is the premise of WEB3. When you have the right methods for API's and a template-based approach for your pre-audited contracts, you can make it super simple to create NFT dAPPS. This can help developers with a brilliant idea not worry about the foundations of what an NFT is, metadata to extract or to add, creating one versus a collection, verifying ownership and more.

speakers.name: Chih-Cheng Liang
speakers.description: Chih-Cheng builds some privacy or scaling applications.

title: Little things I‚Äôve learned in developing Halo2 circuits

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: We will share some Plonkish circuit designing patterns we learned during the zkevm development.

speakers.name: Pablo Stanley
speakers.description: Pablo Stanley is a latinx designer. He is the co-founder and CEO at Bueno,¬†Blush¬†and the creator of  Robotos NFTs. Previously, he was lead designer at¬†InVision,¬†Udemy and Lyft. He gives talks and workshops worldwide. He has a channel called Sketch Together where he shares design tutorials, and is currently producing a kid's animated show with TIME studios.

title: Design tools to get into the NFT ecosystem

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
The design tools you need to get involved in the NFT ecosystem
Pablo talks about his creative process in a number of illustration systems, design tools and software he created.¬†In particular, focusing on his collection Robotos  NFT and his tool Bueno, which provides a seamless NFT creation experience by controlling rarity and creating entire NFT collections without writing a single line of code. It is an NFT generator that can be done.

speakers.name: Nima Vaziri
speakers.description: By trade an engineer and having spent time across different technical backend environments that range from highly available distributed systems to big data systems, machine learning infrastructure, and the scalability issues that span across web2 and web3 spaces, Nima has been curious about how these systems have evolved to fit the different needs they're being built for and what kind of learnings can be applied between these areas.

title: Some parallels between building internet-scale systems across web2 and web3
description: As foundational infrastructure is being built for the web3, some new requirements need to be accounted for in a generally censorship resistant environment. But there are familiar design patterns and research that has gone into solving some problems for web2 systems that could inspire how web3 systems can be built. This talk explores some of these parallels that have already been deployed and what other potential lessons we can learn and apply from the web2 world to web3.

speakers.name: Geoff Lamperd
speakers.description: Product Lead with Ethereum Foundation's Privacy and Scaling Explorations group.

title: Interep: An identity bridge from web2 to web3
description: Interep aims to provide an identity solution for Ethereum users by bridging from an established digital identity source, typically a web2 platform. The product provides an identity layer in an application stack, and integrates with a privacy-focussed layer using the Semaphore framework. Interep can be used to to qualify users, or as an anti-sybil service.

speakers.name: Team Next Billion
speakers.description:

title: Giga, Unicef and Government
description:
PLACEHOLDER TEXT

[Team Next Billion together with a key member of Giga such as Chris Fabian]

speakers.name: James Downer
speakers.description: James has been focused on the intersection of cryptocurrency and emerging markets since 2014 when he published research on the use of bitcoin in Argentina under capital controls. He was the co-founder of Colibri, a solar financer in Nicaragua and the Open Money Initiative, a design research firm focused on the use of cryptocurrency in closed economies. He is the founder of Roda, a crypto native bank for LATAM which provides loans which increase incomes of Venezuelan migrants.

title: Ethereum CAN lend to people without money
description: Uncollateralized loans don‚Äôt exist; every loan is backed by reputation. Most types of reputation are illegible to traditional financial institutions & crypto protocols. Through 4,000+ loans to Venezuelan migrants, Roda has analyzed social graphs to assess credit risk and underwrite loans, thus demonstrating a way to turn reputation into collateral. For the industry to find non-speculative growth, we need to focus more on helping regular people encode their reputation as collateral.

speakers.name: Fredrik Svantes
speakers.description: Security Researcher at the Ethereum Foundation

title: EF Security Research
description: A look at the history and future of the EF security research team.

speakers.name: Takamichi Tsutsumi
speakers.description: Software engineer working on privacy and scaling.

title: Private Exchange on ZKOPRU
description: Give a presentation about private-exchange application on zkopru which consists of three different zero knowledge protocols including socialist millionaire problem, blind find, and zkopru itself. The presentation includes a demo part to show how the application actually works and dives deep into the technical detail of the cryptographic protocols.

speakers.name: Alan Kong
speakers.description:
CMO at SupraOracles.com 

Dr. Kate is our Chief Research Officer

title: Creator of KZG Commitments, Dr. Kate
description:
Dr. Kate is the creator of KZG Commitments and his contributions to the space are enabling Eth 2.0. Additionally, Kate Commitments are the basis for many ZK Proof Systems. 

Dr. Kate is also an expert in DKG, Distributed Key Generation. We propose to invite Dr. Kate to discuss novel DKG techniques and methodologies that can scale L1s and engender better key management systems.

speakers.name: Alex Stokes
speakers.description: Alex Stokes is a researcher at the Ethereum Foundation who believes deeply in the Ethereum vision. To achieve this vision, he has been working on scaling R&D to make the core protocol more secure and accessible to everyone. This includes tooling and testing work for the Merge, exploratory prototyping for sharding work like EIP-4844 and EIP-4895 to enable validator withdrawals after the Merge. When he is not working on Ethereum, you can find him at the nearest mountaintop.

title: Block building after the Merge
description: We are seeing the emergence of a specialized role on the Ethereum network dedicated to assembling the contents of each block as the ecosystem grows and the impact of "maximum extractable value" (MEV) becomes clear. This talk investigates block building after the Merge and what considerations the move to proof-of-stake brings to the process along with what norms we should strive for to avoid dangerous centralization pressures while maximizing validator profits.

speakers.name: Sara Cadena
speakers.description: I spent 19 years living in 6 different countries and studied strategic design in Colombia for 5 years. Then the pandemic hit, and I read a book that made me realize I had always designed for others and never for myself. Since 2020, I‚Äôve been building a framework to redesign different aspects of my life like finance, family, friends, travel, home and love. This life problem solving approach has helped me turn my everyday frustrations into fun and dynamic experiences.

title: Can we marry on the blockchain?
description: In a world where states are in flux, what might the future of weddings be? As a Colombian-Venezuelan couple, getting married under our home country‚Äôs systems was difficult. Colombia requires a ‚Äúproof of being single‚Äù that is a nightmare to obtain as a Venezuelan. Venezuela is difficult to visit as a citizen without a recent passport, which is hard to get. Instead, we got married in the US, where it‚Äôs easier as foreigners, but also signed our commitment on the Ethereum blockchain.

speakers.name: Wanseob Lim
speakers.description: Tech lead @ EF PSE, Author of Zkopru

title: Public goods and experiments, sunsetting Zkopru V1
description: Zkopru is one of the inital projects of EF's PSE team. During the development and experiements PSE team could establish the own ethos for the public goods and experiments. This talk introduces Zkopru project's journey from the beginning to its sunset of the 1st version. Also it introduces the achievements and the future plans.

speakers.name: Stellar Magnet
speakers.description: Stellar Magnet has been in the DAO ecosystem since 2017, contributing to communities such as MolochDAO, AssangeDAO, BrightID, and Space Decentral. Currently she is focused on launching Black Sky, an emerging DAO on a mission to minimize dystopia and maximize harmony with the cosmos. Previously she led Space Cooperative, a worker-owned cooperative which had a mission to create Space Decentral, a DAO that would have been a citizen-led decentralized space agency.

title: Exploring Paths Towards Dissolving Labor with Transformative Autonomous Organizations
description: The Transformative Autonomous Organization, or TAO, can be considered a subclass of a DAO. TAOs don‚Äôt yet exist today in practice, but are a newly proposed model of crypto-charged organizing to build towards a¬†free society¬†where dystopia has been minimized and labor has dissolved. This talk will introduce the six elements that make up a TAO and then do a deep dive on how TAOs can more intentionally reduce the work week by encoding incentives with smart contracts.

speakers.name: Alex Beregszaszi
speakers.description: Alex is the team lead of Ipsilon at the Ethereum Foundation, a group focused on improving the EVM.  Alex has been an early contributor and co-lead of the Solidity team.

title: What's next in EVM
description:
What is the future of the EVM?

This talk will include an overview of proposals to the EVM, many listed and some detailed. It will try to explain the likely hood of adopting them and what needs to be done to make sure they get adopted.

speakers.name: Daniel Gruesso
speakers.description: Daniel Gruesso is a product manager at Chainlink Labs, helping build Chainlink. He focuses his time on furthering developer tooling and education in web3. Previously, Daniel led the developing tooling effort at GitLab.

title: Building web3 products in the open

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: We‚Äôve all heard about the new startup operating in stealth mode, but there's a better path that relies on the principles of open source. Daniel Gruesso explains how product teams can use the principles of open source to build better, faster, and with user buy-in from the get-go in web3.

speakers.name: Rob Stupay
speakers.description: Rob Stupay is managing communications at Remix.

title: What's new in Remix
description: We‚Äôve been pumping up Remix with new tools & features for users of all levels.  Come learn the latest Remix tricks & techniques.  We'll cue up editor improvements, tool integrations (including Git), Remix shortcuts, and our new workflows. We‚Äôll also demo our new interface for using Remix with proxy contracts.  This talk will take your scratchings on Remix to 11.

speakers.name: Rob Stupay
speakers.description: Rob Stupay is managing communications at Remix.

title: Remix Rewards
description: Remix has a program to reward our contributors with non-transferable NFT‚Äôs on Optimism.  We‚Äôll go over the details and the goals of this token / badge.

speakers.name: Chance Hudson
speakers.description: Engineer on the Privacy and Scalability Explorations team at the EF.

title: Building a Unirep ecosystem
description: What does an identity ecosystem built on top of Unirep look like? Learn how reputation works in a system where participants are anonymous and how it can be used to build applications.

speakers.name: Marc Garreau
speakers.description: Developer at the EF since 2017 working on the Mist Browser, Grid, and now the Python team maintaining Web3.py and creating educational resources.

title: Little-known Web3.py
description: A Web3.py maintainer steps though how to use some of the lesser-known features recently released: async functionality, off-chain data lookups, plugin support and more.

speakers.name: Alex Beregszaszi
speakers.description: Alex is the team lead of Ipsilon at the Ethereum Foundation, a group focused on improving the EVM.  Alex has been an early contributor and co-lead of the Solidity team.

title: EVM Panel
description:
This is a panel discussion about the EVM.

We want to be a bit more unconventional and would like to transform the room into a "live voting space" where attendees can fight for their favourite new EVM feature.

Different proposals will be listed and discussed for 3-5 minutes each, where invited panelists give a short opinion followed by loud interaction from the audience.

speakers.name: Leo Alt
speakers.description: Leo is the Formal Verification Lead at the Ethereum Foundation where he also contributes to the Solidity language and compiler.

speakers.name: Alex Beregszaszi
speakers.description: Alex is the team lead of Ipsilon at the Ethereum Foundation, a group focused on improving the EVM.  Alex has been an early contributor and co-lead of the Solidity team.

title: The Showdown: Best Ethereum Language
description:
This session will be an unconventional panel discussion. Instead of being boring and repeating the same things, we will spice things up a bit.

The goal is to decide which is the best language for Ethereum.

How do we find that out? Though a combination of "pub quiz" and on-stage activity (e.g. tug-of-war) between members of different language teams. The audience can chime in as well.

speakers.name: Facu
speakers.description: Argentinian. Yearn contributor. Beach tennis player.

title: Yearn Vaults V3 - Modular Yield
description:
Yearn is a tiled aggregator. Right now, our latest innovation is a multi investments strategy vaults. 

The next innovation for this year is a modularized approach to yield. Featuring junior tranches, more dencentralized via permissionless function calls, and more customizable.

speakers.name: Rob Stupay
speakers.description: Rob Stupay is managing communications at Remix.

title: Remix intro workshop in Spanish

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Remix IDE is the tool that most people begin with for their journey through Ethereum development.  Come learn some basics of Solidity, the most popular language for programming smart contracts.  We‚Äôll be using the tutorials inside of Remix - so you can continue working after the workshop is over.  The workshop will be conducted in Spanish.

speakers.name: Alex Beregszaszi
speakers.description: Alex is the team lead of Ipsilon at the Ethereum Foundation, a group focused on improving the EVM.  Alex has been an early contributor and co-lead of the Solidity team.

title: What would Solidity 1.0 and 2.0 look like?
description:
Solidity has quite a long history already, especially in terms of "crypto years". Yet, the project has not yet reached the "magical" 1.0 release.

This talk is discussing what the language could look like reaching 1.0; and going beyond reaching 2.0.

speakers.name: Thibaut Schaeffer
speakers.description: ZoKrates @ Ethereum Foudation

title: A ZoKrates update
description: zkSNARKs are becoming a cornerstone of decentralised technologies. Yet they are often considered impenetrable to newcomers. We will present an update on the ZoKrates toolbox, a set of tools aimed at making developing zkSNARK applications easier using a high-level language instead of handcrafted circuits.

speakers.name: Piper Merriam
speakers.description: I am a long time core developer of the Ethereum protocol that loves to make things and tell stories.

title: The Portal Network
description: The Portal Network is the culmination of five years of development and research targeting lightweight access to the Ethereum Protocol.  Learn what the Portal Network is, how it works, and what it will mean for Ethereum to have a reliable decentralized network tailor made for end users to interact with the Ethereum protocol.

speakers.name: Piper Merriam
speakers.description: I am a long time core developer of the Ethereum protocol that loves to make things and tell stories.

title: The Power of Stories
description: The real, complex, and often messy backstories of many of those that contribute to the Ethereum protocol to try and capture the nebulous art of leadership within an ecosystem without hierarchy or explicit authority.

speakers.name: Albert Chon
speakers.description: Co-founder and CTO of Injective Labs

title: Self-executing smart contracts and next-generation AMM design
description: This talk will describe the novel concept and implementation of self-executing smart contracts along with its use in designing a next-generation automated market making system on top of a central limit orderbook. The first half of the talk will focus on the infrastructure and security design considerations of the self-executing smart contract system as well as it's potential applicability to Ethereum. The second half of the talk will cover the novel AMM mechanism, particularly in HFT use cases.

speakers.name: Ameen Soleimani
speakers.description:
Summoned MolochDAO and all I got was this lousy T-shirt üëπ 

Reflexer Labs (RAI) cofounder, CEO at SpankChain

title: Let's start a RAI-ot!
description:
Launched Feb 2020, RAI‚Äîa fork of DAI‚Äîis an ETH backed stable-ish coin that uses an onchain PI controller to set interest rates automatically and emphasizes ‚Äúungovernance‚Äù.

If you‚Äôve ever looked at a central bank and thought about replacing it with a computer, this talk is for you!

Come listen to the RAI story so far, what we‚Äôve learned, where we‚Äôre going, and why we think the RAI model of controlled, floating exchange rates are going to be the future of DeFi and beyond.

speakers.name: Sinlin
speakers.description: Sinlin is the Head of Product Design at Web3Auth with over 4 years of experience in the Web3 space. She was the founding designer and designed multiple B2C and B2B products such as Torus Wallet, Web3Auth Dashboard, Websites, Solana Wallet Adaptor and more. She builds and currently leads a team of 4 driven designers to take on the usability issues in Web3.

title: 3 Key Design Considerations
description: Open to joining a panel of UX Specialist in Web3 to discuss about UX in Web3, designing with tech constraints in Web3, designing for mass adoption, designing for dencentralization.

speakers.name: Illia Polosukhin
speakers.description: Illia Polosukhin is Co-Founder of NEAR Protocol. NEAR‚Äôs vision of a scalable, robust, and highly usable blockchain began in 2018 when they couldn't find a protocol that met the needs of builders.  Illia has more than 10 years of industry experience, including 3 years at Google where he was a major TensorFlow contributor and managed the team building question-answering capabilities for the core Google search, as well as an author of several notable research papers.

title: Mapping the Convergence of AI and Web3
description: In the first decade of smart contract blockchains and Web3, the field of artificial intelligence has made dramatic progress. It will soon be possible, and may be already, to run a community-owned artificial general intelligence (AGI) on distributed hardware and manage it with a blockchain. This talk explores the technical requirements and ethical questions around the convergence of blockchain and AI and proposes some early experiment designs.

speakers.name: Mally Anderson
speakers.description: Mally Anderson is a writer and researcher at NEAR Protocol. She was previously creative director at Satori; executive writer for Ethereum co-founder and ConsenSys founder Joseph Lubin; executive editor at Cellarius; and associate editor at Penguin Press, an imprint of Penguin Random House, where she edited several New York Times nonfiction bestsellers. Her work has appeared in Quartz, MIT‚Äôs Journal of Design Science, MIT‚Äôs Innovations, Bitcoin Suisse Outlook, Decrypt, Esquire, and Devcon V.

title: Transforming Scientific Research with Web3
description: This talk proposes building a more open system for scientific research and collaboration that affords scientists the financial and legal ability to work on humanity's most complex, pressing problems in order to benefit everyone. The current paradigm does not incentivize scientific freedom nor collaboration and most research is closed source. We propose a Web3 solution that covers governance, IP management and licensing, engineering, and funding approaches.

speakers.name: Barnab√© Monnot
speakers.description: Barnab√© is a team lead and researcher at the Robust Incentives Group, Ethereum Foundation. He focuses on economic modelling of the Ethereum protocol, using simulations, empirical data and formal analysis.

title: Updates on Proposer-Builder Separation
description: In this talk, I will discuss updates on PBS and economic models for validators, builders, searchers and users.

speakers.name: Maria Londono
speakers.description:
Maria has more than 12 years of experience in cross-border finance transactions. She is currently the head of legal at a Fintech start-up in LATAM where she has focused on creating and upgrading legal UX for clients, setting up a risk- management system and raising capital.

Maria recently studied Design Thinking at Stanford Design and it is qualified to practice law in NY and Colombia. Maria also co-founded smart contract lab, Disrupt3rs, Inc. See disrupt3rs.com

title: Legal Implications of NFT Entrepreneurship
description: This lightning talk will engage the audience by highlighting the aspects of NFT projects that resemble founding a start-up, It will highlight the opportunities behind giving creators, including marketing leaders, artists and performers control over their projects. It will also highlight the legal risks, such as anti-money laundering concerns, IP protection, revenue allocation, and regulatory concerns related to potential security laws-related implications, that may arise and how to tackle them.

speakers.name: Matthias Tarasiewicz
speakers.description: Matthias Tarasiewicz is a senior developer, technology consultant, research designer and project coordinator. He is an enthusiast for immutable and unstoppable code and an Open Source evangelist. Focus areas: Open Source Hardware, Web3, privacy and decentralization. Director of the RIAT Institute and CSO of RIAT Labs. Matthias has a background as digital artist, writer and curator.

title: Cryptostamp and Metaverse Workshop: The future of collectibles (Hybrid Workshop)
description:
In this workshop we are discussing, outlining and drafting the future of collectibles. In cooperation with the Austrian Post we are making available the developments of the "Crypto stamp" and will work on tangible experiments for future NFTs. 

Target audience content creators and startups operating in the Metaverse and with collectibles. The workshop is taking place virtually (Decentraland) and will be hybrid (IRL in Bogota, with virtual participants and program).

speakers.name: Kevin Schellinger
speakers.description: Kevin Schellinger is an entrepreneur, researcher, and one of the early figures of the Swiss crypto industry with activities dating back to 2013. Today, he works with a number of startups supporting their product, R&D, and business development efforts.

title: Limited Liability Identity (LLI): A New Identity Primitive for Web3

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Web3 is still considered the wild west where trust is a scarce commodity. The Limited Liability Identity, short LLI, is a new identity primitive that is introducing liability for pseudonymous actors in Web3 and allows for efficient dispute resolution. The speaker is trying to make the case why this new primitive can accelerate the transition to a trusted web3 and illustrates how the LLI concept could be a cornerstone for Web3‚Äôs native legal stack.

speakers.name: Richard Moore
speakers.description: Just another random developer from Canada, loving Ethereum and looking forward to the awesome future Blockchain has in store. Otherwise, the author of ethers and co-author of Firefly. :)

title: Ethers: What's new in v6?

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Just a quick overview of some of the new APIs and features of Ethers introduced in v6, including Typed-Values, more-flexible Contract interaction and Layer 2 enhancements.

speakers.name: Conor
speakers.description: Founder of Ethereum Brasil.

title: Running a local ETH event
description: Founders of some of the most successful ETH events, from small to large, share experiences (good and bad) for community members wanting to run their own local ETH event.

speakers.name: Austin Fatheree
speakers.description: Austin is the CTO of Origyn Foundation(origyn.ch) and the Executive Director of ICDevs.org.  He has been building web3 and ethereum projects since 2017 and currently is focused on scaling the Ethereum ecosystem and other L1s using the Intenet Computer.  He is also the author of Immortality: The blockchain is a time machine that may save your future self (https://amzn.to/3PoTxfm).

title: Will the Internet Computer eat Mainnet?
description: In late 2022 the Internet Computer will release threshold ecdsa that lets a trustless subnet control a private key that doesn't exist. IC smart contracts will be able to sign ethereum transactions and control smart contracts on ETH mainnet.  This will enable a new Trustless L2 paradigm that enables gasless control of ETH assets without traditional bridges.  In this talk, we will explore where we are with the tech, what is coming in the future(native ETH integration), and what can be built now.

speakers.name: Gilbert
speakers.description: Smart contract auditor and advanced Solidity curriculum creator at [0xMacro.com](0xMacro.com).

title: Demystifying EVM Opcodes
description: Every Solidity developer needs a basic understanding of how the EVM works at the lowest opcode level. Join this talk to speed-run this knowledge and upgrade your skills as a smart contract engineer.

speakers.name: Brendan Playford
speakers.description: Brendan Playford is the founder of Masa Finance, a decentralized financial data platform that is on a mission to enable unencumbered access to credit and wealth creation through decentralized finance. A fintech visionary and tenured entrepreneur, Brendan has founded and scaled major banking and fintech platforms in Silicon Valley and globally, including Pngme, a platform that enables one-click data sharing, real time insights, and credit scoring, and has raised over $50 million in sales.

title: DeFi Credit Protocols: The Foundation for a More Robust DeFi Marketplace
description: Despite headwinds in the crypto markets as of late, the promise of DeFi remains strong and is demonstrating signs of maturity thanks in part to the entrance of innovative credit protocols like Masa Finance which are ushering in new methods to set credit ratings to would-be borrowers in the crypto space and release lending. They may not be as splashy as NFTs or GameFi, but uncollateralized lending credit protocols are hard at work laying the foundation for a more robust global DeFi marketplace.

speakers.name: Justin Browder
speakers.description: Justin L. Browder is a partner in Willkie's Asset Management Department based out of the Washington office. Justin concentrates his practice on counseling investment advisers, investment funds, broker-dealers, and blockchain, cryptocurrency, and digital asset ecosystems and market participants concerning all aspects of the federal securities laws.

title: Crypto Regulation in the United States
description: Developments in US Regulation of Cryptoassets and Liquid Staking Protocols in Particular

speakers.name: Dr. Biyan Mienert
speakers.description: Dr. Biyan Mienert is a lawyer in Blockchain and FinTech-Law. He is also a lecturer for Digitalization Law at the university for applied science in Hessen and University of Cologne. He mainly conducts research and advises on the legal issues and structuring of decentralized autonomous organizations (DAOs), NFTs, Web3, and Token offerings. In his Ph.D., he developed as the first lawyer a comprehensive legal framework for DAOs. Due to his expertise, he is a frequent speaker at international confere

title: How to legally structure your DAO
description: I want to give a short overview of how to legally structure your DAO to be safe and grow. The talk is about the current regularity framework for DAOs. Mainly regarding two approaches Defense tools for unincorporated DAOs to minimize risks and suggestions for DAOs that want  to establish a legal entity, where to got and which jurisdictions and entities fit the best for DAOs.

speakers.name: Jesse Tasman
speakers.description: Holds a MSc. in Electrical Engineering with a passion for entrepreneurship, capital markets and blockchain technology. Currently working as the Head of Product for Redefine, an Israeli startup focusing on blockchain security. Has been crypto-obsessed since 2017 and publicly identifies as a degen.

title: DeFirewall: combatting the risks associated "blind signing" on transactions
description: The current state of DeFi renders users vulnerable to attacks, hacks and scams, potentially resulting in heavy financial losses. One of the primary reasons for this is the lack of visibility into transactions that are being signed. By ‚Äúblindly‚Äù signing on a transaction, users can fall victim to bad-faith protocols, legitimate protocols that have been exploited, phishing scams, malicious data payloads from compromised dApp FEs or even simple human errors in execution. DeFirewall stops this.

speakers.name: Fabian Vogelsteller
speakers.description: Fabian Vogelsteller is a Blockchain veteran who was part of the Ethereum Foundation in its early days. From 2015 to 2018 he helped shape the Ethereum space, building the official Ethereum Wallet, the first decentralized web3 browser and tools like web3.js, the most used JavaScript library in the blockchain space today. In November 2015 he proposed ERC 20, the token standard that initiated the ICO wave and the DeFi movement.

title: The Way to Access EVM Blockchains for Everyone: Universal Profiles
description: The way we access blockchains is flawed. Key based accounts are hard to maintain (remember your seed phrase üòâ ), these accounts have no smart contract readable information, and asking newcomers to have the native token for transactions is THE UX killer. Universal Profiles based on ERC725, proposed by the author of ERC20 will finally solve all of those problems and allow for a complete new wave of standardisation on top of smart contract based accounts...

speakers.name: Robbie Heeger
speakers.description: Robert Heeger is the President and CEO of Endaoment, the first 501(c)3 nonprofit and Community Foundation to be entirely powered by blockchain. Endaoment accepts more than 1000 different crypto assets as donations to its Chraitable Funds, enabling donors to make tax-exempt contributions with cryptocurrencies to any registered nonprofit organization. Heeger is a self-taught software engineer who began working on Endaoment after spending seven years working for Apple's media products division. He

title: Evolving Social Good and Philanthropy through Blockchain Technologies
description: This panel discusses how Ethereum can change the world for the better by leveraging blockchain and distributed ledger for social impact, bridging the divide between blockchain and philanthropy. Additionally, we will look at how the crypto space can channel a portion of its capital gains into charitable, tax-deductible contributions.

speakers.name: David Goldberg
speakers.description:
David got started as an Ethereum smart contract security auditor in 2018 as a sub-contractor for Quantstamp. He leveraged his work with Quantstamp to audit OpenZeppelin‚Äôs ZeppelinOS project directly. He also was the first auditor of Synthetix when it was called Havven. 

Founder of Macro where he leads the audits team ([0xMacro.com](http://0xmacro.com/)). Recently audited Frax, TreasureDAO, Synthetix, thirdweb, more.

Prior to starting Macro was a core contributor at Synthetix.

title: The Evolution of Smart Contract Audits and Where They‚Äôre Heading
description:
In this talk, David Goldberg, the first auditor of Synthetix protocol (2018), ex sub-contractor for Quantstamp (2018), ex auditor of OpenZeppelin‚Äôs ZeppelinOS (2018), and recent (2022) auditor of Frax, TreasureDAO, & more will discuss how the Audit ecosystem has evolved over the past 5 years and where it‚Äôs heading in the future. 

Audit customers value the best engineers auditing their code and as many sets of eyes as possible.   

The future of security Audits will likely combine the two.

speakers.name: Zero Age
speakers.description:
0age, Head of Protocol Development, OpenSea
0age is the Head of Protocol Development at OpenSea, where he oversees the protocol development of the entire OpenSea platform. He is the author of Seaport, a new open-source protocol powering NFT marketplaces like OpenSea. Prior to OpenSea, 0age was the CTO of Dharma Labs (acquired by OpenSea)

title: Powering vertical NFT marketplaces using Seaport
description: Seaport is a marketplace protocol for buying and selling NFTs. While it powers OpenSea in a horizontal capacity, Seaport is open source and allows marketplaces to share a pool of liquidity ‚Äì enabling project-specific, bespoke vertical marketplaces. Since launch, it‚Äôs helped spur innovation across emerging NFT verticals, including ENS names, in-game purchases, etc. In this talk, you‚Äôll hear about emerging use cases and what‚Äôs possible in the next wave of NFT marketplace development.

speakers.name: Anthony Pecchillo
speakers.description:
Anthony serves as the Head of Instruction at Macro's Smart Contract Engineering Fellowship, where he focuses on ramping up Web2 senior engineers as they transition into security-focused smart contract developers in the Ethereum ecosystem.

Previously, Anthony spent 6 years building, running, and teaching programs at Web2 bootcamps like Hack Reactor, App Academy, and Galvanize.

Before software Anthony was an accelerator physicist focused on particle colliders, radiation, and medical devices.

title: Bringing the Next Wave of Senior Engineers to Ethereum
description:
At Macro, I've closely studied 140+ Senior Engineers as they've entered the Ethereum ecosystem and  transitioned into roles as security-focused Smart Contract Engineers, Auditors, and Technical Founders.

I'll discuss the trends I've observed and share some of the most effective techniques I've seen take Solidity developers from an intermediate to an advanced level. I'll also point out some common pitfalls to be avoided.

(Written, with love, for a Technical Audience.)

speakers.name: Maika Isogawa
speakers.description: Maika is a former professional acrobat and performer for the Cirque Du Soleil brand of shows. She is also a Stanford '20 alumnus with a special concentration in Symbolic Systems, a program which combines the study of Human Computer Interaction, Software Engineering, Linguistics, Philosophy, and more. Maika was most recently a Cybersecurity Engineer for Microsoft. She has since founded Webacy, a platform for securing digital assets for the unexpected. Maika and Webacy have been recently recognize

title: Building a Safer Web3
description: A brief overview of the state of the web3 security ecosystem. Form hardware wallets to self-executing smart contracts, I'll cover the options users and businesses have today, and what they can hope for in the future. I'll touch on the new and exciting technology innovations that are tackling some of the biggest security challenges in web3.

speakers.name: Dayan Brunie
speakers.description: Passionated buidler invested in the development of a sustainable decentralized web | Lead Architect @ConsenSys | Volunteer @theShiftProject

title: Fundamentals of NFTs, use-cases & implementation
description:
The objective of this session is to take a step back from what the notion of ownership of non-fungible assets is to understand in depth what NFT can brings, and thus glimpse their almost unlimited potential. 

Agenda:
1) A step back to clarify some key concepts
2) A question of ownerships recorded in ledgers
3) An implementation in decentralized ledgers
4) Non-Fungible Token standards
5) Non-Fungible Token use-cases & implementations

speakers.name: Cairo
speakers.description: Head of Business Development at Coinstore.com

title: Coinstore Exchange Presentation

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Coinstore Exchange Presentation to showcase the work of Coinstore in LATAM and introduce the audience to the services of Listing, IEO / Launchpad, NFT Marketplace, Coinstore Labs (Incubation), VC Funding, etc. specially for projects in Latinamerica.

speakers.name: Jacob Willemsma
speakers.description: Jacob is VP of Partnerships at ETHGlobal and has been part of the ETHGlobal team since before there was an ETHGlobal!

title: ETHGlobal's last 5 years and it's next 5
description: In this talk we'd love to present a very concrete look into ETHGlobal's past 5 years of hackathon and community outcomes and look toward ETHGlobal's new vision for our future.

speakers.name: Tyson Battistella
speakers.description: Tyson Battistella is co-founder and chief technology officer (CTO) of Zora. Originally from British Columbia, Tyson has a background in Computer Science. Prior to co-founding Zora in 2020, Tyson interned at Coinbase with the founding team of Coinbase Commerce, absorbing as much knowledge as possible about the industry, before staying on as a Software Engineer for three years. Here, he met fellow Zora co-founders Jacob Horne and Dee Goens.

title: DAOs + Minimum Viable Nations

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description:
Nouns is the most captivating DAO right now, and the future of the next NFT cycle. Zora believes this will be the dominant form factor and is building NounsBuilder, a protocol that will let anyone start their own Nouns DAO in just a few clicks. Teaser @nounsbuilder

Tyson (Zora cofounder/CTO) would discuss the future of Nouns DAO + how this new format allows for the idea of a minimum viable "Nation," an organized group of individuals operating under a shared and agreed upon set of principles.

speakers.name: Tyson Battistella
speakers.description: Tyson Battistella is co-founder and chief technology officer (CTO) of Zora. Originally from British Columbia, Tyson has a background in Computer Science. Prior to co-founding Zora in 2020, Tyson interned at Coinbase with the founding team of Coinbase Commerce, absorbing as much knowledge as possible about the industry, before staying on as a Software Engineer for three years. Here, he met fellow Zora co-founders Jacob Horne and Dee Goens.

title: Zora Dev Tools Mini Hackathon - What can you build in 50 minutes using Zora developer tools?
description:
Tyson Battistella, co-founder and CTO at Zora + the Zora Protocol team (Ian, James, Rohan), would love to host a mini hackathon workshop. Zora‚Äôs last hackathon was a huge success - over 15K people minted 165K participation NFTs. 

More on the Zora developer tools below which include Zora Dev Kit, smart contracts, Zora API‚Ä¶ 
Some examples built on top of Zora:
Catalog
Mint Songs
FWB Gallery
Lying Flat
Spores 
Olta

speakers.name: onqtam
speakers.description: https://github.com/onqtam

title: Identity & human-readable content addressing at web-scale (billions) through an app-specific ZK rollup
description:
The talk describes how a non-financial app-specific ZK rollup can decentralize identity & DNS for billions of people and address content at web-scale with human-readable URIs with on-chain hierarchical account management & authorization that doesn't require keypairs by default. It provides the simplest mental model for both developers and users compared to all other solutions in the space.

The 1st chapter of this book is complete and explains the idea:
https://onqtam.github.io/headjack/

speakers.name: o
speakers.description: hi

title: blockchain 101
description: hi

speakers.name: Andrea Lerdo
speakers.description: Mexican, queer, sarcastic and politically incorrect. Palm Foundation CEO. Ex Onyx by JPmorgan

title: The Palm Network Foundation - Onboarding the next billion people to web3 empezando con el acceso a herramientas en Espa√±ol para y por comunidades Latinoamericanas
description: Palm Network Foundation planea enfocar esfuerzos en la educaci√≥n y acceso de web3 a comunidades Latinoamericanas. Por medio de grants y proyectos educativos, Palm Foundation busca financiar proyectos Latinos con enfoque a innovaci√≥n.

speakers.name: John Gleeson
speakers.description: John Gleeson is chief operating officer for Storj where he is responsible for sales, partnerships, customer success, and product. Having started his career as an attorney, he is perfectly suited to lead the decentralized cloud vision at Storj. Prior to joining Storj Labs, John was head of devrel at Covisint (OpenText) where he led the identity of things go-to-market. John has a BA from the University of Michigan and a JD from Wayne State University.

title: The next wave of disruption: Innovation in decentralized infrastructure
description: Decentralized infrastructure is the most credible disruptor for the  centralized internet infrastructure oligarchy. Starting a service to compete with AWS, Google or Microsoft in Web2 requires billions of dollars. Through crowd-sourced capacity, trustless abstraction layers and token-based incentives, decentralized infrastructure can provide more private, secure, performant and economical infrastructures than Web2 hyperscalers based on OpEx and requiring significantly less CapEx.

speakers.name: Sam Richards
speakers.description: Code monkey at @Ethereum Foundation building @ethdotorg & other projects. Open source maxi @developer_dao. Always under construction, thanks for your patience.

title: Education as a public good: past, present & future of ethereum.org
description: Content as a public good attracts less attention vs. protocol infrastructure yet is critical resource for our community. See an overview of the mission, progress & evolution of ethereum.org as an educational public good. As the "front door" to Ethereum for many web users across the globe, ethereum.org currently receives ~20 million visits per year across ~50 languages. It continues to expand & grow thanks to thousands of open source contributors. Let's dive into what's next for ethereum.org!

speakers.name: Yingzi Yuan
speakers.description: As a culture and entertainment industry enthusiast, Yingzi previously worked in entertainment holding group Vivendi as an innovation strategist. Then she joined Ubisoft‚Äôs Strategic Innovation Lab as a Strategic Analyst and Open Innovation Project Manager, this background has led her to become one of the company's task force with the mission to explore how new technologies could reshape the landscape of entertainment, analyzing their potential impact in various areas. Among divers projects, she‚Äôs

title: Blockchain gaming and metaverse creator economy
description:
By bridging NFTs, DeFi, virtualgaming, and social elements, Metaverse lets general public take ownership of their virtual assets and experience, and it‚Äôs the gateway to onboard general public to the protocol, currency, product and services of Web3. 

In the next years, we‚Äôre going to see a major trend of crypto companies trying to make a game and gaming companies trying to introduce crypto. The end result will be a more open and decentralized Metaverse.

speakers.name: Tomek Mierzwa
speakers.description: Data analyst and data engineer with a big experience from TradFi, deeply in love with blockchain data. Never believed in ‚Äúthis is not possible‚Äù üòé

title: Storage based analytics
description: There are many well known limitations of the storage information available from Ethereum nodes. Block level diffs, hashed keys, etc. make it not very useful. But what if you have full access to every change in storage history with all used keys exposed? This would change the whole paradigm of analyzing blockchain data. This workshop will focus on storage-based approach to reporting and modeling that finally makes events almost obsolete üòÄ

speakers.name: Rodrigo Fuentes
speakers.description: Authentic and enthusiastic product leader with a proven track record of taking startups from idea stage to millions in sales. Previously co-founded an ad:tech company, leading its growth until it was acquired by a strategic buyer. Currently building AlphaBack, a browser extension that pays users to look at NFTs, with the goal of building the largest DAO-owned ad network that‚Äôs for the community, by the community.

title: The End of Surveillance Capitalism: Respecting User Privacy While Enabling Ad Targeting
description: This talk presents a future where user privacy and consent are respected via ZKPs while offering advertisers needed targeting capabilities. We will discuss a timeline of past attempts; ZKPs as alternative, promising solutions; relative pros & cons; and tech challenges to be solved. In conclusion, we'll forecast the end of surveillance capitalism, where we all enjoy ‚Äúfree content‚Äù in exchange for privacy-preserving access to user‚Äôs attention and data.

speakers.name: Jorge Arce-Garro
speakers.description: I am a blockchain and cryptography researcher from Costa Rica, currently working at Nethermind. I look into all kinds of tools related to Ethereum scalability questions, such as layer 2s, liquid staking, and zero-knowledge proofs. Besides Ethereum, I am working on a PhD in mathematical physics at the University of Michigan.  In my free time I enjoy memes and dancing.

speakers.name: Michal Zajac
speakers.description: Head of Cryptography Research at Nethermind. Enthusiast and researcher of zero-knowledge proof systems focused on their security and efficiency.

title: Quality nodes and how to get them permissionlessly

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Numerous blockchain applications, like liquid staking protocols, distributed validator technologies, data oracles, or zk-rollups‚Äô distributed sequencers and provers require that the set of nodes tasked to perform a specific task is competent to run the task, has proven past performance, or is of ‚Äúhigh quality‚Äù relative to a considered metric. In this talk, we would like to propose a solution to the problem of the automated and permissionless build of a high-quality set of nodes.

speakers.name: David Searle
speakers.description: Data nerd turned crypto enthusiast working at Antithesis to push the boundaries of finding bugs in distributed architectures.

title: Debugging the Ethereum Merge with Parallel Universes
description: The Ethereum merge is a high-stakes event for the entire industry, and requires several large, stateful, distributed software systems to behave flawlessly in order for it to succeed. Unfortunately, it‚Äôs very difficult to develop distributed stateful systems like a blockchain with high confidence. Many of the worst bugs in these systems don‚Äôt show up in the happy case, but require particular network, hardware, or timing conditions in order to manifest. This means your unit tests probably have no

speakers.name: Heather - Holds
speakers.description: Holding for others

title: Unicef Update
description: Unicef Giga update

speakers.name: Anna Vladi
speakers.description:
Being an entrepreneur at heart, I've always wanted to alter the course of the world or at the very least infuence it. I formally left the corporate world and the 9 to 5 grind, and I haven't looked back. Being able to create and BUIDL a business with the potential to help in the financial independence and freedom of billions of people is an honor.
- Anna Vladi Founder of METL Technologies (first autonomous FIAT gateway infrastructure connecting banking rails to smart contracts)

title: How to build a new sovereign autonomous country
description: Ayn Rand first wrote in the 1940s in her manuscript Atlas Shrugged - "the engine of the world", a place where the smartest people in the world would flock to.  Satoshi Nakomoto in 2008 proposed a new monetary system.  Let's examine where we are today. Blockchains are operating systems, with their own monetary policy built in; with staking mechanisms securing them just like government bonds are secured by taxes. Who is to say that when Musk gets us to Mars, the new government will not be born?

speakers.name: Faina Shalts
speakers.description: Faina Shalts is a Lead Blockchain Engineer at ConsenSys. Since joining in 2018, she has worked on Truffle‚Äôs open source tool suite. She now leads the Layer 2/Scaling team at Truffle, seeking to make Layer 2 adoption as easy as possible for developers.

title: Major Trends in the Layer 2 Ecosystem: Where We Are and Likely Upcoming Themes
description: The Layer 2 space moves at lightning speed. Just as we start to grasp a particular concept or protocol, changes and new ideas flood the ecosystem. It is exciting and fast-paced, but it can be difficult to maintain an accurate birds' eye view of current developments and upcoming themes. This lightning talk will quickly survey the Layer 2 field and make some predictions around what themes we are likely to see in the coming months.

speakers.name: Michael
speakers.description: Michael has been actively involved in the space since 2016 and he's an experienced campaigner within the technology space of the Financial Services industry coupled with a previous start-up exposure. He has devoted the last few years to leveraging new innovations built on the decentralized economy. Michael has an MBA from Cranfield School of Management.

title: Leveraging Developer Infrastructure tech in creating a "Complete Cross-chain Product" harnessing intuitive UX
description: My talk is focused on Leveraging Developer Infrastructure tech in creating a "Complete Product" harnessing intuitive UX to bring cross-channel communications between the various L1 and L2 thus opening the opportunity for projects that have far reaching global impact such as ReFI projects. This is leveraging the existing DeFi constructs the ecosystem has built over the past five years.

speakers.name: Justin Ahn
speakers.description:
Builder of micro on-ramps
Co-founder @ Quidli

title: Building more micro on-ramps into crypto
description: There's more to crypto and blockchain than simply 'centralization vs decentralization.' This talk shares short case studies on how building a wider variety of bridges between Web 2.0 & web3 beyond just CEXs can help drive greater distribution of and exposure to web3 elements among the general public over the short term rather than expecting mass adoption of dapps today.

speakers.name: Camilla McFarland
speakers.description: Camilla is the VP of Customer Success, working across product and growth to ensure Mojito customers achieve their goals in web3. As an active member of the web3 community (as part of PleasrDAO, FWB, UnicornDAO, UkraineDAO and more), Camilla guarantees Mojito customers are onboarding into web3 in the best possible way. Following her time as Client Service Content Manager at Bridgewater Associates and Product Marketing at ConsenSys Camilla was VP of Operations at Serotonin.

title: The next wave of adoption: big brands in web3
description: Web3 holds exciting new potential for brands, but we need to cross the UX chasm in crypto. Some of the biggest global brands have already integrated NFTs into their products and marketing strategies, and what the future opportunities are to build a whole new kind of customer engagement and community rewards, that look like nothing we've seen yet.

speakers.name: Pplpleasr
speakers.description: pplpleasr is a multidisciplinary artist with a focus on NFTs, crypto, DAOs, and philanthropy. Her work with Uniswap has inspired the formation of the prolific investment group PleasrDAO, helped define the aesthetic of the decentralized finance movement, graced the cover of Fortune Magazine, the cover of Vogue, as well as collaborations with Steve Aoki and Sotheby‚Äôs. She is in Forbes 30U30 this year and ranks in the top 5 of Fortune‚Äôs NFTy50, and has donated more than $1.5 million to charity.

title: Decentralized Content Creation and Curation

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: Shibuya is a web3 platform for financing and producing film, allowing users to engage, fund, vote on the outcome and become owners of content. The talk will go over how does shibuya decentralize and lay the foundation for large and diverse ecosystem participating in the story/creation process and coordinating via governance to further produce and expand each IP. On the other hand, how does each IP help the Shibuya platform grow its ecosystem overall via governance and coordination of its users.

speakers.name: Brandon Ramirez
speakers.description:
Brandon Ramirez is the Co-Founder of The Graph & E&N, and was the original inventor of The Graph's protocol design and economics.

Brandon is a deep generalist, drawing from his academic studies in Robotics, Control Systems, Economics & Signal Processing, and professional experience in Product Management, UX Design and Software Engineering.

He believes many of the world‚Äôs most pressing problems are fundamentally about incentives and social coordination.

title: Supporting the Ethereum Roadmap with a Decentralized Blockchain Data Supply Chain
description:
The original Ethereum vision was for users to run full or light clients to use the network, yet today the most widely used block explorers and JSON-RPC APIs are centralized.

Decentralizing the blockchain data supply chain is more important now than ever, as it supports key parts of the Ethereum roadmap, such as Stateless Clients and ‚ÄúThe Purge‚Äù, which unlock major gains in security, scalability, and decentralization.

Join us to learn about decentralizing this core part of the Web3 stack.

speakers.name: Arkadiy Kukarkin
speakers.description: Arkadiy is currently the Decentralization Lead at the Internet Archive. Previously he was an IPFS integrations/grants coordinator at Protocol Labs, CTO at Mediachain, and worked on supporting independent music (Hype Machine, Ampled) and cartography (Foursquare)

title: Universal Access to All Knowledge: decentralization experiments at the Internet Archive
description:
The Internet Archive holds over 100PB of data, spanning the Wayback Machine, films, scientific publications, vintage video games, and more. What is it like to try to decentalize at this scale?

We'll share our experience with networks like Filecoin, Storj, and arweave, discuss design trade-offs, offer recommendations for both builders and those curious about storing large amounts of data, and maybe even muse about how institutions could "disappear from sight... and become all of us"

speakers.name: Haaroon Yousaf
speakers.description: I am a researcher at Pometry, a temporal graph analytics startup. I graduated with a PhD in Investigating Cryptocurrency Transactions from University College London. We published many academic papers and privacy analysis/attacks on Privacy pool of Zcash, Cross-chain trading on ShapeShift, the lightning network, analysed a crypto scam forsage and published recent works on bitcoin tracking with fingerprinted wallets.

title: How to track your friends in Bitcoin
description: This talk will show you how you can track your friends on Bitcoin. We will start with the UTXO model, discuss how to cluster addresses and get address tags and end with privacy-enhancing technologies that try to mitigate this. This talk is focused on Bitcoin/UTXO-based coins. It's nice to know a bit of history.

speakers.name: Angelo Paolo Kalaw
speakers.description: Angelo Kalaw is part of the Research and Innovation Circle at the Celo Foundation, where he leads the Social Impact Collective. He has extensive experience implementing projects at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and international development in Sub-saharan Africa and Southeast Asia. He previously worked at Harvard University and the Central Bank of the Philippines.

title: Can Web3 really deliver on hunger and unemployment?

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: What does it take for Web 3 to effectively tackle two of the world‚Äôs biggest social problems, namely hunger and unemployment? We reflect on case studies of projects that sought to apply blockchain technologies to deliver aid and jobs to vulnerable populations in Kenya, the Philippines and Ecuador. We will discuss the state of evidence for decentralized technologies‚Äô successes and failures. To conclude, we map out the key elements to make decentralization work better for social good.

speakers.name: Sebastian
speakers.description: CTO at Nexera Protocol

title: Nexera, the holy grail of NFTs
description: Nexera is a novel technology that leverages the storage within smart contracts that expose an NFT interface. This translates into a cross-chain architecture layer that can be expanded with multiple components. For instance, we have ZK solutions for SBTs. We have wrappers of NFTs that allow us to fractionalize tokens. We have composability of assets, versatile implementation of new EIPs (vault standard, royalties, rentable tokens, etc).

description: Payments

speakers.name: Alejandro Santander
speakers.description: Die hard Etherean. 15 years in software development. 5 years in Ethereum app layer development. Creator of the Ethernaut CTF game. Founder of the EthernautDAO. Ex Aragon and OpenZeppelin. Currently core contributor at Synthetix, as well as forming devs and helping teams grow via the EthernautDAO.

title: Alice in Proxyland
description:
The story of Alice in her journey of making her smart contract upgradeable.

She starts with a very naive approach, and quickly bumps into the fundamental problems of proxies: using CALL vs DELEGATECALL, the execution context, storage collisions, the importance of tooling, etc.

As her system grows in complexity, her proxy architecture iterates and becomes more and more sophisticated, finally arriving to a very powerful, elegant and easy to use architecture: The Router Proxy.

speakers.name: Demian Drabyk
speakers.description: I am Co - Founder & CEO at Wink, Empowering web3 companies with financial solutions worldwide. I am a blockchain enthusiast. I worked as a full stack dev for a variety of companies for more than 10 years. I also co-founded Think and Dev, a blockchain development company. My expertise is primarily in Business Strategy, Management Consulting, Business Process, IT Strategy, Service Management and Digital Transformation.

title: Payroll y Treasury management: Challenges for innovatives companies.
description: Paying and having your treasury in in crypto is now a thing, it's an easy way to make borderless payments and a must for crypto companies that don't have legal entities like DAOs. But the tools to operate with agility and financial clarity are lacking. What are the worst pains of this market and how to solve them.
