I have been developing for more than 10 years, of which little more than the last year was in the Blockchain world. At Think&Dev I am a blockchain developer and team leader.

My partner, Alejo Lovallo, has been working in Blockchain since 2019, after working as DevOps and Developer. He is now specialized in DeFi.

speakers.name: Alejo Lovallo
speakers.description: Senior Blockchain Developer. More than four years of experience in the industry. DeFi expert.

title: Solidity and its evolution: Good Practices at Developing and Testing
description: Walk through the most important changes introduced by the different versions of solidity, good practices to contemplate real life scenarios, involving security, maintainability and testing concerns.

title: Nosy Neighbor - Automated fuzz harness generation for Golang projects
description:
Nosy Neighbor was developed as a breadth-first fuzzing tool for the critical golang clients in the ethereum network - Prysm, Go-Ethereum, and Mev-Boost. Nosy is a very annoying (to the devs) tool that aims to find bugs the moment they are introduced. Leveraging the go/types and go/parser libraries used by the Go compiler, Nosy analyzes the AST of a repo and generates fuzz harnesses for continuous fuzzing

Come learn about Nosy's novel approach to go-fuzzing and the issues it has uncovered!

speakers.name: Ricardo Garcia-Amaya
speakers.description: Ricardo is a founding governance committee member of the most influential tech DAO in the world, Orange DAO (1,300+ YCombinator alumni & $80M web3 fund). Ricardo is the founder & CEO of ILUMA, the 'Superhuman' of web3 ($2.5M raised). Previously Ricardo was the founder of venture-backed VOIQ ($7M raised). He. is also the Founder of the YC Alumni group (4,000+ top tech founders & $600B in valuations) & the Top American Latinx Tech Leaders in the US ($16B exits & $120 Billion to invest).

title: The top 1,000+ Silicon Valley leaders in one DAO: My experience governing the Orange DAO
description: What happens when you have the top tech founders in the world creating a startup DAO? In only 12 months, Orange DAO has grown to 1,300 YC alumni founders with a $80M web3 investment fund. This talk will explore the governance challenges as a DAO grows & the best practices to successfully navigate the messy, political, & complex realities of governing a DAO. How to incentivize members, ensure accountability, preserve affinity, adopt value-aligned compensation, and manage talent.

speakers.name: Felipe Leall
speakers.description: Felipe Leall, Son of Gaia, Ancestral Visionary, Light Networker, Weaver of Worlds & ManiFesting Generator of Love & Laughs, Philosopher, Musician & Mathematician InterConnected with different Elders, and Masters from different lineages, on a deep and practical level. Serves as a messenger of the CosmoGeoCratic Visi√≥n and has been helping to weave Ancestral Wisdom,with the Modern Social & Digital Technologies, the Holistic Sciences, the Cultural & Conscious Arts scene, the New Economies and Integ

title: ReGenerative Governances & Econonomies for a New World to Emerge
description: "Welcome to GAIA & SEEDS EcoSystem! Promoting dapps and tools to facilitate humanity's transition to a globally regenerative and thriving civilization, A collaborative environment that enhances the feeling of belonging to an ecosystem that is Interdependant, sinergic, compatible, holistic and integrall, interweaving knowledge, skills, talents and wisdom of any kind. It is open, inclusive and compatible with any Local, Global, Organic, Digital, Ancestral or Modern iniciatives, 'We are all GAIA'

speakers.name: Puja Ohlhaver
speakers.description:
Puja Ohlhaver is co-author of Decentralized Society: Finding Web3's Soul. 

She is a lawyer, entrepreneur, and social incentive design thinker, whose work has been featured in various outlets, including the New York Times, Washington Post, Wired Magazine, Politico. 

She is currently a strategist at Flashbots.

title: Decentralized Society:
description: Ethereum has the potential to unlock greater social coordination, pluralism, and non-financial use cases with the use of non-transerable NFTs (or soul-bound tokens). Come explore potential applications to transform closed science into open science, as well as applications to enable better, sybil-resistant coordination in DAOs. The workshop leader will be Puja Ohlhaver, co-author of Decentralized Society.

speakers.name: Rime Salmi
speakers.description:
Artist, Music NFT Pioneer, Community Builder üíó
After reaching the top of the chart in Canada, France, Dubai and Japan, singer-songwriter Rime Salmi started her journey as an indie artist, opening her own record label. Initially financing it with her commercial real estate business, she pivoted to trading crypto in 2019. This dive into web3 led her to her first music nft project, a best-seller, and now to her desire to educate more artists on the opportunities the space offers.

title: Musicians: why even a small NFT community is better than a million streams
description: As a music NFT artist myself I've experienced how having a small community of supportive fans that I've built on crypto Twitter, has resulted in more support than 10 years of streaming. I would love to demystify the process of building a strong community and show how accessible it is, any artist can be their most authentic self and find the people who wanna support their journey and their art. There's been no better time to be an independent artist!

speakers.name: Simone Romano
speakers.description: Simone Romano heads Dev Community Growth at IoTeX.  He holds two master's degrees in science from the University of Naples Federico II. One is in Industrial Engineering research and the other in Computer engineering, automation and industrial robotics. He is a Machine Vision specialist with four industrial patents filings.

title: W3bstream, the most technologically advanced data oracle for Web3 developers
description: Dr. Raullen Chai is MachineFi Lab's CEO and Founder. ML was created on the MachineFi vision to democratize the IoT, giving back to users control over their data, smart devices and the value they generate.  Today, billions of people have smart devices and are victims of "Surveillance Capitalism", run by tech firms and corporations who profit from our data. ML changes the status quo. It has built technology and software tools to enable Web3 developers to build reward economy dApps.

speakers.name: Simone Romano
speakers.description: Simone Romano heads Dev Community Growth at IoTeX.  He holds two master's degrees in science from the University of Naples Federico II. One is in Industrial Engineering research and the other in Computer engineering, automation and industrial robotics. He is a Machine Vision specialist with four industrial patents filings.

title: Building X-to-Earn with an Arduino Nano 33 with headers
description: In this workshop, where Arduino Boards will be given out for free to all those who attend it in full, Web3 developers will learn how to easily build an x-to-earn MachineFi dApp. And then, they will be given the opportunity post-event to participate in competition with monetary prizes that will be announced during the workshop.

speakers.name: Jesus Rodriguez
speakers.description: Jesus Rodriguez is the CEO  and co-founder of IntoTheBlock, a platform focused on enabling an intelligent infrastructure for the crypto markets. In addition to his operational work, Jesus is a guest lecturer at Columbia University and founded The Sequence, one of the most popular AI newsletters in the world. Jesus‚Äôs career includes several successful exits as an entrepreneur and tenures building cloud systems at Microsoft and quantitative trading platforms for several Wall Street hedge funds. He

title: High Frequency Trading and DeFi: Ideas, Strategies, Building Blocks and Things You Should Know About
description:
Decentralized finance(DeFi) has opened the door for a new generation of high-frequency trading(HFT) in the crypto space. From basic arbitrages to super sophisticated algorithms, we can see HFT bots all across the DeFi space. How does HFT works in DeFi?
This session will present some of the core ideas behind HFT algorithms in the DeFi space. We will discuss key building blocks of HTF-DeFi infrastructures, risks and show real trades that explain these concepts.

speakers.name: Collin Myers
speakers.description: Collin is the co-founder & CEO of Obol Labs, a R&D-focused team developing a protocol for trust-minimized staking. Before Obol, Collin led global product strategy at ConsenSys and was the global head of BD at Token Foundry.

speakers.name: Ois√≠n Kyne
speakers.description: Co-founder of Obol Labs and building Distributed Validator Technology for Ethereum.

title: How to design DVT while ensuring non-correlation

room.name: Main Stage - On Top of the Mountain - 5th Floor

description: The PoS Ethereum specifications are designed to encourage decentralization by punishing centralization. In this session, we will discuss how to design DVT in a way that minimizes correlation risk in distributed key generation, middleware, networking, and versioning. We'll also describe how creating a trust-minimized, non-custodial, and non-correlated architecture is the most healthy way to deliver trust-minimized staking.

speakers.name: Payton Rose (prose11)
speakers.description: Just a governance nerd, trying to build the future :) Governance Facilitator @MakerDAO - Kernel Block3

title: Delegation Incentives - MakerDAO's Delegation Journey
description: It's been over a year since we launched vote delegation at MakerDAO. Paying people to be delegates has been an assumed future in DeFi for many, but putting the idea in practice while considering the full range of collaborative and malicious actions possible has not been easy. Where are we at with paying delegates at Maker? What have learned about how Delegates vote and what makes people who care, stay?

title: Blockchain technology brings social and environmental solutions to developing countries
description: In places like Africa and East Asia, blockchain technology is being instrumental in building solutions to the most pressing social, economic and environmental problems. A new tool for the unstoppable spirit of human beings to seek solutions to their own problems and make the world a better place.

The Ethereum community controls one of the most powerful tools in the crypto universe to combat censorship‚Äîbut no one currently knows exactly how to use it. Swing by this talk to prepare yourself. speakers.description: Alex Stokes is a researcher at the Ethereum Foundation who believes deeply in the Ethereum vision. To achieve this vision, he has been working on scaling R&D to make the core protocol more secure and accessible to everyone. This includes tooling and testing work for the Merge, exploratory prototyping for sharding work like EIP-4844 and EIP-4895 to enable validator withdrawals after the Merge. When he is not working on Ethereum, you can find him at the nearest mountaintop.
